The cashier is the Barista , If you happened to get in line with three guys in front of you , better start praying because it might take 8 minutes before you can pay for Gas!!!!  you are stuck between lattes and cupcakes,  in my opinion the need two cashiers at all time . Do not  kill customer service for trying to be fancy????????

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

The original text expresses frustration with a restaurant's policy of not providing free water cups, and the customer being charged for a drink instead. To make the sentence longer and more complex, we can use more elaborate vocabulary and sentence structure. Here's a possible modification:

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition"

Original Text: Only giving one star due to their ridiculous policy of not providing water cups. I asked for a cup of water and was given a cup. I looked at my receipt and I was charged for a drink! I asked about this and was told that water cups are only for children and the elderly. Non sense! He (Malcolm the cashier) could have told me before he charged me!

Modified Text:

My experience at this establishment was utterly disappointing and marred by an asinine policy that precludes the provision of complimentary water cups, which led to an unfortunate incident wherein I was erroneously charged for a beverage, despite merely seeking a cup of water, and was met with an unsatisfactory response from the cashier, Malcolm, when I inquired about the anomaly, resulting in a senseless and avoidable controversy.

Only giving one star due to their ridiculous policy of not providing water cups. I asked for a cup of water and was given a cup. I looked at my receipt and I was charged for a drink! I asked about this and was told that water cups are only for children and the elderly. Non sense! He (Malcolm the cashier) could have told me before he charged me!

Update: With a generous gift card from some kind of regional manager (in response to our comment card from the previous visit), we returned, for what will be my last time.

First, they brought me my steak with the wrong sauce--their pepper sauce instead of the shallot butter I ordered. I sent it back, and they brought me the right sauce--with the wrong steak. Funny enough, it was the same Heinz Ward steak I'd been unhappy with in my previous review.

This time, in fairness, my steak was at least cooked a perfect medium-rare. I'm still unimpressed with the flavor of the meat itself, though. It just tastes a little watery compared to the stuff at other restaurants I've been to.

I had three bites and stopped eating, and I am pleased to say that they didn't charge me for the steak. But again: At a place this pricey, I just expect my experience to be at least an B+, and I haven't had anything over a C-.

Can I give negative stars? Do NOT eat here. Way over priced. 

I am an eggs benedict-a-holic. I love them. I have had alll kinds. These are by far the most bland eggs bene I have ever EVER had. We waited for 25 minutes for a table. Far too long when you can see more open tables then occupied ones. Im not kidding 40% full, 60% empty. 

The potatoes were cold. The hollandaise was foul. it had no flavor. NONE at all. I mean I have had ones were some lemon juice is added and it's at least bare-able. But no. It was bland, tasteless, and cold. I told the waitress twice, this is unreal. Add a lemon squeeze and BOOM 10x better. And make sure its warm. You brought it out under a silver plate topper, but it was cold. 

SAVE YOUR MONEY! DO NOT GO HERE. GO wait elsewhere.

Hooters has a sign that takes up an entire side of their hotel that advertises their 24 hour $3 blackjack game. The funny thing about this huge ass sign is that it fails to mention that there is only ONE $3 blackjack table in the entire casino, and that is has shitty 6:5 odds, no re-buys, and that it will always be crowded. The casino here is small, sticky, and everything smells like chicken wings.\n\nIf you've ever been to a Hooters restaurant, just imagine all the worst and horrible things about it, stick a blackjack table in it, and allow people to sleep and stay in your restaurant. That's how bad this place is. At least by visiting this once, I now know, and don't ever have to correctly assume to never come back here again.
Tip for oreganos staff: don't make your customer wait an hour and a half for their order and then get it wrong!!! Thanks for ruining our evening

I have never been so disappointed by this place until now. I went here with my family and found what seems to be tin foil in my food! When addressing the waitress she was very nice about it and she went directly to the manager. When he came to our table first thing he said was he doesn't know how it got in my food and it wasn't part of the recipe. . Well no shit..and then he said he won't charge that on our bill.. well I hope not!! But instead he doesn't offer a new plate or anything and just smiled. Poor management.. even the waitress asked if we wanted something else after the fact. Never coming back again who knows what else is in there food!
This place is terrible chicken bowl was cold and super hard chicken looks like it was cook 5 days ago never will I come back, a refund would be nice!!

I currently live here and wish I had never gotten into a lease with these people.  Our water gets shut off probably around every couple of months and that's being generous.  They're constantly turning the water off for the entire complex because some of the apartments are not getting hot water.  The water has been shut off probably around 4-5 times since I have lived here, and I moved in, in May 2011.\n\nDuring the summer when they shut the water off, there was also no A/C because it's all connected.  There is no running water as I'm writing this review!  I've had to call maintenance 4 times that I can remember since I have lived here.  Once because the doorknob came off the linen closet, twice because the garbage disposal wasn't doing its job and once because the shower head was so rusted that no water would come through it.  Once the lease is up, I'm out of here.

Had a big take out order of multiple dishes.  Yuck!  Not only is it pricey now, and the boxes are smaller but there is ABSOULUTELY no flavor!!  Not one of the take out boxeswerer labeled, so it was a mystery as to what you were eating.  Meat?  Where was the meat?  If there was a piece or two the beef was tough and grisly, chicken obsolete.  There was so much sauce I questioned if it was stew!!  Ordered the Kung Pao chicken and if I got it, which I don't know it all looked and tasted the same, there was no spice at all.   Crab puffs were the only saving grace and a reminder that I really did order from Chop and Wok. 

Never again will I order from Chop and Wok.  I have been a customer since I was in highschool  and am so disappointed that this legend has gone bust with crappy food! 

Hope the owners really take a good look at these reviews as many of us are saying the exact same thing.
Nice gym, management not so good be aware of the contract.  They will continue to charge you until you cancel in writing.  They slid a clause in about auto renewal

been to this wendys a few times not the best customer service but its ok if ur really hungry i have not returned to this location since the redesign to the walmart in that complex (the reason is because they have a subway in walmart now)

I stopped here after dropping off a package at the post office, which was next door and let me tell you ... This place is a RIP OFF! I got a single scoop of vanilla ice cream on a regular cone and paid $3.60! That's outrageous! That'll be the first and LAST time I'll be getting ice cream from there.

My husband and I decided to go to this restaurant for father's day. We were always happy with the food & service. Today on the way there I looked up reviews of this restaurant & 1 other. To my surprise I found terrible reviews involving a waitress reeking of cigarette smoke when she served their table. My husband told me that everything would be fine so we went to this restaurant anyway. imagine my disgust when I found the end of a plastic cigarette  wrapper in my diet pepsi! I picked it out because it looed like a slice of ice. Our waitress was very sweet and apologetic however management only took off our drinks & 25 percent which I feel is unconcionable. We won't be back.

I stopped in for a late lunch at about 2:30 in the afternoon on a Wednesday. I was the only person there. I was seated quickly and ordered a calamari appetizer and a small Greek pizza. I substituted the ground beef that comes on pizza for giro meet. I waited for about twenty minutes and had three glasses of ice tea before the waiter checked on my appetizer. I chief forgot or didn't make the calamari yet. So about seven minutes later the calamari came out. It was soggy and tasted like it was fried in burnt oil. The pizza came out shortly after. The crust on the pizza was hands down the worst I have ever had. It tasted like an opened frozen pizza crust that had sat in the freezer for to long. 
$7.95 for the Calamari
$12.95 for the Pizza
$2.95 for ice tea.
With tax it was over $25.00 dollars for food I would not feed to my dog.
Do yourself a favor and stay away.

Well after spending $15 on lunch ...how is it that you advertise hot dogs being your specialty and you don't have foot longs or sauerkraut, the food was mediocre and the wait was awful but at least we got to talk shit while we waited for our bullshit food ...you got one star instead of zero because the shake was okay ...peace !

I wish there was a way to leave a -5 star review. 

The name of this place is actually "Americas Best Value" Inn. For americas best value we recieved a neighborhood that looked like it was out of the movie Colors, dated furnishings and decor, putrid smelling and horrible stained carpet, an uncomfortable bed and a mildew ridden bathroom. 

We usually stay on the strip but this was a family trip and we needed multiple rooms so we went for the cheaper option. There were no other rooms available in or near the area and we were 257 miles away from home otherwise we would have high tailed it out of there. 

With no other options we drove to the nearest Walmart and bought all of the Lysol, bleach and  febreze that we could in order to attempt to sanitize this place. Nothing we did got rid of or even covered that smell In any of the rooms for more than a few minutes.

We will never stay here again.

Absolutely horrible. I ordered a white wine spritzer, the server told me I don't think we carry that, I don't know these fancy drink names. I told her what it was and that it's been around forever. My wife ordered a frozen strawberry lemonade and got a regular. When ordering our food she laughed when I specified no poblano peppers or any spice. I ordered a weight watchers meal as I wasn't too terribly starving. When our food came she just assumed that my wife who is larger than I wanted the weight watchers. I was completely appalled. I spoke to the manager at once told her everything and explained we were leaving and I was paying for nothing. Next time I visit Phoenix this will not be where I go.

It's ridiculous to call a number for a county facility like this and the phone number doesn't work properly! You can call the number but you can't get through to anyone because when you press the numbers when prompted for a department, nothing happens. You have to call police non - emergency. This listing is a complete waste unless you plan to go to this office directly!

I ordered delivery, it came very fast, unfortunately what they delivered was disgusting. I asked for no mayo, no ham, I got it with both. Not only that, the bread was wet. Completely inedible. Just threw away the sandwich, along with my money.

Nice room. Huge customer service fail. Refused to award our marriott reward points for a stay because we booked our room in combination with our flight. We do this all the time and have never been refused our points, anywhere, ever. They also refused to upgrade my room despite the fact that we are gold members. Should have spent the extra $20 a night to stay at grand chateau. I intended to extend my stay here for 2 weeks but after this mess, I called the grand chateau and they allowed me to book online through my airline and gave me credit for my stay there plus they contacted marriott rewards on my behalf and had the credit for this hell hole applied to my account. Thanks Andrew (\"supervisor\") for getting me such a great hookup at a Marriott that is twice as nice as yours.

the worst hotel ever!!!! warning do not stay here!!!!! moldy sheets , stained sheets, tub felt like water under the plaster! carpet is sickning sheets had hair all over it....crumbs and rubbish pushed on the side of the night stand...we made them change our sheets at 11 o'clock at night and they were all huffy.just filthy......department of health needs to go in their!!!!! if u want to see pictures email me at cnjvape@gmail.com and on the subject line put days inn pictures. i be more than happy to send u photos...its not worth saving money on your trip i am dead serious. i regret stay ing their just to save money , now i have some insect bite on my wrist that is swollen and red....warning!!!!!! if u do belive me i will email u the pictures......

Food was really not that great.

The garlic shrimp appetizer, granted, it was good and ample, but the shrimp were overdone and tough.

We had two platos, I had a tamarind pork and my husband had shredded beef. 
Tamarind Pork-It was a huge plate and portion, but the tamarind sauce was way sweet.  Usually, my notion of tamarind is savory.  The side vegetables were alright and the beans were decent.
Shredded beef-We both thought it had a funny flavor to it.  Once we literally got in to it, we realized it was green olive flavor, which we both don't like.  Other than that olive flavor, it was okay.
Mojito - good, but not great and it was quite small.

Total manipulation at Las Vegas airport Advantage counter! Reservation was for noon. Arrives at counter at 11:25 and was told I was too early! I stood 50' away for 30 minutes. Then manipulated up charges! Make sure you rent what YOU want, not what SHE sells.

"Absolutely no replenishments shall be forthcoming, nor will any returns be accepted. Now, would it be too much to ask for a nominal fee of one dollar to replenish my six-dollar carbonated beverage, thereby rendering the transaction amicable for both parties? It appears that these self-appointed guardians of refreshment are determined to thwart my attempts at acquiring a refilled beverage, whether it be popcorn or soda. My financial investment in this establishment has already surpassed thirty dollars, and yet, I am being coerced into paying an additional six dollars for a paltry quantity of said beverage. The dilemma presented before me is thus: Shall I opt for a chilled potation accompanied by ice, or settle for a tepid beverage sufficient for the duration of the cinematic experience? Furthermore, the seating arrangements within this theatre are noticeably antiquated, exhibiting signs of wear and tear, and perhaps even a tad unsanitary. Moreover, the staff members appear to be utterly indifferent towards their patrons, their behavior bordering on discourteous. In light of these circumstances, it would be wise to venture forth to Town Square, where customer satisfaction and rational thinking are given precedence."

"My spouse and I indulged in a midday repast at this establishment and were thoroughly disillusioned with both the culinary offerings and the tariff. While I am not averse to expending forty dollars on a duo of delectable Mexican dishes, the fare we received was utterly unacceptable. The grilled fish tacos were diminutive, lacking in flavor, and possessed an unpleasant fishy odor. Furthermore, the rice accompaniments were excessively saline, while the beans appeared stale and unappetizing. The poultry salad was equally unimpressive, with an uninspired dressing that failed to enhance its mediocre taste. Additionally, the trio of salsas provided with the complimentary chips fell short of my expectations. In contrast, my local Senior Fish purveyor offers vastly superior victuals and salsas. The sole aspect of our dining experience that was remotely satisfactory was the agreeable ambiance of the upper deck seating area and the attentive service we received. However, even the most generous interpretation would struggle to justify the exorbitant cost of fifty dollars, inclusive of taxes and beverages."

My wife and I had lunch here and were very disappointed in the food and prices. I don't mind spending $40 on 2 dishes of good mexican food but the good we got was horrible. The grilled fish tacos were super small, fishy, and just bland. The sides of rice were too salty and the beans were dry and looked liked yesterdays beans. The chicken salad also was bland and the dressing was just horrible as well. I was also disappointed on the 3 salsas that came with the chips. My local senor fish has way better food and salsas. \n\nThe only thing the was nice was the upper deck seating and the service. You can do way better for $50 after taxes and drinks.

This place is shady as.fuck. they tried to.over charge on bottles and some stripper hoes falsely advertised their price. The girls here are nothing special. Vegas is way better. Im fat and ugly but still not impressed . Avoid these shaddy aholes
Just to show that it isn't just me, as one DumbAss that sent me a message saying. This place was only open 3 months for a reason, charging way too much for Crap!

Beautiful hotel. So well done but the beds are really bad. Last night we were sleeping on two different levels with one side of the bed low in the valley and the other side high on the hill. I changed rooms right now hoping for a better bed but instead the new room actually has a broken bed! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas?! I'm waiting now for a supervisor to come and take me on a tour of the rooms with new beds. I'll be checking out sooner than planned and never coming back!

This BofA drive thru is the stupidest shit i've ever seen! 

Why in the hell would you make two ATM'S together in one drive thru?! Why don't you make it next to each other and not in the same lane like 5 feet away from each other?! We waited in line to get cash for like 10 minutes because one guy was taking forever so it held up a whole line.

STUPID, STUPID, STUPID!!

I've ordered cans of pro sheen in the past, and no problems. this time 2 cans were defective. tops broke off and it was dripping out,so i cant ship it back..(post office wont go for that) I've emailed Ryans twice about it and haven't gotten a response.its been a month or more now. Ive found another company that carries similar spray. really disappointed in them .bad costumer service.

This place is definitely a place you dont want to go to if your looking for a job. I went in for a Wednesday interview she said i will wait sometime for the other manager to setup a second interview because the first one went okay, i waited a few days till monday, called back some chick answered saying they dont talk about employment on the weekends and that its extremely busy? Hello its monday. So i called today (tuesday) and they put me on hold for 20 minutes and some girl answered the phone asking if i needed help i said yes i have been waiting for 20 mins to talk to a manager? No one told the manager that i wanted to talk with them so she immediately transferred me to her , her saying that they will call me when its easier   to them.  And hurried off the phone. These people are so rude when it comes to employment.

This restaurant replaced the Wendy's that was once here, and is currently the only option for food in the D-terminal. I ordered take out once, service was terrible, and I'm never coming back.

I give it a try, so I order the Torta del Barrio to go, with fries. It's a vegetarian option for $13, including cheese stuffed peppers among other vegetables. One gentleman was in front of me, so I wait after my order.

Three people order after me within 15 minutes, each ordering items on the menu of similar preparation (one even got the same dish). They were ALL SERVED BEFORE ME! I ended up waiting for 35 minutes for a meal that wasn't even that good. The fries were soggy and bland, and the bread for the torta tasted stale. No way that cost $13, I could've made that for under $5.

The restaurant didn't look that much better. The place was packed, and they pumped out a couple dishes every 10 minutes. The majority of tables were not served the entire time I was there, and they definitely ordered before I arrived.

When you're trying to fly out, you want a quick bite to eat. The 35 minutes wait was inexcusable, especially since all those customers were served until I was dead last. The most I got out of the cashier was "Sorry, I tried." If you're going to serve food at the airport, that kind of service won't cut it.

I've never said this before, but I'd have preferred fast food at the time.

Wish I could give them 0 star reason being we walked in and sat for 15 min for a table the workers saw us walk in but did not even approach us ...... We approached the waiter after they sat a couple that came after us and we were sitting for 15 min

I must express my profound disappointment with my recent visit to this establishment, which was precipitated by my possession of a gift card obtained from restaurant.com; however, upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the inconspicuous nature of its location within the confines of a shopping center, which seemed to be an inauspicious omen for the quality of the culinary experience that lay ahead. Furthermore, I must say that the pizza, which was advertised as being of the Chicago deep-dish variety, failed to meet my expectations in terms of both its texture and flavor, as it was unacceptably thin and lacked the rich, buttery flavor that I have come to associate with this particular style of pizza. Moreover, the service was painfully slow, and our server appeared to be overwhelmed by the demands of her duties, as evidenced by her repeated oversight of certain fundamental aspects of the dining experience, such as the provision of silverware and straws, which led me to question the competence of the management in terms of staffing and training. Finally, I must note that, although the portions were generous, the quality of the food did not justify the price point, and I would not recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

I'm sorry but I wouldn't go back here. Location is kind of hidden in the back of a shopping center. I had a gift card from restaurant.com and thought this place was worth a try. For one the pizza isn't Chicago deep dish pizza as advertized. It is super thin and not that good at all-tastes like cheap frozen pizza. Service was extremely slow and server kept forgetting basic things like silverware/straws/etc..(granted they seemed to be slammed with only 1 server-hello management). We never got our appetizers until the meal came out and the server was just like oh yea about it. Sure you can get a ton for the prizing (big pizza pies) but it's not noteworthy food or service at all.

The excessive concentration of individuals within a limited spatial expanse engenders an undesirable scenario, wherein the queue for procuring beverages becomes interminable, rendering the experience utterly disagreeable. In contradistinction, it is recommended to seek out the conventional pool area, where staff members circulate and take orders, subsequent to which they convey comestibles and potables directly to patrons, thereby furnishing a markedly more satisfactory encounter.

I was disappointed about the service. It took about 45 minutes for our food to get served, which is so unusual for Chinese rest. The food was not great, the lettuce wrap was the worst I've had so far. I will never come back to this place again.

First of all the portions are small for Persian food. It tasted horrible. Nothing special. They even bring your sodas in a can. For the price you could have very good food in Southern California. I haven't found a good place in Las Vegas for Persian food at all

I'm going to make this simple and sweet.  

I'D RATHER EAT AT KFC'S THAN EAT YOUR CHICKEN THAT COMES ALONG YOUR CHICKEN AND WAFFLES -- AND THAT'S SAY'N SUMTIN!  (Chicken just tastes like batter.  Where's the seasoning?)

Feel free to tell me why their Chicken and Waffles is so amazing.  Just try.  

They serve you so much, I bet whatever gets thrown away is enough to fatten every malnourished child in Africa.  I propose we start a Hash House A Go Go food drive and donate all your leftovers at the door.  

YAY FOR ENDING WORLD HUNGER!!!

Husband and I have been dining here since they opened this location. We both ordered the enchiladas and paid the extra $2.50 for adding beef and $2.00 for chicken. The beef enchiladas virtually had no beef. The chicken one was slightly better since did get 3 small bites of chicken. We are unsure if the beef was just cooked away in the process. They were blobs of doughy corn? tortillas with cheese. There were cold spots in the middle of my dish. Anyway, the meal was $37.00 bucks. Service was okay. We will not be going back again.

I RUSHED to tan today after work. I got to Yolanda's at 7:20PM, only to find that the salon was closed. Both the sign on the door and the listed hours on the website state that Yolanda's tanning side is open until 8pm. I'm pretty pissed that I wasted time driving the whole way from Monroeville to Bloomfield for nothing. I've spent money on (multiple) tanning packages here, but I will definitely be taking my sad, untanned booty somewhere more reliable from now on.

Back for another splendid Sunday brunch review is Mike P and Ashley D!!!! We embarked for an adventure at the Original Sunrise Cafe as we were both starving and unable to use our restaurant.com certificate at Hash house on Sundays :(.... boo.  Anyway to the review:

The Original Sunrise Cafe was packed! However, with good luck on our side we were seated in about five minutes.  The cafe had a nice vibe and was filled with people.  Fresh coffee was....well....Vegas cafe coffee; nuff said.  After a few glances around the menu we both noted how they covered several breakfast categories but only offered a small selection for each. 

We both decided on omelets and OSC offers egg white versions of every omelet.  I have to say that my omelet the Eggzilla (Egg whites, spinach, roasted peppers and salsa topped with sunrise garlic sauce and jack cheese) was pretty good.  Although, Ashley D's omelet was nothing to write home about; sadly.  Overall, for $8.99 they come with a bagel/toast on the side making it a decent deal.  I just think for the amount of breakfast/brunch locations you can do a little better.

My acquaintance and I have been aspiring to visit this establishment for an extensive period of time, but regrettably, our experience was marred by numerous deficiencies.

The decorum of the venue was unimpressive, with tables that lacked aesthetic appeal and an overall motif that failed to cohere.

Furthermore, the beverages served were subpar, particularly the Bloody Mary, which was perhaps the worst specimen I have had the misfortune of sampling.

The brunch menu offered scant satisfaction as well; the eggs Oscar was unremarkable, while the asparagus was unpleasantly chilly and the hollandaise sauce excessively viscous.

The service we received was also unsatisfactory, as our server, Kristopher, appeared to be in a foul mood and conveyed a demeanor that was off-putting from the outset. A smile or other gesture of warmth would not have gone amiss.

In conclusion, our visit was a disappointment, and it is uncertain whether we shall return, save for the purpose of consuming beverages.

Like the optometrist!  When I wanted to use my vision insurance, they printed out a benefit statement (when I asked).  It appeared to be legit as it had my plan name on it, but the benefit amounts seemed too low and they informed me that was my plan's benefit.  I went home and checked at my benefit was SIGNIFICANTLY higher!  I then went back ane explained that they has miscalculated my benefit and that's when they admitted that they are actually out-of-network for insurance plans, \"but it all equals out because we charge lower prices.\"  Hmmmm....so I then go to west valley vision which was less for contact lens and they game me my full benefit (wv vision did seemed higher for frames, though). I don't appreciate being lied to!

I decided to venture beyond my habitual establishment in search of a novel experience, but my expectations were sadly unmet. Not only did this new location charge a premium of 50% compared to my usual spot merely two miles away, but the quality of service failed to meet my standards. The pedicure was utterly subpar, and the nail technician's attention to detail left much to be desired. I shall not be returning to this establishment.

I thought I would try someplace different than my regular place, and boy was I disappointed.  Not only was it 50% more expensive than the place I go to 2 miles away, their service was less than stellar.  The pedi was the worst I have ever had, and the nail tech wasn't all that attentive.   I won't be going back.

Update:  The money was remedied, so I gave it an extra star for that and just having a great time with my friends.  \n\nWent out to party in Vegas last week for Pre New Year's Eve celebration at Blondies. Somebody had to screw something up. The i***t bartender charged us for another party's bill of $138.00 ON TOP of our own overpriced bill!!!   And it is not like we signed for that bill either.  We didn't notice this until 2 days after when we checked our account. Husband did call the manager said to get back to them as they are sure that bill should be refunded back to our account (of course that bill will first be deducted from our account, good thing we are not poor people).  I guess they have a tendency to do this to their clients...so people beware of this carelessness.

I feel like there are three things important for a club: music, crowd, and drinks. 

Whiskey plays decent music. Some days better than the others depending on the DJ. The crowd is alright too. I feel like if you go with a good group of friends, even the worst club can be super fun. The drinks are not bad, decently priced. 

It's pretty casual and it's a big space right in the middle of the EpiCenter. 

My advice: get a fun group of friends and you are all set!

I just went here for morning coffee for the first time. I ordered a hazelnut latte. The service was very nice and all was well, until I took my first sip later in the car. Ewwww. The coffee is completely burnt. This made my usually slightly sweet latte into a nasty bitter mess of disappointment. $4 later I have to throw this away and buy a new one somewhere else. It's completely undrinkable.

I spent a lot of time at Canaletto in the early 2000s but was disappointed with it when revisiting it this past week. Ten years ago the food was authentic and beautifully presented, but the other night the best praise I can muster would be \"passable.\" None of the five in our party felt that they had anything special. \n\nCanaletto, with its \"outdoor\" seating in the Venetian's version of Saint Mark's Square, is still a nice enough place for an American, albeit uninspired take on Italian food. But with so many better food choices in Vegas I can recommend it no longer.

Um. What did I miss?

They have such great reviews but my experience was just "meh".

I provably should have known better then to order entrée seafood at a fast food type place, but the picture was really appetizing!

Volcano blackened mahi.
Waaaaay too salty. Had to scrape off most of it. The fish underneath was OK fresh. Not ocean fresh, but Arizona fresh. :-)

I had veggies that I thought would be steamed but were definitely stir fried. Also OK fresh.

The biggest let down of this was the "mango cheesecake".

I was expecting some kind of mango inside the cheesecake, but, alas, it was just plain old cheesecake with.... get this... "mango puree" on the side.
It was a thimble full of mango juice. And fake mango juice at that.

*sigh*

I would eat here again, but I will definitely lower the bar before I do.

"Two stars for the ambiance, unfortunately, I cannot give more. Those who wish to indulge in a modest Caipirinha with white sugar instead of brown sugar will find themselves in good company here. However, one needs an abundance of time, as the service staff are unfriendly and inattentive. To secure a table reservation, a substantial minimum order per person must first be placed, only then can a reservation be obtained. Having said that, if Karlsruhe had a competing location with the same ambiance but superior cocktails and friendly service, P10 would certainly have to step up their game!"

"Hmmm, this particular Canter's establishment failed to elicit an overwhelmingly positive response from my culinary sensibilities, to say the least. In point of fact, I experienced a lingering sense of disappointment upon conclusion of my dining experience. 

This specific branch of the renowned Canter's franchise, located on Fairfax Avenue in Los Angeles, had aroused my expectations to a considerable degree, given its reputation for serving delectable fare. Alas, my meal, priced at approximately $15, consisted merely of a turkey sandwich on whole wheat bread, accompanied by a portion of french fries and a carbonated beverage. A rather unremarkable combination, I must confess. 

The turkey, though plentiful in quantity, lacked the essential qualities of succulence and flavor, leaving much to be desired in terms of gastronomical satisfaction. It was not until I applied a generous amount of dijon mustard to the sandwich that I began to derive a modicum of enjoyment from my meal. 

It is worth mentioning, however, that my companion's pastrami sandwich proved to be relatively palatable, thus suggesting that my taste buds had not been entirely desensitized by the previous evening's indulgences. Nonetheless, my overall impression of this particular Canter's location remained somewhat less than favorable. 

In light of this experience, I shall endeavor to revisit the authentic Canter's in Los Angeles, with the hope of sampling a truly exceptional meal and thereby justifying the acclaim lavished upon this venerable eatery. Unfortunately, I fear that a return visit to this particular branch is unlikely in the near future."

Hmmm, this Canter's really didn't knock my socks off at all. As a matter of fact, I think I left feeling a little under-whelmed. 

This is a branch of the famed Canter's in LA on Fairfax and I was expecting a lot more. For around $15, I got a turkey on wheat, fries, and a soda. MAJOR UNDERWHELM-MENT. While there was a gang of turkey, it was dry, limp, and tasteless. Only when I slathered dijon mustard on it did I feel like my $15 went towards something.

OH WELL. I do realize this is in Vegas, the land expensive meals. I did try another person's pastrami and it was pretty good. Again, I suppose that nasty turkey sandwich killed it for me. 

My tastebuds may have been shot from the late night prior, so I guess I will someday return to the REAL Canter's in LA and hopefully see what the hoo-ha is all about. I will not be returning to this Canter's sadly!

Please, dear God, please let me be more impressed with the real one.

really? seriously needs an update..looks exactly like it did in the 70s when the mobsters had run of Vegas..smells old when you walk in the door..staff was nice but the building itself? not so much...i see why they are one of the cheapest..

Although the gastronomical offerings possess an undeniable flavorful quality, the menu's ambiguity and the restriction of the "all you can eat" option to a meager selection of dishes serve as a significant hindrance to a truly satisfying dining experience. Perusing the menu reveals a plethora of caveats and limitations on the choices available, which are not explicitly delineated, thereby engendering confusion and frustration. Furthermore, the absence of any explicit stipulation precluding the sharing of desserts among multiple individuals renders the notion of "one item per person" dubious and open to interpretation. Additionally, certain menu items are reserved exclusively for dinner, yet their unavailability during luncheon hours is nowhere explicitly indicated, leading to further disappointment and inconvenience. In light of these considerations, it is unlikely that this establishment will enjoy my patronage in the future.

Kinda crappy but i would stay again on a budget. Their is a weird place in my hard for circus circus, it bad but not unsanitary. 

First, the people that do the check in are the most miserable humans in the planet. Did some one tell them to go as slow as possible? Seriously, it should take you no longer then 2-3 minutes to check me in.

The place is musty with smoke, i mean w/e i don't care that much but some people do. Their is a stale taste in the air. 

The place as a whole is kinda cool, the look of it, the indoor activities like rick wall and extreme rides like you would find on the boardwalk.

The rooms, poor without being dirty. They are boring yes. Do i feel like I'm in the 70's yes. But they are clean so i cant complain too much. 

The steak house inside is good but expensive. Avoid the buffet for sure (much better options in Vegas for same price)

If you are going there because you have too and your on a budget don't fret. But their are much better options if your going to do Vegas do it right!

This Gamestop store is basically like any other Gamestop store-- overpriced used games and consoles, horrible buyback rates, aggressive sales technique, and pretentious employees. Sometimes, when you tell them that you're not interested in becoming a \"member\" or whatever their program is, they just keep talking over you. Do your game shopping elsewhere. eStarland has great prices on used games and consoles and great buyback rates.

This is a new show at Planet Hollywood.

The show is a weird combination of impersonations, girls dancing and comedy.  Coop does a good job, it is just not a good mixture or flow to the show.  

The thing that bothers me the most about the show is the audience members that are obvious plants.  They laugh too loud and laugh at everything. This means to me that the show isn't very good or the show doesn't believe it is good.

This show could be really good if they would decide who their audience was and play to them.  They are trying to play to three different groups and missing the mark.  

http://www.planethollywoodresort.com/shows/the-coop-show.html#.UqoFCX-9KSM

Pros- 
-ambience is nice 
-good sized rooms 
-nice view 
-fancy equipment 
-beds are really soft 

Cons- 
-bad/rude service 
-wifi is basically worthless 
-showers.... its either you take a scalding hot shower or an ice cold one... 
-lighting is trash 
-expensive
-balcony literally blocked of like were some kind of 3 year olds 
-The smell in the room is death...

Overall, there are much better places to stay in Vegas where you don't have to pay these ridiculous prices and still get better service and a better hotel experience.

Last year, I harbored a profound affection for Parlor; however, my sentiments underwent a metamorphosis subsequent to my recent visit this week, which compelled me to revise my assessment. My spouse and I opted to partake of a midday repast at this establishment, and our arrival preceded our scheduled return to work by approximately sixty minutes. At the outset, our experience was devoid of irritation, but as we stood at the hostess station for a duration of five minutes, awaiting recognition, our patience began to wane. Following our seating, we expedited the process of selecting our culinary preferences, thereby ensuring that we were fully prepared for the attention of our server. Nonetheless, a span of ten minutes elapsed before any member of the waitstaff accorded us even a cursory visit. It bears mentioning that, during this interval, the restaurant was not bustling with activity. As our gazes intercepted those of the servers, who nonchalantly glided past us, and a cheerful gesture of greeting was ignored by one of them, despite their having made direct visual contact with us, an atmosphere of vexation enveloped us. Ultimately, we elected to vacate the premises, feeling perplexed and disenchanted.

I had love for Parlor last year...but I have to update based on my recent visit this week. My husband and I decided to stop here for lunch and had the usual hour before we had to go back to work. Well we stood at the hostess stand for about 5 minutes before anyone acknowledged us! At this point, no one's frustrated. After being seated, we made our picks so that we were totally ready for our server...except...no one came over to us...for over 10 minutes! Now we're frustrated! I didn't mention this before, but it was not busy in there at all! After a couple minutes of eye contact with servers as they casually floated past us and even a friendly \"hand wave\" in the air to one of them who looked right past us as though we were totally invisible, we left. We aren't ones to make a scene at restaurants but I just don't get it...definitely lost the love after this one!

I have been an ardent devotee of TP since its inception, however, during the onset of my most recent visit, I was apprised that they were implementing a more stringent policy regarding the prerequisite for a credit card prior to being served luncheon fare. Frankly, this new protocol has left me feeling somewhat irritated, as I believe it displays a lack of respect towards patrons such as myself. It appears that TP is attempting to mitigate the risk of monetary loss due to a select few individuals who have opted to dine and dash, yet, I find it hard to fathom why they would adopt such a draconian measure that targets the vast majority of law-abiding clientele. Other establishments in the vicinity do not seem to encounter this predicament, and thus, I shall take my business (and my palate) elsewhere. Despite the aesthetic appeal of the wait staff and the culinary prowess of the kitchen, I fear that my patronage shall be revoked, indefinitely.

They had what seemed like a commendable special for Valentine's Day, but it ultimately proved to be a facetious promotion. The cuisine was of inferior quality, and the prices were exorbitant. In the past, the food at this establishment was palatable, and the ambiance was bustling. However, recent visits have been disappointing, and the venue has lost its appeal. While it may still be an acceptable location for beverages, it no longer warrants consideration as a viable dining option.

They had what sounded like a good special for Valentine Day turned out to be a joke.  Food was of poor quality, and way over priced.  Food in the past was good here.  The place was always busy.  Recent visits not so.  Disappointing.  Cool place for at least drinks, now I dont even consider it as an option.

I am disappointed because the sight of the pool really intrigued me. It was a nice environment, decent crowd, but I was pretty upset when I went to pay for drinks. We were charged $15 for two WELL vodka and diet cokes in short glasses.... A bit pricey but I was willing to go with it. Then we decided to take two shots of fireball, you know, the cheap stuff. The bill came and it was $16 for two fucking shots of fireball?? They get that for free and other bars literally give it away. On Mill they charge maybe $2 a piece for fireball. It is complete bullshit. Not even a real shot and they charged us almost $20. Will not be back for that reason. Such a rip off!

Average at best. I am so disappointed. I ordered several items from menu. The onion soup is mediocre and very oily. The beets were quite good. The macaroni gratin side was average. A flatiron steak for over $40 is ridiculous and honestly it was not well seasoned. Bottom line: go to Daniel Boulud's or joel robuchon's restaurant. This restaurant was empty and a disappointment. I don't think it will be there in 2 years.

For a behemoth hospitality establishment of such immense proportions and prestige along the famed Las Vegas Strip, I anticipated an exponentially superior quality of accommodations and services, only to be utterly dismayed by the flagrant disparity between the actual experience and my elevated expectations, which were regrettably left unfulfilled; it is utterly perplexing that any individual could possibly confer a rating of four or five stars upon this property, as it appears they possess a limited scope of reference and exposure to genuinely exceptional hospitality experiences. In contrast, a visit to the culinary extravaganza presented by the Mirage hotel would constitute a judicious allocation of resources.

"Ambient temperament notwithstanding, this establishment's culinary offerings leave much to be desired, particularly in regards to the uninspired wedding soup and the underwhelming experience that was the meatballs - both of which suffered from an unfortunate lack of flavor and texture, respectively. Notwithstanding my reservations, I shall afford said eatery a subsequent opportunity to redeem itself once its upstairs counterpart becomes operational; however, until such time, my patronage shall remain suspended."

Cool atmosphere, but thats about it.  The wedding soup was cold and bland and the meatballs I had were dried out and without much flavor.\n\nI'll give it another try when the upstairs opens, but for now I'll pass.
Rice was too dry, service was slow at best and for what we got the price was way to high. The decor was nice though but I can get better sushi from albertsons for a fraction of the cost.

"For the midday repast, I opted for the Yuzu special, as I am a connoisseur of the culinary arts and was eager to sample the establishment's unique take on traditional Japanese fare. However, upon perusing the menu, I noticed that the offerings were somewhat limited in terms of quantity, with an emphasis on variety rather than quantity. Furthermore, I must admit that I was not overly impressed by the culinary experience, particularly given the premium pricing. In my opinion, my own mother's cooking skills are superior, making this restaurant less suitable for those seeking an authentic Japanese dining experience."

For lunch. I had Yuzu special.  I am native of the cuisine, and I think their menu style is offering small portion of many different food: many dishes.  Many dishes, but sorry not so impressed.  To me, considering food quality it is very pricey. Here, I came up that Mother is pretty good chef. I guess it is not for authentic Japanese food lover.

No bueno.  Had an okay haircut here once that would have earned probably 3 stars including mediocre service. Went back again today for the same reason - they're open when my usual place is closed. Or so I thought. I called at 3:45 to make sure they were open, and the guy on the phone assured me I had until 5pm. When I got there at 4:10, he said sorry and pointed to the clock. When I told him I was the one that called, he unapologetically pointed back at the clock and resumed his haircut. I won't chance another lackluster haircut here. Instead, I'll go back to mid city, where the sketchy location gives way to cheap, quality haircuts with great service.

I am only giving them 2 stars because of  they called me later and tried to repair what they did. We went in to work with John Cowan, he lied straight from the start and then 2 hours later we got a better deal on which we were trying to get done. My wife felt uncomfortable and told him so and he got mad at her and began to yell at her very loud in fact. I would say do not work with him he was rude and treated us like we stupid and insisted on telling us how much sales experience he had every 5 minutes. We don't care. Anyways the manger called us later and gave us an even better deal free oil changes for the lease period which was nice, that's why I gave 3 stars instead of one. We are also first time buyers so the maybe that's why he tried to rip us off.

If you've never seen a male revue before, then you might make the mistake of thinking this is a good show.  It was very amateurish and sloppy. First of all, the men were not all cute. Great bodies, yes. But only 2 of the guys had good looking faces.  Second, they can't really dance and do the same tired moves for every top 40 song. Much of the show is actually \"empty\" in that there's one dancer going through the crowd while everyone else is sitting there with no entertainment. In short, the show is lazy. There are some \"OMG\" moments as there will be whenever men strip. But having seen Chippendales, this show is NOT worth $20, much less the $36 we paid from the 1/2 price ticket booth.

boo World Market!  I came in here looking for the \"Hobbit\" line of beers bc I wanted to buy them for my boyfriend to try on New Year's Eve (he called it New Beer's Eve and wanted to try a new beer that night).  I asked the man stocking the shelves if he knew where they were.  he was very friendly and went to look it up for me.  unfortunately, this store had not received a shipment of it yet (or maybe it never will, it was unclear to me).  but I specifically asked if ANY world markets in phx had them and he told me no. but I just looked online and it's available at the world market on camelback!  I totally could have bought it that night for New Year's Eve, lame.

Do not get the taco salad!! Way too much guacamole and sour cream and it is really bland. Kind of a mess.  friendly service, cute little neighborhood atmosphere, but honestly the food is not impressive.

My sleep-number bed and/or remote was broken (room 514), and by the time I fell asleep, the mattress felt swayed like a hammock. I liked the layout of the room, with the headboard against the wall to the bathroom, and the curved desk/dresser layout was different. My room was not restocked well after the first night, such as no fresh coffee supplies or clean glasses and mugs. I asked for no feather pillows when I checked in, but the replacements were floppy, the kind you have to wad up into a ball. Even though this is an airport hotel, catering to business travelers (free wifi, lobby bar, room service, business center), it had no taxis, ever. The front desk had to call one for me, which was a 15-minute wait. Not horrible, but not great.

"It is abundantly evident that opting for a taxi would have been a more judicious decision, as the shuttle service we utilized proved to be woefully unreliable and inefficient. Specifically, the shuttle did not depart from the airport until it had reached its maximum capacity, resulting in a protracted wait of thirty minutes. Furthermore, our experience was exacerbated by the fact that the initial stop was our place of lodging, The Venetian, which fortunately alleviated some of the stress associated with the delay. However, the return journey was equally problematic, as the shuttle was forty-five minutes late, placing us in jeopardy of missing our flight. To further compound the issue, we made four fruitless attempts to ascertain the shuttle's whereabouts, with the response consistently being that it was merely 'five minutes away.' Disconcertingly, fellow passengers divulged that they had been sequestered at the Palazzo for a duration of thirty minutes prior to their eventual arrival at The Venetian, highlighting the lack of concern for punctuality and disregard for the agreed-upon pickup time. In light of these events, it is our conviction that the potential monetary savings do not justify the risks involved with this mode of transportation. Instead, one would be better served by investing in a more dependable service, particularly given the propensity for expenditure in Las Vegas. This lesson having been learned, if one is not pressed for time, this option may still possess some appeal, albeit at a cost of twelve dollars per person for a round-trip fare."

Should have taken a taxi.  The shuttle doesn't leave the airport until it's completely full.  We sat on the shuttle for half an hour.  Luckily, the first stop was our hotel--The Venetian.
I bought a round trip ticket but waiting for the pick-up at the hotel to return to the airport was very stressful.  They were 45 minutes late and we almost missed our flight.  We called 4 times to ask where the shuttle was and the answer was always the same--"it's 5 minutes away".  Other people on the shuttle later told us that they were at the Palazzo sitting in the shuttle for 1/2 an hour before they finally left to pick us up at The Venetian. (they are neighboring casinos). Again, they waited until the shuttle was full with no regard to the agreed upon pick -up time for us.
It's just not worth it.  The money you might have saved would have been better spent on a more reliable service.  You're in Las Vegas for god's sake--you're going to spend money anyway.
Lesson learned.  If you are not in a hurry, then this might be a good option as it only cost $12.00 round trip per person.

"Abysmal service experience with too much repetition."

"Upon arriving at midday on a Thursday, we observed two tables already seated adjacent to ours, and the busser promptly delivered our beverages, specifically water and iced tea. However, a considerable delay ensued before our server appeared to take our order. Following the expedited arrival of our Greek salad, we noticed that the remaining two tables received their pizzas shortly after we completed our salads. Subsequently, an additional twenty minutes elapsed without any sign of our pizzas, at which point our server finally reappeared, offering a dubious explanation attributed to a computer malfunction, and assured us that our pizzas would arrive within the subsequent ten minutes. Notwithstanding the satisfactory quality of the pizza, which warranted two stars, I remain skeptical about future visits due to the subpar service."

I was not particularly inclined towards indulging in a smorgasbord, thus I decided to bypass the Excalibur's spread and venture towards the Luxor in pursuit of a more personalized culinary experience. Specifically, I desired victuals that were tailored to my individual preferences and prepared to order, rather than relying on the unpredictable nature of a buffet. Although my repast was delivered in a relatively expeditious manner, I couldn't help but suspect that certain components may have originated from a warming tray, thereby compromising their overall quality. Specifically, the eggs lacked the richness and creaminess I have come to expect from such a dish, while the corned beef hash suffered from an unfortunate dryness that rendered it somewhat unpalatable. Furthermore, the potatoes, although adequately prepared, proved challenging to consume due to their sheer volume, and the toast, though served in a thoughtful basket, was regrettably tepid, rendering the butter ineffective at melting properly. However, I must admit that the orange juice was quite refreshing, and the decaf coffee, while not exceptional, was still palatable. The service, on the other hand, was quite satisfactory, with the staff exhibiting a commendable level of friendliness and hospitality. The seating arrangements, while comfortable for lounging, proved less than ideal for dining, as they necessitated an uncomfortable posture when attempting to engage with the table. Ultimately, I cannot say that I was thoroughly impressed with my dining experience, given that I paid an additional $5, plus a gratuity, for food that was arguably comparable in quality to what I might have obtained from the buffet.

The sentiment expressed in the statement is suboptimal, and it would be beneficial to implement improvements to enhance the quality of service. The ambiance of the establishment could benefit from a thorough cleansing and refurbishment, as it currently exudes an uninviting and dilapidated atmosphere. Moreover, it is not advisable to engage in gambling activities at this venue, as the odds are unlikely to be in one's favor.
Can do way better. Service sucks. Definitely needs to be cleaned up way more. It's pretty ghetto, here. Definitely don't gamble here

Ordered delivery from this place tonight.  It took over 90 minutes (estimated 45-60).  The food wasn't hot, the rice was just blah, they didn't bring our eggrolls.  So - on their delivery service NO stars - on the food itself - hard to tell honestly - it didn't seem to be what we ordered as was described on the online menu.  Maybe they were just having a bad night but it'll be a while before we try again.

i have tried three times on weekends to get in here, usually not in top form, i may have thrown up the parking lot once...sorry.
but on a sunny thursday morning i manged to get in without much fuss.

usually the fussiness is outside, oh! there is shade now jane l. this makes sense because summer is ovah...duh. so anywho...screaming tots a go go. this is a tiny place...why would you bring your spawn here? i hear tell ihop has balloon animals? maybe you could have them fashion  an anchor shaped balloon creation to match your tattoo flash inspired t-shirt? 

the choices here are slim but the portions are large as well as the amount of grease. hey i like grease...but like red grease dripping out of the back end of my burrito at 4 a.m. because in the gleaming light of the morning it makes me feel so dirty. i had the oats, surprisingly grease free and my partner in breakfast crime had the cheese omelette. i also ordered home fries on the side, some have complained about the rosemary...mine had rosemary, but it looked like it was accidental. pretty bland and boring. the entire experience was pretty bland and boring. i don't see what all of the fuss is about, sure it's good, but it's also breakfast...how hard can it be?

Got sat down quickly and had our orders taken. I asked for #90 and got #19. I waited and waited for our server to come back and he didn't after about 15 mins so I dealt with it and started eating my food. As I'm eating my sister points out a cockroach on the floor next to my feet, she tries to tell someone but they hesitated so she got up and killed it herself. We finally get the check to pay and still had not seen our server (didn't even bring our check) so we paid and left. The food is good but the service and atmosphere makes it difficult to want to come back. Two stars is for the food the cooks made!

Arrived and waited for 10 minutes before I grabbed a menu and asked an employee if the guests were supposed to seat themselves.. He responded \"You can\" and walked by with out furthering assisting me.

"The personnel within this eatery exhibit a high level of cordiality and respect towards their clientele; however, it appears that they are overwhelmingly burdened with responsibilities, thereby rendering it challenging to procure even the most basic acknowledgement or assistance from them. Furthermore, while the queue for placing orders advances rapidly, an extensive delay ensues before the culmination of the food preparation process, which is seemingly disproportionate to the quality of the edibles ultimately presented. A cursory evaluation of the menu reveals offerings that fall short of the standards one might expect from a comparable fast-food chain, such as McDonald's, and yet, the prices charged for these items are conspicuously elevated. Moreover, the dishes are frequently served at an unpleasantly low temperature, and the margaritas, though ostensibly enhanced by an excessive amount of sweetness, lack any discernible flavor profile. In conclusion, if one is willing to invest in an overpriced, mediocre dining experience, all the while supporting local enterprises, then this establishment may be deemed suitable."

The staff here are very nice and polite however, they are also stretched very thin so good luck getting the time of day from someone.

While the line to order goes very quick the delivery time for your food is much lengthier than desired for the quality of food produced.

Moving on to food, they are far below the standard of lets say...McDonald's.  There is nothing wrong with this however, when you pay $8 for a plate of tacos you expect an $8's worth plate of tacos.

The food is delivered cold, the margaritas are unnecessarily over-sweetened and lack any flavor.

Summed up, if you don't mind over paying for less than mediocre food because you'd like to support local businesses then this is your kind of establishment.

I've always suggested this place to friends and co-workers. I usually get takeout from here twice a week. Sometimes they don't have the order ready as soon as they state when you place it, but the most I have ever waited was an extra 10 minutes. The food has always been fresh and tasty.\n\nUntil today. I ordered the 2 roll lunch special and a dynamite roll. I started eating my Dynamite roll only to sudenly have excruciating pain in my mouth. Turns out there was a large piece of wire in one of the pieces!! I cut my tongue and jabbed a hole in my gums. Needless to say I will not be going back. It's one thing to have an 'off night' food wise... But there should never be an excuse for safety issues like this.

The gourmet buffet wars are really heating up in Las Vegas... it seems every few weeks there is a buffet pushing the limits of gourmet in a self serve setting. And I couldn't be happier. However, I am sad to see that the Bayside Buffet at the Mandalay bay is starting to show it's age. The food isnt bad, the service is fine.... but the hotel and resort in general get you in the mindset of expecting that high end experience, and the buffet just doesn't deliver. I think we can expect to see this buffet be one of the next to undergo a major remodel and upgrade...if they don't...I don't see them keeping those tables full.

"Committed the error of patronizing this establishment during Homecoming weekend, and my experience was severely hampered by the sluggish pace of the service. It took an unacceptable duration of over an hour to receive two simple breakfast entrees. While I did not partake in any beverages myself, it appeared that other patrons were enjoying their drink orders. My culinary selection was huevos rancheros with chorizo, a dish I believed would be challenging to prepare incorrectly. However, after enduring the prolonged delay, my expectations were not met, as the eggs were excessively salted, and the visual presentation was uninviting. I fear that I shall not be inclined to return to this venue in the future."

We experimented with dining at The Spot during the luncheon hour, and our culinary excursion proved to be merely average, evoking a sense of familiarity with a casual eatery serving simple fare. Upon conclusion of the repast, it became apparent that the establishment bore a striking resemblance to a humble short-order restaurant.

Our order comprised of the signature Spot sandwich, featuring a rather unremarkable poultry patty nestled between an uninspired bun, as well as a pedestrian chicken salad garnished with a few paltry slices of apple cinnamon bread, accompanied by a scant amount of mixed greens, sliced turkey and ham, and a smattering of walnuts.

The seating arrangements within the premises were somewhat cramped and uninviting, boasting a mere two tables on the main floor and a solitary table situated up a flight of stairs, rendering the venue less than ideal for al fresco dining during the sweltering summer months in Arizona. Consequently, we opted to take our meal outdoors, where the misting system provided a modicum of relief, although the dearth of indoor seating left much to be desired.

A cursory examination of the dessert display case revealed an array of confections that, while visually appealing, failed to pique my interest sufficiently to warrant a review of our dining experience on the very same day we visited the establishment. Suffice it to say, we harbor minimal enthusiasm for revisiting The Spot in the future.

We tried The Spot for lunch, and it was just eh. At the end of the meal, it reminded me more of like a short-order restaurant.

We ordered the Spot sandwich (a plain chicken sandwich with mediocre quality bun), and a chicken salad. The best part of the salad was the little piece of apple cinnamon bread that came on the side. Otherwise, it was little more than salad with deli turkey/ham in it, and some walnuts. 

The seating was uncomfortable, and there's only 2 tables inside downstairs, and 1-ish up the stairs. Not great for summer eating in AZ. We ended up outside. The misters helped a little, but it was disappointing that most of their seating is outdoors.

The dessert case looked pretty good, but not good enough to make me want to try it. 

I doubt we'll go back, it wasn't even compelling enough for me to write this review on the same day we went.

"I arrived at this establishment on a whim, merely due to its proximity to my location. Unfortunately, my culinary experience was underwhelming. Despite this, the interior design and ambiance of the restaurant were quite vibrant and engaging. In fact, one could argue that the decor was excessive, bordering on sensory overload. However, the aquatic display stole the show; the tank housed an array of diminutive aquatic creatures that captivated my attention, their graceful movements hypnotic. 

Moving on to the edibles, I opted for the pad see ew with chicken. Disappointingly, the serving size was meager, and the dish lacked an adequate amount of noodles. Nevertheless, the broccoli was plentiful. The Thai BBQ chicken was unremarkable, failing to impress my palate. As for the garlic chicken, confusion ensued upon its arrival. Our server assured us it was the correct order, yet upon closer inspection, it appeared to be a deep-fried poultry dish smothered in a sweet chili sauce. Baffled, we consumed it nonetheless, grateful for the generous portion size. 

Unfortunately, the service proved sluggish, with even the simplest requestâhot water with lemonâtaking an agonizing twenty minutes to materialize. All things considered, my satisfaction with this dining establishment was limited."

"It appears that the cost of admission at Tropicana Cinemas stands at $1.50 per ticket, but allow me to caution you that the quality of the experience may not align with your expectations, given the limited number of screens and an outdated lobby area featuring vintage arcade games from the 80s and 90s. Furthermore, the low price point seems to attract a demographic prone to disruptive behavior during screenings, such as persistent texting, arguments with security personnel, and bringing young children to inappropriate films. All these factors considered, I might opt for the more expensive options at other cinemas, primarily for the enhanced seating comfort and reduced likelihood of encountering disruptive moviegoers."

Okay, so it is $1.50 per ticket at Tropicana Cinemas. But let me tell you, ya get what ya pay for. There are only I think 5 screens here and a small lobby with 80s and 90s vintage arcade games. It gets crowded in there when people have not yet gone to their theatre. Once inside the theatre you realize that the $1.50 price tag brings in the, um, inconsiderate element. People who spend the movie texting and arguing with security when told to stop. People who bring their screaming kids into a rated R  movie with excessive violence and salty language. People who do not know how to stay in their seats. I would almost rather pay the outrageous prices at other theatres if only for the more comfortable seats and fewer idiots.

After an arduous journey throughout the day, I was eagerly anticipating the prospect of procuring a delectable meal from Paymon's, a renowned establishment specializing in the culinary arts; however, upon placing a telephonic communication with the aforementioned eatery, I was disheartened to discover that they cease to accept any carryout orders beyond the hours of 9 post meridiem.
After traveling all day I was looking forward to ordering carryout from paymons.  When I called in my order I was disappointed to find out they don't take any carryout orders after 9p

I had heard raves about this restaurant so brought 3 guests for dinner.  Food was just ok (the 22 oz  rib eye steak was 50% fat and bones and was undercooked; scallops just ok; frites and vegies barely warm).  Our waitress was very good which compensated a bit for the food.

I've been here a few times. 

The good:
- Very strong drinks. Almost, if there is such a thing, too strong.
- Our first order of cheese curds. Hot, gooey, greasy.
- Cheese soup + chunky tomato soup = delicious bowl of soup.

The bad: 
- Slooow service.
- Our second order of cheese curds. They were made with a different kind of cheese than the first (?) and were rather cold.

I wonder what will change now that they're under new management.

Staff is not knowledgable and unapologetic. Please use better training procedures as I waited 20 minutes for them to figure out a printer situation (and even tried to help with mo knowledge of the product) and they were still unable to assist me. Thank you.

"Our previous sojourn at this establishment was rather satisfactory, approximately three years prior. However, our most recent visit was marred by several unfortunate incidents. Specifically, the room key cards proved defective and required replacement on two separate occasions. Furthermore, the housekeeping staff failed to secure our door properly upon departure, resulting in an unsettling lack of privacy. Additionally, we were roused from slumber on multiple evenings by boisterous guests in the hallway, engaging in nocturnal conversations between the hours of 2 a.m. and 6 a.m. with utter disregard for the sleeping occupants of adjacent rooms. Notably, a fellow guest across the hallway expressed her dissatisfaction with the situation by opening her door and admonishing the revelers to keep the noise level down. Moreover, an unknown individual attempted to force entry into our room late one night, prompting my husband's vociferous intervention. In light of these disturbances, we have resolved not to patronize this hotel in the future."

"Puke. The Chicken Korma's flavor profile resembled that of a rubber ducky, specifically in its texture and consistency, which was unpleasantly reminiscent of a puka. Moreover, the sauce was not the traditional cream or cashew-based variety, but rather a thick and unpalatable substitute that bordered on the grotesque. When requesting all white meat, the waitstaff seemed taken aback by this innocuous query, yet ultimately acceded to my demand. Alas, the poultry arrived undercooked and with an unmistakable whiff of agedness. The chicken tikka masala, once a proud symbol of culinary excellence, had degenerated into a putrid, rancid substance akin to spoiled tomato sauce. The basmati rice, too, had succumbed to desiccation, while the naan bread suffered from an unfortunate excess of heat, leading to an unpleasant charring sensation. The ambiance of the establishment itself was eerily evocative of the infamous Bates Motel, with an unsettling atmosphere of grime and neglect permeating every aspect of the dining experience. Furthermore, the pace of service was sluggish, almost as if the staff were reluctant to interact with patrons. Even the water, ostensibly a basic and essential component of any dining excursion, possessed a curiously fishy tang, further contributing to the overall sense of unease. Perhaps most distressingly, the absence of clientele on a Friday evening only served to enhance the feeling of foreboding and isolation. In conclusion, my visit to this restaurant was an unmitigated disaster, and I would strongly advise against repeating such an experience in the future."

"My anticipation for this park was elevated substantially due to the overwhelmingly favorable assessments proffered by various individuals on Yelp; however, my experience was unfortunately tainted by an abundance of litter, shattered glass, and conspicuous graffiti that permeated the entire area, instilling in me a greater fear of inadvertently stepping on a sharp fragment than encountering a serpent suddenly springing forth from its hiding place."

"My affection towards Papa John's remains steadfast, notwithstanding the subpar experience I had with this particular establishment. Notwithstanding the exceptional customer service I have customarily received, my most recent encounter was marred by an erroneous order, which the delivery person precipitously hurled at us before hastily departing, thereby precluding us from recognizing the mistake until her departure. Furthermore, my attempts to address the issue via telephone were met with a dismissive and discourteous demeanor by the customer service representative, who, after placing me on hold for an extended period, returned to express her powerlessness to effect any meaningful resolution, prior to transferring me to the manager, who, regrettably, proved equally ineffectual in offering a viable solution to the problem (such as arranging for the driver to reverse course or extending a sincere apology). It is my fervent hope that either a different store will become available or that corporate headquarters will assume control over this specific location, as the pizza served by Papa John's is indeed of superior quality and commendably accommodating to vegan dietary preferences, thus rendering it unfortunate if I were compelled to discontinue ordering from them in the future."

I have had previous experiences at Yi that were favorable, however, subsequent to the most recent visit, I will not be returning to the establishment in the future. I brought in a bathing suit, valued at $800, that was a gift, with the intention of having it tailored to fit properly and subsequently reselling it. Upon initial inspection, the garment appeared to be in pristine condition, with all original tags intact. However, upon retrieving the item today, both the primary tag, featuring the barcode, and the secondary tag, which served to secure the thread, were conspicuously absent. 
  When bringing this to the attention of the proprietor, he elected to shift culpability onto myself, implying that I must have misplaced or removed the tags, a notion that is utterly absurd, considering my intentions to sell the item online, thus rendering any alteration to the original state unnecessary and illogical. Furthermore, I emphasized the fact that I did not remove the tags and would never consider doing so, as it would diminish the value of the item. 
 Despite the satisfactory nature of the tailoring services provided, the unacceptable conduct of the proprietor, including the loss of my tags and his refusal to accept responsibility, has led me to decide against patronizing the establishment further. Consequently, I shall take my business elsewhere in the future.

I was eagerly anticipating a tranquilizing facial and massage, and the individuals stationed at the reception area were cordial and accommodating. However, the massage and facial professionals who attended to me were merely adequate in their performance, failing to meet my expectations as a seasoned massage therapist myself. When queried about specific areas of focus during the massage, I naively responded without hesitation, only to be met with a subpar execution by the therapist. She devoted an insufficient amount of time and effort to the designated regions, hastily concluding the massage with a sense of abruptness. The facial treatment paralleled this underwhelming experience, as the youthful and exuberant practitioner, though pleasant, exhibited an excessive eagerness that detracted from the overall relaxation process. Instead of employing slow, deliberate strokes, she opted for rapid, superficial movements that felt more stimulating than soothing. As a novice customer, I received a special offer, but I would never consider paying the standard rate for such an unremarkable service. These practitioners lack proficiency, and I would advise others to avoid them. If interested, please feel free to contact me, and I will discreetly disclose their identities.

I was really looking forward to a relaxing facial and massage. The people at the desk were nice and so were the massage and facial professionals. The massage and facial were average... 
FYI when asked if there is any area you want to focus on in your massage do not say a particular area. I've done it before without issue, but this particular therapist thought that gave her permission to do a pretty good job in the neck and shoulders and rush through the other areas. Seriously like one to two strokes and she was done. When she was done with her rushed one stroke hurried massage, she simply said we are done...No finishing relaxing transition (sorry I am a former massage therapist so I have a lot of expectations in a massage). 
The facial was a similar experience. Happy with what the work she did, but she was young, hyper and wouldn't shut up. She moved fast through the facial with fast strokes like she was trying to wake me up rather than slower deep strokes that would have made it much more relaxing.
As a first time customer, I got a special, but I wouldn't ever pay regular price for a massage here. These guys are amateurs. As a courtesy didn't want to publicly announce therapists names, but message me and I'll share them with you so as to avoid these two young women.
Delicious meal, terrific rice... really too bad we both had intestinal backlash when we returned home. Had to use pepto b. Ugh!

"Profoundly discourteous sales representatives are ubiquitous within this establishment, as evidenced by our recent visit. My companion and I entered the premises with the intention of purchasing an automobile expeditiously, given that my personal vehicle had succumbed to mechanical failure and I was operating a temporary rental. We were scheduled to confer with Luke, with whom I had engaged in prior correspondence; however, he opted to attend to an alternative commitment, thereby necessitating our interaction with an alternative salesperson whose conduct was brusque and displayed an evident lack of interest in facilitating our quest for an appropriate vehicle. Throughout the encounter, I felt profoundly uncomfortable, and it is my conviction that this individual's behavior was responsible for the loss of both clientele and revenue."

Typical rude salesmen working here.  Came in with my boyfriend looking to buy a car immediately since my car died and i was driving a rental.  Was supposed to meet with Luke who I had been corresponding with but he took a different appointment so we met with another salesman who was rude and right off the bat and seemed so disinterested in helping us find a car. Felt so uncomfortable with him from the beginning.  Work on your customer service skills please you just lost customers and money.
