There does seem to be a drastic lack of management. I was determined not to sit outside in minus 1C, so when I asked to speak to a member of management about this, I was told one would be right with me. Still nothing after a 45 minute wait!!!

There are far more accessible places, with better management, and far better food, even the chip shop opposite serves MUCH better fish and chips and at half the price.

This is one place I won't be returning to in a hurry

I am ok with $7.50 warm beers as long as there is a professional sports event in front of me.... The only event that I witnessed was the surprise on everyone's face when they saw how small the portions were!!  I do like the uniforms though.... Reminded me that my car was due for an oil change!!
Been going to Mr. Lucky's for years.  Had the gamblers special.  The shrimp, salad, and potatos were very good.  The quality of the steak has gone downhill.  Disappointed.

Sigh why does everyone like Antonio's so much?  Thin crust = yuck.  Toppings = all oil.  Ingredient freshness = questionable.  Price = (2)*(As expensive as it should be considering the previously implied high oil:crust thickness ratio).  Maybe I just enjoy getting sleazed on by the pizza slicers less than the average Antonio's patron?\n\nThe only redeeming quality of this place is the outlandish variety of toppings:  tortellini, tortilla chips, blue cheese, steak, bacon, you name it, they will cover it in oil and leer at you while they slice it up for you.

If you're a foodie like me, you will NOT be impressed by Hillside Spot. My boyfriend and I came here a couple of weeks ago for a quick lunch after a trip to Ikea. We ordered the Blue Sky burger and a salad/sandwich combo. Let me just say the chopped salad was delicious--but then again how can you go wrong if you use fresh ingredients? The grilled veggie sandwich, however was DIS-GUSTING. The veggies were sopping in oil/grease and were put on the driest piece of bread I've ever had. I couldn't believe that's what they considered the healthy option. The Blue Sky burger was no better...but then again we wouldn't know because the only flavor you could taste was the blue cheese. This place was the biggest disappointment in a long time.\n\nOverall, even with three and a half stars this place is overrated. Just sayin.

Been a four day a week customer of Yogurtland for months. Great place, friendly employees, excellent selection. Decided to try agave out of curiosity. First time there I got the cake batter yogurt and absolutely loved it. I thought this might be my next favorite place. Went the next day and poof! Cake batter was gone. Unlike yogurtland which always has the flavors I like, this place swaps them out daily. I was impressed when the cashier said he had wifi and even provided 15 different cables to charge various devices. My iPhone was almost dead so I asked if he could get me an iPhone charger. Guess what? He didnt have one. Are you kidding? The best device in the world and he has every charger but that one? Also, very pricey. Yogurtland is 8 cents per ounce cheaper. With a family of five that adds up.

We went here tonight for dinner, and the whole experience was just a notch above median. We picked this place through Yelp, and though we cook Indian food (I'm Indian) at least 3 days a week, sometimes we crave for restaurant Indian food. We ordered the mixed grill plate for appetizers and chicken tikka masala and naan for the main course. The mixed grill plate comprised of kabobs (both seekh and tikkas of chicken, lamb and beef) laid on a THICK bed of sauteed onions and a couple of lemon wedges. It arrived sizzling hot, and several people turned their heads to see where that szzzzz sound was coming from!  I dug into it with my mouth salivating in expectation, but it was a rude shock. The chicken was dry to the mouth. The seekh kabobs were overpowered with spices (mainly red pepper), and the quantity--so abysmal! The bed of onions probably weighed more in quantity than the meat. The tikkas were standard fare...oily and spicy gravy, with cubed pieces of chicken. The place is good for students, because it's so close to ASU, but otherwise, I don't think I will go back there again!

"I have an aversion to crafting negative assessments, but this establishment genuinely merits the designation of a refined Outback Steakhouse. My significant other and I requested the Wagyu Filet, and its flavor profile was analogous to that of a conventional filet offered by Outback! Indeed, my partner remains convinced that the restaurant inadvertently served us a standard filet instead of the Wagyu variant...a notion that does not seem entirely implausible. 

Our dining experience involved an expenditure of over $400, encompassing wine, dessert, and an appetizer. Unfortunately, the culinary offerings did not live up to our expectations. While we are known to spend considerable sums of money on gastronomic indulgences due to the experiential aspect, this particular meal did not justify the cost. 

The bone marrow was somewhat enjoyable, but I struggled to reconcile the notion of consuming a $72 filet that lacked any semblance of exceptional quality. Nonetheless, several aspects of our repast proved satisfying, specifically the duck fat fries complemented by a dipping sauce infused with white truffle oil, the remarkable piece of cauliflower accompanying my ostensible filet, and the Darjeeling tea (which was truly outstanding).

In light of our underwhelming experience, we shall endeavor to sample the culinary delights of Jean Georges Steak House at the Aria during our next visit. It is rumored that their Wagyu beef is truly remarkable...and authentic."

I hate writing negative reviews, but this place truly is a glorified Outback Steakhouse.

My boyfriend and I ordered the Wagyu Filet and it tasted like a regular filet from Outback! Even now, my boyfriend swears they gave us a regular filet instead of the Wagyu...he could be right!

We spent over $400 on dinner, including wine, dessert and an appetizer. However, it was not satisfying. We easily spend hundreds of dollars on meals because of the experience we're getting, but this was truly not worth it. 

The bone marrow was good, but I just couldn't stomach eating a $72 filet that tasted mediocre at best. The highlight of our meal was the duck fat fries with white truffle oil infused dipping sauce, the wonderful piece of cauliflower that accompanied my phony filet and the Darjeeling tea (this was outstanding).

I think we'll be trying Jean Georges steak house at the Aria next time. Apparently the Wagyu beef is phenomenal there...and legit!

They're really slipping now.  With dinner, you get cole slaw - you can "upgrade" to soup or salad for 2.50 more.  Really?  I've never heard of cole slaw being a pre-meal before.  I got the French Onion Soup, its actually better at Mimi's.  They put way too much cheese, the bread is pathetic and there's hardly any onions in it.

The prime rib comes with horseradish - very weak and cut with butter.  Never heard of that before either.  Luckily I had some sour cream with my baked potato and I asked for some raw horseradish so I can concoct my own.  Wasn't the best, but way better than the butter!  

The barbeque chicken was ok.  I've had better at diners.  They didn't really season the bird, just threw some barbeque sauce on it.  At least it wasn't terribly dry...

I don't think I'm coming back to this one.  Nooooo..

"St. Francis, our existential surroundings are permeated by cacophonous stimuli, and my cognitive processes were drawn to the concept of partaking in a delectable brunch, complemented by a similarly scrumptious Bloody Mary. The culinary offerings at this establishment are indeed satisfactory, and it is gratifying to observe that the quality of service has undergone significant improvement; however, the presence of a jazz trio within the confines of the dining area engenders an atmosphere that is antithetical to the tranquility I seek. The weekend ambiance is simply not conducive to a relaxing experience, and I must therefore seek alternative venues that can provide the desired level of serenity. My sincere hope is that management will recognize the incongruity of their musical selection and adopt a more appropriate ambiance for those seeking a peaceful repast."

St. Francis, we live in a loud world and I thought the idea of having a delicious brunch, with an equally yummy Bloody Mary, was really appealing. The food is good and the service is getting sooooo much better but what is the deal with the Jazz trio IN the restaurant???  Seriously, we couldn't even hear ourselves talk!!!  You have to figure out what you're going to be during the weekends and I don't think Jazz Club is going to do you any favors.  I really need & want a relaxed environment so will just go down the street from now on.

food here was good. ate the chow mein, calamari, wasabi octopus, and a roll. this would have been a better review but they ruined our dinnner. in the middle of our meal they asked us to move to another table in order to make room for someone else. that just ruined the rest of the dinner and ruined our appetite.

"The gastronomical experience afforded by the consumption of the culinary creations known as burgers at this establishment was satisfactory, and the quality of the meat utilized in their fabrication was indeed impressive. Nonetheless, it is rather vexing that the price paid for a single burger does not include any supplementary victuals, such as sides, which incur additional costs. Furthermore, the speed at which the orders were fulfilled during our visit on a Saturday afternoon left much to be desired, as there was only a solitary individual manning the cash register, thereby resulting in an extensive delay between placing our order and receiving our meals. This, coupled with the repeated utterance of the phrase "Welcome to Smash Burger" or "Thanks for coming to Smash Burger" by the aforementioned singular staff member each time the entrance door opened, contributed to an overall sluggishness that made the dining experience less than optimal, particularly for young children who are easily susceptible to boredom and have limited patience. Consequently, it is unlikely that we will return to this eatery in the future, as there are other venues that offer swifter service and more generous portions at comparable prices."

The burgers were good and the meat they use is great. However, that being said, the fact that you get a burger, only a burger, and nothing but the burger for the money bugs! Any \"sides\" cost extra. The day we were there it was also VERY SLOW! On a Saturday afternoon, during the lunch hour, they had one person working the register taking orders with a line out the door and shouting, (while she took orders) \"Welcome to Smash Burger\" or \"Thanks for coming to Smash Burger\" every time the door opened for people to come in or to leave. We had the kids with us and the waiting time was insane not only to order, but also to get our food. Not a good place to take young children when you need to be in and out with hungry children with short attention spans. Probably won't be going back when we can get faster service and more food for the money elsewhere.

I've been here a few times -- it's ok.  Convenient to my work and the happy hour prices are decent.  The house marg is ok  but kinda small and with LOTS of ice.  The happy hour bar food was ok - nothing special.

The outdoor seating (when the weather is nice) is ok - it faces a parking lot, as does most outdoor seating in AZ.  Also when the weather is accommodating, they open the bar doors to the outside which gives it a cute look / feel. 

Overall - it's just ok. The food is pretty basic and if i used a toaster oven for my costco chimis / flautas - it would be the same.

Wow, getting through security gets worse every time I go.  Last time I went the guy that was looking at the luggage kept passing a piece of luggage through the xray back and forth for 10 minutes, then called over another guy.  They proceeded to have water cooler talk, while the rest of us waited in line, probably remembered that they should be working, went back to examining this same piece of luggage for an additional 10 minutes!! How about we just open the darn thing up if it's going to take so freaking long!

And,Terminal B, with your ridiculous non-signage, you say gates 1-21 are down a corridor, but fail to tell people that once the numbers get to 11 on one side, they start going up on the other side!  So to get to gate 3, you don't have to go all the way down to the end, because the numbers don't drop off.

This place just keeps getting worse and worse.  

PS- 1 of my friends waited 20 minutes in the Starbucks line (in Terminal B).

Well right off the bat the place looks really cool, low walls at the entrance so it already feels like your in the bar, good music, some awesome artwork, and huge TV's everywhere. The problem I have is when you pay $19 for 2 vodka redbulls, which by the way WTF I could by my own bottle of vodka for that, I wouldn't expect my feet to be stuck to the floor... literally almost lost my shoes 3 times. How is it opening week/weekend and the place seemed just dirty?  That makes no sense. Well regardless of the good stuff, I couldn't justify paying another $20 for 2 more drinks while loosing my shoes so we left after about a half hour. In all honesty the place has great potential but with prices like that your only attracting a certain type of people...  Scottsdale dbags.

My 2 stars are for the pleasant demeanor of the person who took our order.
The food was below expectations. We ordered the bhindi masala which had absolutely no salt, yellow daal which wasn't good either. The chicken Tikka masala was eatable though.
Also we ordered laccha paratha hoping to eat laccha paratha but it looked and tasted like butter nan.
Also the service was extremely slow.

Overall a disappointing experience. I would definately not recommend this place to anyone.

Go near this place frequently but never tried until today. Ordered a very simple salad with added grilled chicken. Waited about 15 minutes for the salad (to go). The chicken was cold - I expected warm for the 15 minute wait, there were 4 simple ingredients and it cost $ 10.90.  They also forgot to give me the $2.00 tea I ordered. Maybe I just caught them on a bad day...it is Monday...but probably won't go back.

The design of the restaurant is very winning. I love the metal Buddha entrance way. It is a seriously cool looking place to eat.

BUT ... and this is a freaking ginormous BUT ... the prices for what you get at China Poblano are downright ridiculous. Although above average on taste and presentation, the foods themselves do not merit the prices they charge.

$12 for 4 "When Pigs Fly" which are basically roast pork buns. The dough is very light and the filling is tasteful. BUT it is SPARSE. There was barely any actual filling in the bun. Ludicrous.

A typical roast pork bun costs $1.50 at a Chinese bakery on Spring Mountain and it is FILLED with roast pork.

Go. Go yourself and see. It is like a FREAK show. The most freakishly priced DIM SUM you have every seen. Then go to a normal Chinese restaurant and get five times the amount of food for the same amount of money.

"My initial perception of this establishment is that it possesses an elevated level of appeal, yet upon experiencing its ambiance firsthand, my expectations are frequently disappointed. Notwithstanding, its suitability for group gatherings is a notable advantage, as the tables exhibit a high rate of turnover."
I always think I'm going to love this place, but then when I'm actually there it's just not that great. \n\nGood for groups, though, because the tables turn over pretty fast.

"A retrospective reverie ensued, transporting me back to my inaugural visit to Las Vegas a decade ago. Visualize, if you will, the sheer incredulity evoked by this pulsating playground, as well as the boundless anticipation pertaining to the impending encounter with the fabled Strip. The aerodrome itself presented an arresting spectacle, replete with scintillating luminosity, vibrant signage, and the cacophonous symphony of slot machines resonating throughout. Fast-forwarding to the present era, subsequent excursions having transpired, culminating in my most recent sojourn; regrettably, the venue appears in dire need of a comprehensive renovation. A prodigious sum was expended on the novel City Center within Las Vegas's Strip precinct, yet it seems that a comparable investment in the airport remains conspicuously absent, resulting in an unaltered ambiance characterized by an antiquated aesthetic. A simple refurbishment, such as a fresh coat of paint, would suffice in proffering a marked improvement. No drastic metamorphosis Ã  la San Francisco International Airport is being solicited; rather, a judicious modernization would assuage my concerns."
"The poker room, characterized by its diminutive size and unimpressive ambiance, is plagued by an excessive amount of smoke that permeates the space, originating from the adjacent slot area."
TOO MUCH SMOKE IN THE POKER ROOM....Poker room is too small and lame.  There is too much smoke drifting in from the slot area

I went to lunch today with my family and hadn't been to this location in some time. The table had a sticky residue around the perimeter that was really unpleasant. I looked out the window and immediately saw 4 flies on the inside folks. I look down and the window sill was dirty and the white shudders were equally grimy. 

I ordered an iced tea wondering if I could talk my family into going somewhere else. Nope auntie wanted pie. The iced tea was not brewed. Dissaponting. I ordered the potato soup, meatball sliders and double cream lemon pie. 

The soup was creamy and delicious as always. Yay! The meatball sliders, were just ok. The onions were caramelized nicely but the meatloaf was sort of grainy. If you have had mre meatloaf, it was like that. You get two, I sent one home. The pie was awesome with the tart lemon filling and lemon cream. The crust was nice and flakey.

Take some time, clean your restaurant and go back to brewed iced tea. You do so well with the tired and true recipes, the meatloaf was just meh. I really hate giving you a two star but the cleanliness and the tea just really turned me off.

"Upon perusing the menu at this locally-owned eatery, I opted for the chicken lo mein lunch special, anticipating a satisfying repast. However, upon receipt of my order, I was dismayed to discover that the protein component had been misidentified, and I had, in fact, been served pork. This precipitated an extended colloquy with the staff, during which I endeavored to rectify the situation. Unfortunately, both the pork and chicken proved to be overcooked and lacking in any discernible seasoning, while the lo mein itself exhibited an unpleasant oily residue. The egg drop soup also lacked any appreciable seasoning, and the egg roll presented an enigmatic flavor profile that defied identification, even upon meticulous examination of its contents. The red sweet and sour sauce, however, did display an unexpected piquancy, although it failed to redeem the overall dining experience. Having patronized this establishment on two previous occasions, I must regretfully conclude that the culinary offerings have consistently fallen short of my expectations, despite the laudable efforts of the service staff. As such, I fear that I shall not be inclined to return, even given its proximity to my domicile."

Ordered chicken lo mein lunch special, took quite a while to receive it...but it was pork. Quite a conversation getting it changed. Pork and chicken were both chewy and overcooked, no seasoning whatsoever. Lo mein was ok, but had a strange oily aftertaste. Egg drop soup also had no seasoning. Egg roll was very strange tasting...couldn't really identify what was inside even after breaking it apart (I was told it was carrot mostly). Red sweet/sour sauce was oddly spicy, but not bad. I had been in this place twice before and was underwhelmed with the food, although the service was excellent and the lunch prices were reasonable. I like to support local businesses, but definitely wont go back, even though it is close to my home.

Went with my boyfriend for a few after dinner drinks and was a bit disappointed. The place was packed but the 2 bartenders were more concerned about talking to their friend or the regulars. The service was extremely slow.

Way overpriced. I paid just about $21 for a burger basket, an order of cheese curds, bottled water, and two custard cones. Not even worth the price!!!!Culvers would have been a better option. the food was ok, but I suppose the custard was good.

"Alas, Lakeside, what has transpired?

Formerly, this establishment held the esteemed position of my most beloved yarn store in Madison. However, subsequent to its acquisition by the proprietors of The Knitting Tree (whose customer service was, regrettably, consistently brusque and unaccommodating), my exuberance for visiting has been significantly diminished. Upon my recent return to Wisconsin to reunite with my family, I was eager to experience Lakeside once again, as I had not had the opportunity to do so during the holiday season. 

My anticipation was quickly replaced by profound disappointment. 

The imposing wall of Cascade 220, once a staple of the shop, had vanished. Furthermore, the coffee shop area, previously abundant with an array of yarns, was now devoid of any substantial selection. The remaining yarns were scattered meagerly throughout the premises, rendering the space seemingly barren and uninviting. Although the renovations aimed to create a more open atmosphere, the dearth of inventory was only made more conspicuous by the expanded layout. I yearned for the days when I could leisurely indulge in my cheese sandwich while gazing upon the Cascade wall, lost in thought, contemplating future projects. 

Unfortunately, my visit was not graced with a warm welcome or any offers of assistance. As I departed, none of the staff members bothered to acknowledge my presence or express any interest in facilitating my shopping experience. 

In essence, Lakeside has become a shadow of its former self, eliciting feelings of melancholy and regret."

"2.0 Stars. 

It is comprehensible that establishments within airports engage in price inflation due to the captive consumer base; however, charging $9.99 for a minuscule burrito that barely suffices as a snack rather than a meal is an egregious example of such practice. 

The culinary delight, albeit flavorful, was a paltry offering that left me feeling deprived of a truly satiating dining experience, especially considering the exorbitant price point. 

In retrospect, I would have been better served by embarking on a brief excursion throughout the airport to investigate the presence of a McDonald's restaurant, which, as fate would have it, does indeed exist. 

To avoid financial remorse, it is advisable to refrain from dining at this establishment if a substantial meal is what one seeks."
Service was slow. Ordered seafood platter; some cold, some raw. Sent back and they just reheated the plates.  Not good value.

Too big. Unorganized chaos even if you are on a guest/bottle list. Go from one line to another, then back because no one knows what they are doing. VIP host kept the D&G tag on his suit.... Dude that's supposed to come off when you get that shit tailored, ultra douchey. PS get that shit tailored.

Bad Experience!!! I loved the selection of cars they had. I went there yesterday to test drive a lexus is250 used. I fell in love with the car and would of bought it right then and there. But the sales associate Easton McIntosh was terrible!!! If you ever go there please see another sales associate! I have never felt that belittled ever by someone.If your buying a car you should never feel like that. One, its already a stressful situation buying a car. Second, to have the sales associate talk you down and belittle you is so unprofessional. At one point he said to me and my dad; \"Why are you even here if you cant afford the car.\" HOW RUDE!!!! Tells you a lot about the company if they have people like that working for them. They were non negotiable. This is my first car and I had 50% cash down payment and he still wouldn't work with me. Ill find another car elsewhere and where they appreciate my business. To bad because I loved the car. If anyone on here knows of another sales associate at this dealership who is willing to work with you let me know, thank you!!

Dr. Anjali Iyengar is, to say the least, inexperienced. So much so I would call her green. She has no bedside manner and very little tact when interacting with patients and patient care givers or relatives. She has no understanding of compassion or empathy and her answers to your medical questions are textbook perfect. She lacks common sense, patient etiquette and in my opinion has no love or caring to share with her clients. I say clients because that is what she sees us as. Nothing more. If you don't mind being treated like a non-human and getting critical care from a very inexperienced doctor then she is perfect for you. If you are looking for someone who will treat you well with care and concern while sharing personal experience then please do yourself a favor and find another cancer doctor. This person will not give two thoughts about you beyond your office visits and she quite openly admits to not caring about patients or their caregivers. Push here a little bit for answers and see what she says to you ;)

I know gas stations are not 5 star service or expected the bathrooms to be sparkling but damn... We made a pit stop here since gas was .10 cheaper than the BP across the street and whew... I'm thinking we should have payed the difference... 

You know those slasher/killer movies where people are about to get it in a run down gas station? Yep that's the status of the men's bathroom here... It's the kind of place in which if you gotta go... Well pray first then use plenty of hand washing techniques and hand sanitizer afterwords. The bathroom hadn't looked like it was cleaned in months, there was cigarette butts in the stalls and I'm sure the dude in the single toilet stall was giving birth to a small grizzly bear due to his natural and unnatural noises and remarks. 

They do get a second star only due to the fact that they are cheaper than competitors but they seriously lack cleanliness. I would not advise the kiddo's to use the restroom here.

So used to Love this place but not so much anymore......waitstaff SUCKS SOOOOOO BAD! It took 30 mins to get a drink from our waitress, no one ever came to take our empty food plates, she was too busy admiring herself at mirror. Horrible service the only reason I gave 2 star is because happy hour drink prices are good.  Sushi is sub par, it's just run down and staff thinks they're really special.

My partner was compelled to secure a reservation in order to partake in a culinary experience at this establishment, and it required three separate attempts on his behalf prior to successfully securing said reservation. Upon initial observation, the exterior of the restaurant appears unremarkable, yet upon entering, it unfolds to reveal an interior that is somewhat more agreeable.

The dining area is densely populated, and the servers persist in colliding with our chairs, despite having ample space to navigate around us without such inconvenience. Considering the abundance of superior alternatives, the cuisine offered herein is vastly overhyped, and the inconvenience associated with dining at this location renders it even less worthwhile.

My partner had to make reservation to eat at this joint and it took him three attempts. It looks like a regular restaurant from the outside but it opens up as you go into the restaurant which was a little more pleasant. \n\nIt's very crowded and the servers continuously bump our chairs when they have plenty of space to walk around us. Overrated and this food can be purchase at any Thai restaurant. Not worth the hassle.

The ambiance of this establishment captivates my attention and elicits an emotional response, as the harmonious blend of illumination, spacious seating, and tasteful decor creates a visually stunning atmosphere that exudes elegance and sophistication. However, my culinary experience falls short of expectations, as the menu offerings fail to deliver a level of gastronomical excellence commensurate with the exceptional quality of the interior design. It is unfortunate that such an impressive setting is not complemented by a corresponding standard of gastronomy, as even the most basic dishes, such as a well-cooked burger, fall short of my expectations. This disparity between the superior aesthetic appeal and subpar culinary offerings engenders a sense of disappointment and frustration, as the potential for a truly exceptional dining experience remains unrealized.

I LOVE the interior of this place, its stunning! the lightning is perfect, huge bar, awesome furniture and so on... BUT the food is NOT up to pair unfortunately... if it wasn't for the poor food this place is 5 stars easily...  to bad! Even the simplest things like a decent cooked burger... sad and such a waste!

"Eccentric occurrence! Contacted and requested a taxi to the aerodrome. Estimated arrival duration at my domicile: fifteen minutes. The female who responded to my telephone call averred that they could not ensure a specific time frame. I acquiesced and opted to utilize an alternative enterprise. Subsequently, another individual rang me back and guaranteed that a taxi would arrive within fifteen minutes. Considering my residence is merely a few minutes away from the destination, I did not deem this request unreasonable. The driver presented himself and failed to ascend to my dwelling to retrieve my luggage; instead, he waited for me to convey everything down the driveway. This behavior may have stemmed from some sort of hindrance or inconvenience. The driver was experiencing respiratory discomfort, evidenced by his persistent coughing and expectorating mucus onto the pavement. I was transported to the terminal, albeit not directly in front of the curbside, hence I was compelled to haul my baggage myself. Despite the reasonable fare, I cannot help but feel perplexed by the eccentricities encountered during this journey. In eager anticipation of the city's construction of supplementary light rail stations, which would enable me to transport my belongings at a fraction of the present cost."

Weird experience! Called and asked for a taxi to the airport. Arrival time to my house 15 min. The woman that answered the phone said they can't guarantee a time. I said ok then I will use a different company. Someone else called me back and said they would be there in 15 min. Keep in mind my house is literally five minutes away so I didn't consider this an unreasonable request. The guy showed up and didn't come up to the house to grab my bags and instead waited for me to bring everything down the drive way. I think that might have been because he had some kind of an issue. He was coughing and spitting phlegm all over the sidewalk. I got dropped off at the terminal but not in front of curb side so again had to drag my bags he didn't bother to take them over. I did make it to the airport in one piece and the fare was reasonable but I am only 15 min away. Can't wait for the city to build additional light rail stops! If I have to drag my bags I would rather do it for a quarter of the cost. Weird weird weird!

"Our previous dining experience during the daytime hours was characterized by an impressive display of delectable dim sum offerings, which unfortunately did not translate into an equally satisfying culinary excursion during the evening hours. Specifically, the pace of service this evening was regrettably sluggish, prompting me to request the attention of the manager, whom I informed of our impending scheduling commitments and politely inquired whether it would be feasible to expedite the arrival of our meals. In response, the manager summoned a waitress, who appeared relatively swiftly, and we placed our orders for Singapore noodles and wrinkled green beans. However, while we did receive the green beans in a timely fashion, the noodles remained conspicuously absent from our table for approximately ten minutes, necessitating my intervention once again with the manager, who subsequently contacted the waitress and relayed the information that the chef required a bit more time to prepare the dish. Ultimately, both dishes were of satisfactory quality, yet it would have been preferable to savor them simultaneously."

"In general, the culinary offerings were satisfactory, however, the quality of the sushi was not exceptional, neither was it subpar. My dining companion and I opted to sample a variety of items from the menu, including an assortment of sushi and appetizers. Unfortunately, the hospitality we received was inadequate and left much to be desired. The server was inattentive, unresponsive, and seemed indifferent to our needs, compelling us to request necessities multiple times. The pace of service was also sluggish, which further detracted from our dining experience, despite the modest number of patrons present. In light of this, it is my recommendation to consider takeout options instead."

Our progenitors conveyed us to this culinary establishment for an evening repast, during which we had the pleasure of consuming comestibles that, while not necessarily possessing exceptional gastronomic qualities, were nevertheless palatable. Furthermore, it is worth mentioning that the ambiance of the restaurant was marked by a notable lack of patronage during our visit, which rendered the atmosphere somewhat desolate. However, the hospitality proffered by the staff was indeed commendable, as they exhibited a high level of proficiency in their attentive and courteous demeanor towards us.

I'll keep this short and sweet.

Eight bucks for a chicken pita with lots of chicken and absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  I mean, no flavor at all.

The place is mysteriously crowded.  I honestly can't imagine why.

This is McDonalds for people who don't want to feel like they are walking into a McDonalds. Like McDonalds, it's also a national chain, so I'm not sure why people are saying it's "locally owned," or at least any more locally owned than your local McDonalds.

http://www.zoeskitchen.com/menu.asp

"Consistently received satisfactory service. Male employees manifested proficiency and expertise. Subsequently, I opted to trade my used gear for store credit, supplemented by an additional ten percent of the overall acquisition cost. Following a meticulous examination, I deemed it a reasonable arrangement. However, I should have chosen the cash alternative. Upon my return to procure a lens, I was informed that the aforementioned ten percent had already been incorporated into my store credit, thereby resulting in a discrepancy of $55 instead of the anticipated $50 in store credit. This elicited perplexity on my part, as I had observed several individuals receive their store credit accompanied by the aforesaid ten percent bonus on their purchases. It appeared to me that the buyback event was being misrepresented to entice customers to expend funds at their establishment."

Always had good service. Guys were helpful and knowledgeable. Then  I sold my old equipment for store credit plus 10% of my total purchase ( I doubled checked) I was thinking it was a good deal. I should have taken the cash. When I returned to purchase a lens I was told that the 10% was already added to my store credit and that's why I got $55 instead of $50 in store credit. How does that make sense? I was disappointed since I had watched a few people get their store credit plus 10% of their purchases. Made me feel like they were falsely advertising their buy back event so that people would spend money at their store.

"An inadequate aeronautical facility characterized by an exposed location susceptible to strong gusts of wind, thereby leading to frequent delays and inconvenience. Additionally, the terminal's maintenance leaves much to be desired in terms of cleanliness. My experience involved an arduous process of navigating through poorly designated passageways, precipitating an urgent request for assistance from an airline representative. Subsequently, I was compelled to traverse unlabeled doors, descend a flight of stairs, and await transportation via an unconventional shuttle bus before finally arriving at my designated gate."

"Miniature in magnitude, congested to an excessive degree, and imposing a financial burden on patrons through the implementation of a cover charge, while simultaneously lacking adequate seating arrangements for its clientele, this establishment may not be the optimal choice for those seeking a comfortable and enjoyable experience, particularly when considering the temperature of the customer base in relation to that of the service staff, although, if one's preferences lean towards the realm of rock and country karaoke accompanied by moderately potent beverages served by bartenders whose physical attractiveness falls short of exceptional standards, then this venue may prove to be somewhat satisfactory, albeit still falling considerably short of the quality offered by its New York City counterpart, and, by extension, the greater city of Las Vegas as a whole."

Small. Crowded. Cover charge. No seating. Customers were hotter than the help.

But if you like rock and country karaoke with spendy weak drinks both served up by cute but not hot bartenders. This is your place.

Little or no fair comparison to the original in NY. Same can be said of the rest of NYNY-Vegas.

I will say the best part about the whole place is the Apple store, biggest one I have seen thus far. However, getting into the place and parking is a nightmare. Either there is too little of it on the sides or most of it is valet parking only. The place is like a little village of shopping. Just too far of a drive and it didn't leave enough impression to make the drive worthwhile. I can't see how this place can be very popular during the summertime seeing as it is outdoor shopping.

Saw the excalibur show - EXCELLENT.  The horse appeared in excellent condition.\n\nHowever the casino was nasty dirty.  Please consider hiring some folks to wipe down and clean up, did not want to touch the doors/windows.

"It perplexes me that an establishment of this caliber would require patrons to secure an appointment prior to partaking in a beverage, only to be served by bartenders who appear utterly disinterested in their work, almost as if they are extending a great favor by simply fulfilling their duties; furthermore, the downstairs area, while offering superior service, unfortunately serves as a venue for culinary offerings that can best be described as uninspired and lackluster, not to mention the interminable delay between ordering and receiving one's meal from the kitchen; but, alas, the true piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance lies in the exorbitant pricing, a staggering $35-$40 for a dish that not only fails to impress but also suffers from an unfortunate surfeit of oil, rendering the entire experience a veritable travesty; needless to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment, and I daresay, neither should anyone else who values their hard-earned dollars and a palatable dining experience."

The sentiment of disillusionment permeates my thoughts regarding the transformation occurring at Hilldale, as the once quaint and charming shopping center has opted to transition its layout to an outdoor setting, which, in my opinion, defeats the purpose of having a shopping mall in the first place; furthermore, this drastic change has resulted in the departure of numerous small businesses that were previously a vital component of the mall's unique charm, leaving behind a desolate atmosphere reminiscent of a ghost town.

So disappointed with the changes at Hilldale.  Why would you want to make a mall outside in Madison WI? I used to love being able to browse in small shops without worrying about the weather. Sadly, many of the small shops that I enjoyed have moved or gone out of business.  \nIt feels like a ghost town now.

"A paltry sum of two reviews for a McDonald's, perchance? Allow me to augment that number to three, forthwith! 

My personal experience at this establishment has been somewhat lackluster, I must confess. On four separate occasions, I have graced this location with my presence, only to be met with an inordinate number of errors in my order. Specifically, on three of those occasions, the staff has failed to accurately fulfill my requests. One particularly egregious instance involved a lengthy delay in receiving my chicken mcnuggets via the drive-thru, during which time I was instructed to park and wait for a staff member to deliver my order. This unfortunate turn of events transpired no less than 20 minutes! 

However, I must admit that the interior of the restaurant does possess a certain je ne sais quoi, boasting ample space and impressive cleanliness. Furthermore, the location's proximity to the strip and availability of convenient parking cannot be overlooked. 

P.S. It is worth mentioning that a superior fast food option, In-and-Out, lies merely a stone's throw away, situated but a single block further up the street."

Only 2 reviews for a McDonalds, hmmm...make it 3!

Let's just say, not the best.  I've been 4+ times to this location.  3 of the 4 times, they had my order wrong.  Once, when ordering chicken mcnuggets via the Drive-thru, they asked me to pull around the corner and park...and they would bring it out to me.  I waited 20 minutes!  

On a positive note, if you order and decide to eat there, the inside is actually pretty big and kept clean.  It's also offstrip and has easy parking.  

P.S. In-and-Out is just one more block up the street!

"Upon visiting this establishment during the previous weekend, my companion and I were greeted by the host, an elderly gentleman who, though somewhat brusque in his demeanor, efficiently directed us to our seating arrangement and proffered the menus without bothering to escort us to our table. Following a brief interval, a server appeared, and we placed our order for two cosmopolitan cocktails. Upon sampling the beverages, we were unanimous in our assessment that the taste was unpalatable, rendering them undrinkable. We subsequently requested an alternate selection of wine, which our server hastened to provide, though not before covertly ridiculing us within earshot of the bartender. Despite this unsettling encounter, the quality of the cuisine redeemed the dining experience, particularly the delectable peel-and-eat shrimp. Though the customer service left much to be desired, I am willing to accord the restaurant a second chance, during which I sincerely hope for a marked improvement in the quality of hospitality; elsewise, rest assured that my dissatisfaction shall be vocally expressed."

"A seemingly exceptional dining establishment within the confines of Aliante Station, boasting an additional star owing to the pleasant demeanor of its staff, yet faltering to deliver a palatable culinary experience, unfortunately. My expectations were not adequately met, as the potato pancakes I sampled possessed an unpleasant tang of lemon and vinegar, which rendered them unpalatable, and my attempts to communicate this dissatisfaction to the server were met with an unyielding insistence on her part that the unconventional flavor profile was inherent to the traditional German recipe. As a person unfamiliar with the intricacies of waiting tables, I would venture to say that basic logic dictates that a patron who consumes only a minuscule portion of their order, specifically two bites from an abundant platter of potatoes, does not warrant inclusion of said item on their bill. However, this notion appeared to be lost on the restaurant's staff, leading me to deduce that those who are incapable of effectively serving food opt to impart their knowledge to others instead. Suffice it to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment."

Another "great" restaurant inside Aliante Station.

I gave them an extra star for the perky staff. But that's it. 

I tried the potato pancakes. You get a ton of them! Too bad they tasted like lemon and vinegar. I took  two bites out of a plate that was LITERALLY overflowing with pancakes. I tried telling the server that something was wrong because they tasted terrible and she insisted that the vinegar-lemon taste was the German recipe.

Now, I've never waited tables before. But it's common sense to me that if a fat lady orders a giant platter of potatoes and takes literally two small bites, she didn't like it and it should have been removed from the bill. But that's just me. Those who can't do, teach. Right?

Won't be back. Nope.

As a bride I was VERY disappointed with the services!  They ran more than a half hour past my appointment making me late to my own wedding and because the hair dresser was rushing the curls all fell out and my hair looked horrible; I would have been better off doing it myself!

DID YOU KNOW ALL THE CHEESECAKE FACTORIES ARE THE SAME?  

I have been to a few of them, and this one was like the others.  If you like one where ever you are, then you'll like this one.  

SERVICE:  
The wait is long if you go around dinner time.  We waited, gambled, and drank to get a buzz and went later than 9:00 p.m.   So, we got seated fairly quickly.  The service...nothing special...it's what you'd expect at any Cheesecake Factory restaurant.  

FOOD QUALITY:  
The food was okay.  It was, as I said earlier, like any other Cheesecake Factory on the planet.  

WOULD I GO THERE AGAIN?: 
Probably not.

Storytime!

Weekend. 12:30 AM. Out being rowdy with a nice group of friends. "Let's go to Mario's." Reluctantly, I oblige--we walk in and head to the top floor. A DJ poorly transitions 90s favorites with modern hits. The place is packed--short skirts, popped collars, the reek of cologne and stale beer. We find a place to group together and dance/talk/drink a bit. A group of well-dressed 20-something bros starts laughing and wafting in my direction. "Bro, I just let out a wicked fart, and it's COMIN' YOUR WAY. IT'S SO GROSS." I can confirm that it was gross.

A waitress walks by and spills beer all over my leg. Whoops. She grabs my shoulder and says "whoops." A girl falls over trying to take off her heels. A few more girls stumble around as some dudes smell the vulnerability and swoop in to talk about how expensive their watches are.

I don't mean to be negative, and I'm always down for a party...I'm just not trying to have a bunch of bros fart on me. I thought we had enough of that in college.

Mario's is an alright sports bar as long as you don't go after 10 PM on Thursday-Saturday. Whenever I've been for food and sports and a Yuengling, I haven't been disappointed; the service could be a bit slow, but oh well.

Great food.  Reasonably priced(relative).  But service is horrendous.  I believe we received terrible service because we weren't interested in ordering a bunch of appetizers or bottles of wine.  We were a group of 10 guys all in late 20s early 30s in town for a bachelor party, beer and liquor and meat is all we needed .  Our waitress ignored is the entire night but surprisingly all the tables around us were receiving 5 star service.  I can't rate higher than a 2 with the service being as bad as it was.  What a shame.

While the room itself is decent for what we paid, the casino itself with the people who work there are total failure!!    Dont expect to have a fun gamble and get you drink when you play with brick face dealer who is sitting there emotionless like a robot machine.  For the time I spend there gambling, I never had the drinks serve and bartenders in a bar dont care to talk to you unless you flush your cash for their tip.  \nIf you on a budget,I recommend for  you to stay at Luxor but party and gamble somewhere else.

Meh!  Very average food, poor HH, especially the wine.  I really wanted it to be good but was not impressed.  I left with a $30 bill after 2 average tacos, a very small pour on a cheap wine( which was $9) and a side of beans.  \nThe bad was beautiful.  Too bad the food did not match the atmosphere.

Typical Indian restaurant. Greasy and oily food. Taste was okay. Experience was okay at best. 
- We used the yelp 15% off coupon here - the owner firstly frowned after looking at the deal (promotion that they had been running). He honored the deal but made us feel as if he was doing us a favor. 
- They were catering a private party in the restaurant and still kept it open for general public. The party family kids created havoc, noise and jumped on our tables. Horrible service, they never even cared to apologize for the inconvenience. At least they didnt serve us from the buffet as the party (which I have seen many cheap Indian restaurants do)
- There are many other good restaurants in Vegas that have great reviews on Yelp. Skip this one if you can.
Good selection, but the food was rather boring. Ate here once. Won't go back. Go to the food court or tgi Friday's instead

Order consisted of queso, guacamole and assorted tacos. In brief lacking in flavor. The guacamole was not flavorful at all. Slow, inattentive service. Many better choices out there for mexican. Will not be back.

"While the experience was not optimal, I may consider giving it another attempt. Allow me to elaborate: upon entering the establishment, I endeavored to peruse the menu, which was positioned at an uncomfortably close proximity to my visage, parallel to the wall. Following a brief examination, I managed to identify an item that piqued my interest. Consequently, I placed an order for a bratwurst, accompanied by various toppings, as well as several children's meals. It is worth noting that the children's meal advertised the inclusion of a hot dog, potato chips, and a carbonated beverage. Upon inquiring about the supplementary sides accompanying the children's meal, the manager displayed a discernible level of irritation at my apparent lack of comprehension regarding the operational dynamics of the eatery. His response, delivered with a perceptible sigh, was: 'Everything here is Ã  la carte.' This elicited a degree of curiosity on my part, as the menu failed to adequately convey this information. Specifically, I pondered whether additional toppings, such as onions, would incur an extra charge. However, I chose not to pursue this line of inquiry further, given the manager's dismissive demeanor. 

It is worth mentioning that both the French fries and tater tots were prepared using a baking process, which unfortunately did not yield the most palatable results. The bratwurst itself, priced at approximately $7, seemed somewhat steep for a product that had been pre-cooked and merely reheated in a bun. Nonetheless, the flavor profile was satisfactory, and the establishment boasts an extensive selection of sausages. Thus, I may opt to give it another chance. My sole recommendation would be for the staff to refrain from exhibiting condescending behavior towards patrons who are spending a considerable amount of money, particularly during the early stages of operation. A total of $12 for a bratwurst, fries, and soft drink (Pepsi being the lone option, much to my dismay) strikes me as rather exorbitant. Perhaps the management could consider implementing a more customer-friendly approach, and I might return with my luxury vehicle to sample their offerings once again."

Not great but. I will probably try again.

Let me explain: you go in and try to read a menu that is about 10" from your face, along the wall. Ok fine, I found something I wanted. So I ordered my brat, toppings, etc. and a few kids meals. The kids meal indicates that a hot dog, chips, and soda are included. When I asked about the side for the kids meal, the manager acted kind of annoyed that I didn't understand how things work. He said, with a sigh, like this is the dumbest thing he'd ever heard, " everything here is ala carte". Even the kids meal? Well that's interesting because the menu does a horrible job of showing that. Then does that mean toppings like onions cost extra too? I didn't bother asking because the guy was kind of a d*ck about the menu. 

The fries and tots are baked, and not very good. The brat alone cost about $7 which is a lot for something that was pre-cooked and sitting in some kind of oil or water solution before he put it in the bun.

But the flavor was good and they have lots of sausages, so I will probably try again. Just how about not acting like a jerk when a family spends $50 on your second day of operation, and your menu is incredibly confusing. $12 for a brat, fries, and Pepsi (yeah, no coke) is a lot. Bring your Bentley and try it for yourself.

I am utterly perplexed regarding the commencement of my narrative, as my encounter was regrettably unpleasant from the moment I entered the establishment. Upon being greeted, I was hastened through the process of placing my order, subsequent to which I endured an excruciating wait of over twenty minutes for my meal. Upon returning to my workplace to consume my food, I was thoroughly dismayed by its unpalatable nature, as it not only possessed an unpleasant aroma but also an acrid taste that failed to conform to my expectations. My culinary experience was further marred by the fact that I had opted for Mongolian Beef and Clear Soup, both of which were subpar in terms of preparation and flavor, with the former being excessively oily, overseasoned, and tough, while the latter was merely average and lacking in depth of flavor. Furthermore, the steamed rice accompanying my dish was undercooked, contributing to my overall dissatisfaction. To add insult to injury, I was charged an exorbitant sum of over thirteen dollars for a meager lunch entree and soup, sans beverage. Needless to say, I am left feeling utterly disillusioned and still experiencing hunger pangs due to the inadequacy of my meal.

"My sentiments regarding this establishment are ones of unmitigated disappointment, stemming from the uninspired culinary offerings and the sluggish pace of the service, thereby rendering the overall experience merely passable, yet ultimately unsatisfying; thus, it is my conviction that one would be better advised to seek out alternative dining options within the vicinity."

"I patronized this establishment for a midday repast, and unfortunately, the hospitality was subpar.  The culinary offerings were merely adequate; I opted for the sashimi Benito box.  Alas, the miso dressing accompanying my salad was diluted and lacked depth of flavor.  Moreover, it appeared that my request for a seaweed salad had fallen by the wayside, an oversight that was not rectified despite my bringing it to the attention of the server.  Her response, though well-intentioned, struck me as perfunctory and lacking in contrition.  Upon presenting the tab, she exclaimed, 'I took it off the bill for you,' her countenance radiating an almost condescending joviality, as if she had bestowed upon me some grand favor.  Needless to say, the omission of the seaweed salad from my order was not exactly a boon."

I very, very rarely write in to Yelp, but I feel like I need to be the tie-breaker on this one, as the reviews are wildly divergent.

There are two possibilities for this place.  Either

a) it entirely depends on when you are here

or

b) people don't know what good BBQ is here in Madison.

Now, I live in NYC now, so I'm a bit food-spoiled.  But I love BBQ, so my standards are pretty low.

This was not good BBQ.  I had the full ribs, with mac & cheese, succotash.  Sides were alright, nothing to write home about.  The ribs were overcooked and dried out, and were intolerable on their own.  Sure, if you slather them in enough BBQ sauce, they taste alright, but so does cardboard.

Don't go.  Overly expensive (at least by Madison standards) and just flat out not good BBQ.

"Gastronomical offerings that fail to measure up to the elevated standards of Taco Bell are presented at a price point reminiscent of fine dining establishments, while beverages that lack potency are served in conjunction with them. Notwithstanding the subpar culinary experience, the attentive nature of the staff warrants a rating of two stars, thereby distinguishing this eatery from others that have been deemed unworthy of even a solitary star."

Ugh.  Food that is not nearly as good as Taco Bell is priced like it's four diamond fare.  And to go with it, enjoy the weakest drinks on the strip.  The only reason this place gets 2 stars instead of one is that the service was good.

The service here is non-existent.  We were seated 6 inches away from another table, after being told we couldn't sit at a different table, because there were only two of us and this particular table had 3 chairs. Then we waited for a long time for a server to come, which never happened.   Finally just got up and left.  Very disappointed.

"It is my conviction that the aesthetic appeal of this establishment is undeniable; however, the quality of service I received during my visit was utterly deplorable. Firstly, I was obligated to compensate the proprietors for the privilege of donning their attire, and subsequently, I was met with an unjustified restriction regarding the number of guests I could bring along to witness my nuptial attire. Furthermore, the sales representatives exhibited patronizing and forceful behavior, which only served to exacerbate my dissatisfaction. Notwithstanding these shortcomings, I opted to procure my gown from them, albeit reluctantly. Unfortunately, the ensuing experience proved to be equally unsatisfactory, as the undergarment provided was excessively rigid and caused significant discomfort for my bridesmaid, rendering it arduous for her to fasten and unfasten, and ultimately resulted in prominent bruising on my torso that persisted for a period of three months. This physical distress substantially diminished my enjoyment of my wedding day, thus leading me to conclude that I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this business. Moreover, the gown they created for me bore little resemblance to the one I had originally tried on, leaving me feeling disappointed and disillusioned with the overall appearance, despite any attempts at alteration they may have made."

I must say that the look of this shop is lovely but the experience I had there was terrible: \n\nFirstly, I had to pay the fee to try on the dresses and then they were so rude about me bringing more than two people with me to try on, though of course I wanted to bring my mum, step mum and mother in law to see my wedding dress. The staff were condescending and pushy and lots of the dresses fairly tacky looking. However they turned out to be the best of a bad bunch so in the end I did buy my dress from them. On the day however the corset was very hard for my bridesmaid to do up, agony to sit down in, warped in shape by the end on the evening and left me with bruising around my ribs that lasted 3 months. Being in pain like this really put a dampen on my wedding day so needless to say, I cannot recommend them. Also, the dress they made me looked nothing like the one I had tried on initially in shape so I was disappointed with the look despite any modifications they tried to make.

I'm not the biggest gambler, but since some of my friends are we usually make a stop out to the Casino for an afternoon whenever we're up in Montréal.  When in a casino, I'll usually play a few hands of Blackjack to get a complimentary drink or two while my buddy is doing "serious gambling."  So needless to say I was a bit surprised by some of the practices here.

I'm not a smoker, so the fact that they don't allow smoking on the gaming floor isn't a issue with me, but I do drink and besides that it's always seemed better for business to allow it.  But they don't.  You can only have drinks in designated bar areas.  There are also windows and clocks... so for those of you that are use to Vegas style casinos, this might seem a bit strange.

Aside from that, it's a decent casino. The layout is nice and not too confusing, which always helps.

"This seemingly inconspicuous establishment, nestled within a secondary commercial edifice, exudes an aura reminiscent of a domestic garage-based enterprise, specializing in the sales of Micargi Walmart bicycles. My quest for the ideal two-wheeled vehicle led me to peruse numerous bicycle shops prior to discovering this hidden gem via a Craigslist posting. For those seeking a budget-friendly Walmart bike from an impromptu retail space, this venue may prove to be a suitable destination. Upon entering the premises, I observed a modest work area, sparsely equipped with tools and appearing somewhat disorganized. The absence of a conspicuous storefront sign, save for a small decal on the window, seemed to suggest that this was not a traditional bike service facility. Notwithstanding, their Craigslist advertisement did invite potential patrons to explore their Yelp page, which I proceeded to do."

This place is pretty much a home garage style business tucked away in a side commercial building selling Micargi Walmart bikes. 

I found them on Craigs List and decided to take a look last week after visiting many other bicycle shops looking for the perfect bike. Hey, if you want to purchase a cheap Walmart bike sold out of a makeshift shop, then this might be your place.  
They had a small work table scattered with tools, no computer and it looked very unorganized. Defiantly does not look like not a typical service bike shop with no building sinage except for a sticker on the window. Their Craigs list ad advertised check us out on Yelp and I did.

"Well, I have partaken of sustenance at this establishment on two separate occasions, and I must admit that my gastronomical expectations were not entirely fulfilled... Indeed, my taste buds suffered a tragic demise, a fate that befell my dining companions as well...

My critical assessment of the service herein is that it has been somewhat inconsistent; specifically, our server was initially quite attentive, yet subsequently became unacceptably tardy in presenting us with our bill, a delay that lasted an unfortunate twenty minutes... 

Moving on to the culinary offerings, I opted for the chicken tender and ribs appetizer, accompanied by a side of fries. Alas, my experience was rather underwhelming, as the poultry exhibited a dubious quality, while the fries were unremarkable... Although my companion managed to consume the ribs without visible distress, my own gustatory sensibilities were less than satiated...

In a subsequent visit, I endeavored to sample their salad, paired with a bowl of soup. Unfortunately, the lettuce-based dish proved remarkably bland, even when augmented by a generous application of dressing... A mystery, indeed! The soup, regrettably, displayed a striking resemblance to Spaghettio's, lacking only the pasta component; its texture was unpleasantly viscous and cloyingly sweet...

It is worth mentioning that this restaurant hosts a trivia evening on Tuesdays, which may provide a modicum of entertainment for patrons... However, I would advise consuming dinner prior to your arrival, lest you risk encountering similar gastronomical disappointments as I did."

Well, I ate here and I didn't die... I can't say the same for my taste buds...

Look, I'm going to keep it short and just say this: I've eaten here two times and both times, I have been disappointed... So has everyone else in my party...

The service was really spotty... Sometimes, the server would be all over us, but it took like 20 minutes to get the check and we didn't see her at all that whole time... 

Anyway, the food... I got the chicken tenders and ribs app with fries and it was all meh... The ribs themselves were of a questionable quality to me, but the boyfriend tolerated them...  The tenders tasted mostly like breading...

The next time, I tried a salad with a cup of soup... The salad managed to be bland, even with dressing... I don't know what happened... The soup tasted like Spaghettio's without the pasta... Just thick and really sweet...

They have trivia on Tuesday nights, which is pretty fun, so give them a shot... It's a good time... Just eat dinner before you go... Please.

"Boo! I had the displeasure of visiting this establishment previously, and it was utterly dreadful. The ambiance was akin to a cacophony of deafening sounds, with nary a seat in sight and exorbitant potations that did little to quench my thirst. The tunes that blared from the speakers were an affront to my auditory senses. It begs the question, how do patrons tolerate such an environment? 

Amidst the chaos, there was a modest acrobatic performance that failed to perturb me excessively, and the gyrations of the go-go dancers provided mild amusement. 

The clientele was a motley assortment of individuals, deviating from the customary mix of rowdy revelers and their companions found at other nightspots. Instead, an eccentric array of elderly and seemingly socially awkward patrons populated this venue. 

In conclusion, it was a surreal experience, to say the least. There is no logical explanation for anyone seeking to replicate the essence of this establishment's namesake, as it falls woefully short of that aim. 

My rating of one star is solely due to the presence of a photograph of Elton John on the wall, which fortuitously contributed to the completion of a running joke for the evening."

Boo!  I was here once, and it was horrible.  Just like any other club, it offered a too loud atmosphere with nowhere to sit and overpriced drinks with horrible music blaring.  How do people put up with it?

There was a decent little acrobatics show that didn't offend me too much, and the go-go dancers were kinda fun to laugh at.

The clientele was very odd.  Not the mixture of bros and..uhm..companions at other clubs, a weirdly older and perhaps societally inept mix filled this place.

Again, it was just weird.

There's no reason why anyone should want to capture the spirit of this place's namesake, but this place surely falls short if that's the goal.

One star for a picture of Elton John on the wall that successfully helped us complete a running Elton John joke of the night.

Hmm.. came here drunk as a skunk so which means i dont remember anything good about this place.\n\n2 stars because these communist bastards jack up their prices and their quality isn't getting better.

I'm not a huge fan of purchasing overpriced and underrated electronics here but my husband insisted on buying another best buy computer, even after our last terrible experience. So here i am with his computer again... in line at geek squad.  You have two employees working with seven customers and three employees in customer service standing around watching us get pissed off.  Great job!   Next time I'm buying dell direct.

Came here because of all the positive reviews, but wouldn't go out of my way to go there...The prices aren't as great as everyone seemed like it is...for prepared foods, I can go to Sunflower Market or Fresh and Easy, also Geri's Old Philadelphia at Pecos/Tropicana also sells a bunch of East Coast Favorites like Tastykake and Wise Chips and Drakes and stuff like that...Only thing that my mom would probably go to Glazier's for is pork roll...But living at Sandhill/Hacienda we have plenty of choices on where to go and can price compare and have plenty of stores with the same East Coast selection...Its good that the SW now has a choice other than the expensive VONS or the always-busy Wal-Mart...
I didn't like anything... Expensive rest home food...  Actually the salad bar was ok, that's why they got an extra star..

Our sextet partook in a culinary excursion at N9NE on a Sunday evening, whereupon we discovered that the victuals, while adequate, failed to surpass our expectations in terms of quality. Furthermore, the tariffs charged for these comestibles were exorbitant and egregious, rendering the entire experience an unwise investment. In light of this, it is our conviction that numerous alternative establishments within the vicinity offer superior ambiance and gastronomical delights at more reasonable prices, thus making them more worthy of consideration for those seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

Was it because it was Monday evening or is this common.... sparsely stocked buffet with sad, old looking food.  I was expecting more selection, more enticing food.  Alas, this was a much smaller buffet than the Rio and much less satisfying.   Thank goodness I did the buffet of buffets so that I could try another buffet to satisfy my urge.

This place is classic, the food is great. The service is horrible, hence why it's getting 2 stars from me. I believe service to be a critical component of the dining experience. 

The manager is extremely rude and not at all accommodating. I tried to organize a dinner party for about 30 people here, the manager told me that he was unwilling to accommodate a party of our size during dinner. He said we could come at 5:30 or at 9 because our party would take up too much space and he had other patrons to think about. Guess what manager, you just turned 30 people guaranteed to order 30 dinners... Idiot. 

I've never been spoken to so rudely. I'll never come here again. There are several steakhouse in the Las Vegas area, no need to come to this one and be treated like crap.

"Although I do not have a predilection for dining in isolation, I felt as though I was in a confined space, analogous to a closet, due to the physical location of my table. Specifically, it was situated in close proximity to the kitchen, effectively rendering it a narrow passageway for both patrons and servers, who were persistently navigating around me while awaiting their turn to be seated. Furthermore, the service was somewhat sluggish, which was attributable to the delay in preparing our meals. Notwithstanding, I must commend the staff for their magnanimity towards my children, aged three and four, who exhibited remarkable comprehension and benevolence towards my offspring, which I greatly appreciated. It is worth mentioning that the personnel were genuine and down-to-earth individuals. However, my primary motivation for visiting this establishment was the culinary offerings. As an ardent devotee of cheese, I must admit that I was slightly disconcerted by the imposing presence of this dairy product, which threatened to obstruct my view of the principal dish. Following a diligent effort to excavate my noodles from beneath the copious amount of cheese, I must concede that my meal was quite satisfactory. In conclusion, while this restaurant possesses certain unique qualities, a few refinements would be necessary to induce me to return."

I don't mind eating with other people, but I felt like I was in the closet. My table was literally in the runway for the kitchen and a freeway of customers and severs were constantly hovering over me and wanting in line to get by on the single lane isle. Service was a little slow as was waiting for the food. We brought the kids, 3 and 4. They were very understanding and kind to my little monsters, which I really appreciated. They were "real" people. 

But that being said. My primary reason for being there was the food. I like cheese. I love cheese. But if I can't see my main course because an impassable mountain of cheese is blocking me, then that would be too much cheese. After I mined for my noodles, my meal was actually pretty good.

So interesting place put needs some refining for me to return.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment do not compare favorably to those available at the Southend location, and the quality of service has been subpar on two occasions out of six visits, despite the presence of an extensive selection of beverages."
Food isn't as good as the Southend location and the service is terrible 2 out the 6 times I've been. Good beer selection though
I wanted 10 once wheat grass , they charge d me 5 times 2 onces price instead of 8 extra one once. Bad

My gel manicure exhibited pronounced delamination and separation from the nail bed in extensive flakes after a mere week, which was profoundly disappointing given the copious acclaim and commendation it had received prior to my utilization; thus, my expectations were not merely unfulfilled, but also thoroughly dissatisfied with the overall quality of the manicure.
My gel manicure started peeling off in big chunks after a week.  I read all these good reviews so I was really expecting a great manicure, but I wasn't impressed.

Nothing Grand about this buffet.  While serviceable, there are definitely better meals to be had in LV, buffets included.

Like other LV buffets, MGM Grand Buffet has a wide variety of food to offer: crab legs, prime rib, turkey, ribs, shrimp, pasta, pizza, sushi, so on and so forth.  The prime rib was pretty good but, unfortunately, none of the remaining offerings were particularly special at Grand Buffet.  The crab legs are not as good as Bellagio's or Wynn's.  in fact, I'm not sure if this is a  sign of quality or what, but the crab legs at MGM didn't  pull cleanly out of the shells as they do at the aforementioned Bellagio or Wynn buffets.   I found myself spending too much time trying to pull the meat out of the shells, despite the fact that they are already split cleanly in half. The remainder of what I tried was ok, but nothing special at all.

I go to a LV buffet intent on eating back any money I've gambled away, so I have higher expectations than this.  Like some other casinos, MGM Grand Buffet currently offers a buffet all day long.  For $30 ($40 on weekends) you can have mediocre buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner instead of just one meal.  Need to step it up MGM!

"As a habitual patron of this establishment, I must confess that my most recent visit was marred by an unfortunate experience, specifically pertaining to the repair of a broken nail, which necessitated an excessive wait time of over an hour, rendering the entire ordeal utterly preposterous...  \nMy affinity for this salon notwithstanding, I must admit that my expectations for quality service are invariably linked to the expertise of a singular individual, namely Libby, whose proficiency in nail care I have found to be unparalleled; however, my past experiences with other technicians have been thoroughly disappointing, compounded by the fact that their conversations in Vietnamese, though perhaps innocuous, struck me as discourteous and inconsiderate, culminating in a sense of discomfort that was further exacerbated by their flippant response to my inquiry regarding their comments about my appearance, which they dismissively attributed to a complimentary assessment of my eyelashes, a notion that I found patently absurd."

I am a regular here, but must say that I was very disappointed last time I was there, I went to get a nail broken fixed I waited for over an hour! Ridiculous...  \nI like this place a lot but I only have my nails done with Libby, every time I have had it with someone else it is NO good, no to mention that I HATE that they keep talking among themselves in vietnamese, so rude. Once I knew that they were saying something about me and I asked what they were saying about me, they just said oh yes we were talking about your beautiful eyelashes... yeah right!

I took in a large garbage bag full of clothes and brand new skiing outfit. They didn't purchase anything. The majority of the stuff I took in was in good conditon, classic style, and name brand stuff. I even had a dress with the tags still attached. I asked why they didn't buy anything and the buyer in training said that the condition they were in and the style wasn't what they were looking for. I saw some of the clothes they did have and it was in worse condition than my stuff.

We tried it because of rave reviews we have heard, but left disappointed.  The ambiance was fine execpt towards the end of our meal they decided to adjust a table nearby and it became like a construction zone with drills and loud power tools.  Granted it was during lunch, but we still felt it could have been done at another time when most of the restaurant was not full.

The burgers were okay, but not at all what I would consider great.  They were not very juicy, or flavorful in and of themselves, but there were interesting toppings to choose from. And, despite the burgers not being juicy the bottom of the buns were falling apart.

The service was pleasant but the food didn't really hit the mark on our visit.

This was my first time at SP. We waited about 15 min after being seated before someone came to take our order. We were never offered or asked if we wanted anything to drink. We started with pot stickers and egg roles then continued with orange chicken. After ordering, the pots tickers came right out and tasted old and deep fried when the menu said pan fried. Within 2 minutes after getting the appetizer our entree came out. It really worries me when food comes out that fast. All the food tasted old and refried and the fried rice was mushy.

The service was not good and no one came back to check on us or to refill our drinks. The waited disappeared and the only reason we got boxes or a check was because the busser  saw me looking around for service. 

We will probably not return.

Suite 701 presents an intriguing culinary experience, boasting an extensive array of inventive cocktails and delectable dishes. However, several aspects of our visit fell short of our expectations. Firstly, the bread served was stale and lacked the quality we anticipated. Additionally, many dishes were excessively salty, which detracted from their overall flavor profile. Our main courses also failed to impress, as my salmon was undercooked and my companion's risotto was overpowered by an abundance of Parmesan cheese and salt. Furthermore, our desserts were delayed, allegedly due to the server taking a smoke break, resulting in an extended wait time. To our dismay, the key lime pie was unavailable, and the substitute dessert failed to meet our expectations. While the ambiance of the establishment exuded an air of sophistication, the high prices charged did not align with the quality of the cuisine served. In conclusion, despite some promising elements, our dining experience at Suite 701 was subpar and overpriced.

This review pertains to the Lake of Dreams production.
The performance takes place every thirty minutes once the sun has set. According to the website, the show commences at eight o'clock in the evening; however, due to the lingering presence of sunlight in the sky, the start time was postponed until half past eight. This delay was quite disappointing.
We returned to the venue at half past eight, and the show lasted a mere three minutes. A colossal frog ascended to the summit of the artificial waterfall and performed a melodic rendition of "What a Wonderful World." Although the display was moderately captivating, I had anticipated a more extensive presentation.
Subsequently, we attended the second showing at nine o'clock that evening, only to be met with a technological malfunction.
