My goodness, had I not already indulged in a spree at the outlet stores, I would have undoubtedly acquired an impressive quantity of attire from this very location. The selection available for the fairer sex is truly staggering, and the offerings in San Francisco pale in comparison. Alas, the atmosphere within these walls is rather chaotic and clamorous, with a considerable throng of patrons contributing to the din. Furthermore, I must express my dissatisfaction with the policy adopted by one of the cashiers, who opted to accept solely credit or debit cards, thereby occasioning a delay for those individuals opting to tender cash payment. Lastly, it is worth noting that instead of utilizing traditional shopping carts, this store employs pulling baskets, which, in my opinion, adds an additional layer of complexity to the shopping experience. My sympathies extend to the unfortunate soul tasked with tidying up the premises at the conclusion of the day, as the prospect of confronting such disarray can be overwhelming, to say the least."

"I have had the pleasure of partaking in culinary indulgences at this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that the gastronomical experiences have been nothing short of exceptional. It is my belief that the restaurant is indeed a family-owned enterprise, as evidenced by the diverse array of dishes and the dedication of the staff. The menu boasts an innovative fusion of Italian and American cuisine, offering an extensive selection of prime rib, pork, seafood, and a delectable caesar salad, all of which are executed with equal finesse. My personal inclination is to opt for the Italian options, primarily due to the fact that it is the primary draw for my visits. However, I must commend the linguine with king crab and crispy leeks, which are complemented by a sublime lemon butter sauce. My spouse, on the other hand, takes great delight in the traditional spaghetti and Kobe meatballs. The service is impeccable, and the ambiance is further enhanced by a stunning decor. Additionally, the restaurant takes pride in an impressive wine list, as well as an assortment of expertly crafted cocktails. In conclusion, this eatery exudes an undeniable allure, making it a sophisticated and desirable destination for epicureans."

walking through the airport on way to gate. Thinking about the nasty food I'll likely eat when I reach it. Pass by Blanco. Angels singing with ray of light. I've been to the location in the Tucson hills. Its consistently great food. What a nice surprise in an otherwise awful food environment. Way to go Phoenix airport. Fish tacos were a solid choice.

The people in there were just great to us. In particular the RN in the cardiac unit that helped me (Morgan) was so cheerful and helpful he really took the edge off of being there. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the facility. Yes an older facility will be a bit worn but things that are fixable should be. The hinges on my bathroom door screamed at all hours of the night (and others did as well) and the water faucet shook the whole room when turned on due to air in the lines. Both of these could be remedied with a maintenance person in there for less then 30 minutes.\n\nAll in all though both my wife and I have been admitted to John C. Lincoln and we trust them to take good care of us when needed.

Great company to work with and very affordable prices. Lots of inventory to choose from as well, almost too much :) We did our whole downstairs with wood laminate as well as new baseboards which turned out great. They were very honest people to work with & we will be using them again when we do our upstairs.

First Las Vegas Ramen experience that I indulged in yielded a palatable sensation, prompting me to express my satisfaction with their spicy tonkotsu ramen bowl, which was tantamount to a culinary delight. Additionally, my exploration of their fried rice and gyoza offerings did not elicit any dissatisfaction, as they demonstrated a level of quality that was on par with my expectations. Furthermore, I was pleasantly surprised by the reasonable pricing, which compared favorably to establishments in the Bay Area. Consequently, I shall return to this eatery when hankering for ramen in Las Vegas, and perhaps sample their Tonkotsu-Shoyu Ramen on my subsequent visit.

"Mesa's culinary offerings surpassed my expectations, boasting an impressive array of delectable dishes that catered to my palate's discerning inclinations. The ribeye, in particular, showcased a remarkable depth of flavor, while the jalapeno cornbread exhibited a delightful synergy of spicy and savory elements. Furthermore, the establishment's spacious interior and welcoming ambiance made it an ideal setting for larger gatherings, which we took advantage of during Restaurant Week by indulging in their exceptional three-course prix fixe special for a mere $56 per person."

I have been here since I was a kid. The thai food is F A B U L O U S! The only problem is that they really should waive the extra rice fee of $2.50 if you have four or more people. But other than that, this is the BEST thai food in Las Vegas and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try something new or any good thai restaurant.

"The experience was satisfactory, with a range of alternatives available for selection. Its geographical position was advantageous, facilitating ease of access. However, our expectations were not exceedingly elevated."

"The mixologist responsible for concocting the potations at this establishment is truly gifted in their craft, as evidenced by the delectable elixirs they create. Similarly, the culinary masterpieces presented as entrees are equally impressive. However, I must express my disappointment regarding the sashimi, which, despite its exorbitant price tag, failed to meet my expectations in terms of both quantity and quality, when juxtaposed with the superior offerings of my local sushi purveyor. Needless to say, for such a premium price point, I anticipated an unparalleled level of excellence in the fish utilized for the sashimi. Unfortunately, this was not the case. Nonetheless, the lamb belly dish is truly exceptional and unrivaled in its flavor profile. My only regret is that I did not have the opportunity to sample it prior to indulging in the rabbit entree on a subsequent evening, as the lamb's sublime taste would have made for an ideal introduction to the meal."

"We opted to partake in an early evening repast on a Monday, as our offspring were experiencing hunger pangs and were cognizant of the fact that certain establishments offer complimentary nourishment for juveniles on this specific day of the week. Upon arriving at the venue, we were greeted by hostesses who appeared to be engaged in leisurely conversation, leading us to harbor apprehensions regarding the quality of service we would receive, based on previous experiences and reviews. However, we were seated in a timely manner, and our server materialized within a span of two minutes to take our beverage orders. Throughout the meal, the service we received was indeed satisfactory, as our server struck a balance between attentive and unobtrusive, ensuring that our needs were met without being overly intrusive. A male individual, dressed in plain attire, approached our table and enquired about the quality of our dining experience, to which we responded affirmatively. Subsequently, he surreptitiously approached me from behind and removed my empty cup, inquiring whether my server was providing me with an additional beverage. I replied in the negative, and it is worth mentioning that, while we assumed him to be a manager, a introduction or visible identification would have been appreciated. Notwithstanding, the culinary offerings were palatable, and the service generally efficient. It is also worth noting that a prolonged period of time, extending from 11 am to 7 pm, Monday through Friday, is designated as 'happy hour' at this establishment."

"It is comprehensible how an individual can harbor animosity towards this establishment, primarily due to the extensive queue that encircles the premises. The similarity between this scene and the Indiana Jones attraction at Disneyland is uncanny. Fortunately, I possessed a Fast Pass, which enabled me to bypass the line, thereby avoiding an excruciating wait. My acquaintances informed me that certain patrons had been waiting since 10 pm and had only recently reached the front of the line. The prospect of enduring such a lengthy delay was unsettling, to say the least. Upon entering this venue, my inner demon became apparent, albeit metaphorically. The ambiance of this establishment has a peculiar effect on one's psyche, prompting a carefree and whimsical demeanor. Although I typically find house music to be irksome, there was something peculiar about this setting that compelled me to engage in frivolous behavior, characterized by an uncontainable desire to leap up and down. The vast dimensions of this space enable it to accommodate a sizable crowd, comprising individuals who share a common objective: to partake in enjoyable activities. The evening concluded in the early hours of the morning, with my feet experiencing exhaustion to the point of near-crippling discomfort. Nonetheless, I must express my gratitude towards XS for the exceptional treatment I received."

I have nothing but great things to say about the Mac Shack! High quality pasta, fresh vegetables, and a friendly staff! I ordered carry out this time and even after the drive home the food still had great flavor! \n\nGreat vegetarian options!

Of all the newfangled \"FroYo\" places, this is the one I frequent the most. Of course, that is mainly due to the proximity to CenPho & their \"twitter Tuesday\" special. They have consistent flavors & toppings. I am a creature of habit, so I stick to the cookie monster with tiny little peanut butter cups. Yes, tiny PB cups, so cute! My experience has been that the price is a little higher than the competitors. However, I follow them on twitter and only go on Tuesdays now. They have a \"secret\" word that, if whispered creepily, gets you 1/2 off the price. So for two frogurts, me & the BF spend about $5. NOT TOO SHABBY.

Overall is a good place to eat. It's a tasty sandwich for a cheap price, specially considering the location.\nI had the all American sandwich which I liked but didn't loved because it had cranberries on it. My boyfriend had the cannonball and loved it.

"Matt Goss, formerly associated with Palms hotel and casino, has now transitioned to Caesar's Palace hotel, bringing his extraordinary talent and captivating stage presence to a new venue. Although I have yet to witness his performance at the latter location, I am confident that it will be equally, if not more, spectacular than his previous shows. Goss's powerful, sensual, and svelte voice, accompanied by his remarkable dancing skills and affection towards his audience, creates an unforgettable experience for those in attendance. Additionally, the inclusion of his skilled band and alluring female dancers further enhances the overall quality of the production. As a result, I find myself compelled to participate in the musical experience, singing and moving in tandem with Goss's performance. Upon receiving the opportunity, I will undoubtedly attend his show at Caesar's Palace, eager to indulge in the enthralling atmosphere once again. Indeed, the show exudes an essence of sexuality and passion, resonating deeply with the audience through its tantalizing music."

wasnt sure what to expect from this place being that it was in the Plaza hotel, but food was good, i had a poke bowl and the wife tried the seared ahi plate and both were very good. Still when it comes to poke, their sister location Poke Express up on Craig rd, is the place to go

"While admittedly harboring some trepidation regarding the potential for an overreliance on hackneyed and cliched magic tricks, I was pleasantly surprised by the non-cheesy nature of the performance, which skillfully incorporated elements of humor, politics, and clever illusions. Prior to the main event, a talented pianist and bassist provided an entertaining prelude, with the latter musician unbeknownst to the audience, being none other than Penn himself. Throughout the show, the duo engaged in various forms of audience participation, fostering a palpable sense of inclusivity and engagement. Following the conclusion of the performance, Penn and Teller demonstrated their commitment to their fans by graciously meeting and greeting each attendee, eager to accommodate requests for photographs and autographs, a gesture that spoke volumes about their genuine appreciation for their audience."

Beso is situated within the luxurious Crystals shopping mall, in close proximity to the esteemed Aria resort. Upon entering the establishment, we were greeted with exceptional hospitality, as we were promptly seated and presented with an extensive wine list, followed by the rapid arrival of our orders. The prices of the entrees at Beso range from the upper $20s to $50s, and with the addition of tips and taxes, the total cost per person can reach approximately $75, provided that one desires beverages and sides.  

Our culinary excursion began with the delectable oyster shooters, which did not contain alcohol, much to our delight. Among these, the tomato gazpacho oyster shooter reigned supreme in terms of flavor and quality. For our main courses, we opted for both the tuna and salmon options, which were skillfully prepared and served in generous portions. Although sides are available for purchase, they are designed to be shared, and the wild mushroom side dish, priced at $11, was excessively large for two individuals to consume.  

Despite feeling satiated, we were intrigued by the enticing dessert menu and decided to indulge in the heavenly churros, accompanied by a rich caramel sauce and creme. To our astonishment, we managed to devour all six of these delectable treats.  

The lavatory facilities are located upstairs and can be accessed by taking an elevator and navigating through the nightclub. Additionally, Beso features an outdoor patio seating area and a cozy dining room, the latter of which is not particularly spacious but offers comfortable booths. Our table offered a picturesque view of Aria's fountain, as well as a distant perspective of New York, New York's iconic fake Empire State Building, providing a sense of familiarity and comfort, reminiscent of dining at the renowned Zylo Steakhouse within the W hotel.

I always have a great time. 

Huzzah !

If you love the sun and happy people then this is the place for you.

The price to enter is a little spendy but for a full day of fun and people watching it is worth it. I suggest this festival and all it has to offer.

Wow!  I was introduced to this place by my friend who is a local in Vegas.  She asked me to ride the free shuttle out here from the strip, mainly because driving on the strip is so nasty!  So I rode out and met her at Sam's Town.  I must say, I was quite impressed by the interior of this place.  Very western feel to it. 

The place itself is huge!  It has 2 floors of gambling, and a huge movie theatre!  I ate at the buffet here also.. the food was impressingly good for the price!  They have a different food theme every day of the week.  I was there on Saturday, which happens to be Prime Rib night.  I did not know there was a bowling alley there too, but I'm going to come here next time I am in town!  

I definately liked gambling here much more than on the strip.  I never win anything on the strip.  I gambled at Sam's town for at least 2 or 3 hours, but I didn't lose a dime!  I came out positive!  I don't know if I was just lucky or what.. but the machines were really generous to me!  Also, the cocktail waitresses come around quite often!  It was really a great experience.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be taking the shuttle back to Sam's Town!  =)

I possess a membership with Massage Heights for approximately nine months at this point. I am unlikely to engage in such a pursuit once again. I hold this establishment in high regard, yet my place of employment, a resort situated on the renowned Las Vegas Strip, provides an enhanced experience through various minor details, including additional pampering, hydration, and nutritious snacks both prior to and subsequent to the massage therapy session. Although my workplace does not offer a comparable membership program, I deem it a worthy investment to indulge in such luxuries periodically. Upon culminating my one-year contractual agreement with Massage Heights, I shall refrain from securing another membership, as I believe that alternative services offering superior quality are available for the price I pay.

"My sentiments regarding Tram's are somewhat ambivalent, as my experiences have been inconsistent, with the quality of the Pho varying depending on the quantity and freshness of the basil and mint garnish. However, the other dishes have generally been well-prepared and seasoned. I appreciate the concise menu and the affable demeanor of the wait staff, which contributes to an enjoyable dining experience. Notwithstanding its relatively inconspicuous location, Tram's tends to bustle with activity, even on weeknights. While it may not supersede Pho Minh in terms of culinary excellence, it undoubtedly offers a superior dining experience compared to its competitor, Spice Island, whose Vietnamese delicacies are arguably the most delectable in the city."

"On my inaugural visit to this eatery, I must confess that my culinary experience has been utterly transformed, as my previous lack of enthusiasm towards Asian cuisine has been drastically altered to an unwavering fondness, thus ensuring my future patronage."

I am perpetually dubious when I venture into a Thai eatery, as my unwavering fondness for massaman curry (and its cognates) has led me to experience a wide range of inconsistent quality across the Thai culinary landscape. I have encountered an array of subpar massaman preparations, including those that are inordinately saline, nearly raw, or devoid of flavor. Motivated by my unrelenting quest for a satisfactory massaman experience, I opted to sample the offering at this particular establishment.

The massaman curry presented itself as a veritable delight, boasting a rich, velvety texture and a profound depth of flavor. The potatoes were cooked to perfection, their tender flesh yielding easily to the fork. The shrimp, albeit retaining their tails, were succulent and flavorsome. While the sauce exhibited a faint similarity to tomato bisque soup, it was nonetheless savory and well-balanced. I thoroughly enjoyed this dish, and it satiated my craving for a genuinely satisfying massaman experience.

The ambiance of the restaurant was pleasing, with wooden accents ubiquitous throughout the space. Although the layout was not overly cramped with tables, the floor appeared slightly unkempt, its glossy surface reflecting the evening sun's rays with unfortunate clarity. My criticism notwithstanding, I relished the meal and harbor intentions to revisit the establishment for further indulgence in their massaman curry, while omitting the dessert course in favor of more palatable options.

"Wow, this culinary establishment is quite delectable. I visited this eatery with a sizable assemblage of epicureans and had the opportunity to sample an array of their offerings. Among the hors d'oeuvres, we indulged in the foie gras, spicy crab salad, and tuna tartare. For my main course, I opted for the'surf and turf,' which deviated from the traditional format, as it consisted of a substantial portion of foie gras accompanied by a piece of butterfish. This delectable dish was situated atop a bed of shredded Brussels sprouts and was complemented by a rich black truffle sauce, resulting in an unparalleled gastronomic experience. In addition, I ventured to sample various other dishes and sides, such as the creamed spinach, gnocchi, and lobster au curry. Notably, the creamed spinach was sublime. To conclude my meal, I relished the chocolate soufflÃ©, mixed candy bar, and chocolate and praline bush. The soufflÃ© emerged as the most exceptional dessert, and it was accompanied by a side of pistachio ice cream, further enhancing its flavor profile."

This eatery has consistently maintained its status as a personal favorite of mine, primarily due to the exceptional quality of their signature Gyros, which boast succulent lamb meat and a perfectly balanced z sauce that harmonizes the flavors, rendering them unparalleled in my culinary experiences. Notwithstanding the reasonable price point of $8 per Gyro, the generous portion size and satisfying taste make it an unquestionable value. Additionally, the option to combine a delectable combo meal, inclusive of crispy fries and a refreshing beverage, with a nominal increment of merely $2, presents an irresistible opportunity to indulge in a veritable gastronomic delight. I strongly advocate for a visit to this establishment, which exudes a warm, welcoming ambiance reminiscent of a quaint family-owned business, although its actual ownership structure remains unclear to me.

"This venue offers an optimal setting for a convivial gathering with acquaintances during the happy hour time frame, whereupon I derive immense pleasure from the totality of the ambiance, the specialized beverages, and the Japanese-style cuisine. Notably, they proffer an array of creative and delectable martinis, coupled with reasonable pricing on sushi and nigiri during the aforementioned happy hour period. Moreover, the experience is further enhanced by partaking in one's repast while seated at the sushi bar, thereby allowing patrons to observe the culinary artisans meticulously crafting their fare in real-time, directly in front of them."

If you are seeking a delectable and captivating burger experience in the city of Las Vegas, this establishment is undoubtedly worthy of your consideration. Their culinary offerings boast an impressive array of flavorsome burgers, including the Bahn Mi and Kalbi varieties, which are utterly divine and unquestionably among their most popular selections. Additionally, the restaurant serves an assortment of crispy fries, encompassing both sweet potato and oxtail chili options, which serve to further enhance the overall dining experience. While certain aspects of the venue may exude a strip mall ambiance, the superior quality of the burgers and the extensive beer selection more than compensate for any perceived shortcomings. A visit to this eatery is unequivocally recommended, even if it necessitates a slight detour or additional effort to locate.

"As an itinerant patron, I had the pleasure of experiencing the ambiance of this establishment during a recent sojourn, and I must say that I am gratified to have done so. The demographic diversity of the clientele on the particular evening in question (a Friday, to be precise) contributed to a convivial atmosphere, which was further enhanced by the attentive and expeditious service proffered by the staff. It is worth noting, however, that certain patrons may have encountered less-than-ideal sanitary conditions in the restrooms; personally, I have had the misfortune of encountering far more distressing examples of such facilities, and thus, my expectations in this regard were not particularly high. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I found the experience of consuming beverages from diminutive containers to be quite intriguing, albeit somewhat messy, as I inadvertently spilled a greater quantity of liquid upon my person and the surrounding area than I actually managed to ingest. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to others and eagerly anticipate my next visit."

So many good things to say about maggianos food. One of my favorites is the  chicken Alfredo it's so tasty. I have tried a number of different dishes and this will stay number one. The chicken francese and potatoes are also good. The customer service was on point, the maitre'd Loray had is seated quick, our server was awesome aswell.

"Inexpensive, flavorsome, and satiating. We sampled the pho, spring rolls, and lemongrass chicken; all were delectable and merited repetition. However, my culinary exposure to Vietnamese fare was limited, thus my opinions may lack refinement. 

The proprietor, an individual of marked personality, took it upon himself to select our repast. Fortunately, we were unpretentious and disposed to accept his recommendations, finding him more amusing and captivating than overbearing. 

The venue was bustling, despite our arrival at 7 pm on a Friday, and given their policy of not accepting reservations, accommodating larger groups would likely prove problematic."

"It appears that this eatery is a veritable hit-or-miss affair, with the culinary experience oscillating between exceptional and subpar renditions. I have had the privilege of partaking in their gastronomic offerings on multiple occasions, and while the salad bar consistently impresses, the remaining dishes exhibit marked variability in quality. Despite the occasional inconsistency, I have opted to procure a salad from their establishment on numerous instances, as the convenience of takeout proves an attractive feature. Alas, the popularity of this restaurant during peak hours often translates into a sizeable assemblage of patrons, rendering a tranquil dining experience somewhat unlikely."

I really like George Street, it hosts some of my favourite shops; Cath Kidston, Penhaligons, Coast and Karen Millen and a massive Paperchase to name a few. Even if some of those shops are more for window shopping than a usual shopping spree. In addition all the swish shops there are also a lot of great bars and restaurants too.\n\nOn a summers day it's great to walk along George Street, most of the shops are housed in gorgeous buildings and it isn't as hectic as the likes of Princes Street where crossing the road is like having a near death experience.

"Although not particularly fond of vegan cuisine, I opted to sample it on a whim during my visit to this establishment, which offered an eclectic ambiance that was further enhanced by the friendly demeanor of its staff. My experience took place on a weeknight evening, and while the venue was relatively crowded, I was pleased to observe that the management had adopted commendable measures aimed at minimizing waste and pollution, such as utilizing cardboard packaging instead of Styrofoam for takeout orders and providing wooden utensils, which demonstrated their commitment to environmental sustainability. However, I did notice a minor inconsistency in their approach, as they placed the entire order in a plastic bag, which seemed incongruous with their otherwise admirable efforts to reduce waste; nonetheless, this did not detract significantly from my overall satisfaction with the dining experience."

"After traversing an extensive culinary odyssey, I have finally arrived at this esteemed establishment, whereupon my expectations were piqued by the prevailing acclaim surrounding its gastronomical offerings. As a connoisseur of buffalo wings, I must confess that my unwavering dedication to their consumption has led me to participate in a state-level competitive eating event, where my proficiency in devouring these delectable morsels was showcased. Upon sampling the wings presented here, I must aver that while the actual chicken appendages themselves were merely adequate, the assorted sauces accompanying them exhibited a truly exceptional quality. My assessment of these poultry delights is customarily predicated upon the benchmark of fiery heat, and accordingly, the 'hot' variant proved to be moderately piquant yet remarkably savory. Furthermore, my curiosity prompted me to venture beyond my customary beverage preferences and sample the 'ATL Rub', whose flavor profile struck me as utterly captivating. Although my taste buds do not habitually incline towards sweetened potables, the mere presence of 'cool aid' on the beverage menu struck me as rather endearing. In light of these factors, I shall unquestionably become a regular patron of this eatery, with the aim of eventually indulging in each of the 18 distinct wing flavors available."

We indulged in a delectable luncheon at an all-you-can-eat establishment, whereupon we were presented with an array of gastronomical options, each station showcasing a distinct culinary style. While the diversity of the offerings was indeed impressive, the quality of the fare was somewhat inconsistent, with certain dishes proving to be palatable while others fell short of our expectations. However, the beauty of a smorgasbord lies in its ability to allow patrons to sample a variety of edibles without committing to a single plate, thereby enabling us to savor an assortment of flavors and textures. According to our familial consensus, the standout items on this particular visit were the chilled and grilled jumbo shrimp, coleslaw, corn bread, Italian chicken stew, bok choy, carne asada, flan, and chocolate mousse cake.

"The sole reason that this establishment does not receive a perfect rating of five stars is due to the fact that the ordering process can be somewhat perplexing and chaotic, and during our most recent visit, the tables were not adequately cleared in a timely manner. However, the culinary offerings are undoubtedly delectable, boasting an innovative concept and utilizing fresh, premium ingredients. We thoroughly appreciate the ability to swiftly procure a superlative pizza, but certain operational refinements are still necessary before this dining venue can be considered truly exceptional."

I must confess that my affinity for this amphitheater is unparalleled, particularly when juxtaposed with its counterparts in the DC region. The ease of access, parking, and entry were remarkably convenient, which significantly enhanced my overall experience. In July, I attended a concert featuring Dave Matthews, and my enjoyment was largely attributed to the accommodating nature of the venue. They exhibited laxity regarding food items, permitting entrance with a single ziplock bag, a policy that proved to be a welcome respite from the exorbitant prices charged by on-site vendors. Ultimately, I felt grateful for the absence of prolonged delays typically associated with entering and exiting the amphitheater, a contrast that left me feeling appreciative and content.

"The assessments provided by previous patrons did not engage in hyperbole when alluding to the sluggish nature of the hospitality experience; rather, the duration of time elapsed between the placement of our order and its subsequent delivery rendered the dining encounter utterly woeful. Notwithstanding this unfortunate circumstance, the culinary offerings, particularly the steak and eggs, did possess an undeniable appeal, with each bite showcasing a profound richness of flavor that, alas, could not compensate for the protracted delay preceding their arrival."

When trying to think of where to go for a steak dinner The Greentree Inn came to mind. I had never been here in all the years of living so very close. I was glad I chose this establishment. Food was excellent and I loved the feel of the place

It's nice to see a chain that is committed to doing something and doing it well. We have a local Habit restaurant here in California. On a whim, we decided to drop into one near our hotel in Phoenix last week. Both my wife and I ordered the same thing we always do--mostly to see if the experience was consistent. Well it was. Consistently yummy, might I add.... If you find yourself in Chandler with a hankering for a great burger, I highly recommend the Habit.\n\n4 out of 5 stars for the food being a little on the pricey side for the amount that you get. But who am I to quibble, we'll still be back.

"Mmmmmm...gastronomical excellence personified by an unctuous, savory delight...I mean, simply dabbing it with a napkin would not suffice, for the palatable, mouthwatering slices remained resolutely saturated with an abundance of rich, velvety grease...kind of good, if you will! 

In pursuit of a culinary experience beyond the ubiquitous franchises, I ventured forth to New York Pizza, only to find the establishment bustling with activity on this particular Wednesday evening. Undeterred, I expedited my order with alacrity, opting for a solitary pepperoni slice...which, much to my satisfaction, cost a mere trifle of $3! 

The interior ambiance, though modest in its appointments, exuded a certain charm, comprising a few tables, chairs, booths, and televisions...unpretentious, yet functional. 

To my delight, my pizza emerged from the kitchen with remarkable celerity, allowing me to hasten my departure with minimal delay! 

The crust of the pizza demonstrated a satisfying texture, generously adorned with an array of pepperonis, cheese, and, of course, a copious amount of that delectable, golden elixir known as grease. The sauce, too, boasted a subtle, yet tangible piquancy, striking a harmonious balance between flavors that left me in accord with Ben G's sentiments; although diverging from the traditional New York-style pizza, it remained undeniably scrumptious! 

My gastronomical exploration of this eatery merely whetted my appetite for further indulgence, particularly after laying eyes on the delectable Philly cheesesteak that another patron had ordered, its tantalizing aroma wafting through the air, beckoning me to return and sample its splendor."
This place rocks! Can dine inside at a booth with TV or on the patio w/ your mut! The aju sliders are delish!

"Two Words = Exceptional Culinary Experience.

Every staff member at this eatery exudes amiability, which distinguishes them from numerous establishments in Las Vegas, thereby creating a welcoming ambiance for patrons.

1 star = Efficient production line, where each individual behind the counter exhibits cordiality and warmth, thus providing an excellent initiation to the dining experience.

2 stars = The proprietor extended a warm greeting, presented us with samples of their delectable offerings, and ensured that we thoroughly enjoyed our meal, exemplifying exceptional customer service and fostering loyal clientele.

3 stars = Kalua pig flavor = explosively delicious. A culinary masterpiece that bursts with flavor upon consumption, bearing no resemblance to bland, mass-produced fast food fare.

4 stars = COCONUT BARK = sublime indulgence. This reviewer craves this restaurant's proximity to home, allowing for frequent replenishment of their addictive coconut bark, priced at $3.50 per bag, yet well worth the expense, accompanied by a generous portion. However, reluctance to share arises, so procure your own! (Humorous tone).

The sole absence of the fifth star stems from the minor setback of slightly disintegrating tacos and burritos during consumption, attributed to the novelty of the restaurant and potential wrapping and filling technique refinement. Nonetheless, a superb destination for seekers of rapid, delectable Hawaiian-inspired cuisine, with the coconut bark being an unforgettable highlight."

It was a brief excursion from Mesa, but I had some reservations about boarding the train due to the presence of certain individuals; however, given that it was a public mode of transportation, I decided to overlook my apprehensions and proceed with my journey. Unfortunately, the brevity of the trip did not preclude me from experiencing physical discomfort, specifically in my legs, which were exacerbated by the seating arrangement during the brief voyage and persisted for several days thereafter, owing to my medical condition known as Restless Leg Syndrome. Despite these inconveniences, I acknowledged the benefits of utilizing public transportation, particularly in terms of conserving fuel, and thus, I would consider it as a viable option for my daily commute if I were employed in close proximity to a pick-up location. However, I must caution others to exercise vigilance when parking near such locations, as I learned the hard way by incurring a substantial fine of $200 for an erroneous parking maneuver, which resulted in the unfortunate impoundment of my vehicle. Notwithstanding this setback, I would still be willing to undertake the journey again, albeit with greater attention to detail regarding parking arrangements.

"Discuss a remarkable method of observing a sporting event. I visited Buffalo Wild Wings to view the World Cup and couldn't have requested a more enjoyable encounter. Multiple televisions were positioned throughout the establishment, broadcasting both the World Cup and essential baseball matches! Exceptional hospitality, chicken wings, and brew! The server was incredibly friendly and efficient, managing multiple tables with ease. The boneless wings were flavorful, and the Blue Moon beer paired perfectly. I suggest sampling the fried pickles as an appetizer...a truly impressive offering!"

"Indubitably, another quintessential Charlotte establishment for an opulent and amorous dining experience. Upon entering the Fig Tree, I was eager to indulge in their culinary offerings, having already determined my entree of choice prior to arrival. Fortuitously, my companion, with her refined sensibilities, had secured reservations during the Yuletide season, thereby enhancing the ambiance to suit our preferences. I opted for the grouper, lavishly adorned with a rich butter sauce and succulent lobster meat, which proved to be an exquisite selection. The cheese plate we shared preceding the entrees was satisfactory, albeit perhaps slightly overpriced at $17. Unfortunately, my companion did not share my enthusiasm for her pork chop entree, expressing disappointment with the preparation of the chops, which were allegedly too fatty. I sampled the chops subsequently, and while they did possess a notable amount of fat, I persevered and enjoyed them nonetheless. The hospitality we received was exceptional and charming, and despite the minor drawbacks, the overall experience was sufficient to warrant future visits."

"It is my utmost pleasure to indulge in the delectable offerings of Dunkin Donuts, with a particular fondness for the Toasted Coconut and Chocolate Frosted cake variety; these scrumptious treats constitute the epitome of culinary excellence, in my humble opinion. The vast majority of the time, I opt for the Coffee & 2 donuts combination, as it provides an ideal balance between satisfying my craving for caffeine and indulging in the rich, sweet flavors of the aforementioned donuts. My frequent patronage of this establishment has led to a familiarity with the staff, who have become adept at recognizing my voice when placing orders via the drive-thru; this rapport has been fostered by my consistent ordering of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake duo, which, I must stress, is a crucial aspect of my Dunkin Donuts experience. It is worth noting that, on occasion, the staff has erroneously provided me with a chocolate glazed or chocolate frosted glazed donut, which, while delicious in their own right, do not compare to the unparalleled taste of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake. To ensure an optimal experience for patrons such as myself, I highly recommend taking advantage of the coffee punch card, particularly if one tends to favor medium-sized cups of coffee."
My husband went for lunch with a co-worker yesterday and they enjoyed it very much. Keep up the good work.

"I derive immense pleasure from the extensive array of tapas offered at this esteemed establishment, my dear spouse and I having sampled a diverse assortment of plates, ranging from one to two selections per category, with a particular fondness for the profoundly flavorful deep-fried artichoke and the lavish foie gras, while the delectable deep-fried beignets, also known as bunuelos, proved to be an absolute delight."

"An exceptional diminutive retail establishment! Patrons can opt for outdoor seating or utilize the interior space, both of which offer an agreeable ambiance. The personnel are affable, the coffee is palatable, and the assortment of sweet baked goods is truly delectable - I must confess, I seldom employ such a descriptive term in my everyday vocabulary."

"I had the pleasure of partaking in an evening outing with my significant other at this establishment, and I must say that my expectations were thoroughly surpassed by the ambiance, hospitality, and culinary offerings. The ingredients utilized in the preparation of the dishes were remarkably fresh and delectable, with the Chow Mein being particularly impressive, boasting an unparalleled level of quality that rendered it the most satisfying instance of its kind that I have had the pleasure of consuming in recent memory. The staff members were incredibly cordial and attentive, providing a level of service that greatly enhanced our overall experience. However, I must admit that the lone sushi roll we sampled, specifically the Golden Cali Roll, fell somewhat short of my lofty expectations, eliciting a tepid response from myself, although my companion seemed to derive greater enjoyment from it."

Token Limit: 512 tokens
Accepted Token Types: Letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), spaces, punctuation marks (.,!,?, -)

Please note that this task requires modifying the given text while preserving its original meaning. It's not about generating a new text or creating a summary. Also, please ensure that the modified text doesn't exceed the token limit specified in the problem statement.

"My affection for the taro yogurt and mochi balls is unwavering; however, the dearth of seating and the overwhelming influx of collegiate patrons can be somewhat vexing, particularly for an individual of advanced years such as myself. Despite the cacophony generated by the throngs of youthful clientele, I find the ambiance of this establishment to be generally appealing, and thus, I elect to consume my yogurt elsewhere, in a setting more conducive to tranquility."

We indulged in a luxurious sojourn at the illustrious Golden Nugget from June 29th to 30th, 2013, marking our maiden stay at this esteemed establishment and any hotel in the downtown area. Our opulent Rush Tower suite surpassed our previous accommodations at the Palazzo, where we customarily reside. Despite various factors that could have potentially impeded our stay, including sweltering temperatures of 117 degrees, financial losses, and the presence of our 10-year-old offspring, we experienced an unparalleled level of enjoyment. The hospitable staff at the Golden Nugget displayed remarkable attention to detail, catering to their diverse clientele with refined taste and sophistication. The table limits were ideally suited to our preferences, and the culinary offerings were delectable. Additionally, the prices for accommodations, food, and beverages were eminently reasonable. The pool area offered endless hours of amusement, further enhancing our positive experience. 

My better half, who customarily neglects to schedule a spa appointment in advance, received a responsive and accommodating reply from the Golden Nugget's spa staff when requesting a same-day booking for a substantial ($200) treatment. She extolled the virtues of the spa facility, praising its quality and value. In fact, she expressed a desire to return with her friends, although I harbored doubts about the transferability of my player's card room discounts to her. 

We overcame our hesitation to explore the vibrant downtown area of Las Vegas, engaging in exhilarating zipline adventures and reveling in the complimentary musical performances. Our eagerness to revisit this captivating destination is palpable, and we look forward to relishing future experiences at the Golden Nugget.

"Migrated proximate and visited this establishment for the maiden occasion, thoroughly enjoyed the experience; Kay, an exceptional practitioner, demonstrated remarkable proficiency in her craft while maintaining an optimal tempo, a rare confluence of attributes; customarily, I would engage the services of an individual at a distinct salon who either excels in their work but lacks celerity or is swift yet falters in quality, Kay harmoniously unifies both aspects. This salon boasts an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, replete with captivating pedi basins and state-of-the-art massage chairs. Prices are reasonable and commensurate with the superior quality of service rendered, featuring an extensive palette of gel hues to select from, thereby creating a welcoming atmosphere. I unequivocally endorse this establishment and intend to return forthwith to partake of Kay's expertise."

I've been coming here for about 2 years! Their shrimp fried rice is awesome! It is located right next to my work, so it is very convienant for me. Love the service here! Very fast and friendly! Their lunch menu is also cheap and delicious!
I ordered the yellow curry with chicken and it was so delicious! I would have given 5 stars, but the egg roles were pretty greasy and flavorless.

Our Via train from Toronto to Montreal arrived an hour late due to the train staff's failure to close a door at one of the stops. As a result, we arrived in Montreal at 11PM thirsting for some alcoholic beverages, and maybe a bite to eat. 
After quickly dropping off our luggage and cleaning up, we walked down to Old Montreal to find the perfect place. It took us about 20 minutes of either places closing up shop for the night or simply tacky tourist dives serving nachos before we found the Merchant. It was crowded at midnight and still serving.
Service was a bit slow as we were adjacent to a large birthday group that was just breaking up and asking for separate bills (another conversation entirely!). The host realized the problem and began taking care of us; we had sparkling water quickly and a bottle of red soon after that. We decided to share the beef carpaccio and Cesaer salad appetizer, and it was delicuous. All the food we saw looked delicious, it's a fun rowdy atmosphere, and the DJ was playing great "old" music from the early 90s. 
We liked it so much we returned the next night for drinks after the Killers concert. This place is popular and I can see why.

I had some issues with Cox years ago but I stuck with them. The last couple times that I went in there I had great experiences. They worked with me to lower my bill and were quick and helpful. I'll give 'em some props for that.

Let's be clear, I like what the AZ Humane Society does and I think their Campus for Compassion is a mind boggling awesome facility.

My only problem is that out of the three times we've gone to visit they were... out of dogs.  It's entirely possible we have poor timing or that their adoption program is so fantastic that the dogs fly out of their kennels but... it was still rather strange and I couldn't help but wonder if their kennels are being under utilized.  

But that's all just idle speculation and perhaps a plea for them to get more good dogs out of the county shelters and into the air conditioned, classical music playing comfort of their Campus for Compassion.  I have no doubt that once a dog gets into one of these places he is well cared for.

One thing I particularly liked about their design was that there was a low wall separating the two rows of kennels in each building.  I think that seems like a fantastic idea for lowering the animals stress as they don't have to stare across the hallway at some pissed off dachshund all day.  It also means that getting dogs too and from their kennels isn't as big as a deal because there is only one row of barking dogs they have to worry about.

And yes, it's probably the nicest shelter I've ever heard about.

I couldnt wait to get back to a Smashburger after having my first one in Vegas. I got the Sincity burger in Vegas and they dont offer anything like this that i saw here. :-(\nSo i deceided to get the Arizona burger and it was ok, if it was my first smashburger i wouldnt be craving it though like i did with the sincity burger. So now i still have to wait for that crave.

I walked in and got a pedi, staff were nice especially the two women. The place is cozy, however I guess it's spring that's why it was quite hot. Anyway, it's awesome they have a wide selection of polish! These chairs with back massage available is so cool! Price is reasonable, I got a basic pedicure at $20. If I'm not mistaken, some staff can speak Mandarin. Cool! Will definitely be back.
Very hometown feel in this place. I came here to check out the open mic they have on Thursday nights. And it was great environment and cheap drinks! Great combo!\n\nCan't wait to go back!

"The boyfriend was ecstatic about the multitude of flavors he had perused on the company's digital platform, but his enthusiasm was short-lived upon arriving at the establishment, as there were merely a paltry five options available. Consequently, his assessment of the experience was a mediocre 3.5. Notwithstanding, he did express that his coconut custard was rather delectable. In contrast, my appraisal of the Western flavor was an unwavering 4, as the combination of rich, velvety texture and the subtle crunch of salted pecans resulted in an unparalleled gustatory delight. My craving for this indulgence was so intense that I found myself yearning for a bowl of it even during the writing of this review, despite the lingering aftereffects of a satiating dinner. Although the portion size may have appeared formidable, the frozen treat surprisingly struck a satisfying balance between lightness and creaminess, effectively negating any concerns of excessive indulgence. Furthermore, the well-illuminated surroundings of the shop alleviated any trepidation one might harbor, rendering the experience not only enjoyable but also anxiety-free."

"What an endearing eatery to indulge in a morning repast! 
I recently had the pleasure of partaking in a bridal shower brunch at this quaint establishment, and it was utterly charming! 
The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, particularly the creamy corn porridge complemented by the sweetness of maple glazed sausage and the savory flavor of cinnamon sugar roasted apples. I decided to take a risk and sample this unconventional dish, and my taste buds were delightfully surprised! 
However, the service left much to be desired, as the staff exhibited a lackadaisical attitude towards ensuring a truly exceptional dining experience. Specifically, our group of eight ladies was not informed that beverages were available on a self-serve basis, and no effort was made to offer us specialty drinks such as mimosas. 
Despite these shortcomings, I remain eager to revisit this cozy venue and relish its unique charm."

"This lodging establishment seemed to exude an ambiance reminiscent of a luxurious apartment complex, boasting generously proportioned rooms that were appointed with an array of furnishings, including plush couches, dining tables, sinks, and expansive bathrooms. Despite the spaciousness of the accommodations, the tariff was surprisingly reasonable, with my particular abode costing a mere $25 per night. However, certain drawbacks were evident, such as the somewhat antiquated appearance of the rooms, which seemed to lack a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of aesthetic appeal, not to mention the presence of a minuscule television set. Nonetheless, I chose to evaluate the hotel based on its own merits, rather than allowing its proximity to the famed Las Vegas Strip to influence my assessment."

"My recent dining experience at Joey's culinary establishment was an unexpected delight, characterized by an ambiance that exuded charm and hospitality, complemented by exceptional customer service. Upon being seated, we were presented with an assortment of delectable corn bread muffins that served as a harbinger of the satisfying repast that was to follow. The chowders, which my mother and I sampled in diverse varieties, showcased a masterful blend of flavors and textures that left us both impressed. Furthermore, the principal courses were generously portioned, allowing us to fully appreciate the culinary prowess of the chef. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Joey's to those seeking a dining experience that combines quality, value, and a warm atmosphere, and I personally look forward to returning in the near future."

We split a milk chocolate bar with smooth peanut butter inside.  We really enjoyed the smoothness of the peanut butter filling.  Luis commented that it tasted like a Snickers without the peanuts which for my generation would be a Mars bar:) Our cashier/clerk Antrez was very nice and professional.

The eatery in question is a relatively recent establishment, situated on the ground floor of a historic bonded warehouse, specifically located just off Constitution Street. They have capitalized on the double-height ceilings by incorporating a mezzanine level, thereby creating a diminutive yet optimal space for large gatherings of patrons and augmenting the available table space. Upon entering the edifice, we were greeted with warm hospitality and escorted to our table in close proximity to the expansive arched windows. The interior design exuded a sense of simplicity and cleanliness, further enhanced by the judicious placement of candles housed within red-colored glass vessels, which contributed to the creation of a tranquil ambiance reminiscent of Zen-like qualities. 

It was gratifying to observe that all members of the staff were genuine Spanish nationals, engendering a sense of confidence and authenticity. As an ardent devotee of tapas, my expectations were more than fulfilled by this culinary establishment. The menu was thoughtfully segregated into three distinct categories, namely, 'From the orchard,' 'from the sea,' and 'from the farm.' In an effort to sample a diverse array of their offerings, we opted for six tapas, which, much to our delight, proved to be copious and satisfying. Of particular note were the pork and mushroom cream sauce, as well as the Monkfish, prawn, and squid in tomato sauce. It is worth mentioning that the squid, typically associated with a rubbery texture, was pleasantly surprising, as it seemed to dissolve effortlessly in the mouth, leaving a lingering impression of gastronomic excellence.

Best chips n salsa. I wanna take the whole bottle to myself. When I have parties  at home I order the Fiesta platters. Everything here is good. Only reason I gave 4 stars n not 5 is cause one time I went in n they ran out of Pollo fundido. Gave me a regular chicken burrito. I was looking forward to fundido. Anything fried is better right? Fast service..clean restaurant

Artsy place with a cool vibe. My wife and I went there for a nice lunch and that is exactly what we got.  I really like the contrast of flavors that we had in our sandwiches. Mango, cajun chicken, and avocado --MMM!! Delicous!

I frequent this establishment on a regular basis due to my association with a group of individuals who are employed in the culinary department. The edibles served here are of superior quality, and I have had the pleasure of sampling a majority of the offerings. Particularly noteworthy are the Reuben, the Cajun, and the Royal, all of which are deliciously indulgent, albeit somewhat detrimental to one's health. To maximize your gastronomical experience, I suggest sharing one of the larger portions with a companion, thereby enabling you to sample two distinct varieties. Additionally, the venue boasts an impressive array of brews, which serve as the perfect accompaniment to the delectable fare.

Love the food here!  I think they have the best fried rice ever, and love that the vegetables and meat are large pieces and not chopped into teeny pieces.  I almost always get the Mussaman Curry and it's some of the best I've ever had.  My second favorite is the sizzling beef, although last time I had carry out the meat was tough and way overcooked.

They handle special orders with no problem, although every addition costs $$.  They used to run a spice scale of 1-10 with 5 being comparable to jalapenos, but have since changed it to a 1-5 scale with 3 being the old 5.  My biggest complaint here is that twice now they've reversed the spiciness of the dishes ordered.  Once when I ate in my curry had no spice and my friends had so much spice she couldn't eat it.  Of course they fixed the problem for us right away.  The second time it happened was a carry-out order and it was too much of a hassle to return for the correct items.  Can't see why this should be so difficult to get right.

They have a discount card of sorts, accumulate points based on dollars spent and then earn $10 off a purchase.  I also recently received a 20% email for being in their "loyalty program for a year".  

I'll be back soon!

During my recent sojourn in the Scottsdale region, I was in pursuit of delectable sushi in close proximity to my lodgings, and upon perusing online reviews, I chanced upon this establishment, which piqued my interest. In conjunction with my companions, we opted to partake in a culinary excursion to this eatery, and our expectations were not only met but exceeded, as we experienced an evening replete with conviviality, superlative fare, and exceptional hospitality, courtesy of proprietor Greg and sushi artisan Miki. It is my fervent recommendation that gastronomes seeking a premier dining experience should consider patronizing this venue.

"Exquisite outdoor dining area! \n\nMet with a coterie of companions and relished the porcine platter, accompanied by delectable miniature pancake-esque accoutrements and the piquant mashed potato preparation; both culinary offerings were truly exceptional."
"An exceptional culinary experience characterized by delectable dishes, prompt and attentive service, and an overall ambiance that fosters a strong desire for future visits."
Sheer coincidence that I'm writing a review for Cheba hut on 4-20. But where else should you go when you're blitzted out of your mind on 4-20 and you want a hot toasted sub? EXACTLY!!!
Great place to relax, grab a bite to eat and a drink in downtown Phoenix.  The staff is extremely nice and helpful and there are many options to choose from here.

"Prodigious culinary mastery, unparalleled gastronomic delight! Service, albeit somewhat languid, was nevertheless rendered with an air of elegance and refinement, characteristic of the quintessential Gallic hospitality. I would, without hesitation, avail myself of the opportunity to partake in such an epicurean experience once again, should fate afford me the privilege of a future visit."

Interesting concept. This place is quick-service, order at the counter, sushi restaurant. You go in, place your order, pay for it, and then they bring it over. You fill your own drinks at the machine.\n\nThe sushi was fine. It was nothing special but the prices are great and the service was very fast. If I lived or worked around there, I could definitely see myself going frequently.

"My affection for this establishment persists even after a night of excessive alcohol consumption, specifically on the subsequent day when the lingering effects of the previous evening's indulgence are still palpable. In fact, my fondness for Pho knows no bounds, regardless of the day or time. The prices of Banh Mi, a traditional Vietnamese sandwich, are quite reasonable and offer an exceptional value considering their flavorful taste, despite being slightly diminutive in size compared to other eateries. The quality of both the Pho and various other menu items surpasses expectations, with the notable exception of spring rolls, which, while not necessarily subpar, fail to meet the high standards set by the rest of the menu. Patrons may also partake in a diverse array of boba beverages. However, a minor drawback exists in that the staff occasionally feign comprehension of our orders, leading to errors in the final product. These insignificant discrepancies include omitting garnishes such as cilantro or erroneously including excessive amounts of certain ingredients."

"I have been frequenting this establishment on a consistent basis, and have yet to encounter any of the problems that others have described in their reviews...

The sushi rolls are undoubtedly one of the highlights of the menu, with the Vegas roll being a personal favorite of mine; it has a delightful balance of flavors and textures, and the presentation is visually stunning...

As for the service, I have always found it to be prompt and attentive, even during peak hours; on one occasion, we had a large party of 15 people and the staff handled it with ease...

However, I must say that the state of the restrooms leaves much to be desired; they are in dire need of renovation and proper maintenance, and the sound of employees engaging in personal conversations on their cell phones while using the facilities is not exactly conducive to a pleasant dining experience."

"Your establishment has earned an additional stellar rating due to two pivotal factors. Firstly, the comprehensive renovation has resulted in a visually appealing and refined ambiance, which is sure to enhance the dining experience for your patrons. Of greater significance, however, is the exceptional quality and craftsmanship of the sushi offered at your location. Following a thorough assessment of various Iggle's throughout the city, it is unequivocal that your venue serves the most delectable and expertly prepared sushi. Such a proclamation may seem audacious, but my unwavering fondness for this culinary delight has led me to sample an array of rainbow rolls from diverse locales, and yours truly stands out for its superior taste and texture. In essence, your eatery offers a convenient and satisfying solution for sushi enthusiasts who crave a premium product without sacrificing the convenience of a quick, casual dining experience."

This establishment purports to be a diner; however, it is essential to acknowledge that the quality of service is inconsistent and the ambiance is unremarkable. Despite these limitations, the culinary offerings are generally satisfactory. To optimize your dining experience, consider the following suggestions:  
1. Consider sharing a malt or shake with a companion, as these frozen delights are not only delectable but also substantial in portion, rendering them suitable for sharing. Given the generous size of the meals, splitting one of these treats between two individuals is advisable.  
2. Upon perusing the menu, select an item that piques your interest and remain loyal to your choice. While a few exceptional dishes (such as the meatless meatloaf) truly stand out, the remainder of the offerings are merely average. Consistency is key when it comes to savoring the flavors of this eatery.  
Following a comprehensive assessment, I would assign three stars to this establishment. Nonetheless, the extensive variety of vegetarian options warrants an additional star, elevating the overall rating to four stars.

"The pepperoni rolls served at this establishment are undoubtedly exceptional, boasting a remarkable six 2\" diameter rolls accompanied by dipping sauce for a mere $6.49, albeit slightly pricey, they are nonetheless an excellent value. Additionally, this venue offers Woodchuck hard cider on tap, a superior quality beverage that complements their culinary offerings. While their deep dish pizza is satisfactory, it would benefit from the sausage being cut into smaller, more uniform pieces, allowing for a more even distribution of flavor across the pizza. Unfortunately, I have yet to sample their thin crust pizza or other menu items, but I have no doubt that they will meet the same high standards set by their pepperoni rolls and exceptional customer service, as evidenced by the friendly demeanor and helpfulness of the staff member who assisted me with my to-go order, taking the time to thoroughly explain the various dipping sauce options and beverages available."

Food, service, and ambiance were impeccable.  The only negative on our visit was the horrific lounge singer who proceeded to butcher multiple Beatles songs to the extent that I'm sure the deceased Beatles (RIP!) were rolling in their graves.  Fortunately he stopped at some point throughout the meal.  Sooooo on that unappetizing note, let's move on to the food...


calamari - unbelievable!  Delicious, tender perfectly cooked and seasoned calamari with a great accompaniment of shallots, asian noodles, carrots, scallions, cashews, and red chiles in a lovely sauce.

halibut cheeks benedict with lobster and Hollandaise - delicious.  perfectly cooked biscuits (says the Southern girl who knows my biscuits), the hollandaise was well-done - not too stiff, not too heavy, and perfectly cooked eggs.  The little side salad with it was just ok.

lobster bisque - delicious.  Not too creamy, lots of lobster flavor goodness, pleasing texture.

asparagus with hollandaise - tender, fresh baby asparagus 

corn - amazingly fresh and flavorful.  It was hard to stop eating it.

bananas foster butter cakes - a bit too sweet for my taste but everyone else loved it.  The butter pecan ice cream was divine.

godiva chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream - Oh.My.Goodness.  Were licking the plate not frowned upon (in some places,) I would have.

Whitehaven Sauvignon Blanc - lovely, light, fresh bouquet.  Kim Crawford lovers will enjoy it.  

from the moment you walk in the door, it's all about quick, efficient, professional service.  Everything we had was amazing. Definitely a great place for a special dinner.

Free is good - especially in Las Vegas - and every hour along Fremont Street you get to hang out and watch a show of some sort take place overhead.  I've always enjoyed downtown, first because the hotels are so much easier to get into than on the strip (where you have to walk miles to get from one to the next), but also because it's just so much seedier.\n\nThen to see all the neon shut down and everyone stop and stare - it's just more interesting that people, who are dropping who knows how much money, will care to watch the lights twinkle for five minutes or so.  At the end of it all, you get to watch the street flicker back to life, and everyone goes on with what they are doing.  It's just an interesting phenomenon, less about the show than about what takes place around it - and watching the people is what it's all about.

Having relocated to this geographic locale from the state of Ohio, I found myself in pursuit of a proficient massage practitioner. Following a thorough examination of online reviews pertaining to local masseuses, I opted to engage the services of Jill. She delivered an exceptional 90-minute therapeutic massage, articulating a comprehensive understanding of muscle stretching techniques, including the recommendation to maintain a static stretch for a duration of 40 seconds, a novel concept that I had not previously encountered. Consequent to this satisfactory encounter, I have elected to schedule recurrent appointments with Jill at intervals of three weeks, eagerly anticipating each subsequent session. I unhesitatingly endorse Jill to any individual seeking a tranquilizing massage experience.

Steve Wynn set out to have the best buffett in Vegas, and he does. The Wynn buffet definitely takes the cake. The quality of their ingredients and preparation is a step above the rest, and it's apparent in everything from the thin-crust brick-oven pizza to the huge, meaty crab legs to the New Zealand rack of lamb. I also appreciated the little \"exotic\" touches, such as the Asian noodle soup bar, fresh longans (not canned!) and Asian pears in their pear salad. \n\nMinus one star for that crazy long line, though...we waited for 1.5 hrs, and believe it or not, many people waited longer. Someone in line behind us even fainted and one kid got a nosebleed. Damn, people! With the Wynn buffet being a quintessential Vegas attraction in and of itself, Steve Wynn should consider implementing a FastPass type of system!
Not easy to find. In the back of a shopping center. In went there for Pho all the time. It's the closest I can find to the noodle I had home in China.

I really like arrowhead mall, its one of my favorites. the layout is very helpful and you can see other stores from either side of the mall and all have easy access. I like the fact that it also has an Apple Store. My Favorite Stores are American Eagle And Footlocker. and for my wife they have all the rest... so she can go crazy shopping. it keeps her busy haha...and when we are tired of walking. they have alot of restaurants to choose from :) so this mall has it all...and its close to where i live so i dont have to drive out to AZ mills or fashion square mall...unless we are bored...then the drive out there will be worth it

"Perhaps my anticipations have yet to undergo thorough metamorphosis upon entering the Veterans Affairs healthcare system, but thus far, subsequent to two medical appointments with physicians and a couple of excursions to the laboratory, in addition to today's encounter with a dietitian, I must confess that I harbor an unwavering sense of satisfaction. Not only have I been impressed by the absence of substantial queuing, but also by the seamless and virtually pain-free nature of blood sampling procedures, as well as the unwavering dedication and benevolence displayed by volunteers. Although it did require an extended duration to gain admittance into the system, my experiences have led me to formulate nothing but laudatory remarks regarding the personnel and their services. It appears that the VA facility in question caters to an enormous populace, while simultaneously exhibiting a commendable level of solicitude towards patients' necessities. My sincere gratitude extends to each and every individual involved in providing such attentive care."

"Transactions were discovered throughout the venue, which was delightful to observe, given that an increased number of kiosks were attended by personnel rather than remaining unoccupied. It is advisable to visit the outdoor area if you seek second-hand items or tools, as the novelty of the merchandise is a prominent aspect of this event. Admission to the event requires a minimal fee of one dollar, which grants access to an array of culinary options, despite the absence of the miniature doughnut stand. Visible security measures have been implemented to ensure the safety of attendees, thereby rendering any illicit activities futile. This gathering offers an ideal setting for socializing and enjoying a refreshing beverage during sweltering days with temperatures exceeding one hundred degrees Fahrenheit."

This location offers a truly pleasant experience, and I must say, I feel utterly indulged whenever I attempt to venture out in San Francisco or Sacramento, as nothing I have visited thus far has managed to compare to the exceptional quality of XS.

The most notable aspect of XS is undoubtedly its expansive size, which is complemented by an impressive entrance that opens up to the interior of the club and extends around the pool area, forming a picturesque peninsula that surrounds the water.

Regrettably, my recent visit during Memorial Day weekend was marred by an excessively large crowd, which somewhat diminished my enjoyment of the establishment. In fact, I have never witnessed such a dense throng of patrons within its confines. As a result, I found the experience to be somewhat off-putting.

Furthermore, the musical offerings at XS tend to exhibit considerable variation, veering from the customary hip-hop and pop genres commonly associated with clubs, and occasionally shifting gears to incorporate elements of house music, thereby catching the majority of patrons off guard.

In conclusion, while XS undeniably possesses certain unique qualities that set it apart from other establishments, overcrowding and inconsistent musical selections can detract from the overall experience.

"Commencing with an acknowledgement of the hospitable demeanor exhibited by the personnel stationed at the points of sale, it is imperative to emphasize that such an amicable disposition is not only appreciated but also expected, particularly when considering the substantial discrepancy between the price paid and the manufacturer's suggested retail price. Notwithstanding this caveat, the employees demonstrated a commendable level of cordiality, respectfulness, and gratitude towards their patrons. Furthermore, the cinemas, albeit somewhat unsatisfactory in terms of the tidiness of the restrooms and auditoriums, managed to garner a rating of four stars, largely attributable to the laudable customer service proffered by the establishment's staff."

" Allow me to proffer a solitary term for your perusal, my dear progeny; 'porkbellies', if you will, and, furthermore, permit me to elaborate upon the preparation of these delectable morsels via the medium of grilling, thus imbuing them with an unparalleled depth of flavor and texture that, when accompanied by a trio of complementary sides - rice, pickled eggplant, and macaroni salad, all crowned by a judicious portion of cucumbers - transcends the realm of culinary indulgence, elevating the dining experience to an unprecedented level of gastronomical nirvana, if you will, and, I dare say, rendering any further embellishment or refinement utterly superfluous."

"The ambiance was enhanced by the melodious strains of good music, which complemented the potent concoctions served at the bar; furthermore, the rooftop terrace offered an expansive view of the surrounding area, although it did tend to get overcrowded, thereby detracting from the overall experience, hence the rating of four stars instead of five. Notwithstanding, gaining entry was a seamless process, and we were not subjected to any cover charge. Additionally, it is worth mentioning that the establishment boasted an impressive connection to the renowned Playboy Club, facilitated by a single, imposing escalator."

"Although the culinary offerings at this establishment are of satisfactory quality and the staff exhibit commendable hospitality, the menu options appear somewhat restricted and lack the innovative flair that one might encounter at alternative dining venues."
"The fare provided by this eatery is of a satisfactory nature, with the added assurance of cleanliness and consistency."
"During a weekday visit at approximately 1 pm, the premises were remarkably devoid of patrons, which raises questions regarding the restaurant's capacity to attract a sufficient volume of customers."
"It is curious that, despite the aforementioned attributes, this dining spot fails to draw a larger crowd, particularly during peak hours."

This is my favorite airlines.  They have a very reliable on time record.  The planes for the most part are clean.  I really enjoy riding the air bus.  I love the early morning red eye flight as one could possibly go to vegas and then land in HNL and still make it to work. (well if you are hard core LOL). \nThe food if even offered on your flight is no frills.  Its not the best and nothing really much more to say but its exactly what first comes to mind when thinking of airlines food. If you know what I mean.  \nThis should be the first airlines to check out if flying out of LAS to HNL and vice versa.

After an evening of revelry and wagering, there exists no superior destination for satiating one's hunger than the California Hotel's Cafe, located a reasonable distance from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip. Their extensive menu boasts a diverse array of delectable options, but my personal preference lies solely with the savory Ox Tail Soup, a culinary masterpiece that attracts a devoted clientele, as evidenced by the ubiquity of towering soup bowls and accompanying rice bowls adorning the tables.

Unfortunately, the establishment's remote location from the strip occasionally presents a challenge for even the most seasoned taxi drivers, resulting in occasional unplanned detours through less than desirable areas. However, this minor inconvenience is promptly forgotten upon partaking in the hearty, steaming bowl of Ox Tail Soup, brimming with tender chunks of meat, crunchy vegetables, and an occasional mushroom or two, providing an unparalleled satisfaction, particularly during the winter months when the cooler climate heightens one's appreciation for such comfort food.

While my experiences at the California Hotel have been primarily centered around indulging in their delectable cuisine, their gaming facilities do offer modest table limits, allowing me to extend my financial resources and enhance my overall entertainment experience.

While I am not the biggest Mexican food fan on the block I have always enjoyed eating here. They have this whole Greek/Mexican marriage thing going on-lol. What I really like are the chips and salsa. Interestingly enough their Veggie Burro is kicking!

After going to Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill the night before, this was 100x better. We got there right at 11 so we wouldn't have to wait for a table. This place is clearly popular and there were 10 parties waiting at 11 already so if you have to wait a long time, it should be no bearing on how you rate the restaurant. There were lots of tables, lots of staff, and when we left around 12:30 the place was teeming. 

Our server was very knowledgeable, she explained the menu and gave us her recommendations. Her service was great and she kept checking in on us.

The burgers were delicious - no complaints. We got the sweet potato fries that we could barely finish as there were so many. This place was priced very reasonably considering that it's a Vegas restaurant. For $13-15 a burger, you can't really complain.

Great place and we're sad we didn't get to try the shakes.

My husband and I always enjoy Hef's. The atmosphere is cozy, yet usually hopping and exciting. The clientele is usually quite diverse. Their fried tomatoes are delicious and the drinks are good. Great neighborhood bar.

At the car wash, an establishment specializing in the cleansing of automobiles, one can observe a multitude of patrons eagerly awaiting the transformation of their vehicles from grimy to pristine. The ambiance is enhanced by the rhythmic chanting of "whoa" by those in attendance, further emphasizing the jovial nature of the experience. It is evident that Danny's Family Car Wash, with its numerous locations throughout the valley, has established a successful enterprise, as evidenced by the constant influx of customers and the eagerness of employees to provide expeditious and meticulous service. As a personal testimony, I must confess that I have been remiss in prioritizing the cleanliness of my vehicle, but the sense of satisfaction derived from entering a spotless car is unparalleled. Although the quality of service at Danny's may not be extraordinary, it surpasses my own abilities and saves me valuable time. Furthermore, I recently discovered that visiting the car wash on Tuesdays offers an added benefit, specifically a $2 discount for female patrons. This revelation serves as a reminder to take advantage of this perk in the future. Indeed, being a lady does have certain advantages, even in the realm of automobile maintenance.
