Although it is situated within a strip mall and the interior illumination is somewhat dim, this establishment exudes an atmosphere that is both welcoming and informal, making it an ideal setting in which to indulge in comforting cuisine. In the event that your party consists of four individuals or more, you may be compelled to partake of your meal alfresco, utilizing the outdoor seating located at the entrance of the premises. Additionally, there is a minimal counter area where you can consume your repast while simultaneously observing the culinary process involved in creating the aforementioned crepes. My order, the Frisco crepe, consisted of a delectable combination of fresh blueberries enveloped in a tangy lemon curd, further complemented by a generous sprinkling of powdered sugar and a side of rich whipped cream. While this culinary creation proved to be utterly satisfying when accompanied by my unlimited morning coffee, I could not help but crave a slightly more substantial amount of lemon curd within its composition. Regardless, this venue represents an excellent destination for either initiating your crepe-consumption experience or expanding your gastronomical horizons beyond your customary breakfast options, thereby providing a truly enjoyable and multifaceted dining adventure.
I wanted a good burger and got it here. It was cooked to order. Staff were nice....not jerks and not trying to rush you or pressure you. I really liked the onion rings and options for your burger.

There's a rule in my family. When you buy a house, make sure that you can walk to a liquor store. This comes from the need to keep stocked in winters where you might not be able to drive, leaving you and your family shut in for a few days, disgustingly sober! Oh the horror!!

I can walk to Mike's. It's a small place but lacks nothing.They have an excellent wine selection, fully stocked distillates and a good selection of beer ...  all reasonably priced. No pretense, nothing snooty just a good selection that won't break the bank.

Last summer, when it was so hot, I was looking for some vinho verde. Vinho verde is a light, dry, somewhat fizzy and citrusy white wine from Portugal that is great summer drinking and, most importantly when drinking heavily, it tends to be cheap. He had a really decent one, on sale for $5/bottle!! More than reasonable! 

I've walked way further for way less. Way to go, Mike's!!

This hotel truly epitomizes excellence in both its prime location along the historic Royal Mile and its commitment to providing guests with an unparalleled level of comfort and luxury. The arduous ascent from the train station notwithstanding, the breathtaking panorama afforded by my accommodation's strategic vantage point made the effort more than worthwhile, serving as a powerful motivator to explore the surrounding environs further. The property's architectural style boasts a captivating blend of traditional elements and modern flourishes, complemented by a dimly lit, subterranean bar area reminiscent of a crypt. My lodgings were exceptionally appointed, featuring a Nespresso machine â?a first for me at a Radisson establishment â?and a bed of such proportions and comfort that it defies adequate description. Unfortunately, the television's reception proved somewhat disappointing, despite the best efforts of the hotel's technical staff. Nonetheless, the impeccable service provided by the front desk staff more than compensated for this minor shortcoming, as they graciously assisted me in securing a tranquil dining experience at a nearby eatery, thoughtfully taking into account my preference for a peaceful meal accompanied by a good book, free from any distractions or interruptions.

"Substantially improved compared to our initial stay, during which the establishment was undergoing transformation from Aladdin to Planet Hollywood, we were pleased to experience notable enhancements upon our return. Specifically, we opted for the 'Hollywood Hip' accommodation for a single night at a cost of $159, inclusive of tax, which afforded us a spacious, two-queen, non-smoking room on the 17th floor. Additionally, we received complimentary amenities, including a free bottle of Skyy Vodka valued at $45, $40 in casino play, and various other coupons. The lodging itself featured a generous size, complete with a 42-inch plasma television for our entertainment while preparing for our evening excursions, as well as a well-appointed bathroom boasting a bathtub, separate shower, and two sinks, accompanied by an ample vanity area for the ladies to prepare. Furthermore, the hotel staff considerately provided us with newspapers and an assortment of OK magazines for our reading pleasure. However, the illumination within the room proved insufficient, leaving the space dimly lit, which the females in our party found particularly bothersome. Moreover, the bathroom experienced excessive heat and humidity, likely due to an overabundance of light sources. Notwithstanding these issues, we generally enjoyed our stay, despite minor shortcomings, such as a bed with lingering stains that we chose not to address given the late hour."

Suite accommodations of generous proportions at a cost-effective price point. A mere ten-minute pedestrian commute to both the basketball arena and the baseball stadium. Strategically positioned in the central business district, surrounded by an abundance of establishments catering to culinary and libational inclinations, all within a stone's throw proximity. No need to consider renting an automobile or utilizing personal transportation, as all essential amenities are conveniently accessible on foot. Eagerly anticipating a future visit during the peak season.

"Remarkable discovery! I thoroughly enjoyed the savory beef arepa, it was delectable, albeit the chicken salad variant left something to be desired in terms of culinary excellence; however, my gastronomical experience reached its zenith when I sampled their mouthwatering grilled chicken accompanied by a medley of flavorsome rice and beans - an unmitigated delight! My sights are now set on indulging in their tantalizing empanada at a future date, for they appeared visually stunning and no doubt equally scrumptious."
Love their adult milkshakes otherwise this bar is subpar. The atmosphere is like any other bar on saddlebag trail with a lot of speakers.

Jim and Tabitha, proficient mixologists, excel in their roles as bartenders, providing an exceptional experience for patrons who partake in the establishment's Wednesday comedy night, which offers an enjoyable atmosphere and reasonably-priced fare that satisfies one's gastronomical inclinations.

This establishment purveys an extensive array of alcoholic beverages and associated accoutrements tailored specifically towards adult consumers. Upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the sheer volume and diversity of potations available, with row upon row of various wines, beers, champagnes, liquors, and spirits stretching out before me in a meticulously organized display. The staff members present were both cordial and helpful, further enhancing the overall experience. 
  My personal preferences lean towards a particular type of beer that I had previously encountered in Albuquerque, and much to my delight, I discovered that this location carried not only that specific brew but also several other delectable options, such as the Alien Stout and Nut Brown Ale. Additionally, I came across the Wells Banana Bread beer, whose flavor profile surpassed my expectations. 
  While perusing the wine selection, I found it to be somewhat overwhelming due to its vastness, and thus, I opted to defer exploring that particular section of the store for a future visit. However, I do intend to return and sample the Dreaming Tree crush red and Barrymore Pinot Grigio. 
  In order to cater to the diverse needs of their clientele, the store offers an impressive assortment of glassware, ranging from plastic travel wine glasses designed for outdoor consumption to more sophisticated alternatives. Furthermore, they stock a variety of snacks, including refrigerated meats and cheeses courtesy of Boarhead, alongside more modest choices such as chips and snack mixes, albeit at slightly elevated prices. 
  In summary, this establishment provides a comprehensive collection of goods and services, all conveniently housed beneath a single, well-organized roof, thereby catering to the requirements of discerning patrons seeking to indulge in alcoholic beverages. My initial visit has left me thoroughly impressed, and I believe that this venue far surpasses its neighboring competitor, Lee's.

"The quality of instruction provided by the staff and coaches at this establishment is truly exceptional; however, the designated viewing area for parents and guardians leaves much to be desired in terms of both accessibility and comfort. The space is woefully inadequate to accommodate the high volume of spectators, resulting in an overcrowded environment that makes it challenging to secure a seat, particularly during lengthier classes lasting two hours or more. Frequently, parents are compelled to stand for extended periods to observe their children's activities, which can be tiresome and uncomfortable."

"We have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Root on two separate occasions in recent months. Our initial visit was indeed a remarkable experience, as the atmosphere was conducive to relaxation and enjoyment, with an adequate number of patrons and an ambient level of noise. Our server, a knowledgeable and affable individual, engaged us in a most delightful conversation, discussing various topics such as beer and cuisine, which served to enhance our dining experience. The fare provided by Root was also quite impressive, with their wine list being particularly noteworthy. \n\nHowever, our second visit proved to be somewhat inconsistent in terms of quality when compared to our initial outing. While the edibles were generally satisfactory, the Brussels sprouts, which had been prepared to perfection during our first visit, were unfortunately overcooked on this occasion. Furthermore, our server appeared to be somewhat lacking in his attentiveness and proficiency, as he failed to demonstrate the same level of enthusiasm and dedication to ensuring our satisfaction as his predecessor had done. Thus, our experiences at Root can be characterized as either exceptional or merely average, depending on the specific visit in question."

Update - 05-March-10   They improved the parking system finally.   Good job guys.   \nAlso, kudos to the field workers.   After a spirited rainstorm right before Saturday's race, they worked hard to get the track dry so the race could start.   Good show.

"A culinary experience characterized by delectable fare, reasonable pricing, and an ambiance that exudes warmth and conviviality, ultimately transcends the mundane notion of mere satisfaction. Indeed, the unnumbered lunch special, available for a mere thirteen dollars, offers a diverse array of flavors that collectively constitute a veritable gustatory odyssey."

Their food is amazing. The tatami rooms are just add ons to the whole dining experience.  The unagi bowl is WORTH IT. A little pricy but all sushi places are. If you get tired of buffet, definitely try this place.

A Groupon arrangement rendered this an exceptionally advantageous proposition. Following my initial visit, I assessed that the quantity and caliber of the fare rendered the customary price point at least moderately reasonable. However, upon my return, I noticed that the servings were marginally diminished in magnitude. I attribute this to the fact that the non-Japanese sushi chef lacks comparable proficiency and generosity. Notwithstanding, I am content to convey a generally favorable account of my dining experience.

We indulged in a leisurely Sunday afternoon at Spring Valley Park, accompanied by our canine companion, Solin. Following an online search for suitable dog parks in the vicinity, we opted for this particular park due to its favorable reviews. It boasts three separate enclosures for dogs of varying sizes, and given Solin's diminutive stature, we elected to enter the smallest section. The expansive area accommodated a considerable number of both humans and their furry friends, facilitating an atmosphere conducive to socialization and playful interactions. A water feature designated for canine consumption and disposable waste bags were thoughtfully provided, encouraging responsible pet ownership and ensuring a tidy environment. Solin's excitement was palpable as he frolicked unbridled throughout the park, his zeal unwavering. His unrelenting enthusiasm did elicit concern regarding potential dehydration, however. During an instance of particularly ardent exploration, Solin engaged in an olfactory investigation of another canine, prompting the latter's owner to offer insight into the peculiarities of canine communication. She explained that dogs rely on scent to gather information about one another, gleaning essential details about compatibility from the aroma emanating from their counterparts. This novel perspective struck me as both fascinating and humorous, highlighting the vast disparities between human and animal social rituals. Ultimately, our visit to Spring Valley Park proved a resounding success, offering ample space for canines to exercise and interact while fostering a sense of community among their human companions.

I suppose there are both pros and cons in having a pretty solid Mexican restaurant right up the road from your home. The obvious pro being the accessibility to great food and drink (generally Dos Equis or Modelo for me), followed swiftly by the obvious con of un-doing your exercise routine for the day. 

But in any case, I generally enjoyed this restaurant with the exception of cost. In the grand scheme of things, it isn't necessarily pricey. It is generally comparable to other Mexican restaurants. For me, if I'm looking for a quick, around-the-corner Mexican restaurant- this is definitely the place to be. If I'm looking to penny-pinch, I'd drive a few minutes down WT Harris towards the university and hit up Zapatas (my absolute fan favorite). 

I generally liked every other aspect of this establishment. The atmosphere and décor were set perfectly for a Mexican restaurant. Good ambiance. The food was well prepared and was pretty delectable. Beer was flowing. The service was spot on. What more can you ask for really? 

There were specials here, which most looked appealing. 

Definitely worth a try!

So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

"Ah, an establishment that delivers a beverage accompanied by a miniature mechanical primate on a string to one's acquaintance? Verily, a promising sign indeed! The premises themselves boast an aesthetically pleasing chessboard-patterned floor, ample seating, and an agreeable ambiance in the lower level. Moreover, the staff exhibits remarkable efficiency in their duties, albeit with a taciturn demeanor. 

Upon arrival, a diminutive glass of potable water is promptly presented to each patron, allowing them to quench their thirst while perusing the selection of libations (or, in certain instances, opting for a less complex beverage). A unique approach to menu design, indeed - merely a list of names and corresponding prices, leaving the specifics of each concoction to the discretion of the mixologist. An intriguing concept, reminiscent of a lucky dip, wherein one selects a mystery drink based on individual preferences. 

In my case, I requested a non-alcoholic variation and was curiously queried about the flavors I wished to avoid. A novel approach, indeed! Following my specification of excluding bananas from the mixture, the attendant swiftly returned with a creation tailored to my taste. 

Commendations are in order for the absence of banana essence within the drink. Furthermore, neither coffee nor lamb were discernible within the composition. While the beverage did not elicit an extraordinary response from my palate, it did possess a mature, refined quality, lacking the cloying sweetness and fruity flavors often found in similar drinks. Additionally, an abundance of crushed ice was provided for post-consumption entertainment. All things considered, a reasonable price of £3.50 was charged for this experience."

I am fulfilling my civic obligation as a juror twice a week for a duration of four months, which conveniently allows me to explore a previously unfamiliar part of Phoenix during my retirement. Each day, I indulge in culinary excursions to diverse establishments, savoring a variety of delectable dishes. Cartel Coffee Lab, a trendy eatery boasting an eclectic ambiance, offers an array of tantalizing options beyond their specialty coffee drinks, including breakfast, lunch, and possibly dinner. Upon ordering the BLT, I was inquiringly asked if I was agreeable to the presence of an egg on the sandwich, to which I responded affirmatively, having been exposed to a similar variation of the dish, known as a BELT, during my sojourn in Canada. The friendly server, who attended to my needs with remarkable attentiveness, ensured that my dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable, engaging in conversation and expressing genuine interest in my satisfaction with the meal. While I cannot confer a perfect rating without multiple visits, I assure you that the quality of both the nourishment and hospitality at Cartel Coffee Lab warrants a hearty recommendation. I eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall relish their espresso offerings and likely upgrade my assessment to a well-deserved five stars.

The staff members exhibited exceptional cordiality and hospitality, ensuring that our stay was thoroughly enjoyable and hassle-free. The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and meticulously maintained, providing us with a comfortable and relaxing environment to retreat to after a day of indulging in the various recreational activities available on the premises. The swimming pool was an impressive expanse of crystal clear water, replete with picturesque waterfalls and surrounded by lush greenery, creating a tranquil ambiance that was further enhanced by the cleanliness and maintenance of the facility. We did not experience any delays or inconvenience during our stay, as the service was prompt and efficient. Additionally, the lazy river provided an idyllic setting for a leisurely float, while the on-site restaurants offered an array of delectable culinary options, although at a slightly higher price point than we had anticipated. Nonetheless, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience made it a worthwhile investment for a family vacation centered around poolside fun and relaxation.

After having been terrestrially domiciled on this planet for a duration of twenty-seven revolutions of the earth around the sun, I ultimately had the gratification of partaking in a culinary experience of Korean BBQ for the first time in my life, which transpired in Las Vegas of all locations. We relinquished our ten-dollar beverages at XS and decided it was an opportune moment to relax the gastronomical constraints of our belts at D.J.K. Two remarkable individuals of Korean descent navigated us through the menu; alright, that's a slight exaggeration...they placed the orders on our behalf, but I am exceedingly grateful that they did! It is imperative that you sample soju, a potent Korean liquor that complements the cuisine remarkably well. Additionally, if you happen to be present between the hours of eleven o'clock in the evening and two o'clock in the morning, you will receive a twenty percent discount on your total bill.

this is the best Italian place in Vegas thus far. the pizza is great but the dinner entrees are awesome. I've taken family and friends here from out of town and they have loved it. the chicken Marsala is my fave, I've had the shrimp Alfredo, all kinds of pizza, and foccacia and its been a hit every time. if your ordering pizza for delivery good luck with the girls on the phone, they're like 12 so its hard to get the order through but delivery is fast and the food is really great. the prices are great too!

"Indubitably, my experience during the latter portion of the twentieth century's final decade was characterized by an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which served as the culinary epicenter of my inaugural visit to this city in over a decade and a half. My gastronomical expectations were not only met but exceeded, particularly with regard to the succulent crawfish appetizer that preceded the main course. It is utterly inconceivable that I would tolerate such an extended hiatus before once again partaking in the delectable offerings of this esteemed eatery."

"An exceptional notion, offering an abundance of toppings for a fixed price of $12, thereby providing a singular opportunity for a solitary individual to relish a satisfying repast without the attendant guilt accompanying the consumption of excessive caloric content. Furthermore, the crust exhibits a desirable thinness, thereby facilitating ease of consumption and enabling one to partake in the culinary experience without concern for overindulgence. Additionally, it is gratifying to learn of the existence of an additional establishment in Hillcrest, San Diego, thus rendering it feasible for me to visit and sample their offerings at said location as well. Ultimately, the pizza presents itself as a delectable indulgence, boasting commendable quality and allowing patrons the option of selecting their preferred toppings or opting for the pre-defined menu, all for the reasonable sum of $12 per pie."
Great tacos and really cool scene! I travel to TX a lot, and thought these tacos were just as good (if not better) than what I seek out when I'm there.

THIS PLACE IS PERMANENTLY CLOSED???  Last time we called was summer of 2011 and the voicemail said that the restaurant was closed for the summer.  It is no longer summer and the place is still CLOSED!!!!  Too bad because of my previous review below...

Great outside sitting area, good food too!  The AC gets a bit too cold sometimes but if you say something, they will turn it down.  This place looks classy, nice decor.

Very good lunch selections under $10.00.  The service is good, they take very good care of you.  We asked for something on the dinner menu and they served it to us.  They have a good wine selection but we haven't tried it yet as my coworkers and I go there at lunch.

Try the spinach dip.  It is awesome.  Small salad plates are good and healthy.  Pizza is good, sandwiches are creatively put together.

The indulgence of a self-made waffle cone, complemented by the richness of Almond Joy ice cream, served as the quintessential treat for my taste buds, as I relished in the hospitable demeanor of the servers and savored the palatable quality of the frozen delicacy, thereby fulfilling my craving for a satisfying dessert experience; thus, ensuring my future patronage at this establishment during my subsequent visits to my significant other's domicile in the Steel City.

"We visited this establishment for a midday repast with Rand H., and our culinary experience was rather satisfactory, boasting an extensive array of approximately 40 diverse items, analogous to the customary Indian smorgasbord in scope. The preliminary liquid offerings, specifically the egg drop and hot and sour varieties, were indeed delectable, prompting me to partake in a bowl of each. The primary dishes, encompassing a multitude of flavors and textures, were executed with remarkable proficiency, warranting top marks - five stars, to be precise. However, their concluding sweet course, comprising jello, sliced peaches, and those minuscule, gelatinous spheres commonly referred to as lychee, proved somewhat lacking in quality. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, we enjoyed a superlative luncheon at a most reasonable tariff of $5.75; regrettably, the hospitality we received fell slightly short of excellence, thereby precluding a perfect five-star rating. Nonetheless, in light of the exceptional culinary prowess displayed, I confer upon them a respectable four stars."

This critique pertains exclusively to the crepe I consumed, which thoroughly satiated my yearning for both crepes and sweets. The delectable concoction boasted an array of ingredients, including but not limited to rich nutella, velvety whipped cream, luscious caramel, decadent chocolate sauce, fresh bananas, and crunchy candied hazelnuts. It is utterly implausible to experience anything short of an exceptional day in Las Vegas, particularly when commencing one's morning with such a scrumptious breakfast.

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been consistently satisfying, with the ambiance and outdoor seating being particularly noteworthy. Following my initial visit, I opted to reserve judgment until I had sampled their offerings on multiple occasions. Now, having patronized them thrice, I can confidently attest to the delectability of their fare. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of their service has been inconsistent, with prolonged waiting periods and momentary lapses in attention to detail. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the merits of their gastronomic creations and overall ambiance warrant further exploration."

"Preeminent second-hand retail establishment, offering an extensive array of apparel and other miscellaneous items at reasonable prices, albeit with the occasional presence of some undesirable pieces; however, their previous practice of hosting '99 cent days' and color-coded discounts has been discontinued, which may potentially deter certain customers but ultimately contributes to a more streamlined shopping experience for those seeking quality attire."

Tonight's vacation dinner destination was Bandera, situated in the historic Old Town Scottsdale district. We had been apprised of numerous laudatory reviews pertaining to Bandera, and thus, we were eager to partake in the culinary experience it offered. It is worth mentioning that Bandera shares a familial relationship with two esteemed restaurants, Houstons and The Rutherford Grill, both of which have received top-notch ratings from this writer.  

Upon arriving at the establishment approximately a half hour prior to our scheduled reservation time, we opted to indulge in a pre-dinner beverage and sample the Deviled Egg appetizer on the inviting patio area. Our table was promptly prepared, and we were seated in no time. We elected to initiate our dining experience with the Grilled Artichoke and Cornbread side dishes...the artichoke was exceptionally delectable. The cornbread was truly remarkable, ranking as the most flavorful and satisfying iteration I have had the pleasure of consuming. For my primary course, I selected the Steak and Enchilada combination. The 6oz filet was skillfully cut into three manageable portions, each generously coated with a rich, deep crimson spicy sauce. The enchilada boasted their signature rotisserie chicken as its central component. Both dishes proved to be thoroughly enjoyable. 

My better half chose the Macho Salad as her main course. Upon the arrival of the salad, we noticed that an integral component, specifically the rotisserie chicken, was absent. However, the oversight was rapidly addressed, and she relished it to a considerable extent. 

While I did appreciate Bandera's offerings, they fell slightly short of my lofty expectations, perhaps due to the incorporation of a Mexican fusion element. A commendable effort, nonetheless, warranting a respectable four-star rating.

"I am effusively praising the exceptional massage therapist who executed an outstanding job of alleviating the tension in my muscles a few days prior. Her name is Miranda, a somewhat reserved individual who requires a brief period of familiarization to become conversational. Despite her slender physique, she possesses remarkable manual dexterity and demonstrable strength in her fingertips. It is evident that she has extensive knowledge and expertise in her field, which has led me to schedule another appointment within a relatively short time frame. Additionally, I must commend the immaculate condition of this establishment's facilities and the majority of the staff members, particularly the individual stationed at the reception area, who exhibits a courteous yet no-nonsense demeanor, thereby creating a welcoming atmosphere for patrons."

"The cinematic venues are all remarkably pleasant and appear strikingly pristine, boasting an array of modern amenities that cater to the diverse preferences of their patrons. The concession stand offers an extensive selection of delectable treats, including the tantalizing corn dog bites that caught the fancy of my elder child, who was delighted by the attentive service of the cashier, who ensured timely delivery of the order to our designated viewing area despite the brief preparation time required."

I went there during the \"Montreal poutine week\" , their brisket poutine was so good, the meat was very tasty, however, the service was slow , we had waited about half an hour to have the poutine and there are not many tables, so maybe takeaway is better.

Wow this place reminds me of the coffee shop version of the boba shop I work at. Strange. We were greeted as we entered AND as we left. Everyone was chill and helpful. The prices were simple (I love it when places round to the dollar) and affordable. I got a soy iced latte, which was pretty darn good.

The coffee beans they use are very different than what I'm used to...It's more earthy, I would say. I think I like it! The coffee taste is not too strong and not bitter at all, but the drink was definitely not weak or watery.

The decor is very inviting and I could see myself hanging out with friends, playing one of their numerous board games. However, I came here to study so I refrained from playing with all the little amenities they had.

I wanted to try one of their Yelp-famous grouchy cookies but the cashier said he had never heard of them. Strange...

Bonus points for hassle-free and very fast wifi! Too bad this place is so far from my house. Otherwise, I would definitely go more often.

"Tammy Coe Cakes has emerged as a culinary haven in Phoenix, boasting an array of delectable edibles that have captured the palates of local gastronomes, while the hospitable nature of its staff has fostered a sense of belonging among patrons, thereby solidifying the establishment's reputation as a cherished component of the city's epicurean landscape."
Was looking for WOC's and the sales person was really friendly to my surprise. I would def come back here if they have stock.  Better lucky next time for me.

i'm only 5'2\" and i had to get some low rise jeans hemmed...this place is prompt, does great work, and is quite kind.... Not the lowest price, but well worth what they charge which wasn't much more than a typical tailor..

This place was discovered purely by accident.  I wanted some noodle dish and i was near my old high school I googled good noodle places on my phone...this place.came up...i was like why not just try it for take out...i pulled up and i walked in and looked at the menu...i was so confused...tbey have italian and asian choices...i was like great this place cannot be too good if they are offering two types of food...but i was there already so i was going to try it...i was conflicted i love italian but i wanted asian so i got a staple...pad thai...it was delicious...full of flavor and i was very impressed! Since then i have been back and this place is good...i go here if i am in the area...its super casual...i love to take the food home and eat if while watching my reality tv and desperate housewives show...good place you should try it!

Orchids Garden, a relatively scarce purveyor of delectable Cantonese-style small plates in Las Vegas, has established itself as a reputable destination for those seeking an authentic dim sum experience, boasting an extensive array of options, reasonable pricing, and a spacious setting that comfortably accommodates a sizable clientele.

Mango, chili, lime, oh my! This pie is awesome. The first bite is strange as it's spicy, yet rich and tart. Go past the first bite and you'll be back for more (if you can handle the spice!). \n\nI enjoy Mama Toledo's!
We went here for happy hour a couple weeks ago, but before I could even write a review, they were closed! Yep, as of June 2013 - CLOSED!

Mon Ami Gabi is one of the few places in Vegas that I felt was good value for the price. I had breakfast here one morning and ordered the Blueberry French Toast, and I must say, it was delicious. Large slices of bread, fresh blueberries, whipped cream and blueberry syrup on top. Yum!

4 Stars for reasonable prices, good food, and one of the managers, Bob for overcoming the poor customer service of one individual, Sabrina.\n\nSix of us were seated at a booth.  When the above aforementioned employee approached to take our order I advised her that my wife and I will be on a separate ticket.  She said that she was not able to do that because we were all seated at the same booth.  I asked that if we were seated at the booth next to this one we could be on a separate ticket, she told me \"yep\".  I asked what the difference was that we were here and not there, without explaining why she just came our with \"it's policy, and is written right in the menu\".  I told her then we wont be returning.  Her response is the exact reason why honest working people employed in less desirable positions get a bad rap.  Their mindset is this ain't my place so what do I care if you come back or not.

Dear AMC Rainbow Promenade,
   1990 just called.  They want their movie theater back.  

Yup...if you've been here, then you know that this movie theater can use a make over. I bet back in the day, this was one of the busiest, biggest, and happening movie theaters around.  With all the new theaters with reclining chairs, superior surround sound, and huge screens, it's easy for this theater to lack a little love.  Heck, when was the last time you've seen an AMC 10?  Aren't they usually AMC 20 or even 30's.  But you gotta love theaters like this.  First of all, there's always a deal here and the employees are always great.  And second, this place isn't busy.  Don't get me wrong. I love to be pampered with the huge screens, plush seating, and dynamic audio effects.  But if you're out to just watch a movie, it's the flick and your company that makes an okay experience a great one.  

YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (045/366)

"The young gentleman, Kiddo, entered the photography studio for his senior portrait session, adhering to a prearranged appointment. Following a brief interval of approximately fifteen minutes, during which time he changed into his formal attire, he emerged from one of the rear studios. Subsequently, a thorough examination and evaluation of the diverse photographs and poses ensued, resulting in an exceptional quality of images. The studio's proficiency and expertise were evident in their ability to capture the essence of the moment and portray it in a visually appealing manner. Additionally, they offered a unique opportunity to take supplementary photographs in casual attire, which proved to be an excellent complement to the traditional graduation gown shot. Ultimately, my satisfaction with the experience and the quality of the photographs led me to recommend this studio to my acquaintances and loved ones, with a return factor of eighty-five percent."

I enjoy Encore. It's almost prettier than the Wynn. It's got lots of red and butterflies. I feel rich just walking through it. And there are some great restaurants. It's never as crowded as the Wynn and other uppity properties. The cocktails at the various bars are wonderful. The pool is awesome. Parking is a breeze. But alas, it is still too rich for my wallet. Gaming here is not exactly an option unless you can drop like $100 a hand. But nonetheless, very pretty to walk through.

Omg, best dinner ever, try the meatballs for an appetizer !!!!! It's unassuming how good it was going to be but we will be BAck next time we are in Vegas. Good value as it was not I the casino. I enjoyed the sangria? Although don't sit overlooking the mall, it's very warm by there. Sit inside the resturaunt

I know people hate this place, and I have to start by saying I don't eat meat. So, I don't know about the kabob, and it does seem a little expensive to me, but I wouldn't really know. That being said, they have lots of other food that's not bad. I've had sandwiches and stuff here (veg of course) that were pretty good, and not as expensive as the kabob. They also have pizza joint food (albeit under another name the address/phone number is the same). The pizza is killer, and super fast delivery even in the snow.

"Sakana, an authentic Japanese culinary establishment, boasts formidable attributes that position it as a genuine contender on the eastside. Its extensive menu features delectable appetizers, such as tempura and nigiri, which are unparalleled in quality and generously portioned. Patrons can indulge in fresh, expertly prepared fish, an aspect that sets Sakana apart from its competitors. Although some items, including uni and fresh oysters, are now limited to a single serving per customer, the superior rice-to-fish ratio remains a hallmark of the dining experience. While the fried offerings and specialty rolls are undoubtedly satisfying, the Super White and Garlic Tuna steal the show. The lobster and popcorn lobster rolls elicit grins from even the most discerning diners, while the bulgogi, though not a favorite among some patrons, is still a commendable option. For those seeking a truly unique treat, the quail egg is an absolute must-try. Despite minor missteps in ordering, the staff maintains a courteous and accommodating demeanor. A potential return visit may ensue, contingent upon the availability of uni during future visits."

I am delighted to be cognizant of the fact that this establishment has been reopened under novel administration. Prior to its closure, I would have likely accorded this eatery two stars or fewer, due to my perception that the premises were consistently unclean and my concern that such lack of attention to tidiness in the work environment might raise questions regarding the quality of their culinary offerings. However, since this particular Burger King has resumed operations, it appears to have undergone a considerable transformation for the better. The personnel are meticulous in their approach, exhibiting a high level of friendliness and promptness. Additionally, the venue is now noticeably more sanitary. I sincerely hope that this upward trend will persist.

"Over the past two years, there has been a marked improvement in the quality of the food and services offered by this establishment, making it a challenging task to refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating upon it, despite its affiliation with a large corporation, given the exceptional value it offers for the price, which makes it an ideal destination for those seeking affordable and satisfying culinary options."

"Based solely on their delectable pastries, which showcase an unparalleled level of culinary mastery and expertise in the art of baking, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon this establishment a perfect rating of five stars. However, my evaluation process does not succumb to such superficiality and shallow assessments, but rather encompasses a holistic approach that takes into account various other aspects of the dining experience, including the quality of the food, the ambiance, and the service. Thus, I shall provide a comprehensive review that reflects my genuine sentiments and impressions of this restaurant, without being unduly influenced by my admittedly immense fondness for their sublime pastries.

The dining area exudes a warm and inviting ambiance, with the option to sit outside and savor the delicious fare amidst the picturesque surroundings. The service has consistently demonstrated exceptional quality, with the staff exhibiting a keen attention to detail, prompt responsiveness, and an unwavering commitment to ensuring the utmost satisfaction of their patrons.

My personal preferences, while not exhaustive, include a few select items that have earned a special place in my heart and taste buds. These include, but are not limited to, the flavorsome hummus, the delectable gyro, the crispy flatbread pizzas, and last, but certainly not least, the mouthwatering pastries that have captured my palate and left me in a state of unabashed delight. In conclusion, this restaurant has secured a place among my favorites, and I eagerly look forward to my next visit, when I can once again indulge in their culinary masterpieces."

I came to Sedona Lounge based on some local knowledge, and it turned out to be a great meal!  It's slightly off-Strip and located in Summerlin, but a quick drive on the 215 will get you there in no time.  It's slightly dim on the inside, but it feels much nicer and more upscale than the menu prices would indicate.  Supposedly Andre Agassi eats here from time to time.

Mrs. C continued her string of unbelievable ordering.  She got the cheapest dish, but it was also the best.  How does she do it??  The 3-course menu for about $30 consisted of:
- chicken consomme, brought out in a fancy teapot and then poured into a small bowl of mushrooms tableside
-seared scallops with a bacon and mushroom cream sauce
-creme brulee
There are other 3-course menu choices, but that's how she rolls in Vegas.

I got the NY Strip, and college classmate's mom, (who now lives in Vegas and whose suggestion it was to try Sedona Lounge) got the fillet mignon.  Here's the scoop, tho - on Sunday evenings, the steak menu is 50% off!  We got a great deal on a dinner that night!  I would have liked it if i could have ordered a baked potato with my steak instead of the small roasted ones, but that's a minor complaint when you consider the quality of the food being served.  A great deal, but made even better on Sundays!

"The culinary experience at this establishment was exceptional, with both the service and fare receiving high praise. Specifically, the chicken parm sliders were a notable highlight, inspiring a desire to establish a similar venture specializing in diminutive, savory burgers. An extensive array of artisanal brews complemented the delectable dishes, allowing patrons to sample an assortment of flavors through carefully curated tasting flights. While the sweet treats appeared visually stunning, unfortunately, we failed to reserve sufficient space in our stomachs to indulge in them. Nonetheless, the overall encounter was thoroughly enjoyable, and the prices were remarkably reasonable given the quality of the offerings."

I didn't stay here but I came here to walk around and shop! Planet Hollywood would be a really good place to stay at because its kinda in the middle of the strip plus SHOPPING!!! They have sooooooo many stores inside! I love all the lights outside of this place and inside its just so fun! I think I can spend hours inside shopping..=)

Overall I enjoyed my meal a lot.  The food, while very pricey, was delicious though had a few execution issues.  For example, my otherwise excellent beef tartare had two separate beds of mashed potatoes that really didn't make sense.  The striped bass that I had from the specials menu was delicious.  I loved the flavor of the butternut squash tortelli but I thought that the plating wasn't very attractive.  Portions were just the right size, but with most entrees hovering around $50, this is not a cheap night out.  Service was excellent.\n\nA note to fellow diners - please keep your voices at a reasonable level and control your children.  With tile floors and high ceilings, Olives can get pretty loud.

"Indubitably, the culinary experience offered by this establishment is of unparalleled excellence, with the GARLIC CHICKEN accompanied by an abundance of savory gravy being a personal favorite. The portions are copious, and the prices, reasonable. Although, it must be noted that the Adobo can, at times, exhibit a propensity towards excessive saltiness. Nonetheless, the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet transcends mere culinary indulgence, reaching an apogee of gastronomical delight. A word of caution, however, the establishment's seeming indecision regarding their expansion into California may prove to be a hindrance to their otherwise well-deserved success. An expedited resolution is recommended."
What's not to love! Old town Las Vegas. Tons of lights.\nZipline. Lights. Gambling. Lights. Great food. Lights.\nA must in anyone's lifetime. And can I say this again ... I won here too!

We had an exceptional experience, characterized by a lack of difficulties or inconveniences, and the personnel were incredibly cordial and accommodating. We endeavored to prolong our stay from four nights to seven, but unfortunately, the establishment was fully booked for the entire duration. However, we greatly appreciated the shuttle service, which provided us with convenient transportation for both grocery shopping and excursions to the renowned Las Vegas Strip. We are eagerly anticipating our return visit!!

We are situated approximately one-quarter of a mile away from this exceptional eatery. Formerly known as the Brown Bag Sandwich shop, I had the pleasure of dining there on several occasions throughout the year. However, since its transformation into the Arizona Sandwich Company, I have had the privilege of indulging in their delectable offerings on a weekly basis, and for valid reasons. All of the sandwiches I have had the pleasure of consuming have been utterly sublime. The bread, with its unparalleled softness akin to a goose down pillow, is truly a culinary masterpiece. Each dish is served with an ample portion, irrespective of the item selected. Their sides are scrumptious, and the assortment of desserts, while not typically within my gastronomical purview, appear utterly captivating. The staff, having familiarized themselves with our presence, graciously welcomes us by name upon arrival, fostering a sense of warmth and hospitality. The daily specials are an unmitigated delight, rendering the need to peruse the menu futile. Unwavering in their excellence, I have yet to encounter a single disappointment. Furthermore, keen patrons may capitalize on a frugal $2 sandwich by remaining vigilant and responsive to the establishment's Facebook updates. Offering a swift and seamless dining experience, the venue boasts an impressive proximity to the intersection of University and 52nd streets, directly east of the QuikTrip. Moreover, the efficiency of the restaurant enables a speedy in-and-out duration of fewer than fifteen minutes, catering conveniently to the hectic schedules of its clientele. You are cordially invited to partake in the indulgence.

The Times Square Neighborhood Restaurant is a neighborhood jewel. Breakfast is tasty at a totally reasonable price. Dinner of pizza and wings were some of the best we have ever had. A great local restaurant with excellence service, great beers on tap, and authentic Italian food at such a reasonable price. Don't pass this place....it truly is a must try!

"I am utterly dismayed in my own ability to have postponed visiting this culinary gem for such an extended period! I halted by on a Friday evening and was able to partake in a swift and expedient dining experience, completing my meal in a remarkably brief span of time! 

I opted for the customizable bowl option, selecting succulent steak, flavorful rice, and a vibrant broccoli accompaniment, all unified by a savory spicy teriyaki sauce. The sauce was presented separately, allowing me to tailor the intensity of spiciness to my individualized preference. The resultant fusion of tastes was a resounding success, as the sauce complemented the straightforward yet delectable ingredients flawlessly. 

This eatery boasts an extensive array of sushi, bowls, and salads, with prices that are eminently reasonable considering the generous portions dispensed. 

The interior design of the restaurant exuded modernity and spotlessness, while the staff exhibited brisk efficiency and warm friendliness. 

The sole drawback preventing this establishment from attaining a perfect five-star rating was the fact that the steak, although cooked to my liking, was slightly cooler in temperature compared to the remainder of the dish, and its lack of complete slicing made it difficult to thoroughly combine with the other components when I vigorously shook the bowl."

We had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable luncheon at this esteemed eatery in the company of some acquaintances during our sojourn in this charming town. The delay in being seated was approximately twenty minutes; however, the ambiance of the outdoor seating area, replete with a live musical performance and a picturesque view of Scottsdale and Camelback, more than compensated for the brief wait. I opted for the Market Sunflower salad, which boasted an array of flavorsome ingredients including blackened chicken, goat cheese, bacon, dried strawberries, blueberries, sunflower seeds, and my spouse chose the Smoked Turkey Ciabatta, featuring gouda cheese, bacon, sweet tomato, and roasted red pepper aioli. My culinary experience was thoroughly enjoyable, as I relished every bite of my salad; however, my husband's satisfaction with his sandwich was somewhat diminished, despite the fact that the sweet potato chips served alongside it were undeniably scrumptious. I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying repast.

Who would have conjectured that Las Vegas would eventually gain recognition for their sandwiches? Well, I am now convinced that they have accomplished such a feat, subsequent to savoring "Earl of Sandwich" within the Planet Hollywood hotel and casino. I placed an order for "The Full Montagu," which turned out to be a sizzling hot roast beef sandwich, complemented by turkey, Swiss, and cheddar cheese, lettuce, and, of course, the renowned "Earl's mustard sauce." I decided to omit the tomatoes, as I have come to realize that, at times, tomatoes possess an excessive amount of juiciness, which has the potential to overwhelm my sandwich, causing it to become somewhat disrupted;). Anyway, I also had the opportunity to sample the "Earl's grey lemonade," which I found to be relatively satisfactory, not excessively sweetened. The majority of individuals might argue that the most appealing aspect of a sandwich lies within the meat or the sauce, however, I firmly believe that it was the "Earl's artisan bread" that truly won me over. It managed to maintain a perfect balance between being robust enough to securely hold the meat and toppings, while simultaneously retaining a soft texture that prevented it from becoming soggy. Therefore, if you ever find yourself in Vegas and desire an alternative to the customary buffet, I highly recommend indulging in a sandwich at "Earl of Sandwich!"

What is there a better way to gain couple more pounds after dinner at Windsor, go next door to Churn!  I was so full after dinner, but couldn't resist the unique ice cream flavors, retro candies, vintage/silly toys, and bakery goodies all displayed around Churn.  My Niece had the Peach and Honey ice cream.  She didn't like it at all.  The pure honey overpowered the peach taste, which sounded good but was too sweet.   I had the traditional butter pecan ice cream sandwich.  You get to select from the baked cookies on the counter and the ice cream flavor.  Unfortunately, the ice cream wasn't frozen so it melted too quickly on a hot summer day.   I will probably wait until it's a little cooler to try other flavors on a pretzel cone.

Good but not overly cheap and the service was HORRIBLE.  Servers were polite but couldn't answer questions about the menu or what the dishes we were served were.

We tried several rolls and I have to say my favorite was the simple avocado roll.  Huge chunks of fresh avocado.  The mixed tempura I wouldn't order again... I was surprised by the Monkey Brains appetizer.  It wasn't what I expected.  It was basically a stuffed mushroom (stuffed with spicy tuna) breaded in tempura batter and deep fried.

I think my favorite thing of all was the Lychee Martini.  So strong and a wonderful flavor.  

I think we will try this place again for the 1/2 price Teppanyaki at Happy Hour.

"An exceptional venue for a leisurely Saturday repast, we were promptly accommodated, occupying a table adjacent to a picturesque window offering an incomplete perspective of the aquatic recreational area and arboreal tropicana, which proved to be a pleasant visual supplement to our culinary experience. Each member of our group relished their individual dish; my sibling and I opted to share the deconstructed Filet Benedict, which was thoughtfully divided by our server, while I also savored every sip of their signature Bloody Mary. One of our companions chose the Exotic Coconut Pancakes, featuring a diminutive coconut and mango butter, striking the perfect balance between sweetness and flavor, resulting in an unforgettable gustatory indulgence. An ideal setting for a relaxed yet refined breakfast."

I have been looking for a great breakfast spot in my area and I have found it!  Parson's is a great little family owned place where the owner still works with the staff on a daily basis.  The location itself is worn out, but the food definately delivers!  Let me just say this now....  Best Pancakes in town!  No question.  The staff is super nice and the food flys out of the kitchen.  It's a great Breakfast spot, not to be overlooked!  And don't pay attention to Jennifer D's review.....she is from Snottsdale where they really have no idea of what a good traditional breakfast should be.

The culinary experience was utterly superb, with the pho and fried rice being particularly delectable. Despite our enthusiasm for the meal, we encountered a minor hiccup in the form of unfulfilled expectations regarding the spring rolls, which regrettably did not materialize even after a polite reminder. Nonetheless, the satisfaction derived from the primary dishes was sufficient to preclude any lingering feelings of hunger, thereby rendering the oversight relatively inconsequential. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit to this gastronomic haven.

"The culinary offerings were of exceptional quality, and the ambiance was thoroughly enjoyable. However, the beverages were somewhat expensive, despite the fact that it was happy hour. Additionally, the service was a tad sluggish."

"Optimizing alcoholic beverage acquisition within a constrained budgetary framework necessitates identifying the most economical venue for purchasing spirituous liquids. In this regard, California residents would be well-advised to consider patronizing establishments such as BevMo!, where a 750 milliliter bottle of Hennessy cognac can be obtained for a mere $24, thereby providing an unparalleled combination of quality and affordability that cannot be contravened."

"I am thoroughly delighted to witness the grand opening of Downtown Summerlin, boasting an impressive array of retail establishments, eateries, and services. Its striking resemblance to Town Square and prime location alongside the 215 freeway only add to its appeal. As a resident in close proximity, I have had the pleasure of observing its meticulous development, and I eagerly anticipate the arrival of additional reputable businesses, such as Earl of Sandwich and GAP, which would otherwise require an arduous trek to Fashion Show Mall. Furthermore, the luxury Regal cinema offers a welcoming ambiance tailored specifically for adults."

Happy Hour is the best. The chips, salsa and bean dip are phenomenal.\n\nI come here often for happy hour and always have their Mexican Pizza. Pretty tasty. Their Margaritas are also delish. Letty is usually bartending, she's great. Very friendly and attentive.

We got a great deal to stay in the MGM from Hotwire. It was 50 dollars a night with an amazing view of the strip. I could not believe how cheap the hotel was. The interior of the hotel was really beautiful. It was nice and clean it had a huge wall size window. The view of the strip was best seen at night. 

I did get annoyed of the green light. But it wasn't a big deal. i think I got use to it after the second night we stayed... They offered us 20 bucks off on the MGM buffet which was totally worth it because the food was pretty good. It was not the best buffet in Vegas but it was very good. The mimosas in the morning was a perfect hangover remedy. haha

I would definitely book MGM through Hotwire again. This place was exactly what I expected from a Vegas Hotel. Clean and Affordable and Great Location!

C'est le " first kiss" bar par excellence! Mesdames si on vous y invite il est fort possible qu'il  "mouve". Éclairage aux lampions, musique rétro propice à la détente, plein de recoins intimes et des drinks servi dans un bol (un peu comme un punch)... Une fois envoûté par la musique et enivré par l'alcool un peu trop sucré vous tomberez peut-être sous le charme comme sous la mitraille... 

Pourquoi 4/5: Les proprios de Big in Japan réussissent avec se bar ,ce qu'il ne sont pas arrivé à réaliser avec leur resto. Un endroit unique et original à Montréal. Ils ont transformés un bar crade en un endroit presque parfait. Se fut un coup de foudre instantané. 
Si ça vous intéresse et avez les $$$$$, vous pouvez acheter votre bouteilles de whisky. Elle sera suspendu bien en vue maintenu par un aimant au dessus du bar.... dépêchez-vous le nombre d'espaces disponibles sont limités! 
Mesdames si je vous y invite un soir de scotch et de brouillard vais-je y faire un " mouve" sentimental... et bien non pour le "first kiss" je préfère les parcs et les ruelles... mais ça c'est une autre histoire....

We stopped in at the Keg for dinner and had a splendid time.

Service was prompt and efficient.

The food was splendidly done.   

We had the goat cheese appetizer and were very pleased with the baked cheese flavors.

 The salad's greens were crisp and not overly covered in dressing.

The vegetables were crisp and not overcooked.   

I ordered a rare filet.  It was a wonderfully done rare when it arrived.  The only thing that could have made it better was more blood.  

My spouse ordered the filet and crab. Each was done perfectly.

The big surprise was the coffee was as good the creme brulee (not so last time).

I highly recommend the Keg as an alternative to more pricey alternatives (Ruth's Chris and Morton's).
A first rate golf complex on the beautiful campus of ASU. The clubhouse is well stocked with ASU gear & serves tasty, reasonably priced lunches.

Located within the expansive retail confines of Ocean Terminal, this particular branch of Clinton Cards boasts an impressive array of products, ranging from an assortment of greeting cards, wrapping paper, stationery, and an eclectic mix of gifts that cater to diverse tastes and preferences. Upon entering the store, I found myself becoming increasingly captivated by the diverse offerings, leading me to spend an extended period browsing through the various items on display.  

During my leisurely exploration of the store, I was particularly drawn to a selection of adorable compact mirrors, pencils, pens, and key rings, each featuring endearing animal designs. These diminutive items were part of a promotion, priced at an affordable 99p, which prompted me to purchase several of them.  

While perusing the wedding-themed section of the store, I chanced upon what can only be described as the most unconventional gift item I have ever laid eyes on. Presented in a box emblazoned with the phrase, "Congratulations on your Wedding Day," the contents revealed a somewhat bizarre figurine of a black cat sporting a diamante collar and earrings. I must admit that I found myself in a state of utter incredulity at the sight of this peculiar item, left speechless by its sheer audacity. My curiosity piqued, I couldn't help but wonder what sort of couple would appreciate such an unusual gift on their special day. Needless to say, I wouldn't recommend presenting it to any newlywed pair expecting a traditional or even remotely conventional gift.  

Despite my reservations regarding their questionable taste in wedding presents, I must commend the Clinton Cards branch for its overall inventory, meticulous organization, and the warm demeanor of its staff members.

During the diurnal hours, a most agreeable and tranquil ambiance permeates the establishment, complemented by an excellent beverage commonly referred to as coffee. In the evening, this atmosphere of relaxation is further enhanced by the presence of live musical performances or open-mic nights featuring local talent. Unfortunately, the location of this establishment within a commercial strip mall serves as a notable drawback.

"Groupon served as the impetus for my inaugural visit, and my inherent trepidation was palpable upon entrance. However, my prolonged curiosity regarding this establishment was satiated by the acquisition of a discounted Groupon, which afforded me the opportunity to indulge in their culinary offerings at a reduced cost. My expectations were surpassed, as the flavors present in their dishes were remarkably rich and diverse. Specifically, the eggplant dish I ordered was tantamount to a gastronomic masterpiece, boasting an unparalleled depth of flavor that was reminiscent of a beloved family recipe. Furthermore, the spaghetti sauce was akin to a velvety blanket of savory goodness, enveloping my taste buds in a comforting embrace. The complementary cheese bread served as an excellent accompaniment to the meal, its texture and flavor harmonizing seamlessly with the other components of the dish. The ambiance of the restaurant itself contributed significantly to the overall experience, exuding a warm and inviting aura through its eclectic decor and the friendly demeanor of the staff. Such factors combined to create an atmosphere that was at once cozy and refined, effectively cultivating a sense of familiarity and welcome in those who entered. My satisfaction with the meal was such that I would eagerly anticipate future visits, for the authenticity of the cuisine was undeniable, mirroring as it did the cultural heritage of the proprietors themselves."

I have been frequenting this establishment approximately once a week for a duration of approximately two years. The culinary offerings have been consistently exceptional, boasting generous portions and utilizing high-quality ingredients. Upon relocating from Henderson to Summerlin, I harbored concerns regarding the possibility of discovering a Chinese takeout restaurant comparable in quality to China A Go Go; however, this particular eatery has proven to be a suitable alternative. My personal preferences include Singapore Noodles, War Wonton Soup, and Chicken accompanied by broccoli. While I would greatly appreciate the implementation of American Express as a viable form of payment (as they currently only accept Visa and Mastercard), I comprehend the reasoning behind their decision not to do so.

"While in Las Vegas, I found myself in dire need of both a pedicure and manicure, and thus, I ventured into this establishment sans appointment and waited merely ten minutes on a Thursday during the lunch hour. I opted for Jimmy's expertise in performing the pedicure, selecting the stone variety priced at forty-five dollars, yet, upon adding gel, the cost increased by twenty-five dollars. Additionally, I requested the ombre nail appearance, thereby incurring an additional five-dollar charge. Although the total cost may seem exorbitant, it's essential to note that such services are significantly more expensive in my native Hawaii. Tuyet competently executed the manicure, utilizing gel polish and incorporating an accent nail, resulting in a forty-dollar fee. Despite the steep price point, I deemed it a worthy investment for the desired aesthetic. In the event of a future visit to this location, I would undoubtedly return to this salon."

Pros: 24/7, service great, We were hungry so just about anything would have been good. I had the asian lettuce cups. Made to perfection. Hubby hada mushroom swiss angus burger with fries. He ate the whole thing! \n\nCons: A bit pricey.

The sushi quality is great. The service is top notch. The atmosphere and decor are great -- the kind of place you can easily bring a date and have a romantic night. Things here are on the pricier side though. Ultimately, it's another sushi place. Your sushi ain't made of gold leaf. I'd give 5 stars if the food was a bit cheaper.

"This eatery, specializing in Sino-culinary delights, boasts an unpretentious ambiance, yet offers a satisfying gastronomical experience, primarily due to the reasonable tariffs and delectable fare. Its proximity to my workplace renders it a frequent destination for a midday repast. Efficiency in service is paramount, as the staff strive to accommodate incoming patrons by expediting the departure of existing customers, thereby creating an environment not conducive to lingering; however, the palatable victuals and economical pricing facilitate a hasty exit."

"Great Harvest's inconspicuous nature raises curiosity, given its affiliation with a franchise. Upon entering the establishment, visitors are greeted by a welcoming counter staff, who proffer delectable baked goods samples. Patrons can indulge in an array of distinctive bread varieties, such as those infused with Guinness beer or jalapenos, and pair them with an adequate amount of velvety butter or preserves. The eatery offers an assortment of mouthwatering breads, rolls, cookies, and pastries, as well as expertly crafted sandwiches for lunch. While the chicken salad may be somewhat questionable, the club sandwich boasts an impressive flavor profile. It is worth noting that the red onion presence can be somewhat overpowering in certain dishes; therefore, it may be wise to have a post-meal breath freshener at hand. For a convenient meal option, consider the box lunch, which includes a substantial drink, chips, and a carefully selected treat from the pastry case. The Savannah Bar is particularly scrumptious, featuring a rich, buttery crumble complemented by an abundance of succulent fruit, such as blueberries, apples, cranberries, or peaches. A unique aspect of this dining experience is that the sweet treat is served promptly after ordering, allowing patrons to typically enjoy their dessert before the main course arrives. Although a sense of disarray may permeate the atmosphere at times, the relatively relaxed pace of the restaurant means that securing a table and swift lunch is feasible, even during peak hours."

we've been here one other time about 3 plus years ago and decided to come again for lunch.  we were the first and only ones in at 11 am.  i really wish more restaurants would open earlier than 11 am because i like to eat early lunches.  chips and salsa were good.  its a roasted darker salsa which i enjoy.  i like this place because i like americanized mexican food in big portions and not pretentious or fancy and ridiculously expensive.  my enchiladas were filling and tasty, and my wifes tacos were good.  so to me it really hits the spot.  its reasonably priced, good service, and its in new york which is always enjoyable to go visit.

This establishment boasts exceptional quality, and my frequent visits (eight, to be precise) within a mere three-month period serve as a testament to its excellence. Notwithstanding, a solitary instance of the unavailability of non-white rice varieties constitutes the sole unfavorable occurrence throughout my numerous visits. 
  As it pertains to the culinary offerings, it would be inaccurate to describe them as extraordinary. However, it would be equally erroneous to categorize them as inferior. Each dish I have sampled, including curries, pad thai, phrik khing, hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork, and others, has been, at the very least, palatable. The curry's spicing exhibits impeccable precision, while the phrik khing's vegetables exude freshness and crispness. The sole dish that failed to impress me was the sweet and sour pork, yet this disappointment stems from my preconceived notion that Chinese cuisine served at Thai, Korean, Japanese, or Vietnamese restaurants tends to fall short of expectations. In contrast, the hot and sour soup elicits sheer ecstasy, ranking among the most flavorful creations I have ever had the pleasure of consuming. 
  Based on these factors, I assign the food a rating of 7/10. Nevertheless, considering the reasonable prices, I might reevaluate this score upward to approximately 8.5/10. 
  It is worth mentioning that the service has consistently met high standards during each of my visits, with the same courteous and friendly waitress diligently attending to my party's needs. 
  To summarize, this establishment offers satisfactory nourishment at a reasonable cost, complemented by a charming server.

We didn't have a reservation and they were more than happy to take us in. Hosts were nice and refilled my water without having me to ask even once.

I did not notice any girl hostesses or servers that night? Maybe they were off or something.

Food: Servers were very friendly in recommending something to eat from the menu. We had portabella mushroom as an appetizer and I had fish to eat for dinner. it was really good.

Prices were on the upside. This place is great for date night and small social gatherings. I would come back here.

Made it back in time for a sushi indulgence over the weekend, and it proved to be a satisfactory culinary experience! The only component that did not meet my expectations was the so-called "crab mix," which was incorporated into numerous rolls and failed to resonate with my palate. However, I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy tuna and the spicy crunch rolls, which more than compensated for the disappointment caused by the aforementioned "crab mix." Notwithstanding the absence of happy hour pricing, we still managed to derive considerable pleasure from our dining excursion, departing the establishment in a state of satiety and contentment.

"Gourmet burgers and gastronomical dogs, accompanied by expertly grilled thin crust pizzas, an assortment of delectable sandwiches, and a plethora of additional culinary delights. The unparalleled creativity and innovation that Joe's Farm Grill brings to traditional dishes is truly remarkable, particularly when utilizing their own organic and locally sourced produce. Furthermore, the relaxed and welcoming ambiance only adds to the overall dining experience. For a comprehensive critique and visual representation, please refer to the following link: http://blog.phosyzzle.com/2011/03/02/joes-farm-grill/"

"Halted by this eatery for a nocturnal repast, I was taken aback by the gargantuan proportions of the dishes, with a single serving capable of satiating my hunger for two consecutive days. Opting for the skewer, I must admit that the beef exhibited a hint of desiccation, although it remained palatable. Furthermore, the Mai Thai I requested was presented in an oversized glass, yet its flavor was undeniably delectable. Additionally, the establishment boasts a breakfast menu available throughout the day, constituting a notable advantage."

"Satisfactory poultry-based shawarma, acquired the midday repast iteration which was, in my opinion, sensibly priced at an approximate cost of seven dollars and fifty cents. Notwithstanding the server's inadvertent substitution of carbohydrate-rich grains in lieu of the vegetable alternative, the culinary experience remained a worthwhile investment. Favorable appraisal regarding the pecuniary aspect; anticipating future luncheon visits."

Initially, it is imperative to note that there exist two distinct locations of the esteemed Lino's Pizzeria, and our family has had the pleasure of frequenting the establishment situated on Tenaya Drive for nearly a decade. Throughout this duration, we have developed a profound appreciation for their culinary offerings, particularly their delectable pizzas, which cater to our discerning tastes. My spouse, a native of New York, possesses a profound affinity for well-crafted dough, a quality that Lino's consistently delivers. Moreover, their Giardiniera sauce, an Italian condiment characterized by its piquant flavor profile, has become a personal favorite of mine. Our household places orders from Lino's with a frequency of several times per month, as their culinary excellence remains unparalleled in our opinions.

"The perpetual improvement of Grand Avenue continues to elevate its stature, precipitating a probable influx of populace akin to Roosevelt's scenario, thereby driving artisans and avant-garde establishments towards the western vicinity. Notwithstanding, ephemeral gastronomic gems like The GAP persist (albeit appellation legitimacy remains dubious), offering distinctive culinary experiences. While pizzerias tend towards homogeneity, these enterprising restaurateurs exercise creativity, boasting an exceptional Brussels sprouts dish; albeit, my eccentric chicken entrÃ©e (concocted by an allegedly inebriated chef) transcended expectations during a state of inebriation characterized by an unquenchable craving for sustenance (colloquially denoted as 'drunchies'). Anticipation for forthcoming musical events and performances at this venue runs high, fostering an atmosphere conducive to artistic expression and communal revelry. 

Desirable additions to the establishment might include:

Draft beers and growlers, emulating the successful program instituted by Federal Pizza, which would complement their existing offerings and enhance overall customer satisfaction."
Yummy Boba tea, great slush drinks, and cute servers. What's not to love? \n\nWell, it can get a little expensive for a college student, but prices are comparable to Starbucks ;) Go get some Boba!

Thus far, I've only been once - but I have to admit that the staff here is way friendlier than any other UPS Store or Fedex/Kinko's that I have ever been to.  I have no idea what causes it, but whatever the reason, they sure do seem to enjoy their job, and that means I'll be back to do my shipping from this location rather than any other.\n\nEven better is that it's the closest to our house.  Sweet.

To take a step away from the more authentic Mexican places we've been eating lately, we decided to try out Salsa's, which is more towards the Americanized style of Mexican food.  That doesn't make it bad - just different, so if you're wanting authentic, you may want to go elsewhere.

Inside of this Salsa's, the decor is very nice.  The only complaint is the lighting.  Along the right side of the restaurant, the ceiling fans and the low lights combine to create a very annoying strobe affect.  It was so bad we had to move.  Once we did, it wasn't a problem at all.

Service was excellent, speedy and efficient all around.  Glasses were kept filled, and food came out quickly.  One thing I'll typically do at a new restaurant (new for me, not necessarily brand new) is ask for advice, and the waiter offered it.  A nice touch.  I hate it when they can't do so.

The food was tasty - ingredients were fresh, sauces were not overwhelming.  I had a (steak) chimichanga, and it was one of the better ones that I can recall tasting.  For this sort of Mexican, I'd highly suggest you try them out.

"It was during the culmination of an arduous week of academic endeavors that I had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable dining experience at Biblos with a sizable contingent of my fellow classmates (numbering approximately thirty individuals). Delighted to recount that Biblos proved to be an excellent choice to bring such a remarkable week to a satisfying close.

Boasting a capacious interior, Biblos offers ample space for patrons, with one and a half levels of dining area; we opted for the upper half floor as the lower level was already brimming with customers. The eatery's subtle lighting and melodic background music contribute to an atmosphere reminiscent of fine dining, while the prices, though somewhat elevated, are not exorbitant. It is worth mentioning that, according to rumors, Biblos extends a considerate discount to students who present their identification cards.

Presented with an extensive array of culinary options, we found ourselves thoroughly captivated by the menu, leading to repeated visits from the accommodating staff as we deliberated over our selections with great care. The employees demonstrated exceptional hospitality, graciously reducing the volume of the music temporarily upon request, allowing our instructors to convey some concluding remarks.

Upon ordering, we discovered that the portions were generous and the cuisine itself was utterly delectable! In conclusion, I would wholeheartedly recommend Biblos as a prime venue for gatherings of a group nature."

We have had the occasion to visit this establishment on two separate occasions in recent months, each time with a different child and a distinct set of symptoms. Upon entering the facility, we were greeted by a welcoming staff who efficiently addressed our concerns. During our initial visit, we were faced with an unexpected situation when it became apparent that all of the examination rooms were currently occupied. However, the doctor promptly attended to our needs once they were made aware of the situation. The diagnosis provided was remarkably accurate, taking into account the unique characteristics of each patient. Additionally, we have availed ourselves of the radiological services offered here, specifically to determine whether a small bone in the hand had sustained a fracture. While the waiting area may lack a certain aesthetic appeal and the clientele may be diverse, we believe that the quality of care provided at this institution warrants enduring a brief 25-minute journey, even if it means bypassing other urgent care facilities along the way.

"Upon conducting an examination of the Kohl's retail establishment situated in the southern region of Phoenix, Arizona, also encompassing Ahwatukee, it became apparent that the absence of any substantial divergence between each storefront under the Kohl's brand umbrella rendered my assessment relatively uniform. However, it is worth mentioning that Kohl's tends to offer quite enticing sales promotions, which, when combined with the discounts extended to their credit cardholders through both traditional mail and electronic correspondence, can culminate in remarkable bargains for shoppers. My astonishment persists regarding the considerable quantity of merchandise that can be acquired for a relatively minimal expenditure, which I attribute primarily to the judicious utilization of clearance racks and strategically positioned sale indicators throughout the store's premises.
