Furthermore, I must commend the store's maintenance of a clean and well-organized environment, as well as the efficiency of the checkout process, both of which significantly contributed to a satisfying shopping excursion. As an individual who places a high value on frugality in my consumer habits, I generally find the Kohl's shopping experience to be quite agreeable, and I hope that your own encounters will yield similar sentiments."

"I had the pleasure of indulging in the Ahi salad, which was tantamount to a gastronomical experience, with the avocado being slightly overpowering, yet still complementing the dish's overall flavor profile. However, the burger truly stole the show, boasting a symphony of textures and flavors, from the tender, juicy patty to the perfectly toasted bun. The Snickers sundae was the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, featuring a delightful contrast of crunchy and chewy caramel, rich peanut butter sauce, velvety chocolate sauce, and a generous dollop of whipped cream. The sheer magnitude of this dessert made it nearly impossible for two individuals to consume in its entirety. I am eagerly anticipating my next visit, when I can sample more of their delectable offerings. The menu presents an array of culinary delights that are sure to satiate even the most discerning palates, making it challenging to select just one item. Although there may be a brief wait, it is inconsequential given the exceptional quality of the food and service."

Don't go on 1st Friday unless you want it to be super crowded!  Hipster vibe with good food and drinks on tap.  Slightly uptight staff.  No hard booze though.  Seating encourages canoodling couples or mixing with strangers.  Try the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  I know, it's expensive, but so yummy!  They have a pasta special, but I can' remember if it is on Wed or Thurs.  Come early, as they sell out.

My predilection for acquiring boba beverages is unequivocally satiated by this particular establishment, as it constitutes my go-to venue for procuring such consumables. Amongst their diverse offerings, my preferences gravitate towards the Honey Green Milk Tea and Thai Tea variants, which I unwaveringly esteem as my top picks. It is imperative to request a punch card, as it facilitates the accumulation of loyalty rewards, thereby enabling patrons to enjoy discounted or complimentary beverages subsequent to a specified number of purchases.

"We had an exceptional dining experience at this establishment, accompanied by our parental units. Although the ambiance was vibrant and bustling, it did not detract from the overall enjoyment of our meal. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and contributed significantly to the positive nature of our visit. The culinary offerings were indeed impressive, particularly the slow-cooked pork sandwich, which lived up to its reputation and satisfied our gastronomical expectations. The shrimp appetizer was an unexpected delight, boasting a rich, velvety texture and a symphony of flavors that harmoniously complemented the main course. Unfortunately, the dessert menu did not quite meet our expectations, lacking that certain je ne sais quoi that would have elevated it to the same level of excellence as the previous dishes. Nonetheless, we unanimously agreed that the combination of delectable cuisine, exceptional service, and convivial atmosphere merited a return visit."

"My affection for Ginza and the concept of a sushi bar within a pseudo dining car is unwavering, as it exemplifies Japan's propensity for adopting and refining Western practices, much like the quintessential American chrome dining car that failed as a retro 50s diner. Sushi, by nature, is a communal and social experience, but the boisterous Japanese pop music at Ginza somewhat mitigates this aspect. Personally, I prefer the accompaniment of more subdued music or, at the very least, a volume that allows for effortless conversation. Perhaps I am an anomaly in this regard, but I unequivocally endorse the culinary offerings and commend the friendly and attentive service. If you seek a unique venue to commemorate a birthday, look no further than Ginza, as it truly is remarkable."

I've only used Sunset Park for the dog park.

Sunset park has two dogs parks located on the south side of the park (warm springs side). One park is for the bigger dogs while the other is for smaller dogs.

Both enclosed dog areas are very big and have plenty of room for dogs to run around. Their are hoses at the park so that people are able to wash their dogs or fill up water bowls. The parks as well offer poopie bags incase you forget you own.

They is a shaded area with tables for owners to sit and relax while dogs have fun playing.

My only issue with this place is those that frequent it often and feel entitled as royalty. I bring my dog here when I'm in the area and she isn't very social. She likes me to walk with her and if I sit down, she lays next to me. Dogs at times don't understand personal space and wouldn't let her be. The owners don't help if others dogs were pestering her or playing too rough. I believe one of the regulars said something to the point as, "if you don't want rough dog play, don't bring your dog here."

Outside that, it's great. It's just those days when you have the "Michael Vick Battle Dog Owners"

After numerous unsatisfactory sojourns at the Center City Hilton, I opted to explore alternative accommodations and discovered the Omni, which has become my preferred choice for lodging in the area. For those seeking more economical options, the Aloft, situated directly across the street, offers suitable amenities at a lower price point. Conversely, travelers seeking a more luxurious experience without the extravagant cost of the Ritz may find that the Omni strikes an ideal balance. Throughout my eight stays at the property, I have consistently received exceptional service from the front desk staff, enjoyed spotlessly clean rooms, and appreciated the convenience of satisfactory room service. Although my personal preference lies with the larger executive corner suites offering a picturesque view of the city's central hub, I cannot comment on the quality of the standard junior suites. Notably, the hotel's prime location allows for effortless walking distance to various dining establishments such as Chima, Ruths Chris, Pita Pit, and numerous other eateries, bars, entertainment venues, and recreational facilities situated near the epicenter. In fact, I have enthusiastically recommended this lodging to my kin visiting for my impending nuptials. My experiences at the Omni have been nothing short of delightful, making it my go-to destination for future stays in the area.

My family and I have consistently derived immense pleasure from partaking of culinary delights at this esteemed establishment, whereupon the comestibles are invariably fresh and the personnel endearingly cordial. Nonetheless, it has come to our attention that a recurring anomaly pertaining to the accuracy of our orders transpires when opting for the convenience of takeout, which unfortunately diminishes our overall satisfaction.

Fourth star just for ambiance and nice staff. Pretty bar located in the new \"it\" hotel in Vegas. I had one of the special cocktails (Hot Mule) and I must admit, it was quite tasty. Not even a hit of a buzz, so I'm not sure what the alcohol content was, but it tasted good and sipping it gave me a chance to relax for a few minutes. I happened to be there on a weekday, so there were MAYBE 4 other people in the bar. I imagine this place probably gets pretty packed on the weekends with insufferable hipsters and cougars, but mid-week, mid-day, it was a nice piece of quiet and pretty. Staff were super nice.

"The quality of their sushi rolls is truly exceptional, and their daily happy hour special, which commences at 5 pm and concludes at closing time, offers a remarkable 50% discount on all sushi rolls and a generous 30% reduction on nigiri. Moreover, the service we have received on each visit has been exemplary, with our server demonstrating a proficient, expedited, and cordial demeanor. The speed at which our food is delivered to our table is also noteworthy, and the interior ambiance of the establishment exudes a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere. As such, it is not surprising that this restaurant has become a regular destination for me, with visits occurring as frequently as once a week."

I'm not complaining about the price because I knew in advance that it was $40 per person (price as of this past Saturday night).

So much food to choose from!!! 

The meat is delicious: prime rib, beef wellington, LAMB CHOPS, pork belly, and on...

Crab legs, prawns, sushi, caviar, cerviche, I couldn't get through all the seafood options.

Salads, asparagus, cheeses, cured meats, soups, olive breads, there was no way I could get to it all.

So many desserts: amazing cheesecake, macrons, lemon meringue, chocolate desserts, ice creams, bread pudding, fruit, etc.

So much food and all of it good. Some of the servers were great and friendly (especially the guy chopping up the medium rare beef and pork belly) though one woman seating us rolled her eyes when my friend asked if we could wipe down the table because it had food on it. Another guy, serving the beef wellington, was really grouchy and was yelling at one of his co workers rather than letting anyone have any of his dish. I had to yell "excuse me" about 5 times to get his attention. The guy dishing out the caviar was also rude because I didn't know the names of the different kinds. "Can I please try the black caviar?" I asked. His terse answer: "UH, It's called American caviar!" I've never had caviar before and had no idea, ha ha!

Overall, a good time and good food. I was stuffed and can't eat like this all the time, so it was a treat!

"Indulged in the gargantuan meat pizza, its delectability palpable, veritably satiating our culinary craving. Frequented this establishment previously, accompaniment by my progeny, capitalizing on the recreational amenities available, an idyllic venue for familial bonding."

My husband and I love to entertain and also enjoy a bottle of wine or a couple beers together.  Total Wine offers domestic and International liquor.  Everything from beer, wine, vodka, soju, sangria, etc.  Prices range from fair/modest to expensive (depending what you are buying).

They also have a walk-in Humidor area with a nice selection of cigars (yep, I smoke a nice cigar with my hubby on occasion!)

On certain days they have a counter set up where you can sample wine, one day we were lucky enough to sample some wonderful tequila.  The representatives were knowledgeable and helpful.  No high pressure sales; "if you like, you buy"  if not, it is ok too!

There is an amazing variety, fair prices (you can get 10% discount for buying a case of wine), the staff is friendly and super helpful!

It is a great one-stop shop!  It is clean, uber-organized and if you don't find what you are looking for---the very knowledgeable staff is quick and very informative.

Total Wine is our TOP SPOT for stocking up on all our alcohol!  A MUST for entertaining and party planning!

Super pleased!

Great location in Old Town Scottsdale. Room was only $89 on Memorial Day weekend for a suite. They don't have room service, but they have a food menu: you call in your order. When it's ready, the call your room, and you go down and pick it up. The food was good!

"Capacious servings at remarkably affordable tariffs. Establishment maintains fastidious cleanliness and crispness. Personnel exhibit automaton-like demeanor, yet proficiently expeditious in their duties. Management accepts various forms of payment. However, be advised that premises shut promptly at 21:00 hours."

I love this place because it combines so many things I dig: sandwiches, Italianism, a great wine selection, and an overall nice casual atmosphere. If I had a market, I'm pretty sure it would be like this one if I could help it.\n\nThe one critical thing I would add is that next time I'm craving DeFalco's on a Saturday at around noon, I think I'll call in the order. It's a rather popular place for lunch.

I embarked upon an expedition to discover the premier fish fry venue in Madison and serendipitously encountered this establishment. Prior to my visit, it was advisable to be cognizant of the fact that reservations are not accepted and the premises tend to become overcrowded on Fridays, thereby necessitating a considerable waiting period. This cozy, local tavern boasts a substantial patronage and offers a diverse array of fish options for their Friday fish fry, encompassing both baked and fried variants of cod, perch, and walleye. I opted for the latter, which was utterly delectable. Furthermore, I found their garlic chili fries and homemade chili to be irresistible, resulting in an unfortunate yet humorous consequence involving a hypothetical wheelchair. Unquestionably, this eatery ranks among the superior fish fry destinations within the city limits, and I am eager to return. Notwithstanding, my sole grievance pertains to the absence of reservation facilities and the temporary suspension of carry-out services during Lent, owing to an influx of excessive patronage. Nonetheless, it is heartening to witness a business that flourishes to such an extent that it must decline some customers.

"I had an irrepressible desire to investigate and experience firsthand the essence of Arizona's vibrant social scene. Specifically, I yearned to witness a live performance, one that would showcase exceptional musical prowess and provide an atmosphere conducive to unencumbered merriment. My expectations were not only met but exceeded by a considerable margin, as the sonic offerings of the disc jockey in question were truly awe-inspiring, eliciting a sincere expression of gratitude and admiration. The ambiance of the venue itself was reminiscent of establishments found in my native locales, boasting an intimate dance floor, strategically positioned tables, and a canvas that served as a visual focal point. Furthermore, I was treated to a captivating performance by the talented ensemble known as Simple Citizens, hailing from Los Angeles and featuring a diverse instrumentation, including a trumpet player, which added a unique and engaging dimension to their sound. Of notable mention was the special pricing offered by the bar, with a nominal cover charge of $10 and drinks available at a mere quarter of the standard price prior to 11 pm, escalating to a still-reasonable $5 thereafter. Such information serves as a valuable resource for future visits to this enchanting state, compelling me to frequent this establishment with increased regularity."

```
"Excellent hospitality and a congenial team. \nMy culinary experience involved consuming their tuna salad, which contained succulent albacore tuna and an assortment of fresh, crisp greens that were not merely comprised of iceberg lettuce. \nI would unhesitatingly recommend this establishment to others."
```

The culinary experience offered by this establishment boasts an intricate harmonization of flavors, which is undoubtedly a testament to the chef's artistry and dedication to their craft. Our server, Craig, provided exceptional service, demonstrating a profound understanding of the importance of catering to the needs of his patrons. Notably, my spouse and I have certain dietary restrictions, and the kitchen staff exhibited a commendable level of vigilance in ensuring that the ingredients used in each dish were carefully selected to accommodate these limitations. While the prices may be slightly elevated compared to those of other establishments serving similar fare, the quality and presentation of the dishes render them a luxurious indulgence that justifies the additional expense. We would unquestionably consider returning to partake in this gastronomic delight once again.

When we arrived at this establishment today, it appeared to be a conventional pizzeria, albeit with a limited selection of pies, specifically a solitary pepperoni variety, which we found somewhat perplexing given the relatively early hour of our visit. Notwithstanding this anomaly, we were impressed by the welcoming ambiance of the interior, particularly in proximity to the boulder station, rendering it an ideal destination for a post-cinematic or pre-cinematic excursion. Furthermore, we were pleased to discover that the prices were reasonable and the slices were generously proportioned, thereby making it an appealing option for aficionados of pizza, such as myself, who can confidently endorse it.

The name of this place deserves 5 stars. Mayyybeeeee I'm a little immature, but it never stops making me giggle.\n\nGreat 24 hour pho spot in Vegas. You can always find either drunk or hungover vegas-goers here. Service is shitty and rude, but they are fast and efficient on bringing your food and bill out. They want you IN and OUT. no joke.

"The Arts Factory constitutes a most intriguing and captivating destination for those seeking to acquire exquisite works of art and assorted peculiarities. Beyond the conventional magnificent paintings and canvas creations, one can discover an array of diverse forms of artistic expression and amusing items. For instance, Hiptazmic Studio showcases an impressive array of upcycled and recycled adornments and decorative pieces, alongside unique artworks, t-shirts, engraved tags, patches, and other such novelties. Additionally, Happy Panda Toys boasts an extraordinary compilation of vinyl playthings, and enthusiasts can participate in trading sessions during special launch events. Furthermore, Hell Pop offers an impressive selection of comics and alternative books that cater to diverse interests and preferences. The Arts Factory presents a wide range of choices, ensuring that every visitor can find something that suits their tastes and inclinations. It is recommended to visit the establishment on First Fridays, as not only does the Arts Factory experience a lively atmosphere, but the surrounding area also hosts numerous booths and events that contribute to an enjoyable and enriching experience."

"An extraordinary assortment of brews, accompanied by delectable confections, specifically the rich Belgian chocolate pudding, elevates the culinary experience; however, the remaining fare falls somewhat short of expectations, yet the atmosphere remains convivial, particularly during the Monday night trivia sessions."

"Solely accomplished remove out at this location.  I have been thoroughly impressed by the efficiency of the counter service, which has consistently demonstrated a proficiency in expediting orders and facilitating a seamless dining experience for patrons, thereby fostering an environment that encourages repeat visits and perpetuates a positive reputation for the establishment."

"My assessment of this establishment warrants a rating of four stars, taking into account the limited options available in Pittsburgh for Malaysian and Dim Sum cuisine; however, if situated in a more populous metropolitan area, my evaluation would likely be closer to three stars. My experiences at this venue have been dual, with a visit for lunch wherein I partook of one of their Malaysian noodle soup dishes, which proved satisfactory but lacked that je ne sais quoi quality; in addition, I indulged in their Dim Sum offerings on a Sunday, which yielded a pleasurable experience due to the extensive variety of choices and scrumptious flavors. Although the quality did not quite reach the standards I have encountered in cities such as Boston, Seattle, or NYC, I found it gratifying given the local context. My companion, who has resided in China for an extended period, concurred with my positive appraisal. I would unquestionably return to this eatery. The hospitality was commendable, and the tariffs were reasonable. The ambiance was welcoming, despite the somewhat dim lighting, and the outdoor seating area was available during favorable weather conditions, complemented by a fully-stocked bar with seating."

"Love that Sambalatte has extended its operational radius by establishing a new outlet on 215 & Jones, thereby obviating the need for an arduous excursion to Summerlin. Although the dimensions of this novel establishment are somewhat diminutive compared to its predecessor, it boasts an expanded alfresco seating arrangement that affords patrons the opportunity to bask in the balmy ambiance of a temperate day, albeit with a caveat regarding the sweltering heat of a Vegas summer afternoon. My visit transpired at approximately 6 pm on a quiescent Wednesday evening, and owing to the sparse attendance, the staff was able to expedite their attentions with remarkable celerity. I opted for an iced macha latte, and while no specification of magnitude was solicited, the generously proportioned cup in which it was presented came as a welcome surprise. Its flavorsome contents thoroughly satiated my expectations and left me convinced of its value. On a previous occasion, I had sampled their Nutella latte and found it equally gratifying. Sambalatte offers an assortment of delectable pastries and desserts, inclusive of the increasingly ubiquitous macaroon, for customers to enjoy either within the premises or transport them to a preferred location for consumption. This charming edifice provides an idyllic setting for a leisurely coffee break or a casual rendezvous with acquaintances, and its ample parking facilities serve as a bonus amenity."

So me and a lady friend stopped here for a night out a month back. 

We arrived, there seemed to be no self parking or maybe I'm just not aware of it. Because it was just valet at the front. So i of course had to valet it. Which to me is odd. I'm not a huge fan of a valet service. I'm a big boy, I'll park my own fucking vehicle, FOR FREE. But whatev's. 

I tried to bypass that. We entered and found a both near the bar. The food is a mix/hybrid/fusion of mexican-new mexican food. 

I forgot what I had at the time. But I remember it being REALLY REALLY good. We also shared a great bottle of red wine that our server recommended to us. 

The service was awesome, the food was amazing. A bit pricy, but like i've said before. You get what you pay for. 

Definitely a place to check out, a wonderful date environment.

"For an optimal dim sum experience at a reasonable cost, one must be willing to compromise in certain aspects. Firstly, the servers may not always be attentive or readily available, necessitating proactive measures to acquire their assistance. Additionally, the staff may exhibit signs of fatigue or irritability, potentially resulting in a less than cordial encounter. Furthermore, it is advisable to expedite the payment process by bringing your stamp card to the front counter, thereby avoiding an extended wait time. Notwithstanding these caveats, the establishment earns four stars due to the subjective nature of service quality in Chinese restaurants, which often deviates from Western standards."

"Culinary offerings were thoroughly satisfactory, with an emphasis on proficient preparation and aesthetically pleasing presentation. Specifically, the grilled octopus exhibited a precise degree of doneness, while the primary dishes and confectionary selections were of considerable quality. Although the cost was somewhat elevated, the overall experience was deemed suitable for commemorating my spouse's natal day and creating a memorable nocturnal ambiance."

Having been a resident of Las Vegas for an extended period of time, specifically eight years, and having become accustomed to the various amenities offered by the Suncoast, I opted to stay at this particular establishment due to its reasonable rates and reputation for being a well-maintained property. My decision proved to be a judicious one, as my recent overnight stay at the Suncoast was a thoroughly satisfactory experience.  

The Suncoast Hotel and Casino is widely recognized as an exceptional locals' casino, situated in the picturesque community of Summerlin. As a result of its affiliation with the Coast (Boyd) brand, the property offers competitive rates, making it an attractive option for those seeking a high-quality gaming and hospitality experience without the necessity of being in close proximity to the Las Vegas Strip.  

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the friendly and efficient check-in staff, who demonstrated a keen focus on ensuring the comfort and satisfaction of their guests. The cleanliness of my room was impressive, surpassing my expectations and providing an atmosphere conducive to relaxation.  

As an enthusiast of gaming, I found the comps offered by the Suncoast to be generous and readily attainable, even for a casual player such as myself. The table games available were typical of most establishments, yet the dealers were personable and engaging, enhancing the overall gaming experience. While the poker room was somewhat underwhelming, particularly in comparison to the extensive facilities offered at the Orleans, the Boyd sportsbook remained a highlight, providing me with an enjoyable experience and fostering my anticipation for future visits, especially during the forthcoming football season.  

In conclusion, the Suncoast Hotel and Casino presents itself as an unparalleled value in Las Vegas, boasting a combination of affordability, excellent maintenance, and a commitment to ensuring the satisfaction of its patrons.
Good food and good entertainment.  Food is good and plentiful.  Where the Key West Margaritaville lacks in flare this place has it.

"Upon perusing my culinary options, I opted for the Shrimp Fried Rice, a seemingly innocuous dish that, much to my delight, transcended my expectations in terms of both quality and quantity. Specifically, the copious amount of genuine shrimp, devoid of any artificial or diminutive substitutes, combined with the generous serving size, left me thoroughly impressed and contentedly satiated."

"Oh Dollar Tree, you possess an extensive inventory of diverse items that cater to my desires and surpass my expectations. Your store offers an impressive array of products, ranging from festive holiday cards and coordinating tableware, to practical cleaning supplies and even sustenance for my culinary endeavors. The sheer scope of your offerings is truly remarkable, and I must commend you on your ability to accommodate my varied needs with such efficiency. However, I must deduct a star from my rating due to the challenges posed by the nearby driveway when attempting to execute a left turn. The experience was indeed daunting, but I am grateful to have emerged unscathed and able to share my thoughts on your establishment. Should you find yourself in need of supplies for a social gathering, seek out this store without hesitation. Similarly, if financial constraints are a concern, or if you have suddenly recalled a forgotten family member's birthday, Dollar Tree is an ideal destination. This venue boasts an eclectic selection that caters to a wide range of requirements. Nevertheless, it is essential to note that this establishment may not align with the preferences of those seeking a more refined experience. Rest assured, I hold your store in high regard and will continue to visit frequently, as it is the most convenient location for me."

"Within the confines of the Planet Hollywood shopping complex, this particular establishment boasts an acceptable level of quality. While the customer service experience may not align with my customary expectations, the culinary prowess of their coffee concoctions remains undeniable. Furthermore, the comparative lack of inconvenience associated with this venue serves as a notable advantage when juxtaposed against the Starbucks located within the Planet Hollywood Casino."

I am a local so I have not stayed here. But, we do come here for many of the things to do here. It is always clean and what staff we do run into have been very nice. We have eaten at most of the restaurant  and have been happy. Really like the new addition Zenshin!! \nThey have a bingo hall, bowling alley and movie theater. We have been to some of the Comedy acts and other convention attractions they have. \nLots to do and not a lot of hussel from all the people on the strip.

I tried this place about a month ago, and have been back at least 4 times since. So glad to finally find a Chinese food place near my house that I love. When I call in an order for pick-up, the food is ready within 10 minutes and reasonably priced. 

I've never eaten inside the restaurant myself, but it seems nice. There are always a couple waitresses busy keeping the customers happy. It's a small interior, with about 10 booths and 6 tables (which could be pushed together to accommodate a larger group). 

Great wall is in the small strip-mall just South of Walgreens (which is at Williams Field Rd). Also in the strip-mall is Sherwin Williams and Little Caesers

"It was a momentous occasion, one that marked the genesis of an amorous odyssey, when I first encountered the object of my desire; the sentiment of fondness that I experienced was unparalleled, and the cost, though not inconsequential, was a paltry sum relative to the value I obtained in return. It was, in point of fact, an unbeatable combination."

We deliberately traversed along the Pennsylvania Turnpike with gastronomical yearnings for an extended period, merely due to our intense craving for Indian cuisine. Such actions were indeed perilous, as our tolerance for hunger pangs customarily leads to capitulation to a convenient sandwich at a roadside eatery. Upon entering Coriander India Grill, we were greeted by a hospitable host who promptly accommodated us in a cozy booth. Shortly thereafter, a platter of crunchy papads accompanied by the customary triangular receptacle containing chutneys arrived, temporarily alleviating our hypoglycemic state. Following a cursory examination of the menu, we opted for lamb vindaloo (graded at a fiery 10 on the Scoville scale) and palak paneer (rated a relatively mild 7 on the Scoville scale). Although we were intrigued by the prospect of savoring south Indian dosas, their rarity did not warrant the risk, given the prevalence of northern Indian fare in most establishments. The culinary offerings were delivered expediently, and their flavors were indeed delectable! The vindaloo lived up to its billing, unleashing a torrent of spicy heat that, admittedly, I should have anticipated. My previous experience with authentic Indian cuisine notwithstanding, I erred in estimating my capacity to handle such fervent zest. Conversely, my partner's palak paneer was sublimely rich and velvety. Our satiated visages and contented dispositions upon exiting the eatery bespoke our unwavering intention to revisit Coriander India Grill during future excursions to Pittsburgh.

"Une sÃ©lection de biÃ¨res extrÃªmement attrayante, qui reflÃ¨te avec pertinence la diversitÃ© de la production brassicole rÃ©gionale. Le menu, quant Ã  lui, prÃ©sente une variÃ©tÃ© de plats savoureux, mettant en valeur les ingrÃ©dients locaux et frais. MalgrÃ© l'absence de nourriture consommÃ©e, le potentiel gastronomique de ce lieu est indÃ©niable. L'expÃ©rience de dÃ©gustation de la sangria sur la terrasse, embellie par un environnement chaleureusement accueillant, a suscitÃ© chez nous un sentiment de satisfaction. Cependant, il convient de souligner que l'atmosphÃ¨re ambiante, bien que plaisante, souffrait d'un manque relatif de vitalitÃ©, particularly during the early afternoon hours; a minor shortcoming that could be effectively addressed through the judicious deployment of background music."

While the crab legs are not top notch.. for 16.50 for locals for unlimited crab, very good prime rib, sushi, clam chowder, great stir-fry, Chinese, and very premium gelato there is nothing to complain about i recommend this buffet to anyone looking to get a great bang for your buck here in the las vegas area, i've been to many buffets but this one i keep coming back to for the price is right and so is the food, only bad thing is get there at 5:30pm or sooner or be prepared to wait in a very long long line :/

"On my maiden visit to this establishment, I was taken aback by the seemingly exorbitant prices, however, upon partaking of their culinary offerings, I was pleasantly surprised by the delectable flavors and exceptional quality. Thus, I am inclined to return and sample their diverse menu items."

We indulged in a seated experience at the bar, whereupon the bartender manifested exceptional attentiveness towards us! We opted for the Lollipop Passion Goblet, an extravagant concoction that surpassed our expectations with its remarkable presentation and delectable flavor profile, rendering it a worthwhile expenditure of $36. The beverage's unique feature was the incorporation of dry ice, which, upon being poured by the bartender, produced a captivating fog effect. Reminiscent of a Midori Sour, the drink's taste was complemented by the inclusion of lollipops and a candy necklace, contributing to an unforgettable sensory encounter. Furthermore, we sampled their fries and fried macaroni and cheese, with the latter eliciting a favorable response, while the former was somewhat average in quality. We eagerly anticipate future visits to explore more of their extensive goblet selection and savor their culinary offerings!

Went here with my girlfriends for a late breakfast after a night of partying.\nThe french dip with truffle tator tots hit the spot and helped cure my semi-hangover.\nService was good and my coffee cup was constantly refilled!

"The gastronomical experience was utterly remarkable. However, it is worth mentioning that the establishment's physical appearance, having previously been a Moe's, did not boast an aesthetically pleasing ambiance. A comprehensive renovation of the interior would greatly enhance the overall dining experience. Nonetheless, the culinary offerings were truly exceptional, courtesy of the skilled chefs, although the servers' familiarity with the menu left much to be desired."

It is a minuscule yet picturesque cinema that provides a thoroughly enjoyable motion picture experience, devoid of an overwhelming throng, maintaining a spotless auditorium and offering customary refreshments such as popcorn, confectionery, and carbonated beverages, thereby enabling patrons to partake in a pleasurable afternoon sojourn, which can be further enhanced by visiting Wine Expression prior to or subsequent to the cinematic excursion.

It was my first visit.  All my co workers have been talking  about this place....with that said,  ..........walking up to this establishment is not impressive.  Please do not take a 1st date here.  All I have heard is about the expansion..and thank goodness!! 

This place is dark, the staff look like they are all on tour of some skating boarding ESPN tour  in town.

BUT!!!!

The staff  (who look like skateboarders) were great!  Each one of them so friendly, polite and very attentive. 
Beer selection-par none...excellent selection on tab.  
The expansion section is inviting for large groups...which was perfect for our work HH.
MENU- as my friend would say......UNBELIEVABLE!
I took home a Carne Asada concoction and it was sooooo good.  The calzone idea is great! When you can come up with creative stuffing you can't go wrong.  

Ambiance 3 ..too dark for me 
Staff  5+ -very friendly, attentive & polite
Food 5+- the calzone spin -UNBELIEVABLE...so good.  even take home.
Beer 5 -great selection on tab......can't get that everywhere.

We experienced exceptional hospitality, and the ambiance was enhanced by the captivating decor. Our culinary excursion began with an assortment of delectable pre-game bread, followed by a succulent bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin that showcased the chef's proficiency in the kitchen. Additionally, our dining experience was complemented by a flavorsome lobster tail, which was relished by my spouse. The sweet corn and polenta, along with the savory bacon and Yukon gold gratin, offered a delightful contrast of tastes and textures. Furthermore, the menu boasted an array of inventive dishes, including the forbidden rice, which added to the allure of this gastronomic gem. To complete our meal, we indulged in a wine list curated by a knowledgeable waitstaff, further enhancing the overall epicurean journey. Lastly, the mashed potatoes served as a satisfying conclusion to our delectable adventure. Overall, this unassuming eatery offered a remarkable dining experience that invoked memories of our visit to Elements at the Sanctuary, making it a hidden treasure worthy of exploration.

"An establishment that excels in all aspects, offering an impressive culinary experience, exceptional customer service, and an ambiance that exudes sophistication and refinement. My previous encounters with French cuisine have been limited, but I have found that it is often characterized by meager portions. However, this restaurant defies that convention, as evidenced by the generous serving sizes of their dishes, particularly the steak. The quality of the food is also worthy of praise, with each bite showcasing the chef's dedication to culinary artistry. The complementary sides, including hand-cut fries and freshly baked French bread, further enhance the dining experience. For those who prefer alfresco seating, the outdoor area offers a romantic atmosphere and stunning views of the surrounding area. Overall, I would rate this restaurant 4.5 stars, a truly exceptional rating that reflects the high standards they have set for themselves."

"An exceptional venue for leisurely socializing. Cordial hospitality and delectable cuisine. My personal preference is the BLT&E, boasting an abundance of flavor, a harmonious balance of ingredients, and a tantalizing hint of uniqueness."

"An exceptional lodging experience, characterized by meticulously maintained facilities and an impressive array of amenities, culminated in a highly satisfactory stay, albeit with a solitary caveat pertaining to the quality of the fare served at the hotel's carnival buffet, which, despite its purported 'world-class' status, failed to meet expectations, particularly in regards to the congealed macaroni and cheese, as well as the aged sushi offerings, resulting in a questionable value proposition for the price point of $32.00; however, apart from this isolated shortcoming, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable, rendering the establishment a prime candidate for future visits."

"I thoroughly enjoy perusing the extensive array of apparel offered at this establishment, as it provides me with an ample selection to choose from, thereby ensuring that I can find items that align with my personal preferences and style. Additionally, the prices are quite reasonable, allowing me to acquire a substantial quantity of garments for a relatively modest expenditure. However, it is important to note that the quality of the merchandise may not be of the highest caliber. Furthermore, it is advisable to be aware that returns are not accepted for dresses, and exchanges or store credit are granted only under certain circumstances. As an astute shopper, I make it a point to try on all items before making a purchase, thus mitigating any potential issues. This venue is particularly suitable for individuals who are budget-conscious and seeking fashionable attire, particularly those in the age range of teenagers to early 30's. While some items may be deemed unattractive by some, the diversity of options ensures that there is something for everyone. The store maintains a well-organized atmosphere, and inventory is replenished regularly. Although the customer service may not be exceptional, the staff members are generally helpful and accommodating, provided that one takes the initiative to seek their assistance."

The ambiance of this culinary establishment may prompt you to reconsider your dining choice due to its conspicuous transformation from a Yoshi's/Kyoto Bowl style venue, but I strongly advise you to disregard such reservations. Instead, immerse yourself in the boisterous dance tunes and explore the intriguing menu offerings.

Upon perusing the menu, we opted for the Salmon Lover, Delish, Eel Cucumber, and Sixty Nine rolls. To our delight, each dish proved to be not only delectable but also characterized by diverse textures and an elevated level of creativity relative to the standard sushi restaurant fare. The Salmon Lover, in particular, merits a mandatory trial, owing to its sublime taste and inventive presentation.

Incidentally, I must mention that my culinary preferences are limited by an avocado allergy, which typically leads me to opt for nigiri over rolls upon visiting a new establishment. However, the nigiri options at this restaurant seemed somewhat pricey, and the fascinating variety of rolls motivated me to inquire whether omitting avocado would pose any issues. Much to my relief, the accommodating waitstaff assured me that no problems would arise, and my meal arrived completely free of allergens.

Been here many times, but tonight was different. I was with two others and it was packed. Reservations for 8:45pm. We didn't get sat until almost 10pm. The hostesses were rude or less than apologetic & the waitstaff kept telling us they'd grab us another drink...never did. The bartenders were cordial and the busser; Issac was awesome...he later solved the issue and got us sat...the busser!!! It had been 2 hours, we'd had one drink and we weren't happy at all but we were never rude-just couldn't believe the terrible service we were getting. At this point I'm handing out a 1-star review, however, Issac and our new server Mark were amazing...they knew what our last two hours were like and they took good care of us. They comped a round of drinks...we were going to come back again nonetheless because this experience was a first but they still took care of the round. I think most people would have given this a 1-3 star review but Issac (21 yrs old I might add) and Mark (a seasoned vet) made all the difference. You recovered...you get 4 stars...always room for improvement.

"Broadened my culinary horizons by opting for the grilled shrimp starter, which lived up to its billing as a piquant and flavorful delight; accompanying this delectable dish was a bread offering akin to that proffered at Uncle Sal's, albeit sans the rich, creamy, and decidedly less health-conscious butter garlic sauce that, while missed, did not detract from my overall satisfaction, thereby warranting its inclusion in my future orders."

"I recently had the pleasure of discovering an exceptional new venue in Las Vegas, conveniently located directly on the renowned Strip. The sophisticated and refined ambiance of this establishment effectively simulates the charming atmosphere of Paris, creating a truly immersive dining experience that extends beyond the palate. The delectable cuisine and exquisite wine selection, complemented by impeccable service, contribute to an unforgettable indulgence that will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression on even the most discerning patron."

I engage in gaming activities at the Bellagio approximately six times per annum, and it has become evident to me that the quality of service is contingent upon the shift schedule. Specifically, the morning shift, spanning from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, is characterized by exceptional management, with Calvin, the shift manager, leading by example. The staff members, including dealers, chip runners, custodial personnel, and supervisors, exhibit a commendable work ethic and dedication to providing excellent customer service during this time frame. In stark contrast, the 6:00 PM to 2:00 AM shift is noticeably inferior, with front-line personnel displaying an air of self-importance and a lackadaisical approach to initiating games in a timely manner, particularly in the low-limit game format. Although there are a select few exceptions, such as seasoned employee Timmy, and the 2:00 AM to 10:00 AM team, the prevalent attitude among staff members at the Bellagio seems to be centered around instructing patrons on how to cater to their preferences, rather than prioritizing customer satisfaction. This reversal of focus is, in my opinion, detrimental to fostering a positive gaming environment.

Bold colors and one-of-a-kind tops that will make you stand out. Reasonable prices, and some funky jewelry. They've also got some classic pieces, like the awesome black Fall jacket that I fell in love with - definitely the kind of piece to add to your wardrobe that you will get lots of use out of, and under $100. \n\nThe girls who work here are friendly, and they've got a decent size sale section in the back. I saw some great summer finds - go get 'em ladies!

We have had the pleasure of dining at LaVecchia's on multiple occasions, and this review marks our maiden attempt at sharing our experiences with others. Complimentary parking is conveniently located in the Hearst Tower, and upon validation by LaVecchia's, it transforms into a gratis amenity. A leisurely stroll or rapid conveyance downwards culminates in an atmospheric ambiance replete with business-oriented individuals and discerning clientele, further enhanced by the proximate presence of RiRa, Luce, and an aesthetically pleasing courtyard. Reservations can be made with minimal effort, rendering accessibility to LaVecchia's relatively straightforward. Upon arrival, seating arrangements have been efficiently orchestrated, even during periods of high demand, thereby minimizing delays. The attentive wait staff has consistently displayed commendable punctuality in providing beverages, thus precluding extended waiting periods. While the appetizers have occasionally exhibited excessive saltiness, the primary entree offerings have consistently impressed, warranting our repeated patronage. Indeed, LaVecchia's has proven itself worthy of numerous return visits, despite the abundance of alternative dining establishments within the Queen City area.

Miss the 2.99 special but figured I would give them another try since don tortacos breakfast burrito seems to be getting smaller and smaller. May go here now. Still wish there salsa was a little thicker and had more heat less vinegar taste.

"My spouse and I both opted for the Chili Cheese Dog, and our taste buds were thoroughly gratified by its culinary excellence. The hot dog was cooked to perfection, possessing a delightful snap when bitten into, and the chili was apportioned in such a manner that it did not overpower the flavor of the frankfurter, thereby allowing us to consume it with our hands without any difficulty. However, I must admit that I would have preferred a different type of cheese, specifically shredded cheese, instead of the Kraft singles that were provided. Despite this minor shortcoming, the Chili Cheese Dog proved to be an utterly delectable and satisfying snack, particularly given its convenient location on the strip."

"Prioritizing convenience, I must admit that I rely heavily on County Market due to its proximity to my humble abode. Although I do not possess an automobile, I have found their assortment of goods to be satisfactory, with only a few exceptions during peak periods when certain staples are depleted. However, I must express some dissatisfaction regarding the quality of their fresh produce. On multiple occasions, I have encountered fruits and vegetables that are either nearing spoilage or have already reached that unfortunate state. Additionally, I have purchased bananas that are unripe to the point of being inedible for several days. While I understand that the process of selecting fresh produce can be somewhat arduous, I believe it is essential to maintain a consistent level of quality to ensure customer satisfaction. Despite these minor grievances, I still find County Market to be an acceptable shopping destination and will likely continue to patronize it in the future."

"I briefly stopped by for a coffee to go, and I must say, it was an exceptional cup of coffee! The flavor profile was reminiscent of something I had previously encountered, so I inquired as to whether they roasted their own beans or sourced them from a supplier in Canada. The barista informed me that the beans were, in fact, from 49th Parallel in Vancouver, which elicited a sense of nostalgia within me. Consequently, I would highly recommend this establishment to any individuals hailing from Vancouver who are seeking a taste of home while abroad. In addition to the delectable coffee, I also sampled a scone, which was equally impressive in terms of its culinary excellence. However, I must note that the ambiance of the shop may not be optimal for prolonged periods of time, as it appears to be a relatively small space located off a less frequented street in Old Montreal. Nonetheless, the staff were incredibly cordial and welcoming, which greatly enhanced my overall experience."

"Fresh seafood is procured on a daily basis, ensuring an optimal culinary experience for our patrons. Upon ordering, we requested that the oysters be shucked, thereby facilitating their consumption. Subsequently, we meandered towards the watering hole, where an array of delectable beers and wines awaited our arrival. \nThe diverse assortment of fresh meats, seafood, and salads showcases the establishment's commitment to providing a superior gastronomic experience. Moreover, the welcoming ambiance invites patrons to linger and enjoy a beverage of their choice, while engaging in people-watching activities. \nThe staff members exhibit exceptional friendliness and helpfulness, contributing to an overall pleasurable dining experience. Additionally, the presence of a bar within the premises enhances the venue's appeal, rendering it an ideal destination for those seeking a comprehensive shopping and dining experience."

"Our recent sojourn at the Monte Carlo culminated in a desire to indulge in a delectable steak dinner on the ensuing Saturday evening, and, being a sextet of epicureans, our expectations were not thwarted. The eatery's ambiance, replete with an elegant decor, was unfortunately compromised by its proximity to the casino floor, thereby creating a discordant juxtaposition between the refined atmosphere and the less than salubrious surroundings. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the culinary offerings proved to be exceptional, particularly the colossal 120 oz steak, skillfully presented as a visually arresting mound of succulent meat, accompanied by delectable side dishes and dipping sauces. The hospitality of the staff was also commendable, as they exhibited warmth and efficiency in their service, further enhanced by their generosity in providing us with complimentary access to the Brand's "after hours" lounge, which, regrettably, did not quite live up to our expectations as a late-night hotspot. In conclusion, while the steakhouse itself was worthy of high praise, the adjacent nightclub fell short of our expectations."

"In conclusion, the encounter was generally satisfactory, as I acquired a standard manicure and pedicure for a reasonable price of $35. However, an upgrade to gel was suggested, which did not evoke a sense of obligation to accept. The personnel were proficient, yet their communication skills were somewhat impaired due to a linguistic barrier. Upon entering the establishment, one cannot help but notice the overpowering odor of chemicals, which may be bothersome for individuals with heightened sensitivity to smells or certain health conditions. Additionally, the absence of a designated cashier resulted in minor inconvenience. Nonetheless, this facility offers efficient services at an affordable price, delivering a passable manicure and pedicure experience."

Now, THIS, indeed, is how an arena should be constructed, with its grandstands and mezzanine seating area boasting a pronounced inclination, while the numerous luxury boxes are strategically positioned between the ice rink and the spectators, thereby creating an unparalleled viewing experience for those fortunate enough to occupy them. Additionally, the club areas located beneath the arena floor and behind the goal offer an exclusive and intimate atmosphere for those seeking refuge from the raucous energy emanating from the stands. Furthermore, the breathtaking sightlines afforded by the arena's design only serve to enhance the overall visual experience for those in attendance. And let us not forget the cherry on top, the delectable Canadian beer, which serves as the proverbial icing on the cake, providing an unforgettable sensory experience for all who partake. If Phoenix were to ever truly embrace the sport of hockey, they would undoubtedly come to appreciate the sheer magnitude of this arena's capacity for deafening reverberations, as its architectural design seemingly conspires to amplify the cacophony of sounds generated by the fervent enthusiasts in attendance. Indeed, the very fabric of the arena appears to vibrate with an palpable energy, fostering an environment that virtually compels one to join in the collective frenzy. Moreover, the arena's remarkable versatility is showcased by its effortless metamorphosis into a music hall, a feat made all the more impressive by the fact that large arenas often serve as veritable lifebloods for touring acts. My sole grievance, alas, lies with the rather lackluster environs in which this marvel of engineering was erected. Glendale, regrettably, exudes an aura of sterility and monotony, a characteristic that threatens to diminish the potential for an unbridled, alcohol-fueled night of revelry or an exhilarating concert experience. Further complicating matters is the arduous journey back to civilization that follows, rendering such escapades impractical and, thus, rendering the arena's proximity to its surroundings woefully inadequate. To say nothing of the egregious moniker bestowed upon its nearby neighbor to the west, a name that seems almost laughably incongruous when juxtaposed with the arena's own illustrious appellation.

Trump hotel didn't disappoint. We were greeted with kind employees and that continued all week. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. Shower was huge. 

I dropped 1 star because of the uncomfortable pillows and the train whistle early morning but neither took away from the experience. 

Pool was nice but get there early for a lounge chair. 

Did not try the restaurants but did try the muffins and fruit at the coffee stand and they were great. 

We didn't mind the lack of casino as this led to a much quieter and smoke free lobby. I would surely return.

"The particular site of the renowned Madison Original Pancake House that we are referring to is situated in a relatively secluded position, nestled behind a neighboring hotel, thereby affording it a degree of privacy and tranquility that is not typically associated with its busier, more accessible counterpart. The staff at this establishment is remarkably courteous, efficient, and professional in their demeanor, thereby creating a welcoming ambiance that greatly enhances the overall dining experience. Additionally, this location boasts an abundance of parking options, which is a significant advantage over the alternative site, which was unfortunately plagued by construction-related inconveniences and heavy traffic during our attempted visit. The culinary offerings at this esteemed eatery are of exceptionally high quality, with a diverse array of popular choices being singled out for praise in various reviews. Therefore, patrons can confidently order any item from the menu, secure in the knowledge that they will be treated to a truly satisfying repast."
Gorgeous hotel! Didn't stay here but did you know Carlos from the food channel has a bakery here?!?! WHAT WHAT?!?! Yummerz. Be prepared for 1+ hour long wait though.
It's at least open till 9:30, amazing in this \"24 hour\" town and it tastes great.  Can't beat a 7.95 dinner special with drink, egg roll and soup.  If they deliver to UNLV, it's a five.

"Satisfactory midday repasts at reasonable tariffs. NOT THE TWO AMERICANS ANY LONGER. PRESENTLY KNOWN AS ROCKY POINT TAVERN. My personal preference was inclined towards it. $2 pints of Corona beer and tacos. Visually appealing interior design."

We're am I? Philly? 
Maybe, I've never been. but if I were my cheese steak would taste like this. So good.
Pepper, onion ratios were perfect. The steak was great and the cheese wiz was tasty. The bread is brought in from Philly. Soft with a crunchy shell. Nice.
The pizza is also fresh and hand tossed. The big slices are filling.
But Spinelli's is more than that. They have appetizers, salads, desserts, Stromboli and other sandwiches. Bummed, no brew yet but any day now. 
Mac and cheese bites are a good app choice.
Last words... authentic, relaxing and non pretenses. Enjoy.

"Miniature eatery offering delectable Japanese noodle soup dishes at an affordable cost. During my initial visit, I opted for the tonkotsu variety, featuring a rich pork broth complemented by a generous portion of thin, chewy noodles. My companion, however, selected the spicy ramen option, boasting a flavorful miso-based broth and accompanied by thick, wavy noodles. Upon consuming my meal, I noted that the noodles were slightly thicker than what I would consider 'thin,' yet this deviation from expectation proved advantageous, as I generally prefer heartier ramen noodles. While my first dining experience at this establishment ranked among the most satisfying I've had, this particular visit, although still enjoyable, did not quite meet those lofty standards. Nonetheless, considering the reasonable prices, the quality and quantity of food offered remain exceptional."
Fantastic!  Clean, fairly priced, great service and delicious food - you could not ask for more than that in a restaurant!

"Linda is utterly remarkable! My quest for an exceptional nail technician to enhance my engagement photos led me to her doorstep, albeit serendipitously. Coincidentally, she had recently relocated to Salon Boutique, thereby affording me the opportunity to secure an appointment without much difficulty. Upon our initial encounter, Linda exuded warmth and exhibited an effortless charm, rendering conversation remarkably fluid. Subsequent to that auspicious meeting in early March, I have remained steadfast in my allegiance to her expertise, as she unwaveringly ensures that her clients depart her salon thoroughly contented. It is palpable that Linda's proficiency and dedication are genuinely unparalleled, and thus, I consider myself truly fortunate to have stumbled upon such an exceptional talent! Patrons seeking top-notch gel, acrylic, refill, manicure, pedicure, shellac, or other related services would be well-advised to seek out Linda's expertise, as she additionally provides a complimentary arm and hand massage, further enhancing the overall experience."

At first glance, Outside Inn appeared to be a run-of-the-mill drinking establishment, devoid of any distinguishing features that might set it apart from its contemporaries. However, upon closer inspection, certain aspects of its ambiance captured my attention and piqued my curiosity. The name, in particular, struck me as somewhat amusing and playful, which served as an auspicious harbinger of the pleasant surprises that awaited me within.

Upon entering the premises, I was immediately taken by the rustic, woody aesthetic that permeated the interior design. The liberal use of exposed wooden "log" beams and the overall "woodsey" motif lent a warm, welcoming atmosphere to the space, evoking the sense of a cozy cabin nestled deep within a dense forest. Although the bar area itself was somewhat dimly lit, the abundance of televisions (albeit none of them particularly large) scattered throughout the room ensured that patrons could easily follow their favorite sporting events or news programs while enjoying a refreshing beverage.

In contrast, the dining area, though relatively diminutive in size, exuded a certain charm thanks to its subdued color scheme and judicious deployment of supple, vinyl booths. While I would have preferred a bit more exposed wood adorning the walls to complement the existing decor, the strategic employment of these booths helped to create an intimate, convivial setting that fostered a sense of community among patrons.

My culinary expectations were thoroughly exceeded by the delectable fare presented before me. The sweet potato fries, in particular, delighted my taste buds with their unexpected burst of flavor and satisfying crunch, while the prime rib proved itself to be a veritable gastronomic revelation, boasting a tenderness and richness of flavor that eclipsed that of many other establishments in the surrounding area. Although the tariffs associated with these delights were slightly elevated above the norm, the extensive selection of draft beers available helped to assuage any pecuniary concerns.

The attentive, cordial service I received during my visit only further enhanced my overall satisfaction, leaving me feeling content and satiated. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Outside Inn to anyone seeking a relaxed, congenial environment in which to enjoy a few pints and savor some exceptional prime rib. Its unassuming faÃ§ade belies a veritable treasure trove of gustatory delights and hospitable ambiance, making it an ideal destination for those seeking solace from the stresses of everyday life.

I got a piece of red velvet cake. The frosting is so rich and creamy with a very buttery finish and LOTS of cream cheese. The cake is tasty but dry. Good thing there was lots of amazing frosting to cover that flaw up. The place looked like a trendy spot you would find in NYC with prices to match. The staff was super friendly though.

"To fully appreciate and relish the unique experience offered by this establishment, it is essential to possess an understanding of its distinctive nature and intrinsic value. My associates and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and while the entrance fee of $17 may have seemed steep, we did not begrudge paying it for the opportunity to partake in such a singular adventure. Upon entering, we were provided with arctic attire, consisting of parkas and Uggs, and given gloves to protect our hands while holding our drinks. Prior to gaining access to the bar, we deposited our personal items and electronic devices in secure lockers, and then proceeded to immerse ourselves in a chilly environment, with the temperature set at a brisk 50 degrees. The interior was crafted entirely from ice, including the furniture, lighting fixtures, and even the glasses in which our beverages were served. I found it to be an entertaining and memorable diversion, primarily due to its novel and inventive concept."

The two most important words to remember when going here are: Moscow mule.

Forget everything else; that's what you want. The jukebox has issues, as others have noted. The beer selection is decent, but there is far better in near proximity. The food is decent, but nothing to keep me coming back. What will keep me coming back, however, is the moscow mules. The first few I had there were made with cucumber vodka, and hot damn were they tasty! On another visit, I had a couple made with a vodka infused with mint and I can't even remember what else which one of the bartenders made herself.

Oh yes, speaking of the bartenders, they are awesome. Be nice to them, treat them well, and they will be awesome to you in return.

So in summary: Food, decent; Beer, decent; Moscow mules, delicious; Bartenders, awesome.

Considering the first reviewer, I wouldn't recommend taking their services from a hotel.

However, they do offer shuttle service from the airport. You prepay, so there is no way the driver can hammer you for more money.  Just look for signs at baggage claim that say "Airport Shuttles" or something like that.

There are actually two separate companies.  This one was a bit more expensive, but the other one only took cash.  And I forgot to get cash before leaving for Vegas.  So I had to go with this one so I can charge it.

Use the airport shuttles, it's cheaper. I think it was $6 or so per person to the hotel.  Much cheaper than a cab.  They have the prices posted outside so you can check it out when you arrive.

Surely, this poultry dish is not deep-fried? That was the query I posed to the cashier, as the chicken appeared to possess the characteristic crispiness and savory flavor associated with fried chicken, albeit lacking the telltale golden-brown hue. However, I was informed that it was broasted, a culinary technique unfamiliar to me, which seemingly implies that the chicken is cooked employing a method that is healthier and more nutritious than the conventional deep-frying process. Moreover, this establishment offers an array of delectable treats, including milkshakes, malts, a self-serve yogurt bar, sandwiches, and, of course, the renowned Dole whip. For those who relish the idea of a leisurely excursion, a visit to Boulder City can be a pleasant experience, complete with picturesque scenery. Nevertheless, for those who prefer to avoid the town proper, this eatery is situated on the outskirts, rendering it easily accessible without the necessity of entering the city. Additionally, a drive-thru service is available, although patrons are advised to exercise patience, as each item is meticulously prepared to order, thus ensuring an unparalleled level of quality and freshness. This humble abode, once a modest shack across the street, has since been transformed into a full-fledged edifice, a testament to its enduring popularity and success. BC boasts an abundance of undiscovered gems, and this particular establishment is not to be overlooked. A visit to this restaurant is sure to leave a lasting impression, and skipping it would be a genuine loss.

Its a Chipotle.  Ya get what you expect.  The kids love it.  Wifey can eat healthy there.  \nI don't really consider Chipotle to be very good as a mexican cuisine, but for what they serve, its darn tasty.  love their chips, and their guac.  and their pork is excellent, too.\nNot saying this specific location was, but be sure to watch when they are dishing the protein; sometimes they ca be skimpy on the meat, especially if the line is long.

"I have consistently savored the culinary offerings and regarded them as exceptional in quality. However, the service has been subpar, largely attributable to the emphasis placed on recruiting nearby university students as staff. During one particular visit, we made reservations and were promptly seated by the hostess, who attempted to accommodate us at a table despite our preference for a booth. We politely requested to be seated at a booth, but our request was met with resistance, leading to an impasse that persisted for several exchanges. Ultimately, we threatened to vacate the premises, which precipitated the hostess's reluctant acquiescence to our request. Nevertheless, her subsequent behavior bordered on theatrics, as she melodramatically escorted us to a booth before departing abruptly. This anomalous episode serves as a caveat to management regarding the potential drawbacks of relying heavily on student labor."

"The Pinnacle course at Troon North boasts an impressive luster, offering an unparalleled golfing experience that is nothing short of a true delight. In contrast, the Monument course, while still enjoyable, fails to elicit the same level of enthusiasm, its design and layout lacking the creative flair and intrinsic allure of its counterpart. Although the course conditions are generally satisfactory, they fall short of exceptional, leaving room for improvement in terms of maintenance and upkeep. Lastly, the pro shop offers an assortment of golf-related merchandise that caters to the needs and preferences of golfers, providing a convenient one-stop shopping destination for those seeking to enhance their golfing experience."

Once I find something I like, I usually stay with it. This place is no exception. I've been coming here for over a year now.  I love coming here for my monthly gel manicure. As much as customers they get, it is amazing the staffs remember repeat customers.  One of them asked me for things happened a few months ago.

Friendly staffs are easy to talk to and they know how to pamper you really well.
I am looking forward to my next monthly therapeutic with them.

I managed to fortuitously secure a living space that is conveniently located within walking distance of virtually all essential amenities, including what is arguably the preeminent ski and snowboard equipment retailer in the region. Ski Pro boasts an impressive inventory that surpasses even the most well-stocked ski shops in Colorado, and their focus on promoting sales and offering discounts is evident in the substantial markdowns they offer on various items. Case in point: I recently purchased a ski suit for my child that had been originally priced at $175, but was available for the significantly reduced price of $59. Although the selection of skis and snowboards may not be as extensive as some other specialty stores, it is nevertheless quite comprehensive and caters to a wide range of winter sports enthusiasts. Furthermore, the store's proximity to the Biltmore is an added convenience.

The quality of customer service at Ski Pro is relatively average for establishments of this nature, with staff members exhibiting a level of friendliness and attentiveness that is adequate without being overly obsequious. Considering the laid-back atmosphere that permeates such leisure-oriented businesses, it would be unreasonable to expect excessively cheerful and solicitous demeanors from employees. Instead, they maintain a relaxed yet competent attitude that aligns with the overall ambiance of the store. While they may not display the same level of enthusiasm as workers in more formal settings, they are at least cordial and welcoming, which is a refreshing change from the sometimes surly and aloof demeanor encountered among ski shop employees in certain parts of Colorado. Consequently, I recommend paying a visit to Ski Pro and adopting a carefree attitude when interacting with the staff.

Never have I experienced a subpar dining experience at any of their establishments; the flavorful ground beef hummus is utterly delectable, surpassing all other hummus I have had the pleasure of consuming throughout my existence! On this particular visit, I opted to sample their coconut shrimp for the first time, and I must say, it was an unmitigated success! The dish was nothing short of extraordinary, eliciting an enthusiastic response from my taste buds. However, I must admit that the ambiance was slightly marred by the staff's behavior, which, while not detracting from the exceptional quality of our server's attention, was somewhat unprofessional and incongruous with the overall dining experience. Specifically, at approximately 9:00 PM, the entire team of three staff members decided to partake in their evening meal within the restaurant, in full view of the remaining patrons. While I understand the importance of sustenance for those working tirelessly to provide excellent service, I cannot help but wonder if a brief postponement of their repast or a more discreet dining area might have been more appropriate. In spite of this minor drawback, I would like to emphasize that the quality of our service remained commendable, and the culinary offerings continued to impress. Such an isolated occurrence would not deter me from frequenting their establishment again in the future or endorsing it to my acquaintances and loved ones.

If I were to have the opportunity to procure a single beverage, either a coffee or a chocolate milkshake, I would unhesitatingly opt for the latter from Courier Cafe, despite its antiquated ambiance characterized by aged carpeting, elderly waitstaff, and vintage cutlery. The allure of a rich, velvety milkshake that defies suction through a straw and arrives accompanied by a surplus in a metallic mixing vessel is simply too enticing to resist, even on a frigid winter day. Indeed, any discerning devotee of such indulgences would assuredly follow suit and venture forth to partake in this revered establishment's offerings.

"I have a penchant for this establishment! Although it may not be a quintessential five-star burger joint, it boasts an impressive array of attributes that warrant its classification as a formidable culinary destination. The utilization of premium quality meat is a testament to the eatery's commitment to serving its clientele with the finest fare. Furthermore, the proprietors have adopted an innovative approach by extending an invitation to patrons to exercise their creativity in tailoring their burgers to their exacting specifications. This tantalizing feature allows individuals to assume a sense of agency in the preparation of their meals, fostering a unique dining experience that is both engaging and satisfying. 

The ambiance within the restaurant exudes a nostalgic charm, reminiscent of bygone eras, while the musical selections played during my visit were quite agreeable, save for a solitary Morrissey tune that momentarily threatened to undermine my dining experience; however, I successfully mitigated its impact by diverting my attention elsewhere. Although the theme of the establishment may not conform to the conventional definition of a '50s dinner, it remains an intriguing venue worthy of exploration. 

In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly opt for the two-thirds burger, thereby affording myself the opportunity to indulge in a delectable medley of toppings tailored to my discerning taste."

Originally I was not sure about coming here since I thought the name of the restaurant was gimmicky but this has to be one of the best places in the Phoenix area to get some Pho. I was pleasantly surprised about the quality of the noodle soups here. It seemed quite busy in there during my visit and the service did feel a bit rushed, but it doesn't bother me much as I was there just for a quick meal and I know how busy they can get at a restaurant like that. I plan to come back here to try out some of their other offerings!

"A ubiquitous sentiment permeates the discourse surrounding this establishment, whereby the culinary offerings, while undeniably satisfactory, are eclipsed by the truly exceptional ambiance, which transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime; an experiential venue par excellence, where the tangible aspects of the dining experience, though hardly negligible, pale in comparison to the overall atmosphere, rendering it an obligatory pilgrimage for gastronomes and revelers alike, despite its slightly inconvenient location."

I take immense pleasure in engaging in recreational activities at Tuscany, which happens to be one of the more recently established golf courses in the city of Las Vegas. My maiden visit to Tuscany - the clubhouse was situated within a makeshift structure that resembled a quonset hut or a tent. They have since upgraded their facilities to include a stunning clubhouse and restaurant. Initially, the club encountered some difficulties in cultivating grass in this particular region of Vegas, which is known for its arid climate. Subsequently, the management opted to seek assistance from the team at Rhodes Ranch, who took over the course's maintenance and transformed it into a thriving and lush landscape. Rhodes Ranch serves as the "sister" course, and players can frequently avail themselves of exceptional package deals for playing both courses. The layout of the course is meticulously designed, featuring an abundance of sand traps strategically positioned to accommodate my driving distance. Additionally, there are sufficient water hazards scattered throughout the course to accommodate errant shots. The course meanders past a magnificent stone clock tower and boasts expansive fairways. The underlying theme of the course revolves around wine and vineyards, rendering it distinctive and unique. In my opinion, this course offers exceptional value for the price paid. Although it requires a slightly longer drive compared to some of the Summerlin courses, the experience is truly remarkable and well worth the extra effort.

"The expansive outdoor seating area, characterized by its perpetual occupancy, necessitates an early arrival to secure a coveted spot. The protracted queue, however, is more than justified by the delectable offerings, particularly the recently introduced 'porchetta' sandwich, which elicits nostalgic memories of home-cooked meals lovingly prepared by one's mother. Moreover, the establishment's welcoming ambiance extends to canine patrons, as evidenced by the thoughtful provision of water for furry friends. Such considerate touches contribute to an overall pleasant dining experience."

I have been to Chandelier a few times, it's really beautiful. Go to the 2nd (in between) level and order the Lemon Verbena, not on the menu. Pay an extra couple dollars each to get extra flowers for everyone in your group. You chew the flower (don't swallow) and it will do a weird frothing thing in your mouth for at least 5 minutes. It feels like there's a little fountain in there. The first time, my boyfriend gave me one and I hit him afterwards. But of course I had to repay the favor to my group of 5 the next time I was in Cosmo with a Bachelorette party. VERY entertaining to watch the facial expressions of your friends! And well worth the $23 I spent for the drink + another 3 flowers.\n\nChandelier is always hoppin even at 4 or 5 a.m. Why only 4 stars? One time they made me a terrible cocktail. Also, the bartenders at the bar itself tend to be really bitchy... at least to women.

Great atmosphere,  very good menu, excellent service,  and lots of beers to choose from. The only thing about this place is the parking.  

If you want a quiet place this isn't it. It's called a social house for a reason.  Go for the food, the drinks, and the crowd.  Plenty of TVs to catch a game. 

Enjoy!

"The culinary experience was exceptional, with the crab cakes being the most delectable and flavorful that I have had the pleasure of consuming. The methodical preparation involved a light breading at the base of the crab cake, thereby preserving the natural juiciness and richness of the seafood. The taste was sublime, with none of the usual heavy sauces overpowering the delicate flavors of the crab. Our dining experience has been consistent, with every staff member, from the initial greeting to the final farewell, displaying exceptional hospitality. However, the only drawback was the excessive noise levels, which seemed to be a deliberate strategy to accommodate a high volume of customers in a short period, thereby creating an atmosphere akin to a bustling eatery, where patrons are encouraged to consume their meals quickly and vacate the premises."

"This eatery certainly warrants affection due to its delectable beverages, culinary offerings, and entertainment amenities, specifically the shuffleboard facility. My taste buds thoroughly relished the macaroni and cheese complemented by the spicy ghost pepper cheese and the healthy broccoli salad.
