However, my enjoyment was slightly impaired by the vocalist of the musical group performing on the outdoor patio on October 14th, whose melodic renderings, although not necessarily unpleasant, seemed incongruous within the context of a family-oriented dining environment, reminiscent of those typically found in adult entertainment venues such as Sapphire's, where such attire would have been more appropriate."

"Commencing with the fundamental premise that a healthy lifestyle necessitates constant motion, this culinary establishment offers a delectable array of nutritious options, which, when consumed in conjunction with physical activity, contribute to an optimal state of wellness. My recent visit to this eatery served as a testament to the veracity of this assertion, as I relished a sumptuous breakfast replete with authentic Southern comfort fare, the quality of which was exemplary. Furthermore, the accommodating staff exhibited remarkable patience and tolerance when confronted with an unanticipated display of playful rowdiness from two members of my dining party, who engaged in a spontaneous water fight mid-meal, thereby creating an atmosphere of conviviality and joviality that enhanced the overall dining experience."

Found this place because its close to work. I wish I can go here for lunch on a daily basis but my budget wont allow it! Sushi is always fresh and the staff is very friendly. I've had their all you can eat sushi($20) for dinner and managed to eat 3 rolls. Great deal if you ask me because each roll can be around $9-14. They have tons of rolls you can choose from. Also the complimentary fruit is a nice touch and makes you feel special. You will be glad you visited.

I was grinning so hard when I finally arrived at this establishment, not merely due to the respite it provided from the frigid temperature outside, but also because it was a stark contrast to the vivid descriptions depicted in the Yelp reviews (which included terms such as "crackhouse," "employees who cannot speak English," "filthy," and "so pungent it could render one unconscious," among others). My smile was not just a result of the relief, but also the satisfaction of having proven the negative reviews wrong. After deliberating over whether or not to visit this store (with the intention of purchasing Tom Kha Gai), I was delighted to discover that it was, in fact, A TOTALLY TYPICAL ASIAN GROCERY STORE, reminiscent of Chicago Food Corp. on Kimball or Brwyn Mawr Fresh Market. It was almost comical to reflect on the divergence between the reviews and the reality, as I was processing my purchase. The expectation of encountering an unpleasant environment was utterly misguided, and it was quite amusing to consider the disparity between the reviews and the actual experience. While this store may have its drawbacks, including the limitation of payment methods (cash and check only, with an additional fee for card usage), cramped space, and a layer of dust, it more than makes up for it with its diverse selection of items catering to the needs of those seeking to prepare pungent Asian cuisine. They boast an extensive array of exotic sweets, alongside the essential ingredients such as nuoc mam, chili oil, and fresh lemongrass.

Placed a to go order and the loopy girl taking it royally messed it up. But the manager brought out my correct order really quickly. Additionally, he let me keep the food that she had erroneously given me. Then he offered to refund the entire meal back onto my credit card. Way to go with great customer service!

During my tenure at Shirts and Things, it was customary to procure lunch from this establishment on an intermittent basis. Upon placing an order, I would consistently opt for the bread bowl soup, specifying that half of the contents should be comprised of potato and the remaining half, a judicious blend of broccoli and cheese. This particular configuration proved to be an exceptional combination, as the bread itself possessed notable quality. Furthermore, I would routinely order the Gobbler, a culinary masterpiece reminiscent of Thanksgiving, boasting turkey, cranberry sauce, and stuffing situated upon a bed of marble rye bread. The delivery process appeared efficient; however, the prices were slightly elevated, with each soup and bread or sandwich costing approximately $7, a sum deemed questionable by my standards.

During our sojourn at the opulent Venetian resort, we had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this establishment on two separate occasions, as we were eager to sample the diverse gastronomical offerings available in the city. Upon arriving in Las Vegas rather late in the evening, we descended to the lower level of the hotel, feeling somewhat famished and disoriented due to our unfamiliarity with the area, and happened upon this restaurant by sheer serendipity, as it was one of the few establishments that remained open at such a late hour. Furthermore, we were struck by the remarkable similarity between this eatery and Cheesecake Factory, which we later discovered was not coincidental, given that both are owned by the same parent company. Notwithstanding the lateness of the hour, we encountered minimal delay in being seated, and thus, we opted to return to this venue for our morning repast prior to our departure, given its proximity to our lodgings and our previous positive experience.

Customer service is terrific. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. Everything is clean and organized. I love the way a lady in there did my eyebrows. I believe she is the owner. She's really precise and I love that. I recently came and got a pedicure and it felt kinda rushed. The foot scrub wasn't all that great, hence the one star removal but everything else is great. Definitely give this place a try.

This culinary experience was utterly delectable. Our decision to dine at this establishment was rather impromptu, as we were lodging at the MGM Grand and opted not to venture far afield onto the strip. We were gratified that our hasty decision yielded such satisfying results. The fare is presented in generous proportions, ideal for sharing amongst a group, and we found that four individuals could comfortably consume five dishes without feeling overly satiated. Particularly noteworthy were the lo mein and orange chicken offerings, which garnered unanimous praise from our foursome. 
  The ambiance of the restaurant boasts a convivial charm, yet maintains an undertone of intimacy. To maximize your dining experience, it is advisable to request a table removed from the entrance, thereby minimizing the intrusion of extraneous noise emanating from the adjacent food court. 
  Although not explicitly listed on the beverage menu, the restaurant offers a selection of reasonably priced beers. Following an afternoon of indulging in overpriced poolside cocktails, these 12-dollar, 36-ounce brews provided a welcome respite for our parched palates. 
  In conclusion, a visit to this eatery is unequivocally recommended.

Great Service, Clean Flavors, Big Menu


Wendy's Noodle Cafe has just become my favorite place called "Wendys."  Sorry other Wendys; even though you're the spicy chicken mecca, I've found another.

Everything we ordered was spectacular, and the friendly service sealed the deal, Wendy's is fantastic.  

Our Order:

Pot Stickers - Perfect crisp on the dumpling and delicious pork/scallion stuffing.  Best Potsticker I've had in Las Vegas.


Beef Short Ribs - Wendy's take on Kalbi - The beef had a nice sear on it while not being dry.  Not as good as Kalbi at many Korean spots, but still a very good appetizer.

Shredded Chicken w/ Vermicelli (noodle soup) - DELICIOUS combination of cilantro, kaffir Lime, and Chili.  This satisfying yet light soup is like your mom's chicken noodle soup with a passport. 

Malaysian Fried Rice - Served with chicken wings and squid balls.  The rice was really nice, tasting of subtle garlic, onion, turmeric, and lime.  It was moist without being mushy, and very wholesome.  The chicken wings were good not great, and the squid balls were forgettable.  The rice itself is a definite order though.


Make sure your tongue's passport is up-to-date, because it's time for your tastebuds to see the world.

"Although I cannot profess to have sampled every pancake within the nation's borders or even a sufficient quantity to establish a robust statistical foundation, I must concede that the pancakes under examination compared favorably to those I might prepare in my own domicile, an observation that admittedly astonished me.  My culinary exploration also encompassed the venue's celebrated corned beef hash, alas, the quality of which did not quite live up to my expectations, perhaps due to its reliance on canned corned beef.  

The harmonious fusion of the eatery's ambiance, steeped in history as a seasoned casino in the city's core, and the delectable pancakes transformed the dining experience into a truly satisfying breakfast excursion. Were it not for the unremarkable quality of the coffee, which regrettably conformed to institutional standards despite the thoughtful accompaniment of a half-and-half pitcher, I would unhesitatingly confer upon the establishment a perfect five-star rating.  

The display case housing an assortment of pies piqued my interest, as several fellow patrons have attested, and I look forward to savoring one of these delectable pastries during a future visit. Additionally, the restaurant offers various breakfast specials, such as a pancake and bacon sandwich ensemble, which may pique the interest of discerning gastronomes.  

In regard to parking, those who seek to avoid monetary exchanges may find the options somewhat limited. However, the valet lot adjacent to the casino provides a convenient solution, albeit at a modest cost of fifty cents for the initial hour, with gratuities customarily exceeding that amount for those who wish to demonstrate their appreciation for the service."

Went here for National cheesecake day and ate WAY too much cheesecake ! They were extremely busy offering half price cheesecake but the wait was short . I had the Godiva chocolate and OMG amazing ! If you're a choco fan this cakes for you . Very nice staff friendly prompt etc . will be going back soon Good job Cheesecake peeps !

I bought a Groupon for this place for a full exam, -xrays, whitening trays, and a cleaning. When I arrived, I was warmly greeted by the office staff, who are cheerful and sweet. The entire office is pretty big and really nice. Lots of magazines and Tv's..etc.
As I went back, they told me they had to reschedule me for the cleaning and trays another da, because they were so busy. A little annoying, but sometimes these things happen. 
I came back the following week and had my cleaning done and I am happy as a clam. The office wasn't nearly as busy, and it was actually pretty quiet. The staff is awesome and the woman who did my cleaning was wonderful! I felt totally relaxed and calm, which is necessary when you are getting things jabbed into your teeth and gums for an hour. My teeth look and feel awesome.
Another woman took me back and did the impressions for my whitening tray. She was also really nice and bubbly.
All in all I am totally happy with this place and will be returning next week to get a cavity filled.

My corporation customarily reserved me a seat on United Airlines on a monthly basis when I embarked on business trips, thereby establishing them as my final resort while traversing the skies. Their performance has been relatively consistent, punctual, and hospitable, with a negligible incidence of baggage misplacement, in contrast to Southwest Airlines, which experienced a solitary mishap in this regard, and Delta, whose blunders necessitated a prolonged rectification period of twenty-one days. Consequently, I would confer upon them a rating of four stars.

"Lobby-ya burgers are an absolute culinary delight, a veritable gastronomical explosion that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime. The delectable aroma wafting from the kitchen serves as a harbinger of the epicurean experience that awaits the patron. The gentleman in front of me was effusive in his praise of the establishment's offerings, extolling the virtues of the burger with such fervor that it would have been impolitic to decline the recommendation. Upon partaking of the burger, I found that the gentleman's laudatory remarks were by no means hyperbolic, for the freshness of the bun, the crunchiness of the pickles and lettuce, and the juiciness of the patty combined to create a flavor profile that was nothing short of extraordinary. The fries, with their tantalizing crinkle cut and irresistible taste, served as the perfect complement to the burger, their pipping hot temperature only adding to their allure. In conclusion, my dining experience at Lobby-ya burgers was nothing short of exceptional, and I would highly recommend this eatery to any individual seeking a truly satisfying culinary experience."

"Winner-Winner - Chicken Dinner\n\nI emerged victorious, securing a triumphant victory; my gaming experience at the establishment was thoroughly enjoyable, as the ambiance was pleasant and the staff were cordial. My exploits at the blackjack table proved to be particularly fruitful, yielding a substantial profit. I am eager to return and redeem my remaining chip, with the expectation of further success."

This establishment was teeming with patrons on the fifth day of the week, evidenced by the fact that every table was occupied by jovial individuals indulging in their fondness for Korean cuisine! The ambiance was permeated with an aroma that was both pungent and savory, thus eliciting our anticipation to partake in a delectable meal. 

We opted for the daeji bulgogi and the seafood tofu soup, and upon consuming the latter, we discovered that it possessed a flavor profile that was neither too bold nor too subtle, but rather a delightful equilibrium of spices that effectively warmed our gastronomical cavities. The arrival of the former dish revealed that the meat had been cooked to a state of doneness that was tantamount to perfection, boasting a caramelized exterior that yielded a satisfying crunch when bitten into, while its intrinsic juiciness was complemented by a piquant and saccharine taste. Although we would have preferred the meat to be cooked for a slightly longer duration to achieve a more pronounced charring, the inherent scrumptiousness of the dish remained undiminished. Alas, the sides accompanying the main courses did not quite live up to our expectations, as they lacked the same level of culinary prowess; specifically, the kimchi, seaweed, and fish cakes proved to be the sole exceptions that resonated with our palates, while the remaining options, such as coleslaw and similar items, fell short of our expectations and left much to be desired. 

Despite this minor drawback, our overall satisfaction with the culinary offerings remained steadfast, and we would unhesitatingly revisit this venue in the future!

Comme ca-
Located in cosmopolitan, may utilize opentable to reserve.
This place, we were seated by the side of the restaurant with amazing views! The food, we ordered roasted bone marrow (comes with shredded pork), their special of the day: fried pork cutlet with eggs and something else...and the pork shank. 
First, the bone marrow comes with 1 bone only, expensive but it does come with shredded pork, so it's actually plentiful. The appetizers special of the day, well i know it's pork cutlet, it was amazing, quite a bug appetizer but a bit too salty...the pork shank is huge!! So if you're bringing only one other guest, this is a lot of food, we had leftover which was placed in a nice cosmo bag. The pork shank is tender, falls off the huge bone for the most part, they had a special cocktail for the day, included some bubbly inside, pretty good, forgot the name already. Our waitress was nice and quick, she knows her dishes and specials well, good recommendations by her, will visit again, yum yummm

I had a really wonderful meal here and one of the most memorable in my life. The wine pairings with the tasting menu were fantastic. The service was exquisite. We also sat at a table next to Madeleine Albright, and she was drinking up a storm. She had her own bottle of red wine in a decanter, while the rest of the table was drinking white. So, getting tipsy with a former Secretary of State always makes for an awesome night.

Warning though, the amuse bouche was some sort of lobster gelée/foam. All I know is that it didn't taste like lobster, at least fresh lobster. The waiter acknowledged that many customers complained about this but they still served the damn thing. I had to take an extra big swig of wine.

However, the rest of the tasting menu was served swimmingly and tasted fantastic.

Really nice place!  My filet --medium rare -- was delicious!  My husband said his could have used more flavor, but that's his own fault for ordering it medium well!  The asparagus side was a little small, and a bit overcooked.  Baked potato was perfect!  Loved the bread assortment they brought out!  French onion soup was good but think the fresh herb they added overpowered the other flavors.  Nice wine selection--gosh I hate paying quadruple the wine store price, though!  Bring back BYOB!  Nice staff and loved our cozy booth--made the din not so overpowering and we could hear each other without yelling!  Really, really yummy steak, but it should be for $33.00!!!

"The pizza we consumed was of considerable quality, boasting a thin, crisp crust that simultaneously possessed a satisfying crunch and a palpable chewiness. The sauce was flavorful, with a subtle yet discernible spicy undertone. The toppings were diverse and plentiful, rounding out a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience. This establishment is an excellent option for those seeking a respectable pie without the exorbitant cost associated with room service, particularly for those lodging at a southern Strip hotel, as we did, and benefiting from complimentary delivery by a personable driver."

Top of the Mornin'

Popped in over the weekend while looking for a place to eat, our group wanted to eat at Capo's but we didn't know you have to make reservations in advanced, cause it sells out. Our group sneaked in this quite retreat and enjoyed our time away from the hustle and buss ell of Vegas. 

The atmosphere is very chill, and relaxing. We talked with some other tourist and had a friendly conversation.  We ordered a fish and chip happy hour snack for $2.99 and was happy with the food quality. Our bartender lady was nice and recommended a great place for Italian food.

Whenever I embark on a journey, I have an inherent inclination to seek out an establishment that specializes in Ethiopian cuisine. It is typically located in a region of the city that is not commonly frequented by tourists who are staying in the commercial district. Furthermore, it is often a family-owned and operated eatery that warmly welcomes solo patrons, as I occasionally am. In addition to this, Ethiopian cuisine possesses an unparalleled quality of authenticity, as it consists of meats and vegetables immersed in savory sauces, which are not only palatable but also beneficial to one's physical and mental wellbeing. In Tempe, Lalibela exemplifies the type of down-home, mom-and-pop culinary experience that I previously described, albeit with an Ethiopian twist. Moreover, it serves as an ideal venue for gatherings with companions or loved ones, wherein the sampler platters are highly recommended, as they encapsulate the communal essence of the feast (consumed with one's hands, rather than utensils) perfectly. Lastly, the assortment of teas available is truly delectable.

All I need to say here is...mango cream ale...just came out today and I downed 23 ounces of it. MMMMM!  I would totally come back just for the drink!!! But the menu is fairly large and service was great.  We got the last table on a Tuesday at 8:30 PM for dinner so obviously this is a hot joint.  My sweetie got a beef burrito and ate the entire plate.  Good place for beer!!!! Loved the view of the huge restaurant, very cool.
Delicious and well-priced slices. Definitely going to marry the garlic knots one day. It's pretty packed on the weekends, especially after Alive After Five, but the service is quick.

This is one of my 2 year old's favorite places to go. It's all about the cool slides built into the hill, up to date playground equipment, and when it's hot outside the water features keep him very entertained. Henderson takes care of it's parks but this is one of the better ones in their system. \n\n4 Stars without question!

I ordered the Harvest Chopped Salad and Banana, Espresso, Pistachio, and Date Muffin. The salad had the best combination of fresh fruits, creamy goat cheese, and dressing. I would not complain if I ate one of those every day! The muffin was so delicious, what a combination of flavors! The only down side for me is that it was quite pricey. Don't get me wrong, the food was mouth-watering, but I wouldn't want to spend that much money on a regular basis.

As you walk down the hall you can smell this place from a mile away. I have yet to have a bad meal there! I would totally suggest trying to get a seat on the patio overlooking the fountains. Great meal and a great view... it would be a great spot to propose... just saying

If you are looking to socialize or bring a group for people out that haven't experienced Tempe this is the place to be. The drinks selection is good, the food is a little better than regular bar food. The real highlights of Caseys is the Atmosphere and the staff. Located in the downtown college neighborhood the place is always bussling with people smiles and conversations. The door guys can be a little rough around the edges so don't try to get in the door if you had anything to drink prior to your visit. Also check out the upstairs if yo can sneak by the wait staff its a haunted room!

My inaugural indulgence in boba transpired at a Far Eastern market situated in the Western Valley; subsequent to that encounter, I have discovered several establishments in proximity to my abode that proffer this delectable beverage.  Boba Tea House holds a special place in my heart as my preferred destination for satiating my cravings for this delightful concoction.
 They boast an extensive array of flavors, which afford patrons the latitude to experiment with various combinations; however, I tend to adhere to familiar territory and opt for a Lychee Snow accompanied by boba.
 My experiences at Boba Tea House have been consistently impressive, save for the fact that I do not feel entirely at ease lingering on the premises.  It is not uncommon for individuals above the age of 18 to find themselves amidst a sea of youthful patrons, which may engender a sense of discomfort.  Notwithstanding, I remain undeterred in my pursuit of this delectable beverage and shall persist in frequenting Boba Tea House to sate my yearnings for boba.

My buds and I stumbled (literally) upon this cool find inside the MGM Grand. The three of us were all very happy with our personal pies. Very unique thin crust and cheap for the strip @ 12 bucks. Great find.

We recently had the pleasure of hosting our wedding reception at the Bentley Projects, an unconventional yet stylish venue that perfectly aligned with our preferences. Boasting ample space, the gallery exuded an air of elegance, particularly during the evening hours when the strategic lighting transformed the ambiance into a truly magical setting. Furthermore, the backdrop of original art pieces provided an idyllic setting for capturing memories through photography. The contemporary art on display, sourced from talented artists nationwide, left us in awe, albeit with a tinge of disappointment due to the prohibitive prices. Nonetheless, we harbor hope that someday we might have the opportunity to acquire one of these exceptional works. Of note, the bookstore has since closed its doors, but the adjacent restaurant, City Bakery, remains an excellent choice for a leisurely lunch before proceeding to the gallery to appreciate the exhibition. Additionally, the gallery extends its hours on First Fridays, allowing visitors to enjoy the artwork well into the evening.

I really like this buffet! We went straight to the seafood section! I was ecstatic to see that their King Alaskan Crab were already cracked and ready for you! It was so good, I think that was the best dish there. I had seriously 3-4 plates of food, with crab cakes, salmon, chicken and lamb shiskabobs(they were okay), hummus and pita (Stay away) dolmas, sushi, won tons(really yummy), dim sum(yummy, too!), plus 2 plates of dessert. I especially loved their chocolate covered strawberries. I didn't eat the meat, the steak, but the bf did and said it wasn't that good. Overall, I would come back here, but a lot hungrier. We had a HUGE nasty strawberry daquiri on our way to Planet Hollywood which filled up our bellies. Wish I was hungrier, but hey, that didn't stop me from eating like a horse! (As always =P)

This is a place for the highend vintage shopper. Its pretty expensive, but I will say the store is pretty kick ass inside.  If you don't have patients or you're new to driving, do not park in front of their building. The only way to get out is to back up onto central avenue!

My maiden visit to this establishment was characterized by an absence of elevated expectations, yet it culminated in a remarkably positive experience. The sandwich I procured, specifically a submarine variety, possessed dimensions that were truly formidable, rendering it a Herculean task to consume in its entirety. Despite my initial skepticism regarding my ability to complete the task, the delectability of the aforementioned sub rendered it impossible to relinquish my grasp upon it, compelling me to persevere and ultimately vanquish the formidable foe that it presented. Furthermore, I was delighted to discover that this eatery boasts an expansive area designated for the parking of vehicles, located in the rear sector of the premises, thereby facilitating accessibility for patrons. Additionally, a diminutive purveyor of bagels, situated in close proximity to the main establishment, offers an array of delectable treats that complement the primary fare offered by this dining establishment.
this place is hard to find, but when you get there it's worth it, had the link, brisket, rib combo, was great.

"I have an immense fondness for this aquatic recreational facility. Its aesthetic appeal is truly captivating, and its spaciousness, despite being populated by a large number of individuals, did not convey a sense of confinement or discomfort. However, the beverages served at this establishment are exorbitantly priced, which is a common phenomenon among venues of this nature in the Las Vegas area. Fortunately, I only had to cover the cost of a single drink, but it is still perturbing to observe such inflated prices for potations in general. 

The gentleman stationed at the entrance, James, displayed a level of professionalism and courtesy that was refreshing, especially when compared to the demeanor of certain other individuals who often occupy similar positions at similar establishments. 

In conclusion, if one is seeking a diversionary venue offering a festive atmosphere and varied liquid refreshments in the city of Las Vegas, I would unhesitatingly endorse this particular locality. My associates and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves during our visit."

I have eaten here for both lunch and dinner. The food is always fresh and served relatively quickly no matter what time of day you visit. The staff has always been friendly and informative.

Typical AYCE sushi rules apply (no sharing with non/AYCE guests, don't waste the rice, you have approximately an hour to eat, etc.)

Some favorites: Crab roll, 911, Friday 13th v Jason, Spider roll, spiderman, cowgirl, japanese lasagna...there are so many to choose from


This is a small place so you could end up waiting for a table in the evening hours. The good thing is, the service remains at all time high because they can only serve so many people at once. If you can't get a table, order to-go! It's made fresh when you order it, unlike the cold dry sushi that you get at RA!

"Indulged in an edible indulgence with my miniature companion at an establishment purporting to specialize in delectable baked goods; however, our gastronomical excursion proved to be somewhat disappointing due to an absence of suitable seating arrangements, which precluded us from partaking of our delicious treats on the premises (a solitary, diminutive table did little to alleviate this inconvenience). Perused the menu and discovered a palette of flavors that, while not unremarkable, failed to elicit an overwhelming sense of enthusiasm: red velvet, chocolate, birthday cake, yellow cake, Oreo, German chocolate, and peanut butter cup. All items were pre-prepared, thus eliminating the possibility of customization. Notwithstanding, the cupcakes boasted an agreeable texture, replete with a copious amount of sugary icing. My personal preference leaned toward the chocolate variety, although a faint bitterness tempered my enjoyment. Further dissatisfaction ensued upon discovering an utter lack of potables (a simple glass of water would have sufficed during sweltering summer days). In conclusion, while the cupcakes proved satisfactory, they fell short of exceptional quality. Nevertheless, the business is likely to flourish given its advantageous location."

It required a considerable amount of time to complete the process of obtaining a new tire, approximately one and a half hours, during which the employees were diligently working at their maximum capacity. Furthermore, I was impressed by the fact that the staff member at the counter did not attempt to persuade me to purchase the costliest tires available, instead, he provided me with sound advice, suggesting that a more affordable option was, in fact, superior to the priciest selection.

My offspring procured the Pechuga ala Plancha, which was utterly phenomenal. My female progeny had a quesadilla that she thoroughly enjoyed. The flesh in my tacos was delectable, yet somewhat desiccated, rendering them slightly arduous to consume. My alcoholic beverage and supplementary guacamole were also quite palatable. \n\nI have been a resident of Madison for over a dozen years and was previously unaware of this establishment's existence in this secluded location. I shall unquestionably return.

"Unexpectedly superior in quality, the brisket boasted an impressive depth of flavor and succulent texture that thoroughly impressed my palate. In contrast, the ribs were merely adequate, failing to live up to my expectations. Despite this, I would not advocate for dining at this establishment, as the meat requires a certain level of manual dexterity and a willingness to relinquish one's inhibitions regarding neatness. However, the macaroni and cheese presented a delightfully creamy consistency. Although the dishes lacked the desired temperature, I did not hold high hopes for their thermal properties. Ultimately, while the experience proved satisfying, the cost was somewhat prohibitive."

I'd read about Pop's in LV Weekly awhile ago and when the Groupon for this place popped up, we seized the opportunity and ventured over to Decatur to check it out.  I was surprised to discover it was an outdoor establishment with no indoor seating, and wasn't sure what to expect since the place doesn't look like much at first glance. \n\nBut looks can be deceiving, and I was VERY impressed with the food -- everything is made to order, so even though we sat outside in the 60 degree evening to eat our phillies at one of the tables, the food was piping hot.  I liked that they had a few options for cheese since I'm not a cheese whiz fan, so I got provolone instead with peppers and onions and it was delish.  My boyfriend got the same and we shared the crunchy fried green beans with marinara sauce, which were very good.  Portions were pretty big so you definitely get a lot of food for your money.  I'd definitely go here again!

This place was highly recommended to me and as an American I was naive, I walked in on a Friday night after drinks and appetizers with some friends.  And load and behold there was a seat at the bar no wait, elbow to elbow with a local with her cycling helmet and a gentlemen dressed in a finely tailored suit.  And I am wearing a shorts and a t-shirt (us Americans are so horrible at dressing up while on vacation.

The service overall was really good, traditionally trained bartenders dishing out fine wines and suggestions for diners.  This place is straight up traditional, with the right food, service, and ambiance.  For me I had a glass of red wine and the duck confit salad, I am not normally a salad kind of guy, but I did not regret getting the salad.  The duck was seasoned well, the meat was moist, the greens were fresh (this is the end of August by the way) and the balance of the bitters and the sweets of the greens and the sweet meat was on point.

This is one salad I would eat again, but there are so many other great things on the menu if I was to go here again.

"Consequently, I believe I have arrived at a comprehensive understanding of the situation: Stoney's offers an economical and enjoyable dining experience, particularly during football games, with a diverse selection of tacos and beverages available at reasonable prices. However, it is essential to note that the quality of the food, service, and overall value may not meet expectations, especially when compared to other establishments in the area. Furthermore, while the atmosphere may be suitable for casual gatherings or social events, it may not be the most ideal setting for a formal dining experience. Nonetheless, I would not hesitate to visit Stoney's again, perhaps on a Monday afternoon, when the ambiance is more relaxed, and the prices are still affordable, allowing me to indulge in their modestly priced menu options while enjoying a few drinks."

"My patronage of this establishment is primarily motivated by my yearning for the quintessential izakaya experience, rather than the culinary offerings. As a former resident of Japan, I have a deep-seated affection for the convivial atmosphere that such establishments provide, and thus, my visits to Ichiza are largely driven by my desire to recapture that sentimental essence. 

While the cuisine served here may not be exceptional by the standards of a high-end izakaya in Japan, it is, nonetheless, comparable to the quality one might expect from a typical, run-of-the-mill izakaya in the motherland. It is worth noting, however, that the prevalence of five-star reviews on this platform may be attributed, in part, to the fact that many reviewers have perhaps not had the privilege of dining at a more refined izakaya in Japan, thereby rendering their culinary expectations somewhat less discerning. 

In terms of the food itself, I would assign three stars, as it falls short of the exquisite flavors and presentation that I have had the pleasure of experiencing at other esteemed Japanese eateries. However, the hospitality extended by the staff merits unreserved praise, warranting a rating of five stars. The ambiance, imbued with a convivial spirit, earns four stars, rounded up from three and a half, if only for its successful evocation of the quintessential izakaya ambiance that I have grown accustomed to. 

In conclusion, while Ichiza may not be the optimal destination for those seeking a truly exceptional Japanese culinary adventure, it remains an excellent venue for socializing with companions over a frosty beverage or two, amidst a warm and welcoming atmosphere."

Enjoyed breakfast in this place very much. Warm and cosy. Great espresso, delicious breakfast sandwiches (we had a \"Biker's Dream\", and it was amazing!) And, they have wine and \"alcohol infused\" coffee drinks! What a find. Next time we're in Madison in need of caffeine, this is the only place on the list. \n\nThey do however need to seriously consider cleaning or replacing their carpet

During my recent sojourn in Las Vegas, I opted to lodge at this establishment, and while it may not have been the most extravagant abode, it proved to be a satisfactory temporary dwelling. Despite the unfavorable critiques I perused prior to my stay, I decided to take a chance and was ultimately gratified by my decision. The lodging itself presented no remarkable features, yet our chamber was adequately sanitized upon our arrival, and parking posed no significant obstacle. Although locating a parking space may require some additional time upon returning in the evening, the process of checking in and out was uncomplicated and efficient. Considering their reasonably priced rates, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future.

Stonecreek is a nice place to play, and the price is fair.  I do like the layout.  Fun but not gimmicky.  The scenery is nice, too.

I will have to agree with others about the ball vacuum (aka creek) running right through the middle of the course.  

The staff also seemed nice enough when I was there.  I'm not sure what others were complaining about.  Overall, it's a decent place to play, and its location makes it ideal if you're meeting people from the other side of town.

"Culinary excellence, expedited service, amicable staff, copious quantities of comestibles, and reasonable tariffs characterize this esteemed dining establishment. The piquant hot and sour soup, while possessing a discernible fiery quality, does not overwhelm the palate to the extent that the various ingredients become indistinguishable. For two individuals, the Family combination, priced at $11.95 per person, constitutes a sufficient quantity of nourishment, comprising a triad of soup, egg roll, and crab puff appetizers, accompanied by mildly seasoned broccoli chicken and zesty Mongolian beef, in addition to a serving of rice, yielding surplus provisions suitable for consumption the following day."

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive array of delectable sushi options, all of which are meticulously crafted to order, ensuring an unparalleled freshness and quality. Furthermore, the menu showcases an impressive diversity, catering to a wide range of palates and preferences. The prompt and attentive service only enhances the dining experience, making it a truly exceptional culinary adventure. While the rolls are undoubtedly the stars of the show, other notable delights include the savory baked mussels and Ahi Poki, both of which are capable of eliciting an unrelenting craving. Although a prolonged waiting period may occasionally be encountered, the ensuing satisfaction unequivocally justifies the delay. In light of its merits, an expansion of this eatery would be a judicious decision, allowing a greater number of patrons to partake in the culinary splendor that is Sushi Mon.

"I decided to indulge in a frozen dessert and entered the establishment, whereupon I was pleasantly taken aback by the exceptional caliber of the product; specifically, the rich, velvety texture and burst of flavors that exploded in my mouth with each bite left me utterly satisfied, and the prompt and attentive demeanor exhibited by the staff further enhanced my overall experience, rendering it truly delightful."

"Optimize your visitation experience by prioritizing the libational ambiance rather than the culinary offerings, as the latter may not conform to gastronomical expectations. An expansive outdoor area, replete with multiple televisions and cornhole facilities, serves as an idyllic setting for social gatherings. Restrict your interior presence to the necessities, such as utilizing the lavatory facilities, as the indoor space may not be aesthetically arresting. Partake in the trivia festivities on Wednesday evenings at 8 pm for an enjoyable diversion, complemented by reasonable beverage prices (draughts at $3) and burger specials, albeit the latter may not be a gustatory highlight. Anticipate difficulties in parking, but alternative options exist across the street. In summary, this venue offers a convivial atmosphere for liquid refreshment, yet do not anticipate a delectable repast."

"I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions during my formative years, specifically during my high school tenure. The fond memories I have accumulated here are largely attributed to the delectable subs and, as I recall, a satisfactory soup selection as well. The French fries served here are undoubtedly among the most exceptional I have had the pleasure of consuming, and the inclusion of sweet potato fries as an alternative is indeed a thoughtful gesture. 

As I have matured and my visits to this eatery have become less frequent (owing to my departure from Pittsburgh for academic pursuits), my thoughts have begun to dwell on certain aspects of the dining experience offered here. Specifically, I have wondered whether vegetarian options are available, and I must admit that the practice of charging for refills of soft drinks has struck me as somewhat peculiar. Furthermore, I have noticed that nearly every component of the meals served here, including the fries, meat, and even the bread, appears to be imbued with a noticeable amount of grease. While the absence of debit card acceptance may present a minor inconvenience, the proximity of two banks in opposite directions mitigates this issue to a certain extent. 

In summary, while not perfect, this restaurant remains a respectable choice, boasting an array of palatable subs that continue to attract a predominantly youthful clientele. Were I to assign a rating, I would lean towards a 3.5-star assessment, albeit restricted by the limitations of the available rating system."

Since my daughters favorite food is sushi, this place has become a regular place for us. We've been coming here for a couple years now and love it. The staff is nice, and the food is good! The specials are almost always a welcome surprise! \nWe can always count on getting a quick bite no matter what time.

If you enjoy walking around outside and shopping this is the place to do it. There are several clothing stores and specialty shops. Town Square also offers a movie theater, bars, lounges, and restaurants.

It is easily accessible from the expressway and from the Blvd. There is ample parking around the perimeter, if you can't find any metered parking inside the square.

Most of my trips to Town Square are to Whole Foods. It is one of the largest Whole Foods in the area. I also make a trip down to Texas de Brasil every so often.

It is absolutely a great place to eat, drink, and shop. I definitely recommend taking a trip to Town Square.

"The arena's proximity to the hotel accommodations renders it an extremely practical and time-efficient venue for guests seeking entertainment, but unfortunately, the temperature within the facility is quite chilly, which may pose a minor inconvenience for certain individuals. Furthermore, the event staff adheres stringently to rules regarding audience movement during active gameplay, only permitting passage to designated seating areas during brief interludes or stoppages in play, which some patrons may find somewhat restrictive or rigid in comparison to the more relaxed atmosphere of a traditional theatrical setting. Additionally, lengthy queues for restrooms and concessions were observed, which may have caused minor delays or inconvenience for some attendees."

"Gourmet burgers, an epicurean delight, boasting unconventional pairings, tantalized my taste buds (specifically, the Rising Sun burger, which I had the pleasure of savoring, and a sample of my companion's Gold Standard).  Artisanal steak fries, possessing a delightful texture, characterized by a fluffy interior and a satisfying crunch on the exterior, complemented the delectable patties.  An extensive array of artisan brews further enhanced the dining experience. \n\nDespite the exorbitant prices ubiquitous in Las Vegas, the cost, including gratuity, for a gastronomic adventure consisting of premium burgers and specialty beverages, proved to be a reasonable $27 per individual."

"I experience a profound sense of longing for Katz's, and I am unapologetic about this sentiment. The minuscule, grimy spoon provided a palliative to my hangover-induced affliction on a sluggish Sunday morning. Postino, however, has transformed the aged edifice into an impressive establishment through its resourceful adaptation of construction materials. The unconventional application of building components manifests itself in an aesthetically pleasing manner, such as the red trusses that serve purely ornamental purposes. Although the cost may be slightly elevated, it is advisable to allocate your financial resources towards experiencing the delightful offerings of Postino. To optimize your visit, consider providing your contact information, registering for their email list, taking advantage of happy hour, and capitalizing on special evenings (Tuesdays and Thursdays are particularly well-attended). If your party consists of three or more individuals, prepare to endure a brief delay. However, the wait is justified by the delectable goat cheese and roasted red pepper bruschetta, accompanied by a refreshing glass of sparkling wine. The outdoor seating area, despite its proximity to the parking lot, exudes an air of charm. Additionally, the friendly valets are available to assist you, unless the time falls outside the parameters of reasonably late or early. Patrons of Postino tend to adorn themselves in stylish attire, contributing to an atmosphere of opulence. Embrace this ambiance by donning your fashionable footwear, such as Sam Edelman keyhole peeptoes, and savoring a generous glass of robust red wine with subtle hints of bologna in its flavor profile."

"This eatery formerly bore the name Rainbow Pho, up until the moment when one of its servers opted to procure the entire establishment, thereby prompting a shift in its nomenclature. Pho Annie boasts an impressive array of delectable options, catering to diverse palates by offering both pho and grilled meats, such as pork chops, for patrons to relish. Conveniently situated on the western side of town, it caters specifically to the culinary inclinations of those residing in that locality, affectionately referred to as 'west side peepz.' Upon entering, my companion and I opted to sample their Chicken Pho, while I supplemented my order with a serving of grilled lamb chops accompanied by rice and a fried egg. To initiate our dining experience, we indulged in fresh Vietnamese wraps as an appetizer. Our culinary creations were truly sublime, and the hospitality we received was warm and welcoming, as the staff greeted us with a smile and acknowledged us as regular patrons, rendering our visit an thoroughly enjoyable one and leaving us without any significant cause for complaint."

I recently discovered this place and it is right around the corner from my office.  I love the jalapeno cilantro hummus.  What combination!  I don't love that they charge you for extra pita.  It feels like a bad commercial (remember the got milk commercials where the guy thinks he's in heaven and is stuffing his face with cookies only to find out there is no milk?) but I guess it's a jungle out there trying to get pita.  Maybe my expectation is too high and shouldn't assume you can have another piece of pita bread for your hummus.  At any rate, I've been here a few times now and would recommend the place.  They have a guava lemonade that really is refreshing and I have to give a least for stars for that.  They gyros are also great.

"The pizza served at the second establishment was of exceptional quality, rivaled only by the superior culinary offerings of the flagship location in the city's central business district. Notwithstanding its comparative inferiority, the pizza at this satellite venue still managed to impress, boasting an array of flavorsome toppings and a crispy, well-cooked crust. Furthermore, the spaciousness of the shopping mall in which it was situated made parking a decidedly straightforward affair, devoid of the customary congestion and inconvenience typically associated with peak dining hours. Indeed, upon arriving at the establishment in the late afternoon on a Saturday, we were pleasantly surprised to find the premises nearly deserted, thereby obviating the need for an interminable wait before being seated and served."

We went to Steak 44 before going to a concert. It was a Wednesday night and the place was jammed. We were seated at a two top by the fireplace near the bar. We ordered the calamari to start. Nice big rings, not greasy. I had the filet which came out on the sizzling hot plate. Delicious. Hubby got the scallops. Also very good. We shared the baked creamed spinach which was really good. The baked potatoes..just ok. Sides are a little smaller than Mastro's but priced accordingly. Our server Matthew was excellent. We will be back!

"The ambiance within Brass Monkey surpasses that of any other public house I have had the pleasure of visiting in Edinburgh. Following a morning of academic endeavors or an examination, I often partake in their hospitable offerings, indulging in their extensive selection of beverages and savoring the relaxed atmosphere in the secluded rear chamber, adorned with plush cushions and mattresses. Although slumber is strictly prohibited, the allure of repose is almost irresistible, especially when accompanied by a refreshing pint. Their culinary offerings are equally impressive, with sandwiches being a particular highlight, complemented by reasonably priced beverages. The front room boasts an intimate setting, characterized by limited seating options, thereby creating an atmosphere that is both cozy and vibrant. However, the scarcity of tables can sometimes result in standing room only, which, while not necessarily detracting from the overall experience, may lead to a sense of crowding and discomfort. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, Brass Monkey presents itself as a charming and economical alternative to the more conventional, sprawling public houses in Edinburgh, rendering it an establishment worthy of a visit, regardless of the occasion."

"The initial experience at this establishment was satisfactory, with the culinary offerings being of considerable quality, specifically the pho, which was skillfully prepared and the broth was flavorful. However, the customer service left much to be desired, as I had to physically rise from my seat to request both the bill and a to-go container. It would have been more preferable to have the option to place an order and make payment in advance, thereby ensuring a swifter and more efficient process, especially considering the fact that there was only a single individual handling the cash register and attending to various tasks, thus detracting from the overall customer experience typically associated with a sit-down restaurant. Notwithstanding, I shall return and recommend this venue to others."

"An exceptional morning meal venue... Recommendation: The Lumberjack, proffering palatable and dependable culinary offerings, presents itself as a markedly upgraded substitute to dining at establishments such as Denny's or IHOP, albeit the latter two eateries have not been patronized by this writer in a couple of years. Of note, an oscillating preference between Good Egg and Waffle House (indeed, occasional indulgence in unpretentious fare remains a staple) prevails."

"My personal inclination would be to refrain from indulging in any other Thai culinary establishments situated on the westernmost island, as this particular venue excels in offering an unparalleled gastronomical experience, with each dish showcasing an unmistakable emphasis on freshness and flavor, thereby surpassing the majority of local eateries by a considerable margin."

"Ah, indeed, an exclamation of unadulterated delight! These tacos, a culinary masterpiece, have ignited my gastronomical fervor, as they embody the quintessence of authenticity. Hailing from 'La Villita,' a Chicagoan enclave renowned for its rich cultural heritage, I unequivocally assert my credentials as a taco connoisseur. These delectable morsels, crafted with meticulous attention to detail, tantalize my taste buds with their freshness, flavor, and unwavering commitment to traditional Mexican culinary practices. Initially, my expectations were tempered, given Las Vegas's checkered history in delivering genuine taco experiences. Nonetheless, my skepticism was pleasantly surprised by the superior quality of these tacos. While the price point may seem steep at $2 per unit, I assure you, dear aficionado, that the value proposition is well worth the investment. My gustatory exploration led me to sample two varieties: the taco de tripitas, featuring succulent fried tripe, and the taco de carne adobada, a dish reminiscent of al pastor in its nuanced flavor profile. Both iterations showcased an unwavering dedication to the craft, eliciting an unbridled sense of gastronomical euphoria. The anticipation, as I patiently waited for these edible works of art to be fashioned before my very eyes, only heightened the sensory experience, culminating in an unforgettable gustatory adventure."

A great value for a clean car; this is a no frills place.

There's no  line of people waiting to clean, wax, and polish your car; as such, no one trying to up sell you a new wind shield or $100 detailing service. The employees simply ask what you would like and send you on through the wash. 

**Note, if you have an older vehicle with a metal antenna, be sure to detach it before entering the wash.**

I used to get the $2 wash until I decided to step up to the $5 wash last week. I was plesantly surprised when I saw my wheels were clean when I bent down to wipe them off - this you don't get with the $2 wash. 

They have free vacuum stations for all their customers. If your willing to spend a few extra min doing the vacuuming and wiping down your dash yourself, you get just as good of a wash or better than the full service car washes that you spend $20 on.

Theres usually no (or a very short) line of people waiting to wash their car. In general, you're in and out within 15 - 20 minutes.

"It is regrettable that the complimentary tortilla chips and salsa were of such superior quality that we overindulged to the extent that our capacity for consuming our entrees was severely diminished. Notwithstanding, the culinary offerings themselves possessed an undeniable flavorfulness, as I opted for the chicken mole, my spouse selected the chingalingas, and our progeny sampled selections from the children's menu. Our server, Sara, exhibited exceptional proficiency in her role, as she graciously offered to exchange one of the juvenile portions upon the request of our child, who subsequently devoured the entirety of it and expressed satisfaction with its piquancy. Having partaken of sustenance at this establishment previously, we have deduced that the optimal manner in which to thoroughly appreciate the ambiance of this eatery is by occupying an outdoor table during temperate weather conditions and avoiding peak hours when private gatherings may be present."

This was one of the quickest, most efficient airports I've ever been in. Most of the check in and security process is fairly automated and extremely streamlined. There was no line to check in, and security only took about 5 minutes. No hassle whatsoever. This gave us plenty of time to sit and eat a small breakfast before the flight. Passengers are also treated to two hours of free wifi in the terminal. Fantastic!

"The culinary offerings were delectable, savory, and fresh; however, the portions were diminutive and the prices were somewhat prohibitive, yet still worth the indulgence. Our server exhibited forgetfulness towards the conclusion of our dining experience. Throughout most of the meal, the waitstaff demonstrated attentiveness and each server who delivered our courses was well-versed in their knowledge of the menu. We sampled the grilled scallops, fried squid, spicy tuna, glazed ribs, and salmon nigiri; the spicy tuna and glazed ribs, particularly when complemented with a squeeze of lime juice, were the standouts. Unfortunately, an error in billing resulted in a charge of $366 being applied to my card, rather than the expected $149 for the evening's repast. Despite this inconvenience, I would still consider returning due to the exceptional quality of the cuisine."

So I enjoy places like this.  We went here for lunch and although it was slow we were not greeted at the door and pointed in any direction.  We kind of wandered around and checked out the selection for a minute before someone told us we could sit wherever we liked.  It was $9.99 for lunch which I thought was a little steep for a place like this but it was nice with big booths.  I made myself some broccoli chicken with onions and mushrooms and then used the recipe off the wall to make a mongolian sauce for my stir fry.   The weak point of this place is they don't have a lot of sauces.  I've been to some similar places that have a much better sauce selection.  The people were nice and the food was great though.

"Although I have not had the misfortune of encountering any issues with Cox thus far, I shall proceed by initiating my installation process; the technicians were not only cordial but also demonstrated remarkable efficiency in their work, completing all tasks expeditiously and accurately, prior to bidding me adieu; I contacted their customer service department on a Thursday, and owing to my residence being a newly-constructed property, it was necessary for them to dispatch an individual to assess the development's suitability for their services, which was accomplished the following day; subsequently, my appointment was scheduled for two days thereafter, culminating in a seamless, hassle-free experience; currently, I am enjoying a stable internet connection, and my high-definition television is functioning optimally, with customer service interactions having been satisfactory, thereby leading me to harbor a positive sentiment towards the services I have received."

"HAZE epitomizes the quintessential nightlife experience, and it's imperative to secure a table prior to indulging in the merriment, as this diminutive yet pulsating venue adheres stringently to the principle of limited capacity. The musical offerings at HAZE are truly exceptional, with Thursday evenings serving as the optimal time to partake in the revelry, courtesy of the establishment's esteemed industry night. The luminosity within the premises is utterly captivating, and those who elect to enhance their sensory perception via certain substances will undoubtedly relish the visual spectacle presented here. Furthermore, the performances by the resident go-go dancers/models are characterized by their elaborate attire, which contributes significantly to the overall ambiance of the venue. Ultimately, HAZE manifests as a microcosmic rave, wherein the PLUR (Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect) ethos permeates the atmosphere."

"Initially, it is imperative to acknowledge that this establishment does not proffer an optimal dining experience, as the ambiance is not a primary focus. Rather, it is recommended to visit this restaurant with the expectation of savoring their delectable cuisine, specifically their exceptional Pad Thai, which is served in generous portions and prepared promptly at a reasonable cost."

"A culinary escapade that transcends the limitations of linguistic expression, rendering any attempt at articulating its splendor an exercise in futility, reminiscent of the preceding review's sentiment. An unassuming, bucolic abode nestled within a diminutive park, fostering an atmosphere of rural seclusion while being mere meters away from the bustling city center. Our dining area was situated in close proximity to the kitchen, affording us an unobstructed view of the two youthful culinary artists diligently preparing the delectable fare. The hospitality of the serving staff was warm and inviting. Each course was thoughtfully paired with a wine selection that complemented the flavors and textures of the dishes, creating a harmonious symphony of taste and aroma. The ingredients, sourced locally and freshly procured, were expertly incorporated into each plate, resulting in a culinary masterclass that defied any notion of a traditional'meal.' The convivial ambiance facilitated a most enjoyable evening, shared with a dear companion, and the only minor inconvenience encountered was negotiating the compact exit, which, though presenting a brief challenge, did not detract from the overall pleasure of the dining experience. When in Edinburgh, a visit to this gastronomic haven is imperative."

Windsor ranks among my preferred establishments for after-work socializing, owing to its exceptional beverages, particularly the #89, which boasts an unparalleled flavor profile that never fails to satiate my craving for a delectable drink. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at this venue are also worthy of commendation, with the kale salad being a notable highlight that impresses even the most discerning palates.

Another solid 4 stars for this place.  Yeah it is dead, but that's one of the things I like about it.  I love coming here and relaxing and listening to the off-beat jazz or satellite music they have.  It is so much different than the "busy" atmosphere of Pin Kaow.  And way cheaper too.

I also love the $5.00 lunch special!  I think a lot of the reviews who say it takes forever to eat are really, really hungry.  I'm in and out of here in 30-45 minutes.  

Come and enjoy it!  All the curries and soups I've had here are really good!  Support Silverado Ranch businesses :)

Top notch coffee and espresso here with polite staff, and my goodness I sincerely hope this is the new norm of having draft beers at a coffee shop.  Amazing.  High marks for the aforementioned reasons.  However I just don't care for much of the customer base here, especially the younger kids who seem to occupy the limited table space for lengthy periods of time.  Rather have the mid career to older demographic at many restaurants in this area.  Parking can be challenging at times as well, but that's not surprising for the area.

Nice place to shop for fresh produce and good food. One catch though you have to be your own cashier and bagger, then the light flashes when there is an error with the system, and you have to ask the attendant for help. You can sign up for their Fresh and Easy Card there, for extra discounts. Their new store will be opening on Fort Apache soon too !

I remember coming here when it was New York New York, the vibe is just as great. The patio makes 5801 perfect spot for late night drinks on a gorgeous summer night.\n\nThe bartenders are wonderful and so are the patrons. I have yet to make it out for bingo but it's definitely on my to do list!

This eatery boasts an unparalleled culinary experience, with their delectable cheesesteaks being the paramount attraction. Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by the aroma of expertly cooked meat and freshly baked bread, which served as a harbinger of the gastronomical delight that was to follow. The texture of the bread was optimally balanced between softness and firmness, thereby creating the perfect vessel for the savory steak and abundant toppings that adorned it. Furthermore, the menu offered an array of options, allowing patrons to customize their cheesesteak according to their individual preferences, including various types of cheese, vegetables, and sauces. My personal preference involves ordering the steak 'wit' provolone, peppers, and onions, as it affords me the opportunity to sample the full gamut of flavors that this dish has to offer. In conclusion, my craving for a genuine Philly-style cheesesteak was more than satisfied by this exceptional establishment, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

"Upon encountering some difficulties while navigating the website, I opted to establish communication with a customer service representative, who, much to my delight, proved to be remarkably accommodating and helpful in addressing my concerns. Despite the somewhat obscure location of the menu on the website (positioned above the brunch menu), I managed to peruse its offerings and selected the Om burger, which, I must say, was an unmitigated culinary triumph. In addition, I elected to pair my meal with an order of kale chips, a decision that ultimately proved to be a salubrious choice. My experience with Fern has piqued my interest in their other offerings, compelling me to return and partake in a more leisurely dining experience, taking full advantage of the restaurant's captivating ambiance."

"Having partaken in culinary indulgences at this establishment on two separate occasions in the past year, I must confess that my gastronomical expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed by the delectable offerings presented before me. From the initial assortment of appetizers to the principal courses and finally, the sweet conclusions, each dish showcased an unwavering commitment to quality and flavor. Furthermore, the wine list boasted an impressive array of selections sure to satisfy even the most discerning oenophile. However, it is worth noting that 5Church has acquired a reputation as a venue where the city's trendy denizens congregate to display their meticulously curated aesthetics, resulting in an ambiance that some might describe as affected or pretentious. The waitstaff, in particular, seem to embody this self-conscious hipster ethos, their attire and demeanor bordering on caricature. Nevertheless, if one can overlook these superficial distractions, the edible delights available at this eatery are undeniably worthy of consideration for those seeking a satisfying dining experience in the heart of Charlotte."

Ordered to go. Asked for cold veggies on the side. Did not dissappoint. Got our burgers home, thirty seconds in the microwave and it was as if they had just come off of the grill. Yum!\n\nGot the fries. Really tasty, but kind of frustrating. They are so thin. You have to grab four in order to get any ketchup to stick to them.

The moment you walk in it smells amazing! I loved the MGM's signature smell. We stayed in the Grand Tower, our room was neat, clean, and looked great. The restroom was clean, and looked fairly new. Whatever you do, don't remove the drinks that are in the refrigerator, not even to take a picture because the fridge has a timer. Overall, it was a great experience, Jason checked us out, he was very pleasant and friendly.

"As a neophyte to the culinary delights of Pittsburgh, I was eager to indulge in an exceptional iteration of pierogies, and thus, I opted to sample the traditional potato and sauerkraut variant, in addition to the pizza pierogies, which were highly recommended by the proprietor. Furthermore, I decided to share a Reuben-like sandwich, whose name escapes me at present, with my dining companion. While the pierogies were undoubtedly palatable, I must admit that I was slightly disappointed in their overall quality, as they failed to meet the exceedingly high expectations I had established in my mind. Notwithstanding, I must commend the establishment for its commitment to utilizing premium ingredients and its dedication to crafting its own corned beef, an aspect that truly resonated with me during my conversation with the owner."

Awesome little record store. I could easily spend an hour perusing their new and used selections. I could spend another hour (at least) exploring their various listening stations. I could then spend an additional half-hour finding little neon-colored stickers that tell of upcoming local shows.\n\nI agree with John V. Long live the record store!

"Upon entering this establishment, I was taken aback by the diverse array of beverages available at a reasonable cost. The strawberry banana flavor was quite palatable, however, the milk tea did not particularly appeal to my taste buds. The customer service was prompt and courteous, as I received my order in a mere two minutes and the portion sizes were generous for the price. It is intriguing that this business has chosen to operate in such a location, given its distance from Chinatown and the fact that it does not appear to be an area where consumers would typically seek out boba. Nonetheless, the popularity of this venue was evident, as a group of ten adolescents had gathered there as I was departing. While I would rate this establishment five stars for its quality and value in Las Vegas, it falls somewhat short of the exceptional standards set by certain establishments in San Francisco, thereby warranting a rating of four stars in my assessment."
Had a great dinner last night for restaurant week. Filet was great, the added lobster was a bit over done but still tasty. Service was terrific! Way to go Ruth Chris staff

"Dexter's provided an unexpectedly delightful experience during a recent Friday fish fry excursion. The ambiance of the establishment exuded a welcoming and convivial charm, characteristic of a well-frequented neighborhood bar. The diversity of their beer selection was impressive, with a rotation of distinctive and eclectic offerings, including a particularly memorable Lagunitas Hairy Eyeball. The culinary prowess of the fish dishes was remarkable, with both the cod and walleye options boasting a masterful balance of flavors and textures. Notably, the batter was applied with a deft touch, yielding a golden-brown crispness that complemented the tenderness of the fish without overpowering it. Furthermore, the waffle and brew fries accompanying the meal were cooked to a satisfying crisps, adding a delightful contrast in texture to the dish. Remarkably, even after consuming a considerable quantity of deep-fried cuisine, I did not experience any unpleasant aftereffects. A sincere expression of gratitude is extended to the staff at Dexter's for their role in facilitating my continued adherence to Catholic dietary practices. \n\nIt would be remiss not to acknowledge the exceptional quality of the service provided by the establishment. Following an unfortunate incident where our position in line was usurped, the staff graciously apologized and presented us with a complimentary spinach and artichoke dip appetizer, demonstrating their commitment to ensuring a positive dining experience for their patrons."

"Assuming that the culinary offerings are of an equal standard to the hospitality we have received thus far, I am inclined to believe that this establishment will become a personal favorite of mine. Furthermore, my dining companion and I opted to be seated at one of the elevated tables situated within the bar area, whereupon Terry, our attentive server, promptly presented us with an array of delectable options from which to choose."

"The Blue Parrot, an eatery nestled within the picturesque confines of Stockbridge, boasts an unconventional charm that permeates its culinary offerings and ambiance alike. My recent visit afforded me the opportunity to indulge in their delectable chicken and cashew chimichanga, a veritable cornucopia of juicy poultry, complemented by an accompanying broth that showcased the establishment's dedication to gastronomic excellence. Although service proved somewhat lacking in terms of attentiveness and responsiveness, the venue's unique conversion of cellar space into restrooms engendered a sense of novelty that, while potentially polarizing, undoubtedly enhances the overall dining experience. In conclusion, my foray into the realm of the Blue Parrot yielded a favorable impression, owing to the dual virtues of its savory fare and eclectic atmosphere; such that, should the craving for Mexican cuisine arise, I would unhesitatingly opt to return."
Great place for happy hour. Only four stars cuz the service is always hit or miss but the food has always been choice..

Pinky's garners four stars from this reviewer due to the fact that the cuisine is of an acceptable quality, the ambiance is thoroughly enjoyed, and an array of plant-based options are available, albeit not explicitly indicated on the primary menu. It is advisable to query the servers for the covert vegan menu, which contains an assortment of tofu dishes not listed on the standard bill of fare. On a previous visit, the waitstaff, having recognized this patron's predilection for vegan fare, presented a delectable tofu creation not featured on the regular menu, courtesy of the kitchen. Additionally, the establishment's chili, characterized by its robust flavor and spicy kick, is highly recommended (and, notably, vegan). Be prepared to experience a delay in seating, as the venue tends to attract a sizable crowd promptly at noon. Patrons can select from an array of satisfactory beverages, and the indoor/outdoor patio area is quite inviting. In conclusion, Pinky's offers a pleasant setting for socializing and enjoying a meal.

"Whoa indeed...meat in a sushi roll?!?! It seems almost oxymoronic, doesn't it?!?! Yet, there it was, staring me in the face, daring me to question its validity...the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll, if you will. And let me tell you, it was nothing short of a gastronomical revolution, a true culinary epiphany that left me in a state of utter disbelief and wonder. I mean, who would have thought to combine the rich, savory flavors of lamb with the delicate, subtle nuances of sushi?!?! It was truly a match made in culinary heaven, a symphony of flavors that danced on my palate with grace and finesse. And the presentation, my goodness, it was a work of art, a masterclass in plating and garnishing that would make even the most discerning chef weep with envy. But, alas, my dear friend, the experience was not without its drawbacks. The ambiance, while certainly energetic and vibrant, bordered on the excessive, with the cacophony of sounds threatening to overwhelm my senses at times. But, all things considered, it was a minor quibble, a fleeting inconvenience that did little to diminish the overall enjoyment of my dining experience. In conclusion, I must say that the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll at [Restaurant Name] is an absolute must-try for any adventurous foodie looking to broaden their culinary horizons. Just be sure to bring your appetite, and perhaps a pair of earplugs, just in case."

I debated on going here simply because it's such a touristy thing to do, but decided to go anyway.  I had a great time getting pictures and doing silly poses with most of the wax celebrities.  I went during the week so it wasn't that crowded...except the Michael Jackson figure had a line because each person was changing into Smooth Criminal costumes before taking their pictures.  Each wax figure pretty much looked like the celebrity.  Some capture the likeness so good that it's a bit freaky.  There are a few exhibits where staff try to tempt you into buying a copy of their picture.  It's pretty unnecessary if you have a camera or a decent cell phone camera.  

The only figure I was disappointed in was Cameron Diaz.  Hers seemed to make her look better than what I think she looks in person.  I think the Tupac figure had bullet wounds on his chest from when he was murdered; if true was a bit unnecessary considering there were no bullet wounds on JFK or Martin Luther King Jr.

NOTE:  It's $30 per person to get in.  Pick up a coupon book at the Monorail for a $5 off coupon or catch one of those guys on the sidewalk offering 50% off coupons.  Or Google an offer online before you make the trip to Vegas.  I checked in on Yelp and didn't see a special offer, but seems like there are coupons everywhere, so there should be no reason to pay full price to get in.

Came here yesterday evening while traveling for business.  I always do my homework on Yelp when on these trips to try and find local spots I might not always find by simply driving around.  I have to say I was not let down by the positive reviews.

The Emerald Curry was recommended to me as their best curry, and it really was a solid choice (and I have had a lot of curries).  They are not cheap on their portion size, and the service was friendly and prompt.  I love Thai curry, and seek it out wherever I go -- this curry was very nicely spiced (I like it pretty spicy) and it was loaded with vegetables, which makes me "feel" like I'm eating healthier ;)

I would definitely recommend, and will likely come back when I'm in town again -- it is good quality, reasonably priced, friendly service, and a nice, relaxed atmosphere right on the King Street strip.

This eatery is situated on the Strip side of the Palazzo, thus, taking advantage of the pleasant climate (a balmy 85 degrees Fahrenheit with abundant sunshine), we opted to be seated on the patio. As some individuals have pointed out, there are instances when one might prefer to dine indoors; however, the ambiance was surprisingly enjoyable for late May. My parents are residents of Las Vegas, and I have had the privilege of witnessing the Strip numerous times; nevertheless, the panorama from Morel's onto the Strip was truly breathtaking. I would highly advocate selecting a table on the patio for an optimal dining experience.

The service we received was satisfactory, and our server was meticulous in his attention to detail and exceptionally knowledgeable about the menu offerings. Acting on his fervent recommendation, we decided to sample the French onion soup, which proved to be a delectable and richly flavored culinary delight. My steak arrived shortly thereafter, and it was cooked to perfection, boasting the ideal level of juiciness. While I thoroughly relished every bite of my steak, I couldn't help but feel a twinge of regret for not opting for the macaroni and cheese, as it supposedly exceeded expectations and was utterly delectable, according to the accounts of others.

"This culinary establishment represents the sole location where I opt to acquire Pad Thai, as their Chicken Pad Thai manifests exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations and rendering it a personal favorite. Despite sampling similar dishes at various other eateries, including those that boast authentic Thai cuisine, none have been able to parallel the superior taste and presentation offered by Pei Wei's rendition of this popular dish."
Very good bagels with a hint of back east charm (small and a bit worn down).  Love the Sunflower bagels, not sure what makes it so tasty but Yum!!

I visited this establishment on two separate occasions during a single week, once for an evening meal and a subsequent time to partake in the nocturnal revelry at the club. Upon my initial visit for dinner, I would have rated this venue three stars, as the ambiance was pleasant, the service was satisfactory, and the cuisine was adequate, albeit unremarkable. However, my second visit to the club on a Wednesday evening proved to be a vastly superior experience.
