Despite the fact that many other clubs in the area were relatively quiet, this particular establishment was bustling with activity, boasting a vibrant atmosphere that was complemented by attentive servers who ensured that our needs were consistently met. The beverages were also quite palatable, although I must admit that the fact that I didn't have to pay for them myself may have slightly enhanced their flavor. All things considered, I would unquestionably return to this venue if I were to find myself in Las Vegas once again. Nonetheless, I might opt to explore alternative dining options prior to my next visit, as my previous experience with the restaurant left something to be desired. As a final note, I would advise potential patrons to exercise caution when utilizing the Roman-style sinks located in the hallway, as while they may be conveniently turned on for guests, they are unfortunately not stocked with paper towels for drying one's hands afterwards.

The chefs here may not have attended Le Cordon Bleu but make no mistake: the food is tasty, cheap, and comes out quick. The best part about this place is its status as neighborhood landmark and its extremely amiable staff. You feel like a regular in this place the first time you walk through the door. If you want to resist the invasion of franchises like McDonalds, Subway, etc, spend your hard earned money here. support these guys!

A hidden gem!  

We never knew this place existed and stumbled into it after lunch at Chino Bandito (next door).  They have all sorts of flavors of popcorn and are more than willing to let you sample them. Even some seasonal flavors. We were really excited about the Cake Batter flavor but we sampled it in the store and were a little disappointed in the lack of cake batter flavoring, too much spoiling by Cold Stone's ice cream flavor I guess.  

We took advantage of the bakers dozen deal on the small snack size bags so we could try lots of flavors, it was 13 bags for $11 (normally $1 each).  They were even willing to make us a bag of a flavor if we didn't see it in the small size. 

They have many more flavors than what's on their website, some of the ones we got were Churro, Bacon & Cheese, Cookies & Crème, Coconut, PB & Chocolate, Cherry Chocolate and Candy Bar.  

The store had lots of cute tins/gift ideas so next time you are trying to come up with a gift idea for someone, this might just be a great alternative option to the classic gift card.

"Upon arriving in Las Vegas subsequent to a prolonged automotive journey, I opted to visit this establishment on a Friday evening, capitalizing on the opportunity to avoid the throngs of people typically associated with peak hours. My strategy proved effective, as I was able to procure a prime position at the forefront of the queue, thereby enabling me to promptly place my order for a personalized pizza. The eatery operates under a unique concept, wherein patrons can create their own individualized pizza by selecting an unlimited number of toppings, all for a fixed price. Additionally, a diverse array of sauces is available for customers to choose from. The staff members manning the counter exhibited remarkable cordiality and were eager to offer assistance with any queries or concerns that arose. 

As for the culinary experience itself, I must say that it was quite satisfying. I opted for the meat lovers variant, augmenting it with jalapenos for an additional burst of flavor. The pizza was crafted employing an exceptionally thin crust, which yielded a delightfully crunchy texture upon consumption. Furthermore, I added a subtle drizzle of garlic to the periphery of the crust, thus enhancing its inherent flavor. The freshness of the toppings was undeniable, and the combination of ingredients blended together harmoniously. 

Based on my positive experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to my acquaintances and loved ones seeking a convenient and delectable pizza destination."

"Excellent patron assistance; however, I had to reiterate my order thrice due to an apparent lack of comprehension regarding the simplicity of inputting a single numerical value accompanied by a spicy poultry dish and macaroni and cheese. Furthermore, during my visit, a staff member emerged to perform floor-sweeping duties, which, while commendable in terms of maintaining a tidy environment, was somewhat marred by the individual's posterior proximity to my table on multiple occasions. Notwithstanding this minor infraction, the culinary offerings were generally satisfying, particularly the biscuits, which featured a subtle honey glaze that added a pleasant dimension to their flavor profile. Additionally, the piquant fowl dish caused a noticeable nasal discharge, a positive indicator of its spicy veracity, while the macaroni and cheese dish was similarly enjoyable. It is worth mentioning that the absence of a single ear of corn did not significantly detract from the overall quality of my dining experience."

As noted in previous reviews, Trader Joe's has a large variety of specialty, hard to find, and/or natural/organic items. I do enjoy walking the aisles to find new and interesting products. The specialty ravioli is one of my favorites as well as the all natural desserts. However, what other reviews failed to mention was the natural cleaning products. The main reason I stop at Trader Joe's is for the chlorine free paper products and natural cleaing products especially the laundry detergent. Chlorine free/recycled paper products seem to be hard to find in the stores. Giant Eagle Market District used to carry some Seventh Generation paper products but they haven't had any for well over a year. Before Trader Joe's, if I had to order all of my paper products online to be delivered. Now, I can find good quality, chlorine free, recycled paper towels, napkins and toilet paper for a great value at a local store. Their laundry detergent is also less expensive than the other name brands like Seventh Generation or Method but it works just as well. Yay Trader Joe's for helping me keep my family healthy and clean with less toxins!

"This culinary establishment is of exceptional quality, possessing an ambiance reminiscent of the illustrious city of New York, and is conveniently located in close proximity to our humble abode, thus rendering it an ideal destination for a delectable dining experience. My spouse and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their gastronomical offerings on multiple occasions, and we have been consistently impressed by the superior quality of the fare and the exceptional level of service proffered by the staff."

"The culinary offerings were of an exceptionally high quality, a sentiment that was echoed by my companion and I as we relished every bite of our meal. Furthermore, the hospitality we received was also commendable, as the staff exhibited a proficiency in their duties that was truly impressive. Additionally, the cost of the alcoholic beverage we consumed, specifically the lager, was astonishingly reasonable, almost to the point of being inconceivable. As for the menu items we sampled, they were akin to a gastronomical odyssey, with each dish more delectable than the last. For instance, the Teutonic-style potato strips we ordered were imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile that was simply sublime, while the humongous pretzel we shared was nothing short of a gastronomical tour de force, its sheer size and succulent texture making it a veritable feast for the senses."

Love The Greene House. Especially the Sunday special with half off bottles of wine!

The fish + chips is to die for. So so good. 
And, just about every single appetizer on the menu is delicious!

"It is truly unfortunate that there isn't a Whole Foods Market located in close proximity to our current residence in Surprise, Arizona, as their offerings of organic and natural products align with our personal preferences and dietary requirements. However, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that a local establishment offered comparable quality and variety at a significantly lower cost. Specifically, we purchased a whole grilled chicken, a large fresh fruit salad, and an extensive vegetable juice consisting of beets, carrots, apples, and celery, all for a total of sixteen dollars, which is remarkably reasonable considering the substantial savings compared to the equivalent items at Whole Foods, which would have amounted to at least thirty dollars. While there are obvious differences between the two establishments, we were pleased to find a convenient and affordable option for a healthy meal."
Love this mall...beautiful mall and great stores. Probably spent more then I wanted to, but couldn't restrain. :)\n\nNordstrom's is awesome.  What great service they offer.

I know this isn't the best farmers market. I know it isn't deserve 5 stars. I know they need more local. I know it is weird to see bananas. I get all of that. BUT THIS PLACE IS SO EASY AND STILL CHEAPER THAN A GROCERY STORE. But, yay, it would rock if they stepped up the local produce section.

They have delicious local heirloom tomatoes. That are almost always fresh and perfect.

THE FLOWERS. There is a lady who sales the most beautiful fresh cut flowers. Bring extra cash and buy yourself, your girl, your mom some. Absolutely stunning flowers.

I arranged a meeting with Dr. Tognacci subsequent to receiving a glowing endorsement from a trusted acquaintance. Prior to this encounter, I had experienced unsatisfactory interactions with various medical professionals, which rendered me exceedingly cautious about seeking assistance from yet another practitioner. However, upon engaging with Dr. Tognacci, I was pleasantly surprised by his unwavering dedication to addressing my diverse concerns. Unlike some of his peers who seemingly adhered to a strict schedule, Dr. Tognacci adopted a distinctly different approach. He accorded me the necessary time to voice my apprehensions and displayed a remarkable willingness to delve into exhaustive research, ensuring that each query was adequately addressed. Throughout our conversation, I was struck by his unhurried demeanor and unwavering commitment to fostering a collaborative atmosphere. He demonstrated a genuine interest in my well-being, treating me as an equal partner in the decision-making process. Upon conclusion of our consultation, Dr. Tognacci ensured that I possessed the requisite prescriptions and an ample supply of samples. My sincere gratitude towards him stems from the fact that he has successfully alleviated my anxieties and provided me with a renewed sense of hope. It is my fervent belief that such exceptional standards of service merit unreserved endorsement.

"This diminutive eatery, accommodating a mere twenty patrons, boasts an impressive culinary prowess and exceptional presentation. The atmosphere is subdued, with minimal fanfare, while the music, though slightly too loud, does not detract from the overall dining experience. The sashimi of beef in ponzu sauce is a brilliant entrÃ©e, and the miso-glazed cod is absolutely exquisite. I eagerly anticipate my return visit to sample the main courses and various table d'hÃ´te offerings."

There will always be a place in my heart for The Orchard. As the first place we went to for a drink when we moved into the area five years ago, I've always made The Orchard one of our regular watering holes. The staff are friendly, the prices are reasonable, and although I've not sampled the food menu extensively, what I have had has been very tasty.

What I really like about The Orchard is the atmosphere. There's a mix of regulars who tend to take up residence at the bar and will always offer a tale or two to those who wander in, looking for a place to satisfy their thirst. There's also a great mix of ages, which I find really refreshing as some bars seem to have an unspoken age policy, but that's not the case in The Orchard.

I can't talk about the food in too much detail, but I have had the steak pie, which was delicious, and often my friends and I order chips whilst we work our way through our drinks. The chips are great, not thin and oily, but fat and fluffy.

I will always champion The Orchard, especially on a hot day, when you can sit outside and watch the world go by.

I am particularly fond of this diminutive club, as it presents an optical illusion of being a minuscule establishment nestled within a strip mall adjacent to the Horse & Hound; however, upon entering, one is pleasantly surprised to discover an expansive interior. This venue boasts an impressive roster of both locally renowned artists and nationally recognized performers, having hosted the likes of KRS-One in 2009 and Slick Rick more recently. The security protocols are seamless and efficient, allowing for a swift ingress into the building after pre-purchasing tickets. Although the shows have been known to commence an hour later than scheduled, the experience is well worth the wait. Moreover, this platform serves as an excellent opportunity for lesser-known artists to gain exposure and showcase their talents.  
On a personal note, I opted to abstain from consuming alcoholic beverages (having indulged in a pre-show libation elsewhere), instead choosing to acquire two energy drinks due to a $10 limitation on credit card transactions and the drink's modest price point of $4. The presence of multiple bartenders ensured a prompt and seamless service.  
While the sonic quality is certainly satisfactory, what truly sets this venue apart is its unique combination of spaciousness and intimacy, affording patrons the opportunity to immerse themselves fully in the performance. I would highly recommend attending a show at this location, with tickets typically priced at a reasonable $20 and conveniently purchasable online. Although the website does feature a calendar of forthcoming events, it could benefit from more frequent updates and additional multimedia content such as photographs and videos.

"An impressive array of cigars is housed within the confines of the humidor, boasting an extensive collection of prominent labels that cater to the discerning tastes of aficionados. The spacious interior allows for a comfortable and leisurely experience, further enhanced by the attentive service of the bartenders who promptly presented us with a pairing of fine whiskies and a refreshing side of water at our outdoor table. As the sun began to set, the misting system provided an added layer of cooling ambiance, creating a pleasant and inviting atmosphere that beckoned us to linger. Although intrigued by the exclusive membership section of the club, we opted not to pursue inquiry â?leaving said curiosity to be satiated during a future visit."
Great lunch menu. Food here is always good but the service can be kind of hit or miss. They had one waitress named Jamie that was probably responsible for drawing in half of their business.

First timers, I took the family (wife and three girls) here and we LOVED it. Half-price happy hour appetizers (ribs, enamame and spring rolls) were great. Dinner was excellent as was the service. Got out for $100 + top! which is good value. After a week in Scotsdale, trust me, this is good value. Would def go back; great spot!,

We stumbled upon Casa Don Juan serendipitously in our quest for hangover sustenance and potent potables beyond the Las Vegas Strip. Our fortuitous discovery proved to be a culinary blessing! The complimentary chips, salsa, and beans served at the table were scrumptious, as were the bloody Mary and pineapple pina colada we ordered. 

The eatery boasts an inviting outdoor seating area, which we took advantage of to bask in the sunlight. However, the interior of the restaurant felt rather chilly during our visit. My sibling relished the enormous portion of chicken fajitas, while I opted for a platter featuring delectable pork tamales, a mediocre beef taco, and a fried pablano pepper overflowing with cheese. We devoured every last morsel, and the cuisine effectively alleviated our hangover symptoms. Casa Don Juan's offerings exuded authentic Mexican flavors typically associated with the West Coast.

The ambiance of the venue was thoroughly enjoyed by our party, particularly in light of the private lounge area which afforded us an exclusive setting to celebrate a friend's milestone birthday. Notwithstanding the moderate cost of the alcoholic beverages available, the overall experience was greatly enhanced by the intimate nature of the establishment, thereby providing each individual with the opportunity to showcase their vocal talents without fear of self-consciousness or inhibition. Consequently, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit to this exceptional entertainment venue.

I've never had a bad meal at any of the locations/states I've eaten at.

I don't drink beer but I enjoy the food. 
I most always order the same thing "Mac and Cheese" no chicken, it comes with a decent house salad for only $7.99 (see pics) 

You can't go wrong with this and two people could easily share this meal, it's alot!

They have some pretty good sandwiches like the "Brewers Club" (see pics)

I've also had their Chicken Fried chicken with white cheddar mashed potatoes.

Decent Food and relaxed environment make this place easy to enjoy.
3.5 stars

"The culinary experience afforded by the consumption of the chicken (ckn) was indeed gratifying, with the poultry exhibiting an impressive juiciness and flavor that was enhanced by its freshness. Furthermore, the cost of procuring this delectable fare was eminently reasonable, with the price of $17 for a whole chicken accompanied by two sizable side dishes constituting a veritable bargain. Moreover, the spacious interior of the establishment, coupled with the hospitable demeanor of the staff, contributed to a convivial ambiance that greatly enhanced the overall dining experience."

"My most recent visit to this establishment culminated in the acquisition of their delectable garlic parmesan wings, which thoroughly satiated my gustatory desires with their profound flavor and succulent texture. Notably, the olfactory sensation aroused by the aroma emanating from the recently prepared grease accentuated the overall dining experience. Furthermore, I must extend my gratitude to the management for their considerate provision of the celery, which was presented in a separate receptacle from the wings, thereby enabling me to relish each component of the dish unhindered. My appreciation is further amplified by the fact that they seemingly took cognizance of my feedback, manifesting their commitment to providing an exceptional dining experience for their clientele."

"An abundance of noodles that transcends comprehension, pho broth, Sriracha bottles of enormous proportions, and an assortment of eccentric canned beverages, including those with flavors reminiscent of ginger and'spongy grass juice,' in addition to chewy candies, animated feline figurines, vibrant playthings, and a dazzling display of butchery. Parking may present a challenge, but one can circumvent this issue by securing a parking spot on either side of the edifice. Of late, the vegetable section appears somewhat diminished, yet my affection for this establishment remains unwavering. Moreover, it is advisable to accumulate a minimum of $10 worth of comestibles for a speedy repast or preserved duck eggs, lest one encounter difficulties in utilizing credit or debit cards."

This marked the culmination of my six-day birthday extravaganza, and I couldn't have been more ecstatic to spend the evening surrounded by such exceptional companions! The ambiance of the establishment was utterly captivating, and the delectable fare served was of unparalleled quality. Two of my four dining associates opted for the sausage and peppers, and their effusive praise would suggest that the dish was imbued with a satisfying degree of piquancy. My remaining two companions and I selected the Chicken Marsala and Chicken Piccata, respectively, and we devoured every morsel with unbridled relish. The bread, too, was a sublime accompaniment to our meals. The hospitality of the wait staff was truly commendable, and their dedication to ensuring our satisfaction was evident in the meticulous attention they devoted to our needs. As the clock struck 8:15, the musical entertainment began, signaling the start of an extraordinary spectacle that we were privileged to witness. I must confess that I find the art of people-watching to be an immensely enjoyable pastime, and this occasion proved to be no exception. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon the culinary offerings a rating of four stars, owing to the exceptional quality of both the victuals and the service proffered by the wait staff. Moreover, whether you elect to partake in the terpsichorean delights of the dance floor or merely observe the proceedings, the experience promises to be nothing short of delightful.
Good sandwich, surly lady taking our money...... Actually applied fresh lipstick before serving us. \nCan't take anything away from the sandwiches and the rest of the staff though.

I had the veggie mushroom soup, which they served with a fresh pretzel roll. It was soooo yummy . However if you are going there for lunch, call your order in as they are extremely busy. You may be late punching back in from lunch, like I was. I waited 20 minutes for soup that was already cooked! Other than the wait time, I was pleased with what ordered except the jelly & PB brioche. I would have bathed in the soup if given that opportunity.

"An exceptional eatery for an early morning repast!   Upon arriving at approximately 9:00 a.m., we were impressed by the bustling ambiance, yet the accommodating staff promptly seated us.  I opted for the vegetarian omelette, accompanied by a generous portion of home fries, which proved to be scrumptious and plentiful.   For aficionados of the Bloody Mary cocktail, I highly recommend giving their rendition a try, priced at a mere $9, prepared fresh daily, and truly satisfying."

"The welcoming lobby boasts captivating mosaics embellishing the floor, evidencing a substantial financial investment. A spectacular light display illuminates the imposing waterfall during the evening hours, accessible for viewing from either the bar or the SW Steakhouse restaurant; however, seating is essential for optimal visibility. The staff members exhibit warmth and helpfulness, ensuring a pleasant experience for guests. Although situated away from the central hub of activity on the strip, the location may present either an advantage or disadvantage, depending on individual preferences and requirements."

"Having visited the recently established Fiesta Mall In N Out Burger in Mesa on several occasions and expressing profound disappointment with the culinary offerings, particularly the unpalatable and soggy french fries, I opted to sample the fare at this particular establishment in AJ, thereby granting it an opportunity to redeem itself in my estimation. As luck would have it, the hour of our arrival coincided with the peak lunchtime period, which customarily translates into an influx of patrons and an ensuing state of affairs characterized by crowding and prolonged waiting periods. However, much to our delight, the duration of our sojourn in the extensive drive-through queue was surprisingly brief, barely exceeding five minutes, despite the presence of a sizeable assemblage of individuals partaking of their meals alfresco and an appreciable number of vehicles awaiting their turns in the adjacent parking area. Furthermore, the gastronomic experience itself proved to be a gratifying and satisfying endeavor, as the fries were expertly prepared, exhibiting a delightful crispiness and freshness that complemented the flavorful and generously proportioned burger, which was further enhanced by the richness of a decadent chocolate shake. The overall quality of the service was also noteworthy, as the staff demonstrated a commendable level of efficiency and attentiveness, ensuring that our visit was marked by an atmosphere of welcoming hospitality and unpretentious geniality."

"Network has served as my preferred establishment for wheel alignments for an extended period of time, and I have consistently been satisfied with the quality of their work and the reasonable pricing they offer. However, I have encountered some variability in the level of customer service provided, as there has been a different individual attending to me on each occasion I have visited the shop. Despite this inconsistency, I remain confident in the integrity and reliability of Network's services, and I will undoubtedly continue to patronize them in the future."

Yummy toasted sandwiches. Had turkey and chedder on whole wheat. They were out of the broccoli cheddar soup which I was super bummed about. Maybe next time. The great thing is they deliver! I live right in the neighborhood so its nice for a change.

"As an individual whose culinary expertise does not extend to the realm of popcorn, I must confess that my knowledge regarding the distinction between superior and exceptional popcorn remains limited. Nonetheless, my experiences with Popped have led me to believe that their caramel corn exemplifies a remarkable quality, worthy of recognition. The prices charged by this establishment are reasonable, considering the extensive array of flavors available to patrons. On multiple occasions, I have sampled their offerings, making a conscious effort to explore novel flavors with each visit. Notably, the popcorn retains its freshness impressively well when stored properly, allowing for intermittent consumption. It is thus unsurprising that I anticipate returning to indulge in further instances of their delectable popcorn, as the old adage goes: 'Once you Pop, you cannot stop.'"

"This establishment offered its services at a remarkably reasonable price point, rendering it an optimal choice for those seeking a tranquil and therapeutic experience. While the massage itself was not characterized by the profound pressure I had specifically requested, it was, nevertheless, quite relaxing and ultimately left me feeling refreshed and revitalized. The therapists responsible for administering the treatment were exceedingly cordial and hospitable, creating a welcoming atmosphere that greatly enhanced my overall enjoyment of the session. Additionally, they employed various efficacious aromatherapy methods that contributed significantly to my sense of well-being and relaxation."

"The staff's proficiency in customer service could benefit from enhancement (i.e., acknowledging patrons upon entrance, expressing gratitude for orders, et cetera). Conversely, the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory. I opted for the #2 combination (Philly Steak, fries, and soda for $7.99), which proved to be an adequate portion size for a midday repast and boasted exceptional flavor. Although I am not particularly fond of steak fries, their utilization did not detract significantly from my dining experience. However, I would have appreciated a more copious serving of fries, as the quantity provided seemed incongruous with the sandwich. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, my overall assessment of the establishment remains positive, and I anticipate future visits, given its proximity to my place of employment."

What a cool concept! Not ice cream, not a slush, but more of a snow....or snoh. Choose your flavored snow, a topping, and a glaze (which is essentially a drizzle) on top. The menu isn't overwhelming with too many choices, which can be intimidating when you're trying something new. What they do have though, is really interesting. Taro flavored ice, mogi toppings, condensed milk glaze......it's very creative. \nThe place was very clean and decorated in contemporary IKEA style. I happen to love IKEA which is why I recognized the decor! \nSo what's the verdict? It's really refreshing and tasty. A very unique spin on a frozen treat. My only gripe is that the toppings and glaze were very light-handed, almost non existant. I just barely got to taste the tiny almond cookie crumbs and condensed milk on the top of my strawberry snow.

I had a gratifying experience during my visit to this establishment last night, despite the fact that I was obligated to pay a cover charge of 10 dollars, which I found somewhat disagreeable. However, my friend was displaying some artwork, and I was eager to observe it. The atmosphere within the venue was characterized by a diverse assortment of individuals, ranging from hippie women who appeared to be under the influence of hallucinogenic substances, to metal enthusiasts who exhibited a pronounced tendency to clench their jaws, and even ravers who seemed to be in a state of euphoria induced by electronic music. It was truly fascinating to witness such a varied gathering of people interacting harmoniously. Furthermore, the bartender, who was ostensibly inebriated, served drinks at a price that I considered reasonable, thereby partially compensating for the initial financial burden imposed by the cover charge. During my time there, I encountered several pleasant individuals, was exposed to some captivating musical selections, and even derived amusement from the performance of a band playing a rendition of War Pigs, albeit unexpectedly.

They executed a remarkable interior renovation, transforming the establishment into a contemporary and inviting venue. Previously, this location housed Native New Yorker for an extended period, and subsequently, several other businesses occupied the space. Discovering this hidden gem was undoubtedly a delightful experience.

The breakfast selection, albeit limited, adheres to the philosophy of quality over quantity, as each dish is meticulously prepared and presented. We had the pleasure of sampling their Stuffed French Toast, Chaquillias, and Eggs Tuscano, and we were thoroughly impressed by the explosion of flavors and the reasonable price point of $7 per plate. The generous portion sizes further enhanced our satisfaction.

However, our visit was not without its imperfections. Specifically, the hostess could benefit from heightened awareness and a warm demeanor towards incoming patrons. A concerted effort towards creating a welcoming ambiance would greatly enhance the overall experience.

Our server, on the other hand, exhibited commendable friendliness and attentiveness, despite the bustling atmosphere. Although there was a delay in the delivery of our food, the quality and presentation made the brief wait more than acceptable.

Given its proximity to Sun City West, it was unsurprising that the clientele consisted predominantly of an older demographic. Nonetheless, we eagerly anticipate exploring their lunch and dinner offerings and revisiting their exceptional breakfast menu.

"I would posit that it constitutes a rather satisfactory venue for a Greek buffet, offering a diverse array of culinary options, an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, and the added convenience of a private bar serving an assortment of beverages. I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions in the company of my associates, and I must say that the majority of their dishes are indeed quite delectable, with their ice cream being a particular highlight. Moreover, they cater to the dietary restrictions of my Muslim companions by providing halal meat options, thereby enabling them to partake in the culinary experience alongside us. However, it is worth noting that some dishes may be found lacking in terms of preparation or exhibiting an excessive saltiness. Furthermore, the cost of the meal varies depending on the day of the week."

After perusing the aggregated assessments proffered by patrons, I am eagerly anticipating partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment. As an individual with fastidious gastronomical inclinations, I shall reserve judgment until I have had the opportunity to sample the fare offered by Pita Kitchen Grill, at which point I shall provide a comprehensive evaluation of my dining experience.

A nice little hidden away place in Gilbert\n Gf and I went there for breakfast and it was surprisingly good. I had the pancakes and meat ( sausage) and the gf had breakfast tacos (eggs, vegs, and ham). It was all good and the best part was apple fritters....it has a sugary cover to it and the inside is very soft. \nThis place gets packed so be ready to wait. Price range is moderate for what you get. Also....watch out for el scorpio....sting is muchos owie.

Great food. Has a local feel, not quite dive-y but pleasantly local. Not unexpected based on the location. Went for the Bell's tap take-over for Mad-Craft-Beer-Week. Wife and I had the fish, right tastee.

I came for the Day of the Dead festival this weekend, which is kind of a bust in itself; however, I enjoyed the museum. I checked out the Cotton Fields to Skyscrapers exhibit, and I thought it was really interesting. It traces the changes that have taken place in Charlotte and the towns/counties around us since the Civil War, and the whole thing was pretty wild. I am kind of a history geek, and I really like the interactive approach. The exhibit is pretty large, so you get a real feel for the eras that they're trying to recreate. \n\nThe Day of the Dead exhibit was kind of lame. I got there after they'd run out of sugar skulls, and there were no fancy dancers and only a few altars. I really like that holiday, so I'd hoped for more...however, I did enjoy the free museum admission, so I guess it worked out.

Victor Hugo is a great little Continental Deli on the edge of the Meadows in Edinburgh.  It is in an ideal location to catch all the University students on their walk to and from classes and is a great place to go to in the summer as it is just across from the Meadows.  

Victor Hugo has an excellent selection of freshly made bread and serves sandwiches and cakes make fresh every day.  They have a counter full of all different types of meats and cheeses which are very tempting.  My absolute favourite is their chocolate brownie which is very more-ish and I frequently pop in for breakfast in the mornings and have the fresh fruit salad.  Everything is organic and freshly made, and although everything tastes delicious, it is a wee bit pricey.   Victor Hugo now sell hampers so you can choose which foods you want in it and they will make it up and deliver it to you.

There is seating inside the shop, and it also has tables and chairs outside so it is a lovely place to sit and watch all the action from the Meadows on a warm day.

As a denizen of Matthews, my cardiac organ will forever remain devoted to the Royal Cafe and Creperie; however, Hazelnuts does proffer some delectable crepes. Located in the central district of uptown Charlotte, accessibility to Hazelnuts may prove challenging, unless one works in the downtown area and chooses to traverse the distance by foot; alternatively, patrons may opt to utilize the limited side-street parking facilities available (it is advisable to hone one's parallel parking abilities prior to attempting to secure a parking spot). The eatery itself is situated within the lobby of a structure, thereby ensuring a constant influx of pedestrians; the interior design exudes an aura of contemporary cleanliness, characterized by pristine white walls, striking blackboards, and strategically positioned wooden accents. The menu boasts an array of crepes suitable for breakfast, savory meals, and desserts; however, it is likely that the accommodating staff will accommodate special requests and tailor the crepes according to individual preferences. Following the placement of an order, a brief interval of approximately five to ten minutes (dependent on the length of the queue) transpires before the culinary masterpiece is presented to the patron. Thus far, I have had the pleasure of indulging in the Maple Dream, an ingenious fusion of both savory and sweet elements, encompassing eggs, bacon, and maple syrup; additionally, I have sampled the Basil Pesto Chicken, an exemplary midday option. In conclusion, Hazelnuts presents itself as a superlative breakfast or lunch venue for those finding themselves in the downtown vicinity, despite the absence of elaborate table settings, as the culinary offerings take precedence.

This assessment, albeit somewhat conflicted, has been subjectively augmented to reflect an ostensibly more accurate appraisal, given the inherent limitations of comparative analysis within the hospitality industry. Specifically, the author has elected to assign a rating of 3.5, commensurate with their perceived quality of service, despite the arguably superior accommodations offered by the Bellagio. It is worth noting, however, that the author's satisfaction with the Vdara's staff, cleanliness, and modern appointments has not been compromised by their previous experience at the aforementioned luxury establishment. Furthermore, the presence of a full-sized refrigerator for the storage of libations and leftovers has been deemed particularly appealing, while the bed, though adequately comfortable, has been somewhat let down by the unfortunate state of the windows. In conclusion, while cognizant of the Vdara's relatively affordable pricing strategy, the author remains ambivalent regarding a potential return engagement, instead recommending the Bellagio or Wynn for those seeking a truly luxurious experience.

This course owns me.  That said, it's a great muni course--best I've played.

Course is challenging and will more likely reward the accurate player as opposed to someone who likes to slice their drives all over the place.  There are many holes that offer great views.  I liked the one on the back 9 where you hit basically through an opening in a forest and down three stories onto the green that's about 200 yds away.

Will definitely be coming back again to this well-maintained challenging course.

dmo out.

When I think of Madison I think of this place. The beer is great, the food is diverse and extremely we'll made and the building is beautiful. I've heard raves about the African peanut soup(or whatever) but I opted for the brats and cheese curds.

I have always wanted to go in here and check it out, at various locations, but never did.  Today I passed by here and decided this was a good time to do so.  It was right there and I had the time.  The store was nice and cool (important when it's 111 outside).  The clerks were super nice.  They left me alone when I wanted to just browse but were right there when I had a question or request.  I ended up buying one cute black cotton top with lavender sequined roses on the front and got it for 20% off by filling out an app for a credit card.  The manager even said if I came back within a week I could buy the other one I was looking at for the discount as well.  It's obvious they put customer service as a priority, not becasue of the discount, but because of the overall way I was treated the whole time I was in the store.  I will try to stop by here on future visits to town even though I'm not a big clothes shopper.

"This venue offered an exceptionally enjoyable experience, boasting an atmosphere that was utterly conducive to merriment and social interaction. In the company of my dearest relatives and acquaintances, I had the pleasure of partaking in various recreational activities, the sum of which culminated in an utterly delightful outing. While the culinary offerings did not necessarily constitute a gastronomic expedition, they were by no means the primary focus of our visit; rather, they served as a satisfying complement to the multitude of attractions and diversions available at this establishment. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit, which promises to be yet another occasion for unadulterated enjoyment and conviviality."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, with a particular emphasis on freshness and flavor. My personal experience with their vegetarian sandwich was nothing short of remarkable, as it exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and satisfaction. The trout sandwich I sampled during my visit was also quite impressive, and the aroma emanating from their soup and baked goods was simply enticing. However, it is worth noting that this venue tends to be extremely popular, resulting in a high volume of patrons and a unique semi-table-service system that may take some getting used to. Despite these logistical challenges, I would still highly recommend this eatery for a satisfying midday repast, particularly for those seeking a lighter dining experience. While my personal preference may lean towards Le Cartet, there is no denying the exceptional quality and value offered by this restaurant."

First pho experience. It was better than average. The 3.5 average is spot on. 

My friends and I ordered three different bowls and we enjoyed them all. I had the vegan pho which was super flavorful and full of veggies and noodles. I also ordered the tofu nuggets because I wanted to be able to say that I ordered tofu nuggets with a straight face. They were actually pretty good, as was the sauce they came with. My friend ordered crab rangoon. It was the same old crab rangoon you get anywhere, but they charged $8 for it. Seriously?

The service was very hurried, and the waiter never actually took a drink order. He just brought us all water and that was that; we hadn't even realized until he left with the food order. Hurried service also meant the food came quickly, and you can't complain about that. No asking for dessert either. The check just came when he decided to bring it. So it goes.

Also, for some reason that we couldn't figure out, there was house music playing in the background the whole time. It wasn't annoying. Just confusing. We just chalked it up to being Vegas after midnight.

I'm in love with the place. Granted, I have only been here for breakfast... but hey, it is the most important meal of the day, right? Everything I've tried at Pesto Prima has been my favorite. The Prima Breakfast Sandwich is a mouthful of heaven. This sandwich is full of flavor that all really compliment each other well. It's also a pretty good size; I often get full off of one half. The Chai Tea is to die for. They make their own chai and it is by far the best I've had in town. Also, full of flavor and simply delicious. During my last visit I tried their Java Mocha Blast. It's a protein smoothie full of  magic... delicious. The only complaint I have about this place is that it's closed on Sundays. I hope to eventually try their lunch menu.

"One of the scant establishments within the city limits of Pittsburgh that proffer genuinely Latin beverages! For an overcrowded ambiance reminiscent of a jam-packed sardine can, patronize them on a weekend evening. I savored the tacos during the diurnal hours, and was particularly enthused by the fact that they actually concoct legitimate caipirinhas on the premises, irrespective of the inclement climatic conditions exteriorly. Ah, yes - an oxymoronic scenario that I find utterly captivating: caipirinhas amidst the snowfall... A phenomenon exclusive to the Steel City!"

St. Francis emerges as the unequivocal victor in the culinary contest for the finest French fries in all of Phoenix, with its sibling establishment at the Downtown Public Market boasting an identical formula yet failing to measure up. St. Francis maintains its status as a beloved brunch venue (complete with exceptional live music commencing at 10:30 am on Sundays), while concurrently delivering an impressive dining experience come nightfall. The level of service exhibited by the staff is persistently superior, complemented by the consistent excellence of the cuisine. For a truly satisfying breakfast, consider opting for the sandwich sans the mayo-sauce (let us dispense with the pretense and acknowledge that mayonnaise has no place on a morning meal). The flatbread pizzas and burgers served during the evening hours are equally deserving of praise. Furthermore, the happy hour offerings at this establishment are noteworthy and warrant mention. Although the bar area may be modest in size, securing one of the alfresco stools will ensure a prolonged and enjoyable experience.

"Comparable to, and indeed surpassing the scope and grandeur of, festivals celebrated in other regions of the nation, this particular event boasts an unparalleled level of excellence, owing to its unique and privileged location. The acquisition of art pieces directly from the hands of the creators themselves, be they artists or artisans, serves to imbue the process with a profound sense of significance and personal connection, allowing patrons to form a deeper appreciation for the works on display. Moreover, certain artisans possess an uncanny ability to embody the essence of their creations, their appearance and demeanor mirroring the very same qualities that define their artistic output."

"On my most recent visits, I have observed a marked improvement in the quality of service and attention to detail, prompting me to offer a commendation. Upon entering the establishment, I was presented with a steaming cup of hot tea, which was replenished promptly upon nearing empty. Additionally, I have noticed a significant enhancement in the cleanliness of the premises over the past year, particularly in comparison to my initial visits several years ago. I appreciate these minor yet noteworthy improvements and wish to acknowledge them. Furthermore, I was quite taken by the flavorful chicken porridge ($6.95), which was served at an optimal temperature, allowing for the chicken to be cooked to perfection and infused with a delicate freshness. The judicious inclusion of ginger, expertly shaved into fine slivers, complemented by the crunch of green onion, cilantro, and shallots, resulted in a harmonious balance of flavors. This dish has secured a place among my preferred choices for a nourishing, comforting meal, especially during periods of indisposition. Gradually, this eatery has earned its place as my go-to destination for a satisfying late-night soup experience."

We thoroughly enjoy this establishment. 
  If you opt for an early evening repast, it is suitable for juveniles, as they possess adequate seating arrangements for young children. 
  Their culinary offerings are of superior quality, their servers are prompt, and their employees are both courteous and hospitable, making it a genuine hidden treasure. 
  We have a particular fondness for their Thai green curry (though an increased quantity of rice would be appreciated), and we highly recommend their sampling appetizer platter (absolutely delectable!).

I am thoroughly enamored with this quaint, diminutive nail salon, as it diverges from the conventional, cookie-cutter nail studio; it boasts an immaculate atmosphere that exudes serenity, which, in tandem with the salon's unconventional nature, has captivated my attention and patronage. My penchant for natural, unadulterated nails has been unwavering, yet, in light of recent difficulties with my nails' fragility, I opted to venture beyond my comfort zone and indulge in gel tips, which, according to the astute recommendation of the youthful attendant, would persist for a fortnight. Alas, these aspirations were quickly thwarted, as the gel tips began to separate from my natural nails a mere six days subsequent to their application, prompting my return to the salon. Undeterred by my unexpected return, the skilled artisan, with her adept touch and proficiency in nail enhancements, rectified the issue by employing a durable gel substance, sans posing any interrogatories or expressing the slightest incredulity towards my premature return. Her meticulous approach and dedication to her craft culminated in a natural, refined appearance of my nails, which, in turn, engendered my unreserved satisfaction.

I was lucky enough to eat at the Cracked truck in the Food truck Oasis at bonnaroo.\n\n There are few things I like more in this world than a perfectly cooked egg and I know I'm gonna love a truck that makes this humble food their star ingredient. I did what I had to do and ordered the Goy Vey (bacon, hard salami, hash brown and a fried egg with sweet and spicy cream cheese on a ciabatta roll). This was glorious and for sure the best breakfast-for-dinner I've had in a long time. The sweet and spicy cream cheese made this not your regular run of the mill breakfast sandwich. The only downfall was the hash brown was fairly thin and hard to discern amongst all that fluffy bread.

I had the sensation that I was situated on the set of a softcore pornographic production. Two females were dancing behind these screens, which were illuminated by blue and red lights, thereby creating an ambiance that was highly conducive to relaxation in a lounge bar setting. Although it was somewhat crowded, the gathering of individuals present did possess a certain je ne sais quoi that made it an appropriate venue for socializing with acquaintances prior to embarking upon nocturnal adventures. It was not a location that encouraged ogling, but rather an establishment where one could unwind and enjoy the company of others while partaking in libations, albeit at a cost that was slightly prohibitive, as the combination of redbull and vodka amounted to a total of eighteen dollars, which was indeed a tad steep.

Fuck the continental breakfast.  Get the creamy, slightly tangy eggs benedict on a flaky, butterfly, slightly doughy in the center croissant.  \nCoffee was so good I didn't have to put any creamer or sweetener. Service was excellent 'cause it's Vegas baby~\nLovely upscale decor with sumptuous fabrics, perfect setting for 3 girls to get together the morning after for some post-barhopping, post-coital, post-drama commentaries.

"The predicament pertaining to sandwiches is that a six-inch iteration is insufficient, whereas a twelve-inch version is excessive...humorously so! Anyway, a seven-point-five inch rendition proves ideal, and a fifteen-inch partition of said sandwich manifests itself as a judicious decision, as evidenced by Cousins' implementation thereof. Furthermore, the subs possess an undeniable delectability, while the customer service maintains a superior quality. The proprietor exhibits a remarkable level of friendliness, as he not only recognizes repeat patrons but also displays a genuine interest in their culinary preferences and orders. Consequently, we derive immense pleasure from patronizing this small business establishment and indulging in its scrumptious offerings."

"A truly exceptional customer service representative. Her demeanor was utterly endearing and her assistance was invaluable. Additionally, the establishment offers an uncommon policy of allowing patrons to experiment with their products without incurring any supplementary fees, which resulted in my discovering two exceptional wigs at a combined cost of less than $70. However, the ambiance of certain sections within the store could be perceived as somewhat unrefined, yet it must be acknowledged that this is a specialized retail outlet catering to beauty enthusiasts, thereby warranting a minor deduction in rating due to the somewhat lengthy queues encountered at the checkout area."

"This culinary establishment undoubtedly offers the most exceptional gastronomical experience within the central business district, boasting an impressive array of innovative, delectable dishes, a tranquil ambiance, and reasonable tariffs. Following a comprehensive exploration of approximately half of the menu offerings, I have derived immense satisfaction from the vast majority of my selections, with the sole exception being the mildly piquant red curried noodles and vegetables, which failed to meet my expectations regarding spiciness. Nonetheless, the gypsy stew, with its rich, hearty flavors, has effectively satiated my craving for a truly satisfying dining experience, evoking images of a celestial paradise where comfort food reigns supreme."

"Concealed plant-based culinary delight brimming with gustatory sensations that even the most ardent meat enthusiast could tolerate: Whole Grain Tuscan Linguine devoid of dairy, adorned with soy-based protein. Giggity. \n\nIn case you have yet to indulge in the sumptuous delights of their Rice Krispy Treat, you are missing out on a pinnacle of epicurean fulfillment. I am persuaded that the liberal wedge of gooey, marshmallow-infused bliss is a direct manifestation of celestial baking prowess, taken from the pages of an ethereal cookbook. I crave no knowledge of their enigmatic formula - I simply desire for them to persist in their confectionary endeavors, unabated and perpetual."

Came here for a girls' evening last Friday.  I'm not so much a fan of the forced "complimentary valet" but the city of Phoenix is grooming me to expect such things if I want to eat in the area.  

The restaurant is cute.  Menu is diverse and they have a great cocktail list.  The goat cheese appetizer is pretty fantastic if you like goat cheese.  The food is good, but not great.  I had the vegetable flatbread pizza and with a little more seasoning, it would have been delicious.  Our table shared the cheesecake in a jar as well as the stout cake - all were delicious (and I'm a tough customer when it comes to chocolate cake).  

Our waitress was generally fantastic all evening.  She seemed a little short when there was a mix-up with the credit cards and amounts but was back to being cheery as soon as it was fixed.  I will definitely return!

"While in the vicinity, visiting an acquaintance, I opted to procure a salad at this establishment and was thoroughly impressed! My fondness for a well-crafted salad adorned with aquatic protein rendered me pleasantly surprised by their employment of freshly grilled salmon, rather than the customary pre-cooked, cold variety often found at hasty eateries (such as Panera). The brief delay in preparation time was more than compensated by the heightened culinary experience! Furthermore, I elected to consume my salad off-premises, but my attention was drawn to their offering of fermented beverages and an outdoor seating area."

"Excellent culinary experience characterized by delectable melodies, gastronomical delights, and exceptional hospitality. My previous visit to the Greater Phoenix region included a memorable dining excursion to this establishment. We opted for al fresco seating to capitalize on the balmy evening ambiance, and were immediately captivated by the eclectic and spirited musical accompaniment that harmoniously complemented our dining experience without overpowering conversation. As the evening drew to a close, our server demonstrated remarkable attentiveness and wit, ensuring an unparalleled level of customer satisfaction. The fare itself proved to be a veritable feast for the senses; a garden salad, generously portioned and bursting with flavorful greens, preceded a magnificently crafted pizza showcasing an array of savory toppings artfully arranged upon a wafer-thin crust. However, as we ventured towards the pie's center, we noted a slight diminution in crispiness, leading us to surmise that a brief additional period of culinary indulgence would have enhanced our enjoyment. Nonetheless, Grimaldi's offered an unforgettable epicurean adventure that warrants unequivocal recommendation to any individual fortunate enough to find themselves within proximity."

"Our culinary excursion was thoroughly enjoyable, with the exception of a solitary item, which failed to meet our expectations in terms of both texture and flavor. Specifically, the'red rock' dish, characterized by an unsettling inconsistency and a discernible absence of a certain je ne sais quoi, did not resonate with our taste buds. Conversely, we were thoroughly enamored with the 'kalbi ribs,' 'rock & roll,' 'aria,' 'coco shrimp,' and 'avocado bomb,' which collectively showcased a masterful blend of flavors and textures. However, it is worth noting that the latter dish, despite its otherwise delectable composition, featured a noticeably scant amount of avocado, a fact that contributed to a palpable sense of disappointment. Nonetheless, our overall experience at this esteemed eatery was overwhelmingly positive, and we would unhesitatingly recommend it to fellow gastronomes seeking a veritable cornucopia of gustatory delights."

I spent my honeyroom at the Flamingo and was very pleased, but not at first.  We checked in and were greeted by a very pleasant yet professional front desk clerk.  He gave us our key and off we went to check out our room....it was on the 4th floor and I about screamed when I opened the curtain and got a view of the air unit!  So I called guest services ASAP and we were transfer to the 18th floor GO room at no extra charge!  This was more like it...nice comfortable beds, views of the pool, and the over all feel of the room was much more pleasant, the flat screen was a nice touch.  I also enjoyed showering and watching tv in the bathroom.  :)  I would stay here again, the price was right and the location can't be beat.

They took part of France and plopped it in the middle of Vegas..including the very blue sky with wispy clouds that almost seemed to move as you made your way through streets of Paris. Lots of shops and typical mall prices.

"Utterly exquisite culinary experience. We indulged in the delectable chicken satay, savory dried beef, and flavorsome pad cashew nut. My palate was thoroughly satiated by the scrumptious offerings, rendering me insatiable for more. The hospitable staff members exhibited remarkable cordiality and affability. However, a minor drawback occurred when we attempted to place a delivery order beyond the stipulated time frame, and we were informed that while the restaurant accepted our request, we needed to contact an alternative delivery service. Unfortunately, the latter declared they were unavailable, leaving us in a state of flux with no successful outcome."

Date night!  And where shall we go?  Cajun Queen of course.  This restaurant is located in a beautiful, old house on 7th Street.  Initially, we were seated in the very bright back room.  There also happened to be a ladies' holiday party, and, you know how we gals get when we are having fun.  Very loud.  
So, we asked to be moved.  We were told that there were no available tables in the other two dining rooms, but there was space on the rooftop patio.  Huh?  We didn't even know such a space existed.  It was an unseasonably warm December night, so here we go, upstairs to absolute delight!
The rooftop featured retro Christmas music, holiday lighting and a most splendiferous view.  We ordered a half order of the fried oysters to start.  They arrived crispy, with creamy Ranch dressing.  For our entrees, we both ordered the étouffée, his with crawfish, mine with vegetables.  Both needed a little salt, pepper and hot sauce, but, after a little doctoring up,  they were good.  As an aside, I have had their vegetable étouffée when it needed no adornment.  Awesome stuff.  
And now, we shall request the rooftop each time.  Weather permitting.

LOVE the Old Sugar Distillery for drinks. I love the horchata, or really anything with their honey liqueur. You can also buy bottles of their liqueur, which goes great with anything at home. I feel like it's sort of an underground spot, because most of my friends haven't heard of it, but I have one friend who swears by it. Unfortunately, they close at 10pm (which he says is the best part......how??), so you can't really plan to spend the night here. Though, it is close to some other cool/less-crowded bars, like the Brass Ring.\n\nI don't love how dark it is here, even though it's just one block off Washington... sometimes I walk fast from my car if I'm coming alone.

"We embarked upon a culinary excursion on a Saturday morning, which yielded an unexpected yet auspicious outcome; the venue was teeming with patrons, a circumstance that augured well for the quality of the fare. Notwithstanding the throngs of people, our party of three was attended to with alacrity, as we were seated within a mere ten-minute interval. My gastronomic inclinations led me to opt for the Eggs Maximilian, a dish that featured chorizo, an ingredient whose piquant flavor I find particularly appealing. The portion size was generous, to say the least, as I felt satiated for the balance of the day, having been thoroughly nourished by the multifaceted composition of the dish, which boasted an array of flavors and textures that left nothing wanting. The service we received was brisk and affable, as our servers were assiduous in their efforts to ensure that our beverages remained at least half full at all times. In conclusion, based on the quality of our experience, we shall unquestionably return to this establishment in the future."

I spent the majority of my weekend here for the NASCAR races. 
Now this review is extremely biased... 
I was treated to suite parking, which is as close as you can get. 
I watched the races from the suites, including food and drinks. 
I received passes to the Octane suite, which is a 5 star restaurant and bar at the track, by invitation only. 
So, yes, I really like this place!! 
The grounds were kept as clean as possible considering the amount of people in attendance. The PIR staff were very friendly and helpful. 
A few of the security guards were a little blurry about where some things were, but friendly all the same. 
It is amazing how many people camp at the track for the weekend. 
Next time I'm going to watch the shopping cart races in the "town". 
This was my virgin voyage to a NASCAR event and I must say I was pleasantly surprised and would gladly go again...

Not being a really big cigar guy, I do however enjoy one with a stiff drink every now and again.  I had the chance to try this place out and I have to say I was instantly impressed.  

I think it was the decor really that did me in.  Leather chairs, sofas and love seats.  Comfortable bar stools and warm wood accents and tables.  Perfect interior for a nice relaxing time.  

In terms of food, drinks and cigars I would rank it as acceptable.  I wasn't really there long enough for food so I'll have to chime in on that at another time I suppose.  I do hope to come back some time soon.

I came to Siamese Kitchen with 19 other Yelpers and we plowed through much of the menu and overwhelmed the kitchen but they were gracious and didn't mind when I jumped in to help clear tables and keep the food moving.

Wow, that was a run-on sentence.

Overall the food was really good and the service was good as well.  They did have a hard time keeping up (as most restaurants would when 20 people order at once) but were good natured about some of us jumping in now and then to bus tables or refill water.

I really enjoyed the Yellow curry although I would order it hotter next time.  Dottsy ordered her pad thai hot and the leftovers came home with me...too hot for most.

All of the dishes I tried (7-8) were nice and flavorful.

I will keep Siamese Kitchen in mind for lunch when I'm in the neighborhood, good stuff and good prices.

"Beer Mugs capable of inducing cranial fractures, confirm. Teutonic ensemble featuring an accordion, affirmative. Hostesses donning traditional Dirndl attire, emphasizing their proficiency in managing superior thoracic assets, indeed. Expansive dining area with oversized tables and benches, present. Patrons engaging in shot-downing rituals while standing on furniture, fueled by the rhythmic chanting of the band, were abundant at HofbrÃ¤uhaus. \n\nOur culinary experience encompassed a vast array of delectable offerings, commencing with a soft pretzel appetizer accompanied by a rich, potentially lethal bier cheese sauce, which threatened to surpass the limits of our gastronomical capacities. For my primary course, I opted for the Wiener Schnitzel, complemented by a medley of steamed vegetables and a side of German potato salad. The pork cutlet was cooked to perfection, boasting a delightful synchronization of juiciness and crispiness, rendering it suitable for consumption over two meals. The potato salad displayed a pleasing equilibrium of spices, with a subtle application of mustard and mayonnaise, distinguishing it from conventional picnic potato salads. Consuming both my meal and beverage presented a formidable challenge, but, as a vacationing individual, I felt compelled to indulge excessively."

I've eaten here a few times before, when it was Pink Pepper, but never had the lunch buffet.  A few days ago I decided to check out the buffet offerings.  Everything had great flavor, but I found it all lacking in the spice department.  I know they are trying to make food that is palatable for the masses and one can always add chilies, but I generally prefer my Thai food to arrive pre-spiced.  That said, however, I would definitely go back for more and I did - a few times in fact.  The Thai tea was some of the best I've ever had, I had to order one to go so I could prolong the sweet creamy deliciousness as long as possible.  To top it all off the service was great, and I can't wait to go back!

This restaurant is really similar to its sister The Cheesecake Factory.  I really like how expansive the menu is and the portion sizes are always enough for a small village, which since I enjoy the food so much, makes for good leftovers.

I like that I can try something new each time, this time was the BBQ Asian Pork Tacos, which I highly recommend.  

The service is really good, considering the size of this place is massive and its always packed.  

The downsides are it's VERY loud and its hard to get great service since they are spread so thin.

Upside, they are open late and inside the Venetian which makes it convenient.

"This venue boasts a quaint and secluded ambiance, characterized by an enclosed terrace adorned with ivy-covered stone walls that stretch upwards towards the sky, creating a sense of intimacy and seclusion. The terrace is furnished with an array of seating options, including wooden benches, and features a relaxed atmosphere that encourages patrons to let go of their worries and immerse themselves in the present moment. The musical selection, comprising primarily high school-era tunes, contributes to the laid-back vibe, while the friendly and attentive service further enhances the overall experience. Although the food offerings are unremarkable and can be procured from a neighboring establishment, the setting and ambiance more than compensate for any culinary shortcomings. Additionally, the interior of the pub exudes a warm and welcoming atmosphere, occasionally hosting open mic nights that showcase local talent."

I got Jamerica takeout and it was REALLY messy but SO worth it. The mango run chicken was enormous and everything I could have asked for. Each element was flavorful and satisfying on their own but together they were magical. \nThe shop is decorated with photos and letters and seems like a chill place to have a quick meal.

"The Phoenix Roadrunner Park Farmers Market presents an exceptional opportunity to acquire a diverse array of fresh produce and locally manufactured goods. The vendors primarily consist of approximately forty percent produce, thirty percent local food products, fifteen percent fresh food and beverages, and fifteen percent miscellaneous items. If your primary focus is on procuring produce, it can be challenging to maintain fiscal discipline in light of the numerous other exceptional local edibles available. To optimize your experience, it is recommended that you avoid the parking lot adjacent to the market and instead opt for parking along 36th Street, which enables a leisurely stroll through the park. Some of this writer's preferred products at the market include fresh chili peppers, fresh herbs, distinctive fruits and vegetables, local dairy items, and tamales."

My girlfriend collects robot toys and one of my best friends is a Spawn fanatic so I decided to take a look around. Although there weren't many robots there was plenty more of everything else you can imagine when it comes to toys, McFarlane created or not.\n\nThey had a small, but vital comic archive for the Spawn fan and they offered hard-to-find or unique toys of all genres. Plenty to choose from and even the imports weren't devastatingly expensive. This franchise specialty store can be appreciated by anyone who collects and even for those of us that want to take a look around. Pretty entertaining as a time killer for the masses or a Mecca for the few. I walked out empty-handed, but with a curious smile on my face, my friend on the other hand was pleased with the fare he found to support his hobby.

This place is worth it just for buckaroos... even though I'm sure that their 'bucko nuggets' isn't actually made of chicken, getting a drink/hot-dog/nuggets/fries/nachos/ice-cream/packaged cotton candy for about $10 total is awesome.

"Committed to a south rim excursion, which initiated at a sluggish pace, boarding a bus that conveyed us to the Miracle Mile, followed by a brief interlude for refreshments, specifically a Danish pastry and either coffee or water, prior to transferring onto an alternative bus. The process required some time to become streamlined. Made brief halts at a rest area adjacent to the dam, situated in Kingman, Arizona, and subsequently enjoyed a moderately satisfying meal in Williams, Arizona. The south rim presented a considerable distance to traverse, necessitating multiple stops at the canyon, each lasting approximately an hour, before embarking on the return journey, with an additional halt in Kingman, Arizona. It is crucial to prepare appropriately for the prolonged south rim venture. Our chauffeur, Tommy, demonstrated exceptional skill and offered comprehensive insights throughout the expedition, concluding around 9:30 pm."

"Culinary delights are utterly remarkable, with tuna tacos being an exemplary illustration of such gastronomical excellence. However, it is advisable to temper one's expectations regarding the promptness of service, as the establishment's focus on creating delectable dishes takes precedence over expediency. Despite this, the duration of time spent waiting is undoubtedly compensated by the exceptional quality of the food."

"Culinary delights abound at this esteemed establishment, specializing in Middle Eastern cuisine. As a Briton with Lebanese ancestry, I have had the privilege of indulging in a diverse array of delectable dishes, each with its unique flavors and textures. My gastronomical journey has led me to this venue, which I highly recommend for its authentic and tantalizing fare. Kudos to the chef and staff for their dedication to excellence!!"

Went to zoo lights for the first time and can definitely see how great it is for kids! Went on a Thursday night and it was Packed! The whole zoo is lit up and it is fun to walk around. Admission is $10/adult. FYI most the animals are asleep so don't get your hopes up!

I've been here for two things: An overnight stay, and a wedding.

1) The rooms are really lovely, much prettier than I ever would've expected.  I'm always taken aback by hotel rooms that aren't decorated with those tacky shades of bright green, coral and tan.  This had a pleasant ivory/gold and navy blue color scheme.  The bed was very comfortable.  Everything seemed very clean.  The staff was friendly upon check-in/check-out.  The only problem was that the walls were incredibly thin and we could hear everything that was being screamed down the hallways by drunks at 3 a.m.  

2) My friend's wedding reception that was held here was lovely.  A member of the waitstaff noticed that a friend of mine had spilled her water all over the table and mopped it up before we could even ask for a towel.  Most of the service was great like that, except for a mixup with some of the entrees--but that was corrected immediately upon our request.

You've got to sit in the patio out back. I'm in Texas and have access to all types of great Mexican food. This place holds its own. Beer was cold, food was fresh, chips and salsa were good. I'd go back and I don't say that about too many places.

Ben here a few times for lunch. Its in a tiny strip mall, and parking can be an issue. We have always had the thin crust pizza and it has always been very good. A large usually will feed two of us.. gluttony definately takes over while your here, and you have to remember to control yourself :)

My boyfriend and I were merely transiting through Las Vegas on February 14th and opted to spend the night, taking advantage of a newly refurbished room at the Gold Coast Hotel, which we secured through hotels.com for a remarkably affordable rate of $30.  

While the location was not directly on the strip, I personally preferred the tranquility and convenience it offered, particularly since we had our own vehicle and did not have to contend with the chaos of pedestrians and challenges of parking typically associated with the strip.  

Upon entering our accommodations, we were pleasantly surprised by the extensively modernized interior, complete with a brand-new bed, contemporary furnishings, and an aesthetically pleasing restroom featuring a large showerhead and a stand-up shower, albeit lacking a bathtub.  

The aspects that truly impressed me about this particular hotel were the user-friendly parking arrangement, a streamlined check-in process situated in close proximity to the parking structure, and the overall ease of navigating the premises without encountering excessive crowds or rowdy individuals, creating a comparatively peaceful ambiance within the casino. Moreover, I was astounded by the absence of cigarette smoke odor within the establishment, a truly unique feature.  

Despite these positive experiences, I deducted one star from my rating due to the sluggish and inefficient service displayed by the check-in staff, which included four individuals behind the counter, with only two actively engaged in their duties, resulting in a 20-minute delay in processing our reservation, despite there being only one customer ahead of us.

"Wow, talk about a total surprise! For the most part, my preconceived notion of breweries revolves around the production and consumption of beer, not culinary delights. However, this establishment serves as the quintessential exception to my generalization. Upon entering, I was struck by the welcoming ambiance; an open and spacious setting reminiscent of a warehouse, which fostered a sense of conviviality. We were promptly presented with menus, encompassing both beverages and cuisine. The beverages were satisfactory, yet unremarkable in their flavor profile, though I would still relish the opportunity to sample their diverse offerings. In contrast, the culinary creations transcended my expectations, boasting unconventional presentations, such as soups served in test tubes, accompanied by delectable flatbreads. The sole drawback encountered during our visit was the limited availability of certain menu items during lunch hours, thereby precluding me from indulging in the highly-recommended shrimp and cotton candy skewers. My anticipation to revisit Charlotte is now heightened, as I eagerly look forward to partaking in distinct gastronomic experiences, particularly the aforementioned cotton candy."
servings are huge... actually in platters and their menu is so reasonably priced!  great food... comfort food esp. family style =)

"Despite the fact that I possessed a Groupon for this particular establishment, I must admit that my expectations were surpassed by the culinary experience offered here. While the supplementary dishes were merely adequate, the pork ribs themselves were cooked to perfection, boasting an optimal tenderness that stopped short of complete disintegration from the bone. Furthermore, the flavorful sauce accompanying the ribs was abundant and of superior quality. Based on my satisfaction with this meal, I would unhesitatingly endorse this restaurant to any individual seeking genuinely delectable ribs within the Phoenix area (a task that, regrettably, proves challenging to accomplish)."

Was it the portraits of Cantinflas on the wall or the food that impressed me the most?

Not sure but I was very happy with this place. The portion sizes were "abuelita" style...my term for portions that are almost too much to handle but delicious. We had the Tamales Oaxaqueno and the Four Traditional Moles. Both were beyond great. Plus Horchata and pineapple soda. 

I would say the only downside was the service seemed a bit erratic. We had a second waitress try to take our orders before we pointed out we were being served already. There was also a woman going around soliciting for change. It took a while before she was shooed off. Overall though I would definitely come back and recommend Casa Reyna.

I have had the pleasure of dining at Famous Dave's a mere ten times, yet my fondness for their culinary offerings knows no bounds. The service has consistently met my expectations and I must commend them for their adeptness in creating a welcoming ambiance. I highly recommend registering for their electronic missives, as they often contain exclusive promotions and discounts.

My affinity for their corn bread cannot be overstated; it's a sublime fusion of sweetness and perfection, leaving me yearning for an indefinite supply. Alas, my craving for their delectable victuals often results in an inflated total, with a recent excursion costing a considerable sum of $70 for two main courses, refreshments, and a sizable hors d'oeuvre. However, the abundance of leftovers generously compensates for the financial investment.

In conclusion, I must draw attention to the invaluable role played by the paper towels positioned atop each table. Their absorbency and versatility prove indispensable in mitigating the aftermath of an excessive BBQ sauce consumption, ensuring that both personal hygiene and dignity remain intact.

This is the best pizza I have eaten in Vegas and one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten (the best pizza I have eaten is in downtown Disney). I gave them 4 stars because their service is incredibly slow but in my experience man of the restaurants in Vegas have slow service. Definitely worth a try and I may be going back for seconds before I head home.

I found this place by accident, as it is tucked away in a strip mall with a very unassuming sign.  It has a very Chipotle like fell, with the whole \"build your own\" but oh so much better, which was shocking to me as well.  The ingredients are fresh, and you can really taste the difference.  They give you healthier options, which is always a nice change.  The guys who work there are ALWAYS so nice and friendly, it's hard not to go back for more.  The chicken, is by far my favorite but they have, shrimp, steak, carnitas, and a veggie option.  \n\nTo make it even better, it is locally owned and operated!!

Armed with a voucher for an indulgent burger meal, Anita and I were not disheartened by the prospect of partaking in such a delectable offering. The burgers, typically served during the daytime hours, were graciously made available for our evening repast by the accommodating staff at Rick's, a chic boutique hotel boasting a contemporary yet inviting ambiance in its reception, bar, and dining areas, replete with warm hues and textures.
