Our voucher featured Innis & Gunn as the preferred beverage option, but alas, it was unavailable, prompting us to select the Grolsch swing-top alternative, which we found quite satisfactory. The burgers, generously proportioned and bursting with flavorful fillings, were cooked to perfection, while the fries, slender and crispy, complemented the meal nicely. We thoroughly enjoyed the culinary experience and would enthusiastically endorse it, although the price point, ranging from approximately \u00a310 to \u00a313 for a single burger, might justify a minor deduction in stars. The service we received throughout our visit was attentive, efficient, and pleasing, earning high praise and making us eager to return.

Virgin America gates not far from security check in. Plenty of seating and eateries nearby. Flying in on a Sunday and out on a Thursday the place wasn't crowded so it made fpr a pleasant travelling. Vegas vibe throughout the airport including slot machines in the baggage claim area.
"Although I am not particularly fond of Ramen, I must admit that this establishment serves truly delectable dishes, my son's pork belly bowl being a prime example; he relished every bite."

"Gastronomical haven! Extremely delighted by the culinary offerings. The oxtail chili cheese fries possess an unparalleled flavor profile, rendering them an absolute delight for the taste buds. The black and green burger, with its incorporation of bleu cheese and pineapple ketchup, constitutes a gustatory experience that is simply unmatched in terms of sheer enjoyment and satisfaction."

I really like bar food, almost too much, and it's something I probably need help with. I can mostly thank some great spots in my home town, but locally, Zipps can be blamed for my progression.\n\nTheir burgers are consistently hot and flavorful, and the focaccias for the most part are good...even if they're just wraps. But in my book, their wings are my favorite in town. More specifically the golden medium wings have tremendous spicy/sweet balance. And their happy hour specials are some of the best deals anywhere. Anywhere!!!

This gambling establishment, as you might anticipate, primarily caters to an elderly clientele. They boast an extensive array of slot machines and video poker terminals, as well as what is arguably the most expansive bingo hall ever conceived. 
  Upon meeting my parents at this casino on a Wednesday at noon, I observed that I was merely one of a select few individuals within the 21-30-year-old age bracket present. Nonetheless, the majority of the croupiers were relatively youthful. A notable advantage of this venue is that the predominantly senior demographic results in the minimum bet for blackjack being lowered to a mere $2, thereby providing an ideal opportunity to refine one's 21-playing abilities without incurring significant financial loss. I opted to participate in a game at a $5 table and managed to walk away with some winnings. It is worth noting that I failed to notice a craps table, and the roulette wheel was automated, which I found rather peculiar. 
  Although the younger player demographic likely converges on weekends, leading to a higher number of unoccupied tables, this casino does not possess an abundance of gaming tables overall. 
  In conclusion, this casino is undoubtedly worthy of a visit, and its location on tribal land only adds to its allure. However, drivers should exercise caution when traveling to and from the casino, as the Beeline Highway is closely monitored by the Arizona State Police for speeding violations.

"My spouse and I partook of a culinary experience at this eatery this evening, and our palates were thoroughly satiated by the delectable fare presented before us. We initiated our meal with an order of hummus, a traditional Middle Eastern dip, which served as a suitable precursor to the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance â?the gyro sandwich. My companion opted for a side of steak fries, while I selected a simple green salad to complement my entrÃ©e. The quality of the comestibles was superlative, with the side salad eliciting particular praise due to its freshness and flavor. Notwithstanding the somewhat outdated ambiance of the establishment, which prevented me from conferring a perfect five-star rating, the culinary prowess of the chef and the hospitable demeanor of the proprietors assuredly warrant a repeat visit in the near future."

"Recently, we had the pleasure of partaking in a midday repast at this esteemed establishment, and our expectations were thoroughly exceeded. Despite the throngs of patrons and the somewhat arduous process of securing a parking spot, we were able to secure a table with relative expediency. The ambiance of the restaurant was reminiscent of a quintessential dive, complete with the melodic strains of 50's music emanating from the radio (a delightful touch, we must say). The culinary offerings were quite impressive, particularly the Lamb Burger, which we found to be a veritable gustatory delight. Our spouse opted for one of the Hot Dogs, which was enshrouded in a rich, velvety blanket of Chili and Pimento Cheese; their effusive praise for this delectable dish was palpable. It is worth noting that, despite our unwavering satisfaction with our own meal, we couldn't help but experience a pang of gastronomic envy upon beholding the tantalizing Hot Dog arrayed before us. Suffice it to say, we would unhesitatingly return to this eatery in the future."

I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!\n\nFor dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!

"Commencing my assessment, I must aver that my appraisal shall diverge from the norm. We attended Graze for the Frozen Assets benefit soiree in support of Clean Lakes Alliance, whereupon the eatery underwent a metamorphosis to accommodate this grandiose themed gathering. The atmosphere was rather convivial, fostering an air of joviality among the patrons. Graze catered the affair, and their delectable hors d'oeuvres garnered unanimous approbation from the attendees. The venue was bursting at the seams with revelers, as evidenced by the copious number of individuals we engaged in conversation, all of whom expressed immense satisfaction with both the location and Graze's hospitable nature as host."

first happy hour since we arrived back to scottsdale and this place still has one of the best. the sushi and sake are well priced, but still....what's up with the freaking music!!! it's like a club in there, so loud. and when did the waitresses start dressing like skanky school girls? they're nice to look at, but it gives the place a kind of, i don't know, colleg-ish bar feel?
The $29 Kobe Burger was outstanding! (actually worth the $29 - highly recommend!) - service was very good - Matt

"Indubitably, it is a minuscule, cramped, and somewhat decrepit coffee bar that could be classified as a ghetto establishment, but the chai served therein cannot be surpassed in terms of quality. The 'barista,' who appears to be the sole proprietor and operator of this diminutive drinkery, seems to be preoccupied with the meticulous preparation of a single cup of coffee at a time, thereby neglecting to acknowledge the presence of any other patrons. Consequently, the waiting period for obtaining a cup of coffee may be prolonged beyond the norm. However, if you possess sufficient leisure time, specifically ranging from 10 to 15 minutes, it may be advisable to procure your coffee 'to go,' as the experience may not necessarily be regrettable."

"The recent establishment of a novel Stingray venue at Scottsdale Quarter has contributed positively to the progressive growth of eateries within North Scottsdale. Featuring an innovative design, the bar area boasts entire walls that can be effortlessly slid open, effectively integrating the outdoor ambiance into the indoor space. The interior design exudes an air of refinement and sophistication, while the immaculate cleanliness of the premises serves as a testament to its relatively recent opening. Upon visiting this establishment, I enjoyed a satisfying lunch experience, highlighted by my customary order of the lunch sashimi combination. Priced at $15, the sashimi combo at Stingray is marginally higher in cost compared to the identical dish offered at RA, situated across the street in Kierland. However, the inclusion of a complementary cucumber salad and the richer, more flavorful miso soup at Stingray constituted a notable difference. While both restaurants offer a comparable quantity of fish, the shorter and thicker slices of fish at Stingray facilitate easier manipulation with chopsticks. Additionally, the spaciousness of the bar area, extending profoundly from front to back, allows patrons ample room for their personal belongings and creates a sense of relaxation, without the sensation of being overly intrusive upon the bartender's workspace. The service provided by the staff was adequate and cordial, fostering an atmosphere conducive to a pleasurable dining experience. Based on my positive encounter, I would unquestionably consider revisiting this establishment in the future."

"Prior to attending this particular Cirque du Soleil production, I had yet to experience the captivating nature of their performances, and thus, my anticipation was palpable. Upon entering the auditorium, my initial reaction to our seating arrangement was one of mild disappointment, as our seats were located at quite a distance from the stage. However, my concerns were quickly alleviated, as the elevated position afforded a comprehensive view of the elaborate set design, which bore a striking resemblance to the fictional city of Midgar from the popular role-playing game Final Fantasy VII. The attendants, adorned in attire reminiscent of a fusion between Tim Burton's signature gothic style and the wizarding world of Harry Potter, added to the enchanting ambiance. The show itself was a visual feast, with a dynamic set that incorporated a rotating platform, which moved with mechanical precision in various directions, allowing for an engaging and easily followable narrative. Furthermore, the artistic influence of the production was evident in the stylish clothing available for purchase at the gift shop, which, if I had unlimited financial resources, would have been a welcome addition to my wardrobe."

I always get the fish tacos with sweet potato fries. Best in town. I really haven't had better fish tacos anywhere else despite my many failed attempts. They have a decent brunch buffet but you literally won't be able to eat for 3 days, it is an insane amount of food and you get full just looking at it all!

These are the best, \"mass produced\" brownies I've ever tasted!  I am very impressed with how they keep the texture and moistness consistent across all of their different types and flavors of brownies.\n\nTheir store is really just a counter with a bunch of different brownies.  This isn't A place to go for dessert.  You show up, you try whatever samples they might have out and then you select which brownies they want.  Their focus really is on selling large quantities of brownies and their mail order business.
The food is excellent  , great special occasion restaurants .. southwest flair not the typical Mexican food . Excellent choices of Tequila  - and cocktails..

Likle most delis, Peckhams has somewhat of a bizarre effect on me. I love the thought of it, and as I approach the door I get visibly excited at the thought of the numerous culinary treats within. Yet when I actually get inside, I can never find anything I actually want to eat, or can be bothered with the hassle of cooking.\n\nOne day I'll find something I'm sure. That aside, Peckhams is a chain deli with branches in more or less every area that has below average unemployment. Cous cous, olives, fancy bread, cakes and imported booze, you know what to expect.

We came here last night because of a restaurant.com coupon, but couldn't use it because it was a half off bottles Monday... and it did say it on the coupon after reading the fine print. But, we stuck around anyway and we had an enjoyable experience. I love the look of the place. Reminds me of an east coast new york style restaurant with the brick walls. Ambiance is romantic and pretty. Tables are somewhat close together but not unbearable. Probably not the best place to bring children. Food prices are kind of hefty also, but I enjoyed my chicken Gorgonzola dish. My boyfriend got the same thing and he liked it as well. Service was good and fast. Would come back again.

Die neueröffnete Mood Lounge im ehemaligen Kaktus ist eine wunderbare location, mitten im Wald im Norden von KA an einer schönen mit einzelnen Kiefern bewachsenen Lichtung, bei den Sportplätzen. Das interieur ist stylish, man kann draußen sitzen, soweit alles wunderbar.
Als ich dort war, war gut besucht. Leider hatte die Bedienung am Nachbartisch eine Fehlbuchung gemacht und war dann dermaßen damit beschäftigt und etwas konfus, dass sie sich erst nach einer knappen halben Stunde in der Lage sah, mir die Karte an den Nachbartisch zu bringen. Ich war kurz davor, zu gehen.
Nach 35 Minuten hatte ich dann einen Tequila Sunrise für 6,50 EUR auf dem Tisch stehen. In einem Longdrinkglas. Die Zusammensetzung war wohl richtig, aber der Barkeeper verstand wohl kein Englisch und wusste deshalb auch nicht, was es mit dem Sunrise auf sich hat bzw. haben sollte. Oder er hatte zittrige Hände oder einfach keine Lust, sich die Mühe zu machen und den Grenadine zu unterschichten. Jedenfalls enthielt das Glas einige Eiswürfel die in einer einheitlich orangen Mischung schwammen. Nicht gut. 

Also: location 5 Sterne. Service und Cocktail leider nur 1 Stern.

"Indulge in a bygone era of sophistication and luxury with an evening at this quintessential Las Vegas Steakhouse, reminiscent of the fabled Rat Pack era. Savor premium quality steaks, complemented by robust cocktails and exceptional service that exudes a keen understanding of your every desire. On prior occasions, I have had the pleasure of indulging in their delectable bone-in ribeye and filet mignon offerings; however, my personal inclination favors the latter for its unparalleled tenderness and rich flavor profile."

The ambience of this converted Phoenix gem is apparent when you walk up. It's cozy, inviting and hip without being obvious about it. The small bar is nestled between the kitchen and windows facing the outdoor patio, a perfect vantage for enjoying a craft beer. I chose the seasonal Great Divide Wild Raspberry Ale, with amber tones and real raspberry essence. As a bit of a dairy diva, the griddled cheese sammie seemed appealing - it was recommended by several staffers and lived up to it's foodie fame. Paired with the soup du jour (cheesy chicken enchilada), it was taste bud bliss.

Went for a tour which was incredibly packed with daycares since it is the summer but the workers handled it lovely. Pay the $10 to make a chocolate pizza, it is worth it. The chocolate is amazing and there is a large selection to choose from!

Dined here on a Tuesday for lunch, wasn't too crowded, service was a little slow as you can tell they have a lot of lunch orders to fill - hence the 4 stars. However, this place is probably thee best place for sushi in Madison.  Highly recommended, you wont be 

Great date spot - definitely recommended for lunch , I am sure wait times will vary depending on the day.  

Enjoyed the salmon with mango ... excellent roll! All the food was perfectly done.

"The Shark Reef is an ideal location to escape the hustle and bustle of the busy crowds and avid gamblers, offering a unique experience to immerse oneself in an 'underwater' adventure. Having visited the attraction on two separate occasions, I have come to appreciate the diverse array of marine life showcased, including manta rays, octopuses, various species of sharks, and an assortment of fish. Additionally, the presence of a crocodile and other reptiles in the initial exhibits adds to the overall appeal of the aquarium. Located at the southern end of the Las Vegas Strip within Mandalay Bay, the Shark Reef features two walk-through tunnels, providing visitors with an immersive experience. It is worth noting that a member of the staff is stationed at the interactive manta ray exhibit to educate guests on the proper way to interact with these magnificent creatures, as it appears that repetitive guidance is necessary to ensure the safety and well-being of both humans and animals."
Great fast Asian food. Place was packed during lunch. Everything was fresh and flavorful. I like that combos are so cheap and cone with fresh potstickers.

Mert's is very good soul food. Came here with a friend last week. It took a minute for the cornbread to come out because it was hot and fresh out the kitchen. I'm not a big cornbread fan, but slap some butter on this stuff and it's quite amazing.

Our server recommended the ribs, and so I ordered them with the yardbird, mac and cheese and greens. All around great. The ribs were falling off the bone, the yardbird and very good. The mac and cheese was stellar and the greens were some of the best I've tasted in North Carolina.

I finished my meal with the peach cobbler, which was fine, but not great. I kinda wished they had more chocolate options here. I would most certainly come here again.

My in-laws took my husband and I here to thank us for helping them move. I've been wanting to try this place for over a year and I wasn't disappointed. When you first arrive you're greeted with 360 views of the valley. It's an excellent spot to take some pictures--especially at sunset. 

We were promptly seated at a table in the middle of the restaurant after a trip down the slide. We had a great view even though we weren't right beside the window. That was nice. I hate going to a place with great views and staring at the back of the kitchen all night. 

We started with the rattlesnake and cactus fries. I'm glad I tried these unique offerings but I'm not sure I'll try them again. No trip to the Rooste would be complete without them. I had the barbecue chicken and it was delicious. My husband had a burger and his parents had pork chops and prime rib. The cowboy beans are the best I've had. Everyone left happy with a full belly and leftovers to spare. The beer is reasonably priced and served in giant mason jar "pitchers." The best part is that every meal ends with complimentary cotton candy. 

This is a great place for families and they have a full bar for the adults. Don't miss this place if you're visiting Phoenix and if you live here, why haven't you visited already?
Say "hi" to Horney the Bull!

This establishment constitutes one of my preferred Italian eateries within the city limits of Las Vegas, as it embodies an antiquated ambiance reminiscent of the bygone era of Las Vegas's storied past, replete with undertones of organized crime, which, despite its campy nature, manages to function remarkably well.

Several salient aspects regarding this culinary destination warrant mentioning prior to delving into its gastronomical offerings. Located south of the famed Las Vegas Strip, this venue primarily caters to local patrons, thus making it a veritable gem for those seeking an authentic experience untainted by the glitz and glamour associated with tourist hotspots. Furthermore, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance, given the eatery's propensity to attract sizable crowds, and be prepared to expend a sum ranging from $15 to $30 per individual (excluding beverages), as the portions are generous and the quality of the cuisine is consistently high.

On numerous occasions, I have had the pleasure of partaking in the delectable fare served at this establishment, and I must confess that the service has always been exceptional, with both large and small gatherings receiving attentive and proficient attention from the staff.

The difficulty in singling out a specific dish as a recommendation stems from the fact that each item on the menu has consistently impressed my taste buds. However, I feel compelled to steer your attention towards the garlic knots, which, while seemingly unremarkable, transcend the realm of ordinary breadsticks by an order of magnitude. These delectable morsels are capable of eliciting such intense delight that a return visit would be motivated solely by their presence on the menu. Rest assured that the culinary offerings will not disappoint; they are, in point of fact, quite excellent!

We procured last-minute tickets during the inaugural weekend of Zarkana, a production that unequivocally upheld the fundamental tenets of Cirque du Soleil, boasting (1) elaborate costumes that could readily serve as the source of envy for any festive gathering come Halloween; (2) remarkable physical feats executed by a dynamic ensemble with unbridled energy; and (3) a narrative thread that, despite one's best efforts to comprehend, ultimately proved to be somewhat perplexing. In summary, a spectacular performance offering a temporary respite from the pecuniary draining effects of casino gaming for a couple of hours.

Besides witty egg puns, Eggspectations has a wide range of breakfast options; eggs benedict, omlettes, sugar shack and other non-egg based dishes like burgers and pasta. I wouldn't say this is a unique place for brunch but it is reasonably priced and has a nice atmosphere. The dish I ordered when I was last here was the Eggs Florentine, which was quite excellent. 

Menu can be seen here:
http://www.eggspectation.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/Menu_MTL_EN.pdf

"Dined at this establishment on the final evening of my sojourn to Charlotte, and my culinary experience was quite satisfactory, as the fare provided by the kitchen was of considerable quality, and the hospitality extended by the staff was indeed cordial and welcoming; the ambiance of the venue itself was also quite pleasant, boasting an array of televisions for the viewing pleasure of patrons, which happened to be broadcasting a Sunday night football game during my visit. Furthermore, the portions served were generous in size, prompting me to opt for the pulled pork plate designed for a single individual, which was accompanied by two sides of my choosing - macaroni and cheese, as well as fried okra, both of which were delectable and left a lasting impression upon my palate. Notably, the dining area featured numerous booths, contributing to the overall convivial atmosphere of the restaurant."

"A contemporary yet laid-back gastropub that showcases refined British cuisine within a vibrant and welcoming ambiance, complemented by the presentation of global sporting spectacles. The focal point of the eatery consists of an impressive bar adorned with an assortment of beer taps and a backdrop reminiscent of quintessential British telephone booths. 

In the company of a sizable gathering, we relished each and every dish we sampled: enhanced eggs, English ale onion soup, shepherd's pie, a medley of sausages, fish and chips, gastropub burger, butternut squash soup, pork and duck rillettes, beef cheek sandwich, and their delectable roasted jidori chicken. Every offering was meticulously prepared and bursting with flavor, leaving us utterly perplexed as to which dish was the most enjoyable (although it's worth mentioning that both the fish and chips and shepherd's pie were among the finest we've had the pleasure of indulging in to date). 

Furthermore, the prices were reasonable, provided that one possesses the Caesar's rewards card to unlock the more advantageous pricing on the menu. Our server was attentive and courteous, contributing to an overall pleasant experience. We shall undoubtedly return to this establishment in the future."

Still on a quest for the optimal donut, my relentless pursuit has led me to Arizona Donut Co. in Tempe, whereupon my expectations were surpassed by the amiable demeanor of the female staff, though unfortunately, their donuts fell short of my gastronomical standards, garnering a mere two stars at best; needless to say, I did not have the pleasure of consuming the entirety of the old-fashioned glaze and glaze twist I ordered, as the unappealing sight of the oil in which they were fried, combined with the unsettling notion of ingesting such an excessive amount of grease, prompted me to abstain from further indulgence, leaving the remaining pastries uneaten and casting doubt upon the likelihood of my future patronage, save for the possibility of sampling their boba drinks, which, according to a fellow customer, are allegedly quite satisfactory.

Best all you can eat sushi place in town!!! I come here all the time!! Amazing!!! The seared tuna is out of this world!!! If your a local they have a stamp card and after 9 purchases you get one free!!!!

My recent visit with my parents was characterized by their inherent indecisiveness, which ultimately led us to dine at Vida, a culinary establishment that, much to their satisfaction, offered an array of delectable options that catered to their refined tastes.

"There exist establishments that specialize in the culinary delights of pizza, while others proffer a product that merely resembles this delectable dish (Pizza Hut, Domino's, et al.). Brooklyn V's unquestionably falls within the former categorization, offering authentic pizza that rivals its counterparts in both taste and quality. Upon entering the eatery, we opted to initiate our gastronomic excursion with their signature garlic knots, which proved to be an excellent choice. These tantalizing tidbits boasted a delightful marriage of flavors, with the rich, velvety marinara sauce serving as the perfect accompaniment. Subsequently, we elected to sample their 14-inch white pizza, augmenting it with an assortment of toppings including pepperoni, onions, and garlic. The foundation of this dish, the crust, exhibited a remarkable balance of lightness and crunchiness, a truly commendable attribute. However, the pizza itself presented a slight inconsistency in texture, manifesting as a subtle sogginess. Notwithstanding this minor flaw, the overall taste remained satisfying, rendering it a suitable option for those seeking a genuine pizza experience. A consideration of the cost reveals a somewhat elevated price point relative to establishments peddling a similar product. Nonetheless, when factoring in the superior quality of the cuisine, a comparison to eateries serving authentic pizza renders the pricing at Brooklyn V's eminently reasonable."

Upon checking in several hours ago, I was warmly received by an accommodating and hospitable receptionist who provided me with a spacious room located on the first floor. However, I expressed my preference for an alternative accommodation situated on either the second or third floor, to which the receptionist graciously informed me that none were currently available for the present day, but assured me that I would be able to occupy a new room by the following day. I must say, the quality of service I received thus far has been quite satisfactory and I am eager to continually assess and provide updates on the service quality over the course of my stay.

"Folk music revelries ensue with unbridled enthusiasm within the confines of this establishment, as management appears nonplussed by the throngs of patrons who converge upon the premises, culminating in an impromptu ceilidh of sorts. Indeed, this venue has earned its stripes as a veritable Edinburgh institution, attracting an array of talented performers who showcase their musical prowess; suffice it to say, if a folk artist is slated to perform at the nearby Liquid Rooms, rest assured that the ensuing celebration shall transpire here. Alas, Sandy Bells has fallen victim to the constraints of the smoking ban, whereupon the erstwhile ubiquitous cloud of smoke served to mask the pungent aroma that now permeates the atmosphere. Heed my counsel and indulge in a few ales or beers, thereby mitigating the impact of your olfactory sensibilities and allowing you to partake in the merriment unencumbered."

I love this place for quick bites. I first came here when I had a groupon, but that was more than a year ago, and I haven't been back since. Why? I love a good deal: coupons, specials, sales, etc. however, zaba's doesn't offer any of these things (to my knowledge), so it took me a long time to return and pay full price.

Speaking of full price, their prices are pretty hefty for a fast food joint; I spent about $17 on a chicken salad and a massive shrimp burrito. 

Each of the items were large and filling. My sweetie pop and I shared them both and still had leftovers. The shrimp was cooked fresh, but the chicken tasted a bit old and dried out.

All of the other fresh ingredients that you can add (think Subway) are both healthy and delicious. Of love their sweet potatoes, black beans, fajita mix and brown rice most of all.

Overall, I was quite pleased (and full), I just wished they had some coupons! This is feel good fresh Mex that won't make your tummy say %$!&#! after you've eaten here.

Awesome brunch place!!!

It's always packed but you get seated in 10 and food comes by 20. 

Scones are delicious!!!! I love the savory ones! Quiches are great too. If you only want pastries, just walk down a couple of doors on the weekend and there's the pastry shop! And you can save the wait!

I also LOVE pigs in a blanket!! How has anyone not done sausage in pancakes before?! The Mac and cheese pancakes with andouille sausage are really good too!!

I also love the speedy eggwich, if you're into something simple :).  

My new favorite is the grits with sausage patties on the side!! Best thing ever and I always have leftovers!!! :):)

"I profoundly cherish the Outside Inn, boasting an adequate assortment of beverages imbued with hops and barley, complemented by culinary offerings that transcend mediocrity. Specifically, the pretzel chicken sandwich and diminutive burgers known as'sliders' earn my unwavering approval. Although classified as 'bar food,' the fare presented by this establishment exceeds expectations. Moreover, the establishment offers a Wine-O Wednesday promotion, providing patrons an opportunity to partake in a delightful alcoholic beverage at a reasonable price. My spouse and I regularly visit this venue after work, seeking a brief respite accompanied by a refreshing drink or two. Notably, the air filtration system within the premises functions admirably, minimizing the impact of smoking on my senses unless it originates from an immediate proximity."

Growing up, the Greenland Supermarket was a Lucky's, and little bit later an Albertson's. However, just like everything else on Spring Mountain between Rainbow and Decatur I barely recognize it anymore. Chinatown is getting quite epic. 

This is a review of the food court:
In the Greenland Supermarket food court there's a Hawaiian place, a Sushi place, two Korean booths, a Tofu "casserole" place (which I don't think I'll ever try, it sounds kind of disgusting) and a coffee shop which serves Boba but seems to be out of it a lot. 

I really wish the Hawaiian place served lumpia and Portuguese donuts but I digress, the spam musubi was quite delish. The sushi place is pretty cheap, for $1.99 they will give you two nigiri, which is about ten nigiri for $10. I also tried Korean food for the very first time when I came to this place, just for the hell of it. I had a kim-chee and meat stuffed bun, which will have to grow on me sadly. It tastes very good at first but the aftertaste is pretty odd. 

In conclusion, I had a pretty good experience here. I wish they had a little more variety (such as a Vietnamese booth or more offerings at the Hawaiian booth) but I will definitely return.

"Mmmm!  Yet another update for Sesame Inn!  I was going over to the Byham after work last night for the Richard Thompson concert and I had a considerable amount of time to kill before the show.  I'm talking about two and a half hours here.  So since I was dining alone and I had a preference for Chinese cuisine, I headed up to Station Square for some more Sesame Inn. \n\nMy culinary inclinations aren't particularly adventurous when it comes to Chinese fare.  The egg rolls here are truly exceptional.  The shrimp with pea pods is a commendable selection if one favors the fundamentals.  One unfortunate aspect of Chinese cuisine, besides the fact that it can leave one feeling rather bloated approximately an hour after consumption, is that the servings are often excessively generous.  It would be beneficial if they offered smaller, lunch-sized portions for dinner.  Fortunately, I was able to stop by my office afterwards and store the surplus victuals in my refrigerator.  Leftovers for dinner tonight!"

"This quaint eatery exudes an endearing familial ambiance, reminiscent of a small, homespun establishment lovingly managed by a dedicated matriarch and patriarch. The culinary offerings are undoubtedly fresh, assiduously prepared, and presented with a generous portion size. While my personal preference for chickpea dip inclines towards a more pronounced garlic flavor profile, it would be unjust to censure their rendition, given the need to accommodate diverse palates. The Babajanoush, an Armenian eggplant-based dip, showcases a laudable attention to detail in its preparation, manifesting a velvety texture and a judicious blend of quality ingredients, all suffused with an unmistakable sense of national pride and time-honored domestic techniques. Furthermore, the pita bread, radiating warmth and softness, is served in copious amounts, complementing the dishes without overpowering them. Lastly, the tabbouleh salad embodies a harmonious symphony of flavors and textures, deftly balancing the richness of olive oil, the vibrant freshness of cilantro, the juiciness of tomatoes, and the nutty essence of bulgur, collectively yielding a satisfying and well-rounded gustatory experience."

I have been frequenting Thrive/Fresche for an extended period of time and have developed a profound fondness for their nutritious bowls; however, I must express my dissatisfaction with the dining experience, as the establishment exudes a pungent odor reminiscent of bleach or another synthetic substance, which unfortunately does not translate to a pristine ambiance. Specifically, the seating areas are often stained and appear unkempt, giving the impression of neglect in terms of upkeep and maintenance. While it is reasonable to assume that some degree of disarray is inevitable given the high volume of patrons, management should prioritize more efficient cleaning protocols and consider replacing damaged items in a timely manner. Unfortunately, al fresco dining is not a viable alternative, as the surrounding area is permeated by an unpleasant odor, likely emanating from a nearby waste receptacle beyond their control. In light of these factors, I recommend opting for takeout and utilizing advance ordering to minimize waiting time. Notwithstanding the aforementioned drawbacks, I still endorse the enjoyment of their culinary offerings.

Went in yesterday, with a friend of mine. Service was ok, the server just checked on us a minimal amount. Ordered beef tips, and was very pleased with my choice, but needed a to-go box. Packed up my leftovers, left the packed box of food on the table, and headed to the ladies room and my friend came with me, came out and our table was cleaned off, including my to-go box. Found my waiter who had apologized and offered to make a new smaller portion. Did not have time to wait, so declined. Just irritated that they couldn't wait a few moments to be sure the guests had left before they pitched my stuff. I did appreciate the quick way to resolve the issue though.

"Information: Admission pricing varies according to age group and showtime, with adult evening shows costing $10.00, adult Friday and Saturday shows after 6 pm costing $10.50, child (1-11) and senior (62+) shows costing $7.00, adult matinee shows before 6 pm costing $8.00, and early bird 1st matinee showtime (7 days a week) costing $7.00. This particular cinema is the preferred choice of my parents, despite the proximity of two other theaters to their residence, likely due to factors such as minimal crowding, reasonable pricing, comfortable seating, efficient service, and available discount combos at the concession stand, offering a modest reduction in price ranging from $0.50 to $0.75.

Tips: Consider signing up for the Cinemark weekly email newsletter to receive occasional coupons and promotions. Seniors can enjoy $4 movies on Mondays through Fridays before 4 pm. Additionally, student discounts are available."

"The accommodations offered exceptional value, given the prime location.  The guest quarters were remarkably expansive, and the hospitality of the staff was truly commendable.  Based on recommendations gleaned from tripadvisor.com, we opted for a room in the North tower, purportedly refurbished to a more contemporary standard.  Aesthetically, the bathroom cabinetry exhibited minor cosmetic deterioration, manifested in the form of peeling paint.  Otherwise, our sojourn was utterly enjoyable, and I would not hesitate to consider this establishment for future lodging needs."

"My familiarity with St Leonard's Land is limited to the context of sitting for my first and second year exams within its expansive halls, thereby rendering it a less than ideal location in my personal preferences. However, in comparison to other exam venues, the spacious nature of the building, replete with numerous small staircases leading to secluded gymnasiums and rooms, does confer a certain degree of uniqueness upon it. My experience in the primary hall was particularly noteworthy, as I was struck by its impressive capacity to accommodate a substantial number of tables and chairs simultaneously. In contrast, the smaller gymnasium in which I took my exam the following year, while still possessing a respectable size, exhibited signs of wear and tear, including scuffed floors, outdated decor, and grimy windows. Nevertheless, the presence of strategically positioned curtains served to effectively mitigate any potential echoes, thereby creating an environment conducive to concentration."

"The delectability of sliders and baby brats was utterly remarkable, their gastronomical appeal being second only to that of Marzen, a brew which, alongside its cohort blonde bock, enjoyed a ubiquity within domestic settings that was nothing short of pervasive."

To Rate Stoney N40 you have to actually look at the two sides of Stoney's, the saloon/food and the club/dance hall. Food half four stars, club/dance hall pushing 3. This is a smoke free location which is a huge plus. I prefered Stoney's over Revolver for this reason.

First off with the good: The food and service is excellent. We eat at the bar and the bartenders have always made every meal the best. Each time we've asked to substitute something else on the menu we have been accommodated. I've eaten at Famous Dave's, Mesquite BBQ, Dickie's and Lucile's.. I think Stoney's is on par with Famous Dave's, the customer service, and the local feel gives it a step above any franchise. We eat here weekly and if you don't like the food, your just don't know good BBQ. They need to advertise more though.

The Bad: The club/dance hall is lacking. They are competing with Revolver which is close by. Stoney's has recently started mixing club music within country music. Listening to Luke Bryant then going to Lady Gaga. It just doesn't do it for me at all. This typically brings in a mix from country hats to flat bill affliction-tapout-wear-young kids. Mostly everyone gets along well. They need to have gaming machines at the bar to bring in more people, which will bring in more revenue and hopefully then they can go back to being a country bar,

"Cautious about a venue that offers a diverse array of culinary options, including alfredo pasta, burgers, carne asada burritos, and cheesecake, and questioning whether this establishment might excel in none of these dishes, I opted to investigate further. Commendations are in order for the meticulous preparation of the burgers, allowing customers to specify their desired level of doneness, ranging from rare to well-done. My dining companion and I both ordered our burgers at medium-rare and medium, respectively, and they were cooked to perfection. However, the burger patties themselves lacked flavor, leading me to surmise that they utilize pre-formed frozen patties, which seemed evident from their uniform shape. The restaurant provides numerous opportunities to enhance the burgers, such as adding a fried egg or sautÃ©ed mushrooms, which we took advantage of. The vegetables were fresh and crisp, while the buns were adequately buttered and soft. The fries had a satisfying saltiness, though their flavor was optimized when fully submerged in ketchup. Notably, the pickles were delightfully dill-flavored, prompting me to remark, 'That's a pun that's never been pickled before.' Unfortunately, my companion's fruit punch arrived severely diluted, underscoring the importance of requesting drinks without ice and adding it only when ready to consume them. Additionally, I ordered an iced coffee, which was unremarkable yet satisfactory, and appreciated the convenience of having it delivered. In conclusion, while the menu boasts an extensive variety, the quality of the burger and fries was merely average. Nevertheless, the delivery service is reasonably priced and efficient."

I love the Original Pancake House, but I always hated going to the SouthPark location because it's always insanely busy, usually has a long wait and the tables are incredibly close together.  This location is much more comfortable and has a little more room to sprawl.  We got there around 8:30 on a Sunday morning and left just as it was starting to get busy.  Delicious pancakes, cheery atmosphere and quick service gets my vote every time!

Lovely interior and tasty food. Went during first week & got a 1st come / 1st serve table in bar. No gluten free entrees on menu but they were able to come with a lovely punt. Looking forward to returning to see the next generation of the menu & a few opening kinks ironed out! Overall - highly recommend but call in advance for reservations or go early for a walk-in table.

"Indubitably, the most exceptional smorgasbord I have had the pleasure of indulging in, boasting an extensive array of culinary options that catered to my palate's every whim. The delectable fare not only tantalized my taste buds but also satiated my hunger, rendering it an unparalleled gastronomic experience. To fully appreciate the diverse offerings, it is imperative to arrive with a healthy appetite, allowing one to sample a modicum of each dish. Although the prices may be slightly elevated, the quality of the cuisine renders it a worthwhile investment for those seeking a truly satisfying repast."

"Aria boasts an innovative culinary hotspot that exudes an ambiance of sophisticated elegance, complemented by a fastidious attention to detail in its gastronomic offerings and an erudite approach to customer service. This establishment has had the privilege of hosting yours truly on multiple occasions, and each visit has consistently presented an opportunity to immerse oneself in an atmosphere characterized by a convivial assemblage of discerning patrons and an unwavering commitment to creating a welcoming environment ideal for prefacing a nocturnal excursion to a nightclub or theatrical performance. It is my fervent recommendation that you acquaint yourself with John Venegas, an individual possessing an unparalleled proficiency in cultivating a rapport with clientele that is at once both warmly personable and uncompromisingly professional."

"Indulged in a culinary experience featuring a dairy-based pie today, and my gastronomical expectations were thoroughly satiated by the delectable fare provided by this esteemed eatery. The gustatory sensations elicited by the artisanal pizza were complemented by the hospitable and efficient manner in which it was served, thereby creating a veritable epicurean delight that I would unhesitatingly recommend to any individual harboring a yearning for a scrumptious pizza. Furthermore, the salads proffered by this gastronomic establishment were likewise impressive in their flavorful composition and generous portioning, thus further substantiating the merits of this venue as a prime destination for discerning diners."

"What an enjoyable venue to spend an evening! Although beverages are pricey, the clientele and staff are exceedingly cordial and hospitable. On a Friday night, I opted to partake in some merriment and decided to visit this establishment due to its appearance, which suggested a jovial atmosphere. Upon entering, I observed that the interior was rather diminutive and was filled to capacity with individuals, resulting in a warm temperature, which was further exacerbated by engaging in physical activity. I approached one of the bars and requested that the bartender surprise me with a concoction. To my delight, I was presented with an electric lemonade, which was truly delectable! It required a brief period of time to capture the bartender's attention, however, they were quite occupied, and therefore, I cannot hold it against them. Furthermore, a group of individuals drew me into their conversation while I waited, rendering me oblivious to the delay. Throughout my experiences in clubs and bars, I have never encountered such an array of individuals who would approach me and initiate arbitrary discussions. In fact, I received an invitation onto the balcony, which was designated for a private gathering, and was encouraged to indulge in the bottle service available. Cheers to Grey Goose and Red Bull! Kazba, thank you for displaying a pleasurable experience. Among the convivial patrons (including the affable bouncers!), exceptional DJ, and intriguing mixed drinks, I am thoroughly impressed."

Amazing set, the performers do things that are just mind blowing. I couldn't really follow the entire story, but got the gist of it. The story line isn't why you go anyway. Overall enjoyable experience.

Nice little hidden gem on the north side of town.  Gave me the feeling that I was in the move \"Swingers\".  Good mix of drinks with island inspired names. Video poker and slot machines at the bar but dont expect ti get comp drinks unless you put in a $20 and are betting max credits. Funky jutebox all with vitage music.  Arrive early and snag a seat in the back or at the bar- the tables in center of the lounge are uncomfortable and kinda feel like a childrens play table - if you have tall or more curvy friends get a table in the back with the couches. Bartenders were pretty friendly and were preety quick on the service. Look forward to my next visit.

"Culinary indulgence: utterly remarkable... devoured the bone-in ribeye; savored its juiciness and tenderness... sublimely satisfying experience. 
Tariff: indeed, a tad pricey, but commensurate with the opulence of the location. Hence, four stars. 
Atmosphere: tasteful, understated elegance. 
Hospitality: impeccable service delivered by attentive and personable servers. 
In conclusion: unwaveringly endorse this esteemed establishment for steak aficionados seeking an exceptional dining experience, willing to part with a premium."

Nice out of the way all you can eat sushi place.  I usually eat enough nigiri to make the trip and price worth while but as a discerning certified asian, I eat muuuuch more than I can handle.  I can eat way more fish than the $25.95 all you can eat price.\n\nOnly restriction is one uni and amaebi dish per person (and one toro when they have it).  The tempura here is very well done and somehow, in the middle of a desert, the fish is quite fresh.  Definitely a place I'd go back to when I'm in town.

This establishment serves as our preferred venue for Chinese cuisine whenever we visit the airport, primarily due to the delectable fare they offer. During our initial visit, we encountered subpar service; however, the culinary delights they provided were sufficient enough to warrant a second chance. Upon our return last night, we experienced a considerable improvement, with a marked enhancement in the quality of service rendered by our server, who exhibited both humor and attentiveness to our gathering's requirements. Our orders were prepared expeditiously, with all four dishes arriving freshly cooked and steaming hot within a mere five-minute interval. My individual preference remains the Szechwan chicken, although the entirety of the menu selections we sampled boasted exceptional quality and flavor. The food at this establishment maintains a high level of excellence and does not possess the customary greasiness often associated with Chinese cuisine, making it an appealing option for those seeking a more refined dining experience. Furthermore, the ambiance of the restaurant exudes a welcoming atmosphere, while the noise level remains tolerable and unobtrusive. Notably, upon utilizing the Yelp application to check-in, we were led to believe that a complimentary dessert would be forthcoming; regrettably, this perk was not honored for reasons unknown.

We thoroughly relished the inaugural festivities at the Summerlin venue, whereupon we were impressed by the aesthetically pleasing ambiance and the exceptional quality of service proffered by the staff. Throughout the course of the evening, our culinary experiences were largely satisfying, with the notable exception of the barbecued shrimp, which unfortunately failed to meet our expectations due to the utilization of four medium-sized, out-of-shell shrimp that were overcooked, resulting in an unfortunate texture and a lackluster dining experience further compounded by the presence of hard rice. In order to execute this quintessential dish effectively, it is crucial to incorporate large in-shell shrimp and reassess the sauce to include a sufficient amount of garlic, thereby elevating the flavor profile and ensuring an enjoyable dining experience for patrons.

"Upon culminating a quest to identify an edible establishment that offers delivery services, I chanced upon this eatery and decided to partake in their gastronomical offerings. Following a fifty-minute wait, which seemed interminable due to my advanced state of pregnancy, I relished the delectable flavors of the California club sandwich, accompanied by a rich, velvety gooey ball. The former dish proved to be an unmitigated success, while the latter indulgence elicited such unbridled enthusiasm that I felt compelled to savor each morsel in silence, precluding any possibility of sharing it with my six-year-old offspring until she became cognizant of my possession of a sweet treat. The quality of the victuals was such that I envision repeated visits to satiate my cravings for the aforementioned gooey delight. Although I cannot comment on the ambiance of the restaurant proper, the efficiency of the delivery service during peak hours left much to be desired. Nonetheless, my inaugural experience with this establishment has kindled a desire for future patronage."

"I possess a profound fondness for Lai Lai's culinary offerings, however, my significant other does not share my enthusiasm, citing an absence of piquancy despite her request for an additional quantity of red chili oil, which she deems insufficient. My personal taste preferences do not lean towards fiery sensations, which likely contributes to my appreciation for this establishment, as their sweet sauce is truly delectable. \n\nTheir noodles are unparalleled in quality compared to any other Mongolian restaurant in the Valley, and the staff member responsible for serving patrons exhibits exceptional kindness and a welcoming demeanor, creating the illusion that she recognizes me on each visit. Unfortunately, the pineapple portions they serve are excessively generous, making it arduous to locate satisfactory pineapple dishes in Phoenix. Furthermore, the prices charged at Lai Lai's are somewhat steep, and they have adopted a strict policy regarding leftovers, only permitting to-go orders to be priced based on the weight of the food."

A luxurious lodging establishment, characterized by an elevated level of refinement and sophistication, boasting superior quality dining establishments, accommodations, service, and other amenities, yet, regrettably, they have a tendency to engage in exorbitant pricing practices, capitalizing on their guests' financial resources to the utmost extent possible.

The standard guest rooms, while marginally more sumptuous than those found at a typical four-star hotel located along the Las Vegas Strip, are essentially comparable in terms of dimensions, rendering them unsuitable for accommodating large groups of individuals; therefore, it would be more practical and cost-effective to reserve a suite at a less prestigious hotel, if you intend to host numerous guests.

Notwithstanding, this opulent hotel offers a plethora of opportunities for indulging in extravagant expenditures, providing an optimal environment for those who possess the financial means to indulge in lavish spending.

"An exceptional eatery that offers an optimal environment for indulging in delectable dumplings. The venue's diminutive size, accommodating up to five individuals, fosters an intimate ambiance conducive to relishing flavorsome fare. Upon entering, patrons may experience a brief delay due to the establishment's popularity, yet the cordial staff expedites orders with remarkable efficiency. The menu presents a straightforward selection, ranging from $5 to $9 for fifteen dumplings, and salads priced at a mere $1 to $1.50. Following the recommendation of the affable server, I sampled the wasabi salad, which delighted my taste buds with its piquant zest. Subsequently, I indulged in beef and onion dumplings, shrimp, pork, and coriander dumplings, with the latter emerging as the most scrumptious variant I have had the pleasure of consuming. The brief waiting period, approximating five to ten minutes, merely heightened my anticipation for the culinary delights to follow. Unquestionably, this restaurant merits a return visit, as it serves genuine dumplings, unaccompanied by extraneous options such as fried rice or sushi found at other establishments. This review aims to provide valuable insight; feedback regarding its helpfulness would be greatly appreciated."

"My captivation with this exhibition is unequivocal, as the meticulously arranged human remains, coupled with the various bodily systems, serve as a pinnacle of edification. As an individual whose aversion to scientific disciplines was pronounced during their academic tenure, I find this manifestation of science to be simultaneously engaging and enlightening. 

The unobstructed visibility of the arterial and venous networks, juxtaposed against the partial dissolution of the remaining tissue, is nothing short of extraordinary. Such an exemplary presentation profoundly enhances one's comprehension of the intricate interconnectedness of these complex biological structures. 

I would enthusiastically endorse this exhibit to any and all interested parties. Furthermore, in light of MGM Resorts' temporary promotion, whereby three attractions can be experienced for the sum of $54, the opportunity to incorporate both this exhibit and the CSI Experience at the MGM Grand into a single visit, thereby maximizing one's exposure to diverse forms of cognitive stimulation while minimizing financial expenditure, is indeed a most advantageous proposition."

The Orleans Hotel persistently receives elevated commendations in Las Vegas as the optimal lodging choice for value-conscious patrons, a sentiment with which I wholeheartedly concur. The guest rooms are spacious and furnished with utmost comfort, while the pool area strikes an ideal balance between sunlit and shaded zones. The establishment boasts several well-regarded drinking establishments and dining options, including a recently inaugurated TGI Fridays that tends to be perpetually thronged. Furthermore, the hotel features a bowling alley and an 18-screen movie theater complex situated on the higher floors, allowing guests to surreptitiously partake in supplementary amenities if they are so inclined, which, in my case, I frequently am. I have had the pleasure of staying at the Orleans Hotel on multiple occasions during the past couple of years, taking advantage of their slot tournament package priced at $99 for three nights, inclusive of entry into the competition. Unfortunately, my performance in the tournament has been less than satisfactory, yielding zero victories thus far. Nevertheless, I remain optimistic and plan to participate once more in July. The sole drawback associated with this hotel and casino lies in its off-strip location along Tropicana Avenue. However, this minor inconvenience is offset by the proximity of the Seamless Gentlemen's Club situated directly across the street. In conclusion, the Orleans Hotel offers an exceptional value, particularly when considering the accommodation rates, making it a wise choice for anyone seeking a memorable and enjoyable experience in Las Vegas.

While I may not be an ardent devotee of Mexican cuisine, my spouse is, and thus, I find myself evaluating this establishment, as she regularly dispatches me to this particular neighborhood. During our visit in June, she indulged in their offerings twice within the same week, and I have returned thereon multiple occasions subsequent to our relocation. Her preference is the Burrito enchilada style, accompanied by green sauce and a medley of rice and beans. Allow me to assure you that upon procurement of this culinary delight, the food is contained in a vessel that maintains its thermal properties for a minimum of three hoursâand I stress, people, it remains piping hot. The menu boasts merely five options, which I shall post forthwith, and you shall observe that the cost of this authentic Mexican fare is indeed considerable. Notwithstanding, this local haunt attracts a diverse clientele who convene daily for luncheon. It is worth mentioning that the establishment operates until approximately 4 pm, at which point it becomes uninhabitedâa phenomenon I found quite amusing. Thus, if one is willing to venture into this specific neighborhood in pursuit of genuine Mexican cuisine, they shall discover that the expenditure of eight dollars shall provide them with an unparalleled gastronomical experience, according to my spouse's esteemed opinion. Bon appÃ©tit, my associates!

"My excitement knew no bounds upon arriving at this establishment, as I had been eagerly anticipating the indulgence in their delectable offerings for quite some time. The velvety texture and rich flavor profile of the custard did not disappoint, earning it a well-deserved perfect score of five. However, my enthusiasm was somewhat tempered by my lukewarm reception of the icee, which failed to resonate with my taste buds in the same manner as its creamy counterpart. Despite this minor setback, I remained determined to sample a variety of flavors, including lemon, lime, cherry, chocolate chip, strawberry-mango, and cucumber melon. Upon doing so, I discovered that the latter two options were the most palatable to my sensibilities, thereby solidifying my conviction that a successful visit can be assured if one adheres to the practice of judicious flavor selection."

Love this place! Only reasons it's getting 4 stars instead of 5: the calamari appetizer was very small, maybe 7 or 8 rings, and they don't have soda water. Otherwise the place is a great value. Nice atmosphere, friendly and attentive service and super tasty hibachi dinner for the price of lunch? Yes please!

"Situated within close proximity to my workplace, this establishment has become a familiar destination for me, having partaken in their midday offerings on multiple occasions. In general, it is a satisfactory venue, providing a swift and relatively economical (in relation to sushi) dining experience. 

They boast an extensive array of options, which are presented on a continuous conveyor belt, allowing patrons to select their preferences with ease. Amusingly, certain items, such as cream puffs, jello pudding, and canned fruit, are also available, adding a touch of levity to the atmosphere. 

While some may find the service to be lacking, I have found the process of dividing checks to be straightforward and efficient, and have never encountered any difficulties in obtaining my requested items. 

It is worth noting that my experiences have been limited to the lunchtime hours, and thus, I cannot comment on the evening ambiance. Nonetheless, the visuals depicting tables with stacked plates are quite humorous."

"My significant other possesses a shared ownership interval at this lodging establishment, thus enabling us to indulge in the luxury of a spacious one-bedroom suite. As a novice visitor to the city, I found the location's removed proximity from the primary entertainment thoroughfare to be a welcome respite from the frenetic energy synonymous with the Las Vegas Strip. While some may find it peculiar that I opted not to engage in gaming activities, given the abundance of such opportunities within the city limits, I must confess that my motivation for visiting this famed destination was rooted in an unquenchable curiosity regarding its unique ambiance. In this regard, our accommodations proved ideally suited to satisfying my desire for an immersive experience, boasting a commodious living space replete with a generously proportioned flat-screen television, a well-appointed kitchen area equipped with a microwave oven and refrigeration unit, and a palatial bathing facility. Furthermore, our vantage point offered a captivating panorama of the city's skyline. For those seeking a more subdued sojourn, devoid of the raucous revelry often associated with this metropolis, I would enthusiastically endorse this hotel as a prime choice."

"The culinary experience during the evening meal was truly remarkable!! A baby spinach salad, complemented by the savory warmth of bacon, proved to be an absolute delight and a personal highlight of the dining excursion. Opting for the tender and flavorful filet, while my spouse selected the succulent ribeye, both dishes showcased the chef's proficiency in cookery. However, it must be acknowledged that, despite the delectable offerings presented at this establishment, my affinity for steakhouses remains unwavering, with Ruth's Chris maintaining its position as my preferred destination for an exceptional dining experience."

"My maiden encounter at this establishment was admittedly unpleasant, but subsequent interactions have led me to recognize the exceptional quality of service and cuisine offered by this organization. Following an initial disappointment, we were pampered with lavish hospitality during our subsequent visit, indulging in an exquisite culinary experience that rivals any other Mexican fare I have had the pleasure of sampling. While the prices may be perceived as somewhat elevated, it is important to acknowledge that the cost is commensurate with the superior quality of the dishes served, and thus, it is reasonable to expect such pricing in a free market economy."

"Upon entering the establishment, I observed that the inventory of cupcake flavors appeared to be somewhat depleted, which, given the proximity to the closing time, did not come as a surprise. However, I was promptly reassured by the friendly staff that, despite their absence from the display case, a plethora of flavors (specifically, those denoted by a small circular symbol adjacent to their name on the menu) remained readily available in the kitchen, and could be quickly prepared upon request. Thus, the perceived shortage was effectively mitigated, much to my delight. Furthermore, my visit was further enhanced by the generous offer of a complimentary red velvet cupcake, contingent upon my mentioning a specific phrase,'sugar rush,' which I discovered through following the shop's official Twitter account (@sprinklescupcks). Additionally, I must commend the bakery on its charming website design and commitment to offering seasonal flavors tailored to various holidays and celebrations throughout the year, including Passover, Cinco de Mayo, and Mother's Day this month. In fact, I am eagerly anticipating a return visit this weekend to indulge in their delectable Key Lime cupcakes."

We thoroughly enjoyed our luncheon at this establishment, and our culinary experiences were nothing short of exceptional. Our party relished their respective dishes, but the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance was undoubtedly the delectable dessert we shared. Specifically, the gargantuan layered chocolate cake with its remarkably moist texture left us all in a state of utter amazement. However, it was the sublime frosting that truly elevated our taste buds to new heights; it was akin to savoring the richness of fudge from Disney World or Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory, both renowned for their mastery of all things chocolate. Such an indulgence was almost too fantastic to believe, leading me to question my own memory at times, wondering whether such a delightful encounter could possibly have been mere fantasy. Nonetheless, I assure you, dear reader, that this eatery is genuinely worthy of your patronage, boasting a truly impressive array of culinary delights.

As a local from Hawaii, this is place is pretty good. I tried: 

Kalua pork and cabbage
Hamburger steak
Korean chicken

The korean chicken was fantastic. Just alittle but of crunch on the skin of the chicken and just the right amount of spice. 

I've had better Hamburger steak, but it'll have to do. I wish there were more vegetables on the plate

I've had waaaay better kalua pork. There isn't much flavor to it. 

The mac salad on all the plates was just like home in Hawaii. Just a dash of pepper and it was like being home. 

I really disliked the cash only deal. You're in a casino, people.

"I am utterly astounded by the exceptional quality of service at this establishment, which defies expectations for a fast-food restaurant. The ambiance is pleasant, with a spacious and well-appointed interior, enhanced by an array of engaging articles on the walls that provide entertainment during the brief wait for one's culinary selections. The Caniac Combo, in particular, is a masterclass in portion control, offering a satisfying quantity of delectable sustenance that is further complemented by the sublime dipping sauce. While the sweet tea could benefit from a touch less saccharine, a simple mixture with unsweetened tea rectifies this minor shortcoming, and the lemonade, oh the lemonade, is an unmitigated delight, retaining its refreshing zest even after the ice has melted. Such an impressive beverage selection, coupled with the convenience of a drive-thru, ensures that I shall return with alarming regularity."

"The aforementioned retail establishment serves as the focal point of my unwavering dedication, evoking nostalgic memories of my formative years, during which I frequently visited said premises in the company of my peers, indulging in leisurely activities such as perusing novel merchandise and consuming refreshing beverages. This particular branch, having remained operational for an extended period, boasts an impressive array of amenities, including an expansive parking area, numerous shopping options, and a dedicated eatery, albeit lacking a certain renowned coffee franchise, as previously alluded to by another patron. While it does not qualify as a comprehensive grocery store, it does offer a limited selection of edibles and refrigerated items for convenience. Furthermore, its setting within the Silverado Ranch community contributes to its reputation as a secure and well-maintained shopping destination, in contrast to certain other retail chains."

We had a phenomenal experience at this esteemed eatery, characterized by exceptional service proffered by a delightful waitress who exhibited a profound knowledge of the menu and its intricacies, which greatly enhanced our culinary journey. My filet was cooked to perfection, boasting a tender texture and a delightful medium-rare consistency that was complemented by the delectable dressing of the accompanying greens. My spouse had the pleasure of indulging in the beer-brined chicken wings, which were expertly paired with an avocado sauce and a Caesar salad, resulting in a gustatory symphony that elicited effusive praise from him, particularly regarding the crispy pig's ear crackles that graced the salad, elevating it to a pinnacle of flavor and texture. However, our satisfaction was slightly marred by the roasted cauliflower side dish, which, unfortunately, did not live up to our expectations due to its lack of warmth and divergence from the description on the menu. Nevertheless, we were impressed by the whimsical decor adorning the restrooms, which contributed to the overall convivial ambiance of the dining area, further enhanced by the thoughtful gesture of providing warm towels after the meal, a subtle yet effective touch that reinforced our sense of well-being and contentment.

"The salmon offerings at this sushi establishment are utterly delectable and tantalizing, boasting an unparalleled quality that is simply TO DIE FOR. The Salmon Kama, Salmon sashimi, and I Love Salmon Roll are all sublime creations that will indulge your taste buds in a symphony of flavors and textures. The kama, with its satisfying crunch on the exterior and luscious, velvety interior, is a true gastronomic masterpiece. The divine sashimi, with its melt-in-your-mouth tenderness, is a culinary experience like no other. And the salmon rolls, for those who crave a more traditional sushi experience, are also quite palatable. However, it must be noted that the non-salmon sushi options at this establishment fall somewhat short of the mark, with the seaweed salad lacking a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of seasoning. Nevertheless, any dish that has been subjected to the culinary wizardry of frying is bound to please even the most discerning palate, with the soft shell crab and tempura being prime examples of this. Furthermore, patrons can enjoy an all-you-can-eat option for the reasonable sum of $20, with the added bonus of half-off happy hour specials available during most hours of the day. Additionally, this establishment has listings on restaurant.com, providing further incentive for gourmands to partake in the epicurean delights offered here."

"Indubitably, my visual perception was confronted with an unanticipated exposure of an individual's posterior region protruding from their athletic attire, which was devoid of any underlying garments, ostensibly due to an oversight in their laundry routine; however, such unexpected occurrences are inherently assimilated into the realm of adventure. 

My personal aversion towards operating a motor vehicle within urban areas (indeed, I harbor a profound dislike for driving in general) renders this alternative mode of transportation an utterly delightful experience. The vehicles were spotless, and our waiting time for a cart was brief and infrequent, as they arrived with remarkable regularity. Throughout our excursion, we did not encounter any difficulties or interruptions, and it is worth mentioning that the tram halted merely thrice, at most, during our entire journey, which spanned from the concluding portion of the track in Mesa and back to the central district of Phoenix. Furthermore, we availed ourselves of the opportunity to embark and disembark from the tram on three separate occasions, without witnessing any authorized personnel engaged in ticket inspections, even when the vehicle was filled to capacity with standing passengers. 

My anticipation is heightened in eager expectation of the forthcoming month, when this transportation system will operate until the late hours of 2 am, thereby enabling us to explore and experience an array of establishments and locales within both downtown Phoenix and the central district of the city, with unrestricted freedom and convenience."

"My culinary excursion to this esteemed eatery occurred on a previous occasion, specifically for the purpose of partaking in their midday repast, and I must say that my expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed, particularly with regards to their chopped salad, which garnered such effusive praise from various patrons that I felt compelled to sample it for myself, and I must confess that it was truly a gastronomic masterpiece, possessing the qualities of an upscale public house, albeit at a cost that could be deemed somewhat prohibitive; nonetheless, I would unhesitatingly return to indulge in this delectable salad."

I have an equal fondness for this location, or perhaps a marginal preference for it over the Los Feliz venue. The musical offerings on the jukebox were quite satisfactory, and indeed superior to the sonic ambiance that permeated the atmosphere of the Beauty Bar on the adjacent premises. On weekend evenings, specifically Fridays and Saturdays, a convivial throng would congregate, yet I was able to secure a snug seating arrangement, albeit in close proximity to an amorous couple whose intimate activities were tantamount to engaging in sexual intercourse on the furniture. Despite my discomfort, I couldn't help but be mildly diverted by the young man's ingratiating gestures.

I was Ill prepared for the lavish world that I was stepping into. I was under dressed and was expecting something rustic (why, I dunno). Whilst the building in which the Wine Loft is housed is fairly new and modern, it gives zero indication of the chic ambiance lurking inside. I seriously had a \"woah\" moment upon entering.\n \nRich, dark, masculine undertones are complimented with black contemporary furniture. Dimly lit lights make for an intimate and romantic environment to either impress that hot date or vibe with the music with a nice glass of wine. Low key, mature and just plain sexy.

Holy Yummy!!' The Wagu Beef Sliders were out of this world! The pork belly was so good as were the mashed potatoes and our Filef. The atmosphere was super cool, the music was AWESOME!!! The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because our server was super terrific but the assistant servers were a little weird...other than that, great great time and a must go if you are in Vegas!

"The eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable cuisine and an extensive selection of sugary indulgences, rendering it a viable alternative for breakfast or lunch for those lodging at the Paris Casino. Furthermore, the confectionery store adjacent to the restaurant maintains a predictable assortment of diminutive sweet treats, thus catering to patrons with a penchant for such delights. Additionally, members of the Harrah's casinos' Total Rewards program can utilize their accrued complimentary points within both the culinary establishment and its adjacent sweet shop."

What you say? A hot pot all for myself? Yeah!

I had the lamb hot pot and my partner had the beef hot pot ($9.99 each). The lamb broth had a vinegary tang to it, which I liked and the beef broth had a good hearty flavor. Both came with tofu, crab sticks, tofu skin, mushrooms, a fish ball (with pork inside), bok choy, carrots, tomatoes (ideal for a good broth flavor), and their respective meats (thinly sliced). We ordered add-ins of fish balls ($1.50) and noodles ($1.50), which we split between us, and spicy level 4.

The broths were very flavorful and you could adjust the flame below if you wanted it more or less bubbling hot.

It was our first time there, so the owner was very helpful in explaining how it worked, which we both appreciated. She also showed us how to do the sauces, even offering to make one "special" for us. I mixed green onion, cilantro, and garlic oil; my partner was quite fond of the garlic oil and Chinese BBQ sauces together.

Tip: the ingredients can be quite hot, so take out the goodies and put them on a plate to cool off a little before wolfing them down.

While I wish we hadn't waited so long to finally stop in,  now that we have, we will definitely be back. Next time, we're going to try some of the skewers they offer, too.

"I thoroughly enjoy dining at this particular Olive Garden establishment, primarily due to its proximity to my domicile. Following an unsatisfactory visit to another branch (refer to my review of the Olive Garden on Centennial), I opted to patronize this location and was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional quality of service. Upon arrival, I was promptly seated and served a beverage in a timely manner. My soup arrived swiftly and was piping hot, while the Chicken Marsala was exquisitely prepared and presented. Additionally, I requested a dessert to-go, which my server graciously offered to complimentary, albeit unnecessary, given the exemplary nature of my dining experience. I genuinely appreciate such thoughtful gestures and consider this eatery my preferred Olive Garden destination."

Sunday breakfast at 3pm! Yes, I am a fan!

If only this place is not hidden in the corner of a building in Civic Center, I'd find it a long time ago! There we are, stopped by at 3pm for a late breakfast, and we enjoyed every bite of our food! 

-Freshly squeezed orange juice - yes, not from a bottle or a can, you can taste the freshness, so get a large glass! (medium size is the size of the water glass which you'll see once the water is delivered to your table)

-Original French Toast - yummy! nothing special but the original! That is all we need!

-Banana Nut Pancakes - my fav! pieces of banana and pecans 'hidden' in the puffy pancake top with maple syrup! I paired my pancakes with seared/fried(?) prosciutto, saltiness and sweetness all together! can I come back tomorrow?

-Soup of the day - Chili - yes, this cup of chili was spicy!

Service was excellent as we were the last table at the restaurant, we did not feel any rush that we need to leave as the clock ticks to 4pm (when they close). One thing I wish our server had said was that the portion is big. Both the French Toast and Pancakes are very big dishes, if you are not so hungry for a huge meal, share your plate!

"Burgers of considerable quality!  This establishment boasts a unique concept of 'custom-built' burgers, wherein patrons are afforded the opportunity to select each component of their burger, ranging from the type of meat, bun, cheese, toppings, and sauce, thereby allowing them to create a culinary masterpiece tailored to their precise preferences.  Furthermore, the prices charged for these delectable burgers, while somewhat elevated, are commensurate with the superior quality of the ingredients employed in their preparation, thus making them worthwhile for those seeking a satisfying dining experience that transcends the mundane fast-food fare commonly found elsewhere.  It is unfortunate, however, that the cost of indulging in such gastronomic delights can be somewhat prohibitive, as the total expense for a meal for two, inclusive of two burgers, a shared small fry, and beverages, can exceed $20, which may be perceived as excessive by some individuals.
