Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the ability to craft distinctive and flavorful burger combinations that are unavailable at other establishments renders this eatery an appealing destination for those seeking a memorable dining experience.  Indeed, the quality of the food and the novelty of the concept justify the cost, and I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment in the future, were I to find myself in the vicinity.  Moreover, I wish such establishments were more widespread, as their absence in certain regions limits the opportunities for culinary exploration and enjoyment."

I love firebirds and eat here often, they have one of the best hamburgers around if you are willing to pay the $$ also addicted to their house salad... great specials during the week and the bar area is a nice place to relax, especially when its cold and the fireplace is going.
I stopped here for lunch and the service was fast and friendly.  The food was fresh and wasn't greasy.  Overall, I was pleased with this place and will be back again.

I had procured a late model 4Runner from the early 1990s at a discounted price, cognizant of the fact that it required certain repairs and refurbishments. Amongst various other issues, it exhibited a profound exhaust leak stemming from a severely corroded catalytic converter. Fortunately, Advance was able to expertly weld in a suitable replacement component that aligned with my financial constraints and performed the necessary labor while I waited. Consequently, they have become my preferred exhaust specialists for all future endeavors pertaining to exhaust system maintenance and repair.

I have driven by this location numerous times and would try to remind myself to go there when out with friends, but just never seemed to get around to it...until last week!  This location serves up the same great food as the other locations, but isn't as busy.  I will definitely come back.  

If you are looking for the atmosphere of the one on Central, you won't find it.  It's more like the one in Mesa, but even toned down a bit compared to that one.

Go for the food!!!  The service was great and everyone is just as friendly so what are you waiting for?  Get in there and eat some food!

"Like the majority of culinary offerings within this particular urban setting, I would categorize it as 'Pittsburgh good,' a qualitative assessment that acknowledges its relatively superior quality within the local gastronomic landscape, while recognizing that it may not necessarily meet the elevated standards of more discerning consumers in other cities. However, it is worth noting that the pho served at this establishment is, in fact, the most satisfactory in town, a distinction that, while perhaps not constituting effusive praise, remains noteworthy in light of the generally mediocre quality of similar dishes available elsewhere in Pittsburgh. It is also relevant to mention that my exposure to other pho places within the city has been limited to only two instances, both of which were regrettably subpar, thereby rendering my endorsement of this particular eatery somewhat relative to my admittedly meager frame of reference."

Guess what?  I'm a guy and I can sew a button back on and sew a small, albeit ugly, patch on torn fabric.  But that's it, I cant needlepoint or anything.

I had a few items to be repaired and one item to get hemmed. Good prices, $5 per repair, and $10 for the hemming.

Very nice work done by a couple of friendly ladies.

Papa Murphys is by far my favorite of the chain pizza available in Las Vegas. I always get the DeLite crust, as it reheats much better than the thicker crusts. You get to pick your toppings, and they have a bunch to choose from. The sauce is good, and the toppings always taste fresh. 

Look online for coupons before you go. The website always has some, and there is usually one for the DeLite crust. You can call ahead, but it usually only takes a few minutes if you go in to order.

The reason I can't give them 5 stars is because they always seem to be out of something. One time, it was the DeLite crust. They stretched the regular crust out instead. They have been out of bacon at least twice while I was there, and various other toppings at one point or another.

But if you are looking for a cheap, tasty pizza and don't mind cooking it yourself, go to Papa Murphys.

"Feeling an unwavering inclination towards culinary exploration on a Saturday morning, I opted to diverge from my customary route to the market and experience something novel by visiting Chez Boris, a venue that had piqued my curiosity throughout the summer months. Located within Montreal's vibrant Mile End district, specifically on Park Avenue between Laurier and Fairmount, this eatery specializes in delectable doughnuts, offering them at a reasonable price of 75 cents apiece. Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by the diverse array of coatings available for their freshly prepared, made-to-order doughnuts. Opting for a trio of doughnuts, I selected two sugar-coated and one cinnamon-coated variety, along with a raspberry-coated doughnut to round out my order. Each doughnut boasted a satisfying crunch on the exterior, complemented by a delightfully fluffy interior, thereby fulfilling my expectations for an idyllic doughnut experience. If you seek a brief respite from the mundane and crave a sweet treat that transcends the ordinary, Chez Boris is an absolute must-visit destination. Moreover, the utilization of a Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) as a card holder only serves to enhance the charm of this captivating eatery. In conclusion, I assure you that paying a visit to Chez Boris will undoubtedly satiate your yearning for a unique gastronomic adventure."

I recently had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable repast at Logan's Roadhouse, accompanied by a fellow gastronome who had not yet had the privilege of dining at this esteemed establishment. Our culinary excursion took place in the early afternoon, thereby affording us the opportunity to indulge in a leisurely luncheon without the burden of excessive crowding.  

The hospitality we received was of the highest quality, with our server displaying consummate proficiency in her duties and ensuring that our glasses were perpetually replenished with an array of refreshing beverages. However, it was the sublime dinner rolls that truly captured our attention and left an indelible impression upon our palates. Indeed, they were nothing short of extraordinary, their heavenly flavor and texture evoking feelings of pure bliss and contentment.  

My dining companion and I both opted for the delectable pork chop, which was skillfully prepared to achieve maximum tenderness and juiciness. Furthermore, the sweet potato fries that accompanied our meals were enhanced by the judicious application of cinnamon and butter, creating a delightful harmony of flavors that complemented our main courses perfectly. To maintain a sense of balance and equilibrium, I elected to include a serving of expertly cooked broccoli within my meal, thus rounding out the ensemble with a healthy and nutritious component.  

Ultimately, the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of our dining experience arrived in the form of our companion's generous offer to cover the cost of our repast, graciously bestowed upon us like a cherry atop a sundae. It was a magnanimous gesture that served as a fitting conclusion to a truly satisfying and enjoyable meal, made all the more memorable by the captivating ambiance and exceptional service that characterizes Logan's Roadhouse.

I'm not giving a 5-star just because I have yet to taste any of their boba drinks. But I did try their Deli Manjoo that were so addicting and delicious! The owners had brought over a few samples for our work near by to try and we have been hooked! 

Just today, I went by to get the Deli Manjoos but their machine was broken (BUT THEY ARE IN PROCESS OF FIXING IT ASAP!!!!!!) so I got myself a combination chicken and lamb baguette sandwich and it was so delicious!!!!!!!!  

The (new) owners were such sweethearts and so kind! They are always so welcoming and always smiling :) I will definitely go back, even if I'm not working or just near by!

On a Tuesday evening, I found myself with an unanticipated hiatus of approximately one and a half hours while awaiting the arrival of an individual at the aerodrome. Seizing the opportunity to indulge in a culinary escapade, I opted to visit the revamped establishment formerly known as Old Pewter Rose. As fortune would have it, the venue was bustling with patrons, and in light of my time constraints, the accommodating staff proffered us a table situated adjacent to the kitchen, providing an unobstructed view of the culinary artisans at work. This unique dining experience, reminiscent of a Chef's table, was dubbed something distinct by the eatery.  

The dual delight of savoring delectable fare and observing its preparation elevated the encounter to an unforgettable level. Positioned directly in front of the line cooks and chefs, my dining companion and I relished the opportunity to witness the creation of each dish. Our server, cognizant of our gastronomic inclinations, recommended the flavorsome nutty fried chicken, presented alongside sweet potato mash and asparagus. The tantalizing aroma wafting from the plate prompted us to devour its contents with alacrity, leaving naught but an empty dish. Furthermore, we were treated to a heavenly, fluffy roll whose quality was assured by a rigorous approval process, as indicated by a sign stationed within the kitchen. This fastidious attention to detail undoubtedly contributed to the sublime, doughy excellence that graces my palate even now.  

In conclusion, my excursion to this refurbished edifice proved to be a truly satisfying adventure, heightened by the friendly service, scrumptious victuals, and welcoming ambiance. Without hesitation, I shall return to partake in further explorations of the menu, boasting an array of enticing options that regretfully remained unexplored during my initial visit.

Had lunch here today with my husband, we ordered the veggie spring rolls with the sweet chili and plum sauce, very tasty. The restaurant itself is interesting, abit dark. The waitress was very nice, and our food came quite quickly. We ordered chicken phad thai to share, mild spiciness, extra peanuts. I was alittle disappointed at the lack of spice, but all in all, the dish was really good. We asked for some red chilis and added some spice to the dish ourselves. Very yummy. I am from the Seattle area originally, so I know good Thai food. This has been my best experience so far, and I've tried a few places looking for great phad Thai. I'd come here again, but I have faith that I can find better :)

We visited this establishment with a group of five individuals seeking a delectable breakfast experience. Fortuitously, we arrived prior to the onset of peak hours, thereby ensuring a more tranquil ambiance. Two of our party members opted for the iced tea, which unfortunately lacked depth of flavor and appeared somewhat diluted.

Myriad pancakes were sampled, including the cinnamon-infused variety, carrot, red velvet, and whole wheat options. A subjective ranking of these selections, from most preferred to least, would be: cinnamon, carrot, red velvet, and wheat.

The cinnamon-flavored pancakes delighted our taste buds with their satisfying blend of sweetness and savory undertones. These pancakes are unquestionably recommended. In contrast, the carrot pancake failed to showcase its namesake's distinct flavor, instead boasting a subtle, almost negligible essence that barely distinguished it from its wheat counterpart. The red velvet iteration suffered from an unfortunate dryness, further compromised by an overpowering sugar syrup that eclipsed the inherent flavor profile.

The cowboy omelet, while adequate, could benefit from several adjustments. Specifically, a more delicate cooking method for the eggs would result in a less rubbery texture, while a slight reduction in doneness for the vegetables would enhance their natural sweetness. The fried potatoes, although unremarkable in terms of saltiness, avoided the unpleasantness of excessive crispiness.

A rating of 3.5 stars seems appropriate for this venue, considering the generally satisfactory quality of the food and generous portion sizes. Notwithstanding some minor missteps, we would still consider revisiting this establishment to sample other menu items, particularly their French toast and alternative egg dishes. Our server provided commendable assistance throughout our visit.
cool and open.  Little pricey but they give you good stuff in the ambience.  Wish you didn't have to pay to go downstairs.

I think this place deserves between 4 and 4.5 stars. It is new and the service was impeccable.

The food is great value for your money ($45/person) and the wine can be as affordable as $30 bucks a bottle, or as high as hundreds of dollars.

They wouldn't call themselves a buffet, but it kind of has the same idea. You start at a unlimited salad bar, and honestly, there's not much salad about it which was awesome. They had mozzarella, parmigiano cheese, prosciutto & salamis, their very own smoked salmon, in additon to salad, as well as soups.

When you're ready, they will start bringing out the meats. Make sure to ask for filet mignon, they had it but were stingy about taking it out! Their ribs are also melt-in-your-mouth and their lamb didn't have much of a gamy taste. Skip the chicken if you can, this place has a TON of  better meat choices than that.

Oh, also, TAKE YOUR TIME! My friend went crazy and then threw up 30 minutes into the meal...You really need to take your time here and don't rush, even if the servers seem pushy with cutting you the meat.

It is an enjoyable experience though and looking forward to doing it again =)

I live in the area and have been wanting to try this place for a while.  I took my friend here for a celebratory dinner last week.  Overall, we like this place.  Service was very good.  The bottle of wine we ordered was out of stock, so our server suggested another bottle but offered it at the same price as the bottle we wanted.  Nice gesture.  

The corn cakes with pulled pork appetizer was probably the highlight of the meal.  Very good.  The Arcadia Salad was also good.  Being from New Mexico and loving green chile, the green chile Mac n Cheese was a little dissapointing.  The ribs were ok.  Certainly not fall off the bone.

Love the ambiance and openess...with the exception of the music.  More about that below.  Interesting artwork with the chalk board feature, although it is so cluttered to the point that we couldn't take it all in.  Sometimes less is more.  

As I aluded to earlier...I'm a firm believer that music is the single-most make or break factor to a great ambiance.  The music simply does not fit.  Paula Abdul did not add to my enjoyment of dinner in any way.  Maybe we were just at a cheesy point of the mix, but I think some more edgy/progressive/hip music could do a lot in further creating an enjoyable ambiance.

Overall, I'm a fan.  Good Job.

I indulged in a culinary excursion at this establishment, sampling their cheese pizza and zeppole, which proved to be delectable offerings. The hospitality of the staff was agreeable, albeit not of an exceptional caliber. Despite this minor shortcoming, my sojourn at this eatery was undoubtedly worthwhile.

Burger Bar presents an innovative culinary experience, courtesy of Chef Hubert Keller's visionary conceptualization. Patrons are invited to create their ideal burger by selecting from an array of premium meats, including buffalo, lamb, angus, and kobe. Furthermore, they may choose their preferred temperature and an abundance of toppings. Of note is the extravagant Rossini burger, priced at $60, boasting Australian Kobe-style Wagyu beef, sautÃ©ed foie gras, and shaved truffles on an onion bun, complemented by a rich black truffle sauce. However, we recommend eschewing this option in favor of building a custom burger with identical ingredients, sans black truffles, resulting in a significantly lower price point of $30. This modification allows for a more balanced flavor profile, as the potency of the truffle sauce might overpower the delicate umami of the foie gras. An alternative to enhance the dining experience is to pair the burger with a selection of sauces from their extensive collection, featuring unique varieties such as spicy ketchup and truffle mayo. Without a doubt, Burger Bar offers a truly exceptional culinary adventure, with the possibility of indulging in the most delectable burger one has ever had, albeit at a considerable cost. Thus, it is highly recommended to partake in this gastronomic journey and relish the unparalleled flavors presented by Burger Bar.

I came with friends 3 times before we were able to get in without waiting an hour. The line is out the door and taxis are shuttling tourists from the strip non-stop.\n\nFood was good, don't get me wrong. But waiting an hour for a burger? The food wasn't anything that blew my mind, but it was good. French fries were very good, I enjoyed them more than my burger.

Time to finish up this review...LOL..Came here on opening day and the wait wasn't so bad. The hostess checks us in on an iPad and texts us when our table is ready. The whole service experience was so welcoming, professional and friendly.  But lets get to the important part! The food :) I ordered the Hells kitchen burger; Full of flavor with a spicy kick...I found my new favorite burger! I come to Vegas every other weekend and stop by here when it's not so packed =)

My husband and I ate here while on a business trip and just loved everything about it.  Before 9 I though AJ Maxwell in New York had the best  steak and seafood.  My salmon was the best prepared salmon I have EVER had in my life in a restaurant.  My husband loved his steak.

My lobster mash potatoes was amazing.  The complimentary sample dish sent out was fabulous (can't remember what is was called). 

The crowd was a fun mix of the hip and young, older and chic, entertainment and sports crowd and after hours business type.  Music was nice and loud.

The prices were a bit high, but I would spend all over again because the service was great and the food was yummy!

I love going to BWW.  $2 Stella on Thursdays and wings that are actually spicy.  Definitively worth the price.  \n\nThis place has a great view of a TV from almost every seat, and there are a lot of places to sit.  I've taken clients here for lunch and I've never had a bad experience with a server.  They may not always be fast, but I've never thought they were slow.

"Optimize your culinary experience by indulging in the delectable sesame chicken or savory mixed vegetables complemented with a crispy fried tofu, and consider requesting an additional dash of piquancy to enhance the flavors; furthermore, take advantage of the hospitable nature of the establishment's proprietors, who will assiduously ensure that your dining experience is nothing short of exceptional."

"Caution to those unfamiliar with the locality: I am currently stationed at Mandalay Bay and opted to procure a pizza and an order of garlic knots via telephonic means from Biaggio's. It is worth noting that no explicit mention was made regarding any potential delivery fee, yet a $6.00 surcharge designated as a 'Strip Delivery Charge' was incorporated into the total upon the arrival of the culinary items. Furthermore, the establishment failed to include the aforementioned garlic knots in the delivery. However, it is worth acknowledging that the pizza itself was of superior quality. 
 UPDATE: Following the posting of my assessment, I received a telephonic communication from Biaggio's expressing regret for the issues I encountered and offering to rectify the situation by eliminating all associated costs. Despite my insistence that they compensate me for the consumable items I received, they adamantly refused. Kudos to Biaggio's for their exceptional customer service and dedication to ensuring client satisfaction! As a direct result of their commendable efforts, I have chosen to upgrade my original three-star rating to reflect my sincere appreciation. Indeed, I have become a fervent devotee of this laudable enterprise."

awesome food.
one of a good dining experience with excellent service.
the food is a tad salty for my taste, I wish they use more natural ingredient other than Salt.
presentation was great and cooked my filet to perfection. the meat on the other hand, had a few gristle. :( that seems awful..
I would try a different meat dishes, but they should monitor their steak quality..

I had the privilege of visiting the Gold & Silver Pawn Shop yesterday in the company of a colleague, and we arrived around 4:30 pm. Much to our delight, there was no queue to gain entry, and the atmosphere within the establishment was not chaotic or overcrowded, thereby enabling us to thoroughly absorb the ambiance and engage in conversation with the employees. Our visit proved to be particularly educational, as we gained insight into the intricacies of the show's production and were informed that had we arrived earlier, we could have potentially been selected as extras for the day's filming. It is worth noting that the gentlemen who work at the shop are typically present from Monday to Friday, between the hours of 9 am and 3 pm. However, they tend to remain in the rear of the building, thus avoiding the throngs of enthusiastic spectators who frequent the shop daily. For those aspiring to appear on television, it is crucial to possess an item of sufficient interest to warrant its display on the program, as well as the charm and persuasiveness necessary to navigate the show's rigorous selection process. Alternatively, arriving early enough to serve as an extra on a day when filming is taking place can also prove rewarding. Although the shop offered various tourist-oriented items, I felt no shame in acquiring a Pawn Stars t-shirt, and I derived immense satisfaction from doing so. The shop itself was not particularly extensive, yet I found the assortment of memorabilia to be captivating, and I was further entertained by the staff's recounting of anecdotes regarding the acquisition of specific items, which mirrored the experience of watching the program from the comfort of my own home. Ultimately, I would wholeheartedly endorse this excursion to any devotee of Pawn Stars.
Good Pizza for Arizona. They have a great lunch special, 2 slices and a drink for $5 including tax. If you are looking for good pizza in the Scottsdale area come by an

We indulged in a delectable dining experience at Bouchon, located within the luxurious Venetian hotel. Previously, we had only encountered the petite Bouchon to-go bakery on the lower level; thus, we were pleasantly surprised to discover an expansive restaurant situated on the upper floor of the establishment. Our visit transpired during the luncheon hour, and we relished the opportunity to sample their culinary offerings. Specifically, we opted for the flavorsome smoked salmon accompanied by cream cheese and chives, nestled within a crispy bread roll. The incorporation of capers amidst the sandwich elevated its flavor profile, rendering it an unforgettable gustatory experience. It is worth mentioning that smoked salmon is not typically a preference of mine, yet I felt compelled to venture beyond my customary choices and was ultimately delighted by the dish's excellence. An image of the scrumptious sandwich can be observed here: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rcaPajgKOJC2vo_l3xa42A?userid=OhFp0SPP5udI9EccfpzQ_g. Additionally, my fellow diners enjoyed the pork belly special, which was artfully presented and drew comparisons to the Bouchon location in Napa, according to my acquaintance who has had the pleasure of dining there. A visual representation of the pork belly dish can be found here: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rcaPajgKOJC2vo_l3xa42A?select=CrbIl0aP3b-AFMtoK2Vv5w. It is worth noting that this eatery warrants a subsequent visit to indulge in one of their more extravagant entrees, as the quality of their cuisine is truly exceptional (and not merely confined to their convenient to-go bakery selections). Unfortunately, I failed to sample their renowned macarons, which, according to hearsay, are truly delectable.

DELISH!! Very yummy! We were so pleased to find this charming little spot. As others have said, yes, it really is better than the place across the street. The service was great and the fish was tasty. We'll definitely be back!!

I arrived at this establishment with the intention of procuring some of my preferred pastries, specifically those of the Cinnabon variety, as it had come to my attention that such items were available for purchase at this location, thereby obviating the necessity of visiting a shopping mall in order to obtain them. As a former employee of Cinnabon, I possess firsthand knowledge of the distinctive flavor profile associated with their cinnamon rolls, and thus, I was eager to determine whether the quality of the aforementioned pastries would meet my elevated standards. Unfortunately, upon sampling the rolls in question, I was disappointed to discover that they fell short of my expectations, which, I must admit, may have been unreasonably high due to my previous association with the brand. In light of this experience, I cannot help but wonder if Schlotzsky's, the parent company of Cinnabon, might consider implementing a recruitment strategy aimed at securing personnel who specialize in the preparation of Cinnabon products, thereby ensuring that each item is crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail, thereby meeting, if not surpassing, the expectations of discerning patrons such as myself.

Nice las vegas club.. If your a chick you get to get in for free and free drinks before 12:30pm.. And guys like us get to pay $30 to get in and struggle at the bar trying to purchase a drink past all the chicks trying to get their free drinks... Lol over all the club is small and tight when filled to capacity.

Hubby and I were in Charlotte for the week and prefer vegan restaurants. It was fairly  easy to find off the expressway. It's a cute place. Everything is made from scratch. They offer plenty of GF options. Our wait time was about15 minutes but worth it. It's a tiny place with little seating but were able to eat inside since it was past the lunch rush. No public restroom.
Great food & super friendly staff! Older hotel but clean & well kept! A historic gambling site for those who want the old school style treatment.

Fast and nice to work with!\n\nEveryone here has been so pleasant to work with for all of my at-home projects. I haven't used Copies at Carson for anything professional - but lots of sticker and postcard making! They also print photos.

Really loved Ishi when they were at the old location, because it was cozy and always full. Since they moved they have a bigger place, had to cut costs on certain items but the sushi and hibachi is good and not too expensive. Saki bombs are cun there!

I missed the Lobster and Steak Day. It moved from Monday MNF to Thursdays. Its Kinda a cool spot to watch MNF. Staff are nice. Food honestly is really good. The Dj Wouldn't play Digital Undergrounds \"Freaks Of the Industry,\" said it was to slow for time. Free Parking.

I have a propensity to visit this establishment prior to attending Pittsburgh Penguins games or concerts. The beverages served here are truly remarkable, as is the culinary fare offered. However, it is occasionally challenging to capture the attention of the bartender, necessitating a physical search for their whereabouts. Notwithstanding this minor inconvenience, I find this venue to be an enjoyable and hip destination for pre- or post-event socializing at Consol Energy Center.

BEST RICE IN TOWN! I'm not as big on Lebanese food as I am on Persian food but their kafta is still real good.  Their rice is something from heaven, so good I usually order an extra side.  Also, their pita bread is made fresh right when you come in, soooooo nice!  Their service is great and friendly!

"AZ88 embodies the quintessential contemporary dining establishment, boasting an ambiance that is at once captivating and sophisticated, with a distinctive dÃ©cor and lighting scheme that seamlessly complements its upscale surroundings in Scottsdale. The expansive menu offers an impressive array of culinary options, catering to diverse tastes and preferences, while the competitive pricing belies the high-end quality and presentation of the dishes. Our dining experience was further enhanced by the attentive service and convivial atmosphere, augmented by the unconventional yet ingenious design elements incorporated into the restrooms. Notwithstanding the occasional optical illusion created by the ubiquitous mirrors, our group's collective verdict was that the fare was undeniably delectable, making AZ88 an unquestionable recommendation for those seeking a memorable epicurean adventure."

My husband and I stopped for lunch last Saturday, we were the only people in the whole place.  The waiter was so friendly. The bread and dip was amazing. We both ordered the chicken bacon sandwich with tortellini salad they was fantastic. The tortellini salad is such a nice change for a side option.  The lunch prices and sizes were perfect.  We felt perfectly full but not weighed down.  It would have been 5 stars if only they had a better outside area.

"Upon perusing culinary critique by Guy Fieri on his televised program, 'Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives,' we opted to sample the fare at this establishment and formulate our own opinion. Upon arriving, we observed a queue of approximately thirty patrons, yet the efficiency of the service rendered the wait time negligible. Following our order, we were presented with a paging device, and within a fifteen-minute interval, we were served an abundance of delectable, freshly prepared cuisine, accompanied by ample seating both indoors and outdoors. Our morning repast consisted of pancakes of considerable proportions, augmented by homemade sausage and potato fries, and further complemented by refreshing house-made lemonade and cheesecake. An excellent dining experience, indeed; we eagerly anticipate our return."

I attended a wedding reception here and it was a great facility for a dinner event.  Of course, the facility was beautiful  and staff was friendly. The food was pretty good.   The layout was perfect for an event like this -  there was plenty of room for lots of large dinner tables as well as a dance floor.  They kept the beverage stations open and well stocked.  The bride and groom were very pleased and the guests had a great time.

Spent an amazing afternoon at the Phoenix zoo.   The weather was perfect and it wasn't overly crowded.   The animals musta missed the memo announcing our arrival as most were sleeping but they were at least sleeping out where you could see them.  \n\nExtras are a bit pricey but overall it was a great way to spend the afternoon outside, enjoying the wonderful fall weather.

Very good experience. They had a wonderfully attentive wait staff (on a Saturday night no less). My meal was excellent (beef burgundy). My fianc\u00e9's steak was rather undercooked even after we sent it back (hence the one star ding), but it was still quite good and that is really my only complaint. \nIt strikes me as a solid date night / special occasion kind of restaurant.

Never throughout my existence have I encountered such an extensive collection of keepsakes in a singular location. It resembles strolling through the workspace of Gene Summons, albeit he were an M&M enthusiast. 

An abundance of miscellaneous items, ranging from dolls-candy machines and bottles-toys, to an extensive array of miniature, flat chocolate circles that have become synonymous with the renowned confectionary treat, are on display. 

This exhibit is an absolute necessity for tourists who possess an affection for chocolate. An assortment of objects, not solely intended for purchase, but also for observation and appreciation, is presented. Quite simply, it is awe-inspiring. 

Personally, I experienced immense enjoyment, or, to be more precise, several hundred flat chocolate circles.

one of the best buffets i have ever been too. they have everything there. EVERYTHING. the only thing thats holding it back from getting 5 stars is that the line to get in is ridiculous and it is pretty pricey... but it is what it is i guess. if your ever in vegas you should try this buffet out at some point

A phenomenal eatery within the Las Vegas vicinity, offering delectable morning repasts and an exceptional patronage experience, complemented by a Yelp check-in promotion, resulting in an overall gratifying visit. However, it is advisable to anticipate a delay in entry during weekends due to the establishment's popularity among patrons.

"Take advantage of our tantalizing Tuesday offerings, where cinematic experiences can be savored for a mere $1! Additionally, our thrifty Thursdays boast a bargain price of $1.50 for an alternative day of entertainment. While the seats may not recline, the nominal fee renders this detail inconsequential. Considering a budget-friendly outing with a significant other? Look no further than our humble abode."

Ahhhh L'Appartement! J'y deviendrais locataire demain matin...J'y suis retourner pour une 3i\u00e8me fois et l'exp\u00e9rience y fut une encore tr\u00e8s agr\u00e9able. L'ambiance est d\u00e9contract\u00e9 sans \u00eatre trop bruyante, les fen\u00eatres y laissait entrer une lumi\u00e8re chaleureuse et le service, encore une fois imp\u00e9ccable et sympathique. Le menus est simple mais tr\u00e8s bien ex\u00e9cut\u00e9 et les prix fort attrayants. D\u00e9finitivement une adresse a ajouter \u00e0 son carnet! On signe o\u00f9?

CHRISTMAS FESTIVAL. From an adult's perspective, this would be 2 or 3 stars, but from the kid's viewpoint it's a 4.
 
 If I had not gone on a groupon deal, I would  have felt ripped off. On the positive side, my niece and nephew had a really good time. They're only 6 and 3, so they did not have high expectations. We were there for 3 hours, so we definitely got our money's worth. But a lot of that was us just playing the games -- ring toss, bean bag toss -- so I guess you could say that we made our own fun.

I'd never been, so when I read "hay ride" and "train ride," I expected something a little longer than a loop through the desert. The "train" is actually a tractor pulling cars, and it took the exact same loop through the desert as the hay ride. Granted, after night fell, the loop was different in that there were lights on the train and lighted displays along the course. They looked pretty and the kids enjoyed them.

The petting zoo could have used a better clean up from the recent rains. Most of the animals were docile, but one of the donkeys tried to kick the worker who was supervising the zoo. We were warned to stay away from him and from a largish pig who was antisocial.

Everyone was friendly and helpful.

Next year I think we'll do zoo lights.

"It is readily apparent why this diminutive culinary establishment has gained widespread popularity; the victuals are modestly priced and delectable, the portions are generously sized, and the menu boasts an extensive array of options representative of various well-known Asian cuisines, including Chinese, Japanese, Thai, and Mongolian. The convenience of being able to order tonkatsu, pad thai, and General Tsao all on one menu is a significant advantage, and while the ambiance could benefit from additional illumination and a few cosmetic enhancements, the primary focus is on the affordable and savory fare rather than the aesthetic appeal. During peak dining hours, it is not uncommon for there to be a brief delay in the preparation of food due to the high volume of take-out orders."
Very good.... The stone crab wasn't quite as good as I remember the original in miami and my steak was a bit over salted. But overall everyone in our party of 8 was very pleased w their meal

"The Brunch Buffet presents an exceptional culinary experience, boasting a vast array of delectable dishes that cater to diverse tastes and dietary preferences. While the service may be somewhat inconsistent, the quality of the fare more than compensates for this minor drawback. When compared to other buffets, the Brunch Buffet stands out as truly remarkable; however, it is essential to manage expectations and recognize that it falls short of the exceptionally high standards set by fine dining establishments where each dish is meticulously prepared to order. Embrace the spirit of indulgence, relinquish any sartorial constraints, and savor the moment, allowing the rich flavors to transport you to a state of gastronomic nirvana."

Nestled inconspicuously within a secluded nook, situated at a considerable distance from the vibrant Las Vegas Strip, we chanced upon a charming bakery. Although their assortment of breads may be limited in scope, the quality of their offerings more than compensates for the dearth of options, boasting an unparalleled freshness, airiness, and softness that is simply divine. Furthermore, their roll cakes are equally delectable, and their menu features an array of traditional Japanese delights such as honey rolls and puddings, which serve as a testament to the bakery's commitment to diversity and cultural authenticity.

"Gastronomical excellence and an ambiance of elegance! A substantial tariff, indeed, yet commensurate with the lofty standards one might anticipate in a city such as Las Vegas, particularly when situated upon the famed Strip. 

The hospitality of our servers was of an exceptionally high caliber, as they exhibited profound consideration towards my companion's dietary restrictions, which included an aversion to both gluten and dairy products. Such thoughtfulness is not always encountered among the multitude of establishments that claim to cater to the needs of those with specific culinary requirements. 

The presentation of the cuisine was aesthetically pleasing, while the variety of teas available was impressively diverse and unexpectedly extensive, transcending the customary solitary option commonly offered by the majority of dining establishments."

The pleasure we experienced during our recent visit to St. Francis was truly remarkable, and the exceptional quality of the service we received significantly contributed to our enjoyment. The captivating architectural elements of this esteemed establishment are undoubtedly a sight to behold, and we highly recommend requesting a guided tour to fully appreciate their intricate details. Anticipating our next visit, we eagerly look forward to indulging in the expanded menu offerings and extended operating hours. However, we must caution that the cost may be somewhat prohibitive.

The wife and I got a room here for fifty or so dollars a night on Priceline and really enjoyed ourselves. Our room had a sliding glass door facing the pool, a very nice pool, and we could just walk out of our room straight into the water... nice. Our room was nice with a comfy bed and modern design, plus there's no parking fee and it right by Scottsdale Fashion. I would have no problem staying here again for a little getaway, I would always prefer Valley Ho, but if the money isn't there this is my second choice for sure.

"I have a penchant for this airport, having found myself stranded here on multiple occasions due to layovers, both domestically and internationally. The layout, while not overly complex, does necessitate a certain degree of ambulation between terminals, thus, it is advisable to don comfortable footwear and possess a suitcase with sturdy wheels. All terminals are accessible by foot, obviating the need for a shuttle service; however, this also implies that one will be required to traverse a considerable distance on foot, as I have previously alluded to. 

The central hub, which serves as a connexion point for numerous terminals, boasts an impressive array of culinary establishments. I have availed myself of these facilities on several occasions, including a layover in 2005 en route from Nicaragua, whereupon I observed the Super Bowl at a Chili's or similar establishment. For those who adhere to a plant-based diet, there exist a sufficient number of options to satiate their gastronomical desires. 

In addition to the aforementioned dining options, there are various retail establishments available for perusal, should one find oneself with an excess of time to kill following the consumption of a couple of Bloody Marys. While not the most exceptional airport in terms of overall quality, it nevertheless ranks as a respectable facility in terms of navigability, gastronomic offerings, and cleanliness."

"Although it may not necessarily qualify as the most exceptional barbecue experience I have had the pleasure of indulging in, considering that I reside in San Francisco, where there is an unfortunate scarcity of genuinely delectable barbecue establishments, this particular venue manages to satisfy my cravings quite effectively. The generous proportions of the meals, the flavorsome quality of the culinary offerings, the hospitable nature of the staff, and the reasonable pricing all contribute to creating a welcoming ambiance that is reminiscent of a traditional, down-home barbecue setting, thereby making it an establishment worth visiting for anyone seeking a casual, satisfying dining experience in Las Vegas."
Really comfortable seating! And you can bring in delicious wood fired pizza from Five50 Pizza Bar that right around the corner.

There were some dishes on the menu that were good and some were ok the drinks were great however with vodka and pomegranate. Kimchi fried was good although there is a similar dish at ichiza that is priced less and taste about the same. I expected the quality to bet better than that of ichiza. The salmon  i got had miso which tasted good, the only issue I have was the price.

"Upon entering this establishment, I was immediately struck by its stark contrast to the Scottsdale norm. Gone were the pretentious hostesses and sleek modern decor, replaced by a diminutive tiki bar adorned with garish neon beer signs that cast an eerie glow upon the reeded wall coverings. Instead of the ubiquitous break-beat/techno that has become synonymous with sushi bars thanks to Ra and Stingray, Ichiban opted for a decidedly more questionable musical selection, featuring an assortment of cringe-worthy '80s tunes that would have been better suited to a VH1 "Awesomely Bad" marathon. \n\nDespite this dubious start, the sushi itself proved to be a delightful surprise, boasting imaginative and innovative creations that incorporated everything from jalapenos to Mexican tortillas into their specialty rolls. My personal favorite was the Chimichanga roll, essentially a Philly roll augmented with avocado and then promptly deep-fried, which unfortunately threatened to clog my arteries with each bite. Fortunately, a generous happy hour policy offered $4 Cali rolls and affordable sake daily from 5-7 pm, making the experience slightly less financially ruinous for those who timed their arrival appropriately. Furthermore, patrons seated at the bar were treated to an amusing spectacle, courtesy of the owner's personal preparation of each specialty roll and his penchant for theatrics. Alas, tardiness carried a penalty, as those arriving after 7 pm faced a significantly less "happy" financial outcome. Ultimately, the musical selection, while admittedly nostalgia-inducing, fell just shy of earning a coveted fifth star."

"I partook of a delectable repast at this establishment on the preceding Saturday, and my culinary experience was utterly satisfactory. Although I possess only a cursory familiarity with Filipino cuisine, I found the flavors to be remarkably palatable and the prices to be eminently reasonable. This cozy eatery, with its limited seating capacity, maintains a brisk carry-out trade, which attests to its popularity among local gastronomes. My own gustatory explorations encompassed the savory goat and chicken dishes, served with a side of rice, as well as an assortment of other delights, such as skewers of potatoes lavishly coated in brown sugar and several pieces of succulent squid. Upon reflection, I would unhesitatingly endorse a visit to this venue for any individual finding themselves in the vicinity."

The occasion of my twenty-first birthday was commemorated by a visit to a luxurious resort, whereupon I was indulged with an upgrade to a palatial forum tower suite situated on the twenty-third floor, affording a panoramic view of the pool area. The opulent accommodations featured two lavish bathrooms, each boasting a separate entrance leading to a dual showerhead showering facility, in addition to a capacious tub, an abundance of mirrors, and ample closet space. The aesthetically pleasing chamber, conveniently located within walking distance of several premier hotels, served as the setting for an unforgettable experience.

"The waiting period in the anterior waiting area is appreciably shorter compared to the primary, comprehensive spine clinic located just around the corner within the medical complex. 

The most advantageous feature of this surgical establishment is the brief duration preceding the preoperative surgical process. The wait time is considerably shorter, which constitutes a refreshing change. 

Furthermore, it is a surgical medical facility that adheres to standard procedures commonly implemented in typical surgery centers, instilling a sense of comfort and security in patients under the care of seasoned nurses and surgical personnel at all times. 

To mitigate the tedium associated with waiting, cinematic presentations are offered to ensure that both patients and their companions remain entertained and engaged throughout the experience. 

Overall, this facility warrants a rating of four stars."

Very cool place downtown in CityScape, love the idea, not your dad's bowling alley full of sweaty old men playing in league's. This is definitely built more around the lounge concept than bowling lanes. A great place to have a b-day party with friends, they have huge screens at the end of each lane that were playing college football games when we went. They stocked local brew from Four Peaks which is awesome.\n\nThe downside is the service wasn't the best but this is a new location so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that they will figure it out. Other than that we highly recommend checking it out, once CityScape is done it's gonna be great to hangout downtown.

I have had the pleasure of frequenting Culinary Dropout on a regular basis, with a minimum of one visit per month, and often times more frequently, ever since its inception at the Yard. My affinity for the culinary offerings here is unwavering, as I take great delight in savoring a variety of dishes, specifically including, but not limited to, the delectable bistro steak, the flavorsome Korean style steak, the succulent salmon, the mouthwatering meatloaf, and the tender, fall-off-the-bone ribs. Additionally, I must commend the eatery on its judicious selection of libations, featuring an array of fine beers and wines that pair perfectly with the meals.

I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary excursion to Trattoria del Lupo in Mandalay approximately a year ago, and my gastronomical expectations were not only met but thoroughly exceeded. The Ragu alla Bolognese I had the privilege of consuming was a masterful symphony of flavors, boasting the perfect equilibrium of savory meat and fresh tomatoes, complemented by the satisfying texture of well-cooked pasta. To further enhance this delectable dining experience, we opted to pair our meals with Bellinis, a delightful and refreshing concoction of peach-flavored sparkling wine that proved to be the perfect accompaniment to our repast. The ambiance of the eatery itself was reminiscent of a classic Italian trattoria, complete with an charming open patio nestled within the heart of Mandalay's vibrant restaurant row. This idyllic setting afforded us the opportunity to engage in leisurely people-watching, as we observed an array of club-goers, ranging from mildly tipsy to utterly inebriated, awkwardly navigating the winding walkways and eventually stumbling upon the trendy nightclubs in the vicinity. Although the prices charged for such epicurean indulgences were slightly elevated, the overall experience proved to be an unforgettable and worthwhile investment for my taste buds.

"Conveniently located in close proximity to Arizona State University, this establishment boasts a welcoming and hospitable atmosphere, characterized by a simple yet warm decorum, complemented by a culinary experience that showcases authentic Thai cuisine in a manner that is both flavorful and visually appealing. While the quality of the dishes served can be somewhat unpredictable, with instances of exceptional taste and presentation followed by periods of relative mediocrity, the restaurant's commitment to providing diverse levels of spiciness for its patrons is undeniably commendable. Particularly noteworthy dishes include the crispy fried tofu accompanied by a sweet and tangy sauce, the refreshing papaya salad, best savored when ordered with an added kick of heat, and the Pad Prik King, a harmonious blend of green beans, carrots, and lemon leaves, expertly stir-fried with a choice of protein. Additionally, the Pad Thai and Pad Woon Sen, comprising glass noodles, are equally satisfying options. Throughout each visit, the service staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional friendliness and attentiveness, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience for all patrons."

I must say that my expectations were thoroughly surpassed by the ambiance and aesthetic appeal of this establishment. The majority of the female patrons boasted physiques that could be described as nothing short of tantalizing. Furthermore, the nature of the lap dances provided an unparalleled level of intimacy, as they were not only comprehensive in their scope but also permitted a degree of tactile interaction that was nothing short of remarkable. Additionally, the manner in which the performers reclined upon a bed, thereby creating an atmosphere of uninhibited indulgence, was truly exceptional. Were it not for the absence of alcoholic beverages, which, in my opinion, would have elevated the overall experience to a five-star rating without hesitation, this club would have left little to be desired. Nonetheless, the lap dances themselves were the undeniable highlight of this venue, and their quality cannot be overstated.

"While indulging in a brief sojourn from my habitual environs, I chanced upon this diminutive yet charming refuge amidst an expanse of arid terrain. Upon ingress, I was instantaneously struck by an overwhelming sense of similarity to the Batcave, owing to the pronounced obscurity that permeated the interior. Following a cursory exploration of the premises, during which I relied upon tactile sensations to navigate the store's layout, and having availed myself of a sufficient quantity of contemporary and archival issues, I opted to procure several serialized publications and proceeded towards the exit, fortified by the luminosity emanating from my smartphone's display, which had been previously augmented with a flashlight application, thereby rendering me suitably prepared for any future visits."

"The unmitigated magnificence of penguins, monkeys, and a kapibara in Canada renders a visit to the Biodome an absolute imperative. A leisurely stroll of ninety minutes or two hours through the Biodome's diverse ecosystems constitutes time remarkably well spent. The comparative liberty afforded to the animals to roam their respective pavilions offers a refreshing departure from the confines of traditional zoo enclosures, thereby facilitating an engaging game of monkey-spotting or an opportunity to appreciate the breathtaking beauty of the macaws, while being cognizant of the fact that owning one as a pet would be unfeasible due to their extended lifespan. 
It is advisable to avoid scheduling a visit during school recesses and weekends, if at all feasible. This is with a view to circumventing the presence of boisterous children who may potentially diminish the overall enjoyment of the experience. Moreover, it is desirable to secure a vantage point in the penguin section that affords an unobstructed view of the swimming penguins, sans the encumbrance of exuberant youngsters impeding the waterline.
Admission fees for non-Quebecers and students are rather steep. Nonetheless, a visit to the Biodome remains an indubitable must-see experience. Furthermore, combining the Biodome excursion with a trip to the Botanical Garden enhances the value of the outing. 
It is not recommended to indulge in the Olympic tower experience. Instead, opt for a visit to the Mont Royal chalet, which not only provides a superior view but also entails a salubrious hike up the hill, all without incurring any cost."

I possess a predilection for frequenting the establishment during the designated period of reduced prices, which occurs daily from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. and 12 p.m. to closing time. This temporal window affords me the opportunity to indulge in a delectable steak complemented by a single side dish at a discounted rate, while still maintaining the high culinary standards that are synonymous with the restaurant's reputation. Upon entering the interior space, I am immediately struck by the ambiance, which evokes a sense of nostalgia reminiscent of classic Western films. To fully appreciate the experience, I highly recommend sampling the signature mint julep, a potent concoction that typically suffices for my needs. However, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance to avoid potential delays, especially during peak hours. On one occasion, I arrived between 6:50 p.m. and 7 p.m., only to be seated later than anticipated, resulting in the application of full prices due to our delayed ordering.

"The eatery situated within the premises of the Phoenix Art Museum boasts an exceptional dining experience, characterized by an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, a judicious selection of fresh ingredients, harmonious flavor combinations courtesy of the Farm at South Mountain, an accommodating and attentive team of servers, and prices that are eminently reasonable, thereby establishing itself as the most satisfactory museum restaurant this writer has had the pleasure of patronizing. Upon entering the establishment, we opted to indulge in some beverages and a mere hors d'oeuvre between exhibits, and our expectations were greatly surpassed by the superior quality of the cuisine (unencumbered by the exorbitant prices often associated with captive audiences), the warmth and hospitality of the service, and the inviting atmosphere, which led us to deliberately plan future museum visits with the intention of savoring their delectable offerings. Observing the culinary creations being served to fellow patrons, it became apparent that the sandwiches featured impressive ingredients, the crab cakes presented a delightful appearance, albeit with minimal filling as per the server's description, and the coconut cake constituted a generous portion that was truly a gastronomic joy; furthermore, the menu selections bore names that cleverly corresponded with the Hollywood Costume theme, contributing to an unforgettably amusing dining experience."

"It is my sincere belief that Zipps possesses an inherent appeal, which has led me to frequent the establishment with considerable regularity during the recent March Madness festivities. Notwithstanding certain criticisms regarding the quality of service, I remain optimistic about the potential for improvement, taking into account the fact that all novel ventures experience initial difficulties and challenges. In light of this, I would advise against hasty judgments and encourage individuals to afford Zipps a reasonable period of time to address and rectify any issues. Drawing from my personal experience in the role of opening or assisting in the launch of diverse dining establishments, I am confident that Zipps will eventually overcome its nascent obstacles and emerge as a reputable and successful enterprise, consistent with the standards upheld by its sister locations throughout the valley."

First time here was on a Tuesday morning around 10:30.  I've always heard this place was busy so I thought we'd be good at this time.  We were able to be seated right away but I was still amazed on how many people were there for breakfast at this hour.  Atmosphere was a little noisy but service was quick.  The coffee was just right for my liking, and I had the scrambled eggs with salami with side of hash browns and wheat toast.  I had actually ordered the home fries but got hash browns, which was perfectly ok because they were amazing.  The strawberry jam was fantastic as well.  I'll be going back.

"I have been perpetuating my visits to this establishment on a monthly basis for a duration of five years, entrusting my automotive needs to the proficient expertise of a singular technician. It is utterly inconceivable that I would consider alternatives to this steadfast allegiance."

"My sincere apologies for the brevity of this review, as it is imperative to highlight the exceptional quality of this establishment's bacon-covered cinnamon rolls, which are undoubtedly the most delectable and satisfying culinary delight in the city. Upon request, the accommodating staff will graciously adorn the already heavenly pastries with a fried egg, thereby elevating the dish to an unparalleled level of gastronomic excellence. It is indeed a stroke of genius on my part to have discovered this gem, and I assure you that the experience of consuming such a masterpiece is nothing short of transcendent. Furthermore, while the prices may seem steep to some, I firmly believe that the unparalleled quality and generous portion sizes more than justify the cost. In conclusion, I highly recommend this venue to anyone seeking a truly exceptional breakfast or brunch experience."

"The confluence of bottle service, Kaskade's melodic mix, and the convivial company of a group of ER nurses has rendered me utterly content. I shall unquestionably revisit this establishment in the future. My sole grievances pertain to the surly demeanor of the bouncers, who display an excessive fastidiousness regarding the maintenance of a fluid pedestrian traffic during performances. They remain oblivious to gender, shoving aside anyone obstructing their desired path. Furthermore, the club's management endeavors to cultivate an air of exclusivity by fixating on inconsequential details, such as footwear, within their premises. This results in the ejection of patrons, including those who have indulged in the club's offerings and are in the process of departing, merely due to a perceived state of intoxication. Notwithstanding these criticisms, I shall confer four stars upon this venue, attributed to its exceptional musical selection, ambiance, and impressive roster of performers."

3.5 stars, but they get 4 from me since the grilled chicken was super juicy!

My friends and I came here around 9:30pm to grab dinner before clubbing. It took about 10 minutes to be seated, which wasn't bad considering it was extremely packed. It took awhile for our food to arrive, so this may not be the place to dine if you are in a hurry to get somewhere.

We saw how large the portions were, so my friend and I shared the Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella. The grilled chicken wasn't dry at all. I was surprised at how juicy it was considering it was white meat! I couldn't finish even though we shared. Definitely kept me full the rest of the night.

Yelp reviews said this was the sister restaurant of The Cheesecake Factory, so we kept comparing the two. I think I like this one better! We saw the next table's Shrimp Scampi and that looked absolutely delicious! Dine here if you want good quality and portions for the price!

I sure am glad my roommate told me to check this place out. Kristen and I stopped by RnR the other day for a late lunch and happened to get there just in time for happy hour, my beer was less than her tea, awesome. I love the look of the place, the front door is huge and sweet, and while the inside is on the smaller side, it doesn't feel packed, and there is ample seating outside, I can't wait for the cooler weather so we can stop by more often and people watch. \n    We started with two appetizers, the pigs in a blanket, which are the old childhood favorite with a light and flaky pastry crust, they were delicious, and the chicken lollipops, super tender on the bone chicken with buffalo sauce, so stinking good. We then shared the pork sandwich, which had a sweet and tangy sauce that complimented the tender pork wonderfully, it was a terrific sandwich and came with a bucket of fries. \n    With crazy hours, good drink selections and a great happy hour, RnR is definitely worth checking out, I wish I had came here sooner.

yes!  this is the closest thing to a real mall I've found in Vegas.  crappy stores, arcade and good people watching.  love it! lots of neat things you want but can't justify buying.  nothings too overpriced when compared to other shopping on the strip. one day I promise myself ill buy that oversized painted fan for the living room, or that set of throwing knives. pretty fun place to waste time if your sick of loosing at slots...

I am commenting on the super Bi-lo in Matthews on Fincher Farm lane.  The managers and sales staff are quite friendly and do go out of their way to assist you. They recently overcharged me on an item that was still advertised as buy one get one free but they made good and refunded all the  money plus I got to keep the item. Can't complain about that. I wish they did offer more gourmet items as Harris Teeter does but I like the shopping experience there and they do have good deals on lots of items that I buy frequently. That is why I keep going back.

Dined with 14 for business. Eclectic menu with several very high end entrees including Kobe beef and geoduck, but you could get away with 30 ish per person if you were on a budget. We had a tri plate appetizer of various poultry cuts which were loved by all. A group of us shared the Kobe, a fried rice and a fish dish. All were very good. Service was Asian-reflective gracious with several managers mindfully keeping an eye on a bevy of effective staff. We had a birthday cake brough in from a 3rd party for a surprise and it went off flawlessly. I give 5 stars under only the most phenomenal circumstances so please don't take the 4 star as a repudiation. I would certainly recommend.

Chen's, probably the best Chinese food on campus. 

I usually order the chicken shanghai noodles which is quite good. It's probably the sauce they put in it , but it keeps bringing me back. For plaza food, its also a decent price of around $8 for a good amount of food. 

They also have free bubble tea after 5pm - it's not the greatest but hey, it's free.

Villa Dolce, an eatery located in Middleton, has recently become the recipient of our inaugural visit, subsequent to a fervent endorsement proffered by acquaintances. Lamenting the dissolution of Casa Bianca, a Madisonian establishment renowned for its culinary offerings akin to those of New York City, we opted to explore alternative dining options within the locality. Regrettably, Madison does not boast an impressive reputation for serving superior quality pizzas, as the indigenous Wisconsin cheese lacks the zesty flavor characteristic of Boston's Regina's or the acclaimed apizza locales of New Haven. Furthermore, the chain restaurant Uno's, though corporate in nature, fails to replicate the distinctive charm of its Chicago prototype (we demonstrate a preference for Due's). Its competitors in Chicago, such as Lou Malnati's, also excel in their respective offerings. Contrary to our expectations, Villa Dolce presented itself as a gratifying revelation. The crusts were expertly crafted, while the inventive toppings (we incline toward vegetarian options when it comes to pizza) showcased an exceptional degree of freshness and palatability. In our estimation, Villa Dolce constitutes a formidable contender for the title of finest (upscale) pizza in Madison. Prior to reaching a definitive verdict, we shall conduct several additional visits. 
The gelato we had the pleasure of sampling was truly sublimeârich in flavor, delightful in texture, and boasting a distinctive essence that left a lasting impression. We find ourselves perplexed by the comments articulated by other reviewers. 
Our server, possessing a friendly, informed, and ardent demeanor that stopped short of being overly intrusive, provided us with insightful counsel and recommended dishes we might enjoy during future visits. The ambiance and seating arrangements within the establishment exuded a sense of comfort and warmth, enhanced by the availability of seasonal outdoor seating. The atmosphere was reminiscent of a cozy cafÃ© rather than the typical pizza joint. 
In conclusion, Villa Dolce has emerged as a triumph. Although we shall withhold the fifth star temporarily, pending further exploration.

I confer upon this establishment a rating of four stars, primarily due to the economical nature of their pricing structure and the generous proportions of their pizzas, specifically the medium-sized variety, which is indeed the largest I have had the pleasure of encountering. While the pizzas themselves may lack a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of exceptional quality, they are by no means deficient in terms of flavor or satisfaction. Furthermore, the service provided by the staff was adequate and met my expectations.

I finally checked out the new Mint since I was attending the YAM's Black & White gala.  I was  impressed with the new space as well as the party that the YAMs put together.

The museum itself is modern, open, and quite large.  My favorite exhibit on this visit was the Romare Bearden collection.  It is quite extensive and there are a lot of great pieces. 

Back in the day (10-15 years ago) I was a YAM (Young Affliliate of the Mint).  As a YAM, I  attended a lot of special events at the old Mint of Craft & Design (in the old Montaldo's building) as well as lots of events at the Randolph Mint.  This venue is larger and better equipped to handle special events and parties than the old Mint of Craft & Design.  

The food, drinks, and music at the Gala were all quite good. Can't wait to go back for another event at the Mint, or just to spend an afternoon wandering through the galleries again.

"Our dining experience was truly exceptional, as the service we received was of an extremely high quality and we were seated at the bar area. Our culinary journey began with the delectable Jalape\u00f1o popper burger, which I personally relished, while my companion opted for the Dynamic Duo, a judicious combination of flavors that complemented each other perfectly. Additionally, we shared the King roll, a sushi dish that boasted an impressive size and left us both in awe of its scrumptiousness. Unfortunately, we were unable to complete our meals, as they were so satisfying that we were left feeling utterly replete. Nonetheless, we eagerly anticipate our next visit, as the menu offered an array of tantalizing options that we cannot wait to sample."

"Delighted to halt here! This venue offers an optimal setting for indulging in beverages and unwinding! Apart from the primary bar, all seating arrangements are situated outdoors, boasting misting systems during the summer months and heating devices during the colder seasons. 

The barkeepers exude amicability, proficiently dispensing artisanal cocktails. Gastronomical delights are accessible. 

Indeed, this establishment qualifies as a motorcycle enthusiasts' gathering spot, yet it exudes a tranquil ambiance that welcomes both local patrons and travelers, fostering a sense of inclusivity and conviviality."

"This venue offers an exceptional setting for post-work libations, boasting a superb bar that aficionados of mixed drinks will undoubtedly appreciate. Personally, I relish the prospect of occupying a stool at the bar, savoring a meticulously crafted cocktail while engaging in lively conversation. For those who prefer alfresco revelry, the expansive rear patio presents an enchanting ambiance, replete with glass-enclosed fireplaces and ample seating. Furthermore, enthusiasts of recreational activities will be delighted to discover a bocce ball court, providing an entertaining diversion from the usual sedentary drinking experience. On a recent visit, my spouse and I found ourselves momentarily at a loss for conversation topics, but fortunately, a set of trivia pursuit cards conveniently lay on the table, inspiring us to devise our own rules: if either of us failed to respond correctly to a question, the other party was entitled to pose a follow-up inquiry. The resultant intellectual duel proved enormously enjoyable, underscoring the establishment's suitability as a regular haunt. The culinary offerings are equally impressive, making it an ideal gathering spot for friends."

This particular destination represents one of our most preferred stopping points within the city limits of Las Vegas, boasting an array of delectable culinary offerings, an assortment of unique shopping experiences, and an abundance of captivating sights to behold. It is highly recommended that one allocate a minimum amount of time to peruse this location, even if only briefly.

After briefly visiting Bass Pro, we decided to partake in a copious amount of nourishment at our lodging, and thus, placed an order for multiple meat tacos and a few street tacos. Although the street tacos did not quite compare to the delectable offerings of the mobile taco vendors in Hawaii, they were still savory and satisfying. Additionally, the employees exhibited a welcoming and amicable demeanor towards us, which further enhanced our dining experience. Consequently, we would unquestionably consider patronizing this establishment again in the future.

"An exceptional happy hour experience reminiscent of past indulgences in my previous neighborhood, accompanied by my spouse, where we would partake in copious amounts of delectable victuals and potables during the fleeting hours of felicitous prices, culminating in a total expenditure of less than thirty dollars. Our gastronomical rotation comprised an array of tantalizing delights, including crispy potato skins sans bacon, creamy hummus, succulent chicken wings, golden-fried mozzarella, and, of course, the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistanceâfried pickles. These delectable, deep-fried gherkins were the epitome of flavorful indulgence, eliciting unadulterated delight from those who relish the combination of tart, briny pickles and crispy, golden batter. Furthermore, the establishment offers generously-sized draft beers and well liquors at reasonable prices, complemented by an impressive array of mixological masterpieces, notably their sublime bloody marys, which boast an unparalleled excellence in the region, with an optional Cajun-style rim imbuing the beverage with an added layer of complexity and depth. The service, generally speaking, was satisfactory."

"The pace of service at this establishment was somewhat sluggish, yet the ambiance and state of cleanliness within the dining area were quite pleasant. The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, particularly the hamburger, which garnered my approval and admiration. The complementary bread provided was of an addictive nature, prompting me to crave more, while the pasta dishes exceeded expectations, warranting my endorsement. Although the cost was slightly elevated compared to other eateries, it remained within reasonable bounds."

Mekong Supermarket boasts an impressive level of cleanliness and organization, allowing patrons to navigate the store without encountering obstacles or being overwhelmed by pungent odors. The layout and upkeep of the live and frozen seafood section are equally commendable, with clear product labeling and well-maintained tanks that house a diverse array of aquatic life. Prices at Mekong are competitive and affordable, making it an attractive option for those seeking fresh seafood. Although we had specific weight requirements for our seafood, the accommodating staff were more than willing to assist us in selecting the perfect catches, including a live lobster, tilapia, and catfish, all weighing less than 2 pounds. The tilapia and catfish were expertly cleaned and packaged, while the lobster accompanied us to Asian CafÃ© Express, where it was skillfully prepared to our liking. Mekong and ACE maintain a mutually beneficial agreement, enabling customers to choose their preferred seafood and have it cooked according to their preference for a nominal fee. This unique experience was thoroughly enjoyable and one that I would eagerly repeat.

This quaint eatery, conveniently proximate to the esteemed Museum of Fine Arts, offers an array of delectable fare, which we had the pleasure of sampling on a leisurely Sunday morning. The culinary offerings, while not revolutionary, were undoubtedly satisfying, and the beverages, equally impressive. It is worth noting, however, that the ambiance is somewhat more refined than that of a typical cafe, thus it would be wise to consider donning attire that exudes a modicum of sophistication prior to visiting. Additionally, it is advisable to be cognizant of the fact that the prices charged for the consumables offered herein are slightly elevated in comparison to those of neighboring establishments. Nonetheless, this charming venue remains an agreeable destination for those seeking respite from the rigors of daily life or, perhaps, a brief interlude preceding or following a visit to the adjacent cultural institution.

The poor drive thru window teller was getting yelled at by the tube customer and still managed to keep her cool and help me with my deposit. Susan was incredibly composed, and did her very best to be patient and polite, despite obviously being flustered. Be kind to these people!

Casual atmosphere and great food. What more could you ask for on a weeknight in Uptown? The crowd here is laid back and unpretentious, and the servers here are friendly and welcoming. The menu offers a great selection, from traditional items like wings and wraps, and even pizza. Dare I say it: this may be the best pizza I've had in Charlotte so far! Level with me here - it's not phenomenal, and it's no NY slice, but it's pretty good for Charlotte! I had the spinach and sun dried tomato small pie. It's not crispy, but it's doughy and yummy - I'll take it. We also had the honey chipolte wings which were spicy and delicious. Only minor issue here was that our server, who was the bartender, kept forgetting to put our wings in and it took us forever to get them. But he was so cool and funny that we didn't really care much, and it actually became funny after a while even though we were starving. \n\nPicasso's is large in size and as I mentioned, draws a great crowd. We were here on a Tuesday night and it was packed. There is a big leather couch right in the middle of it to lounge on and you are surrounded by TV's no matter where you sit. Head on over for some great food and relaxation!

"Notwithstanding the unfortunate incident involving the inadvertent consumption of a piece of bacon that led to the dental injury, the culinary experience was indeed delectable and satisfying, prompting us to visit the eatery situated within the premises of the M hotel."

"The Yummy: A culinary haven offering competitive pricing, an accommodating team, a diverse array of fresh produce, and an inviting ambiance characterized by well-lit and spacious surroundings, further enhanced by the provision of designated parking spaces for environmentally conscious vehicles (eco-friendly store).\n\nThe Yucky: Exercise caution when perusing the section featuring products approaching their expiration date; although these items are discounted by fifty percent, it is occasionally wiser to avoid certain products altogether, as their quality may not align with your gastronomical expectations."

This eatery represented one of the initial culinary establishments I had the pleasure of partaking in upon my relocation to Phoenix; thus, it holds a special place in my gastronomical experiences. The delectable fare served here was so impressive that I felt compelled to return the following evening with my spouse, savoring the scrumptious offerings in the midst of an ambiance that exuded warmth and sophistication. Furthermore, the alfresco seating arrangement afforded us the opportunity to bask in the balmy evening air while enjoying our repast, further enhancing the overall dining experience. The meticulous attention to detail demonstrated by the staff left a lasting impression on me, solidifying my resolve to patronize this esteemed establishment at future intervals.

First of all, food here is really really cheap and they don't scrimp on the portions either. This is the place where you want to come when you're down on chips but still want to have some chicken rice. Food is not the best, but they certainly make it up for its affordable price and portion

"It is utterly lamentable that this establishment does not possess a location in Boston, as it would undoubtedly be a tremendous success, given the exceptional quality of their culinary offerings. During my recent vacation in March, I had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable breakfast delights on three separate occasions. Their BLT bloody mary's are truly sublime, featuring a carefully crafted combination of flavors, including a bacon-rimmed glass, a slice of lettuce, a tomato, a bacon slice, and a piece of white toast for dipping. The presentation was also quite impressive, as it arrived on its own plate. The menu offered an extensive array of options, which led to a state of utter bewilderment, as we desired to sample every item listed. In order to experience a variety of flavors, a friend and I opted to share several dishes. We began with the Snickers pancake, which, despite being singular in nature, proved to be a culinary masterpiece, measuring a generous 12 inches in width. Its taste was nothing short of exquisite. Our second selection was the Fried Chicken and Waffles, infused with bacon slices, which can only be described as a gastronomic indulgence. While it may have been a tad unhealthy, it was nonetheless an incredibly satisfying experience. Finally, we sampled the Hash dish, which featured grilled chicken, asparagus, sundried tomatoes, homestyle potatoes, two eggs, and a fresh biscuit. Although somewhat healthier than the other options, it was still delightfully flavorful, with the accompanying marmalade serving as the perfect complement. In conclusion, a visit to this establishment is an absolute must during any Vegas vacation."
