"I must confess that I did not have the opportunity to partake in my beloved frozen yogurt indulgence until the month of June in the rather chilly city of Chicago, hence my eagerness to visit Yogurtland during my recent sojourn to Phoenix. This particular establishment operates on a pay-by-the-ounce system, which allowed me to sample an array of five distinct yogurt flavors prior to settling on a half-and-half combination of peanut butter and devils food. While the low-fat content of their offerings might suggest a healthier alternative, my enthusiasm for peanut butter led me to augment my selection with an assortment of Reese's Pieces and various other sugary embellishments, thereby transforming it into an unparalleled gustatory experience. It is abundantly clear that my colleagues and I were not alone in our yearning for frozen yogurt, as Yogurtland was bustling with activity. Furthermore, it is not difficult to comprehend the popularity of this establishment, given its delectable flavors, extensive array of toppings, and reasonable pricing structure."

"Devoid of any protracted waiting period, we were able to immediately partake in the convivial ambiance of the outdoor seating area, whereupon we encountered a group of affable individuals who, through their hospitable demeanor, contributed significantly to the overall enjoyment of our experience. Although the culinary offerings did not quite live up to our elevated expectations, they still managed to satisfy our hunger and quench our thirst, thus rendering the establishment worthy of a four-star rating. My spouse and I are decidedly inclined to revisit this venue in the future."

"An exceptional wine bar nestled within the historic Old Town district, offering an impressive array of vintages at remarkably affordable prices, as well as delectable fare that surpasses the typical small plates and mediocre offerings associated with wine bars. Accommodating a sizable bachelorette gathering (albeit with a hint of reluctance), the establishment showcased its hospitable nature by presenting us with a complimentary dessert for the bachelorette. Upon perusing the wine list, I was compelled to perform double takes, astounded by the incredible selection available at such economical prices. Furthermore, a list of 10% discounted wines was discreetly displayed on the back of the inventory, awaiting our discovery. The food proved to be a pleasant surprise, with generous portions that catered to diverse tastes, leaving each member of our group thoroughly satisfied. Particularly noteworthy was the bruschetta sampler, which we highly recommend as a starting point for your culinary journey. The charming outdoor patio, complemented by live music, further enhanced the overall ambiance, solidifying this wine bar's status as a standout destination."

This review could have attained a perfect five-star rating if it were solely based on the culinary offerings. However, due to the unpretentious nature of the establishment and the cacophony of sounds generated by the sushi chefs, which resembled more of a battle cry than a warm welcome, I felt compelled to deduct a star. Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted with an enthusiastic round of applause from one of the chefs, which I reciprocated in kind, albeit with a hint of bemusement.  
The ambiance of Ru San's is decidedly casual, and the prices are similarly unassuming, with a sum of $10 granting access to a seemingly endless array of sushi options. For those with hearty appetites, this represents an unparalleled value, as two modest rolls could easily surpass that cost at other establishments. While the sushi served at Ru San's may be described as 'Americanized,' it is undeniably delectable. Notwithstanding the potential health implications, the deep-fried sushi is a singular delight.  
To ensure optimal freshness, the sushi plates are meticulously labeled with time markers, and while the sushi often vanishes before the designated time elapses, this speaks volumes about its quality. Ru San's will persistently hold a place in my rotation of preferred local sushi haunts. 
Nota bene: To avoid potentially lengthy waits, especially during peak hours, it is advisable to arrive promptly at 11:30 AM for lunch.

"Aesthetically captivating establishment specializing in frozen yogurt, reminiscent of the charming retro and mid-century modern styles, has been designed to facilitate an ambiance conducive to customer satisfaction. Friendly shop girls, while slightly unsettling in their vigilant monitoring of patrons during the self-selection process, have been employed to ensure a seamless experience. Perhaps the layout of the shop, marred by visibility obstructions and vulnerable to mischievous behavior, necessitates this measure. Nonetheless, a more discreet approach to surveillance would be appreciated, lest the feeling of being under scrutiny mar the enjoyment of the premises. Commendations are extended to the raspberry sauce, which, refreshingly, does not emanate from a squeeze bottle and contains discernible fragments of fresh raspberries. The assortment of toppings, remarkable in its profusion, includes such unexpected treats as entire Hostess cupcakes and Little Debbie peanut butter wafers, thereby expanding the scope of customization options."

"Firkin On Paradise, a British-themed public house situated within the Las Vegas Bar Belt at the intersection of Paradise and Harmon, offers an atmosphere that exudes joviality and revelry while maintaining an affordable pricing structure. Patrons can enjoy a wide range of televised sporting events, including soccer and football, on numerous televisions scattered throughout the establishment, while partaking in libations and delectable fare. During our visit, we noted that Firkin On Paradise presents a plethora of enticing promotions, such as a $2 beer special and a $5 fish and chips offer. These economic prices contribute to the allure of this venue, particularly when compared to nearby establishments like Hofbrauhaus, which charge nearly double the price for a pint of beer. Additionally, the ambient noise level within the pub allows for effortless conversation and contemplation, enhancing the overall experience. The culinary offerings, as depicted in images on Yelp, appear scrumptious, and the servers are both cordial and knowledgeable regarding the daily specials. Furthermore, the presence of pool tables and the British pub theme, coupled with its proximity to the Hard Rock Hotel and Kiss Mini Golf, render Firkin On Paradise an ideal location for an enjoyable outing. The combination of these factors convinced me to return to this establishment and indulge in their reasonably-priced beverages."
The food was very good - we all needed doggy bags!  Service was fast and friendly. Would definitely come back!

"Consistently exceptional culinary experiences are a certainty at this esteemed dining establishment, as evidenced by my spouse's recommendation for an evening meal last week. Unfortunately, our fastidious offspring was not particularly enthused about partaking in a repast at this venue. Following a week-long deliberation, I opted to indulge in a midday feast at this locale, employing the promise of delectable fortune cookies as a means of persuading my progeny to accompany me. Upon perusing the menu, I settled upon the familiar choice of pan-fried noodles complemented by succulent shrimp, prepared with a piquant seasoning. The culinary expertise of the chef was once again showcased, as both the vegetables and seafood components were cooked to perfection, resulting in a gratifying gustatory experience that proved difficult to resist consuming in its entirety. Notably, my discerning daughter expressed satisfaction with her selection of chicken teriyaki served with noodles, devouring the majority of the dish and concluding the meal with a pair of delightful fortune cookies. This restaurant has consistently maintained high standards of cleanliness, and the staff have always displayed warmth and hospitality towards patrons. My sole desire is for them to adopt a more efficient approach to serving meals, ensuring that all dishes are presented simultaneously rather than sequentially."

Finally managed to locate Sausagefest at StrEATs, a veritable culinary extravaganza that showcases an array of delectable sausages and other savory delights. Hailing from the southern precincts of Chicago, we opted to subject both the Polish and Hot Italian varieties to a thorough examination, and we were pleasantly surprised to discover that they both met our expectations with flying colors. The Vietnamese rolls, while unconventional in nature, proved to be a stroke of genius, boasting a remarkable balance between texture and flavor. The buns were soft and pliable, yet robust enough to contain the abundance of succulent morsels within. Furthermore, the fries were cooked to perfection, sporting a delightful crunch on the outside while retaining a fluffy interior, much like the ones we relished back in our hometown. Kudos to Sausagefest for their commitment to excellence; we eagerly anticipate our next visit to indulge in their gastronomic offerings.

"Excellent! 
My experience at Red Lobster was truly exceptional, having not visited one in an extensive period of time. Following a disappointing dining excursion to a high-end seafood restaurant with an inflated price point, Red Lobster offered a refreshing contrast with its superior quality and affordability. 

Upon entering the establishment, my girlfriend and I were warmly greeted and seated promptly, despite being quoted a wait time of 45 minutes. The ambiance was inviting, and the staff exhibited excellent hospitality throughout our visit. The biscuits served were of exceptional quality, complemented by inventive specialty cocktails that contributed to an already enjoyable dining experience. The variety of options on the menu catered to diverse tastes, ensuring there was something suitable for everyone. 

Personally, I opted for two succulent lobster tails, cooked to perfection and seasoned with great skill. My girlfriend chose the Surf & Turf option, which she thoroughly enjoyed, although she playfully declined my request for a taste. (She does read these reviews, after all.) 

If I were to offer a minor criticism, it would concern the rapid heating of the water in the bathroom sink. However, this did not detract from the overall satisfaction we experienced during our meal. In conclusion, our dining excursion to Red Lobster delivered an extraordinary culinary adventure, superb service, and an impressive value, especially when compared to our previous dining experience at a fine dining seafood establishment."

Fun park with lots of swings and slides. The water play area is fun and a refreshing break from the sun. Unfortunately, depending on the day, it can tend to get very crowded, and this close to an urban city you tend to get people from all walks of life converging in one place, I'm talking about the bad elements. There are nice courteous hard working people that come to the park to have a nice peaceful and respectful time, and then there are the rest, those are the ones you have to worry about.

Four visits to understand why my phone was not activating correctly. Each visit offered a new insight on what was wrong with my switch from an Iphone to an Android. It was not really their fault for not knowing. As long as they put in the effort and eventually addressed the issue at hand, I am satisfied with the service.

This place is a delight. Vegetarians, many of the dishes can be made meatless, so don't be afraid to ask. In fact, they have SOY-rizo which you can substitute for the Mexican chorizo with a couple entr\u00e9es. This tells me all is made to order (I approve!) The decor is more homey, artsy/craftsy then fancy/schmancy. Not my taste but the effort is appreciated. Don't forget to BYOB... or on certain nights, when you order 2 entrees and an appetizer (they call it a \"small plate\") you get a complimentary bottle of wine. We finished with coffee and flowerless chocolate torte. Perhaps the best I've ever had in my long dessert-filled life. FRESHly brewed coffee (just for me!) makes all the difference. The chef/owner came out to say hello and check on us. An appreciated touch. Would recommend and will return (that the chocolate tort better be on the menu!!!)
Small little place down to earth quiet setting awesome biscuits and gravy you have to come before 11 or you won't get breakfast

"The opulent ambiance and refined decorum of the Trump Hotel provided a luxurious respite from the frenetic energy and garish excesses typically associated with Las Vegas. The absence of a casino within the hotel's premises contributed to an atmosphere of tranquility and sophistication, allowing guests to focus on indulging in the finer things in life without the distraction of the ubiquitous slot machines and craps tables. The accommodations themselves were nothing short of sumptuous, boasting plush furnishings, meticulous attention to detail, and an overall aesthetic that exuded elegance and refinement. Of particular note was the innovative integration of technology into the bathroom, where an LCD screen embedded within the mirror allowed guests to multitask by watching television while engaging in their oral hygiene routine. While this novel feature undoubtedly added a touch of whimsy to the experience, it was ultimately the spacious, deep-soaking bathtub that stole the show, providing a blissful oasis for weary travelers seeking respite from the bustling city outside. Furthermore, the hotel's commitment to exceptional service was evident in the impeccable room service, which delivered delectable culinary creations to guests' doors each morning, further enhancing the already extraordinary experience. For those seeking a sophisticated sojourn in Sin City, the Trump Hotel stands as an unparalleled choice."

I am a big fan of skinnyfats and I come here once a week. Today I was disappointed about the level of customer service that the waitress had. We are a group of 4 and all the food came out except mine. My partner asked the server of the status of the food. The waitress gave attitude and did not express empathy for the salad not being ready with the rest of the meals. She came back and slammed a house salad in front of me and told her that I ordered a quinoa salad with chicken then she just took the plate back. She finally came back with the correct plate and walked away. As a customer service manager for a financial institution, I have high expectations of the service here. The other employees were nice and engaging with the guests. This employee needs coaching and feedback. The food was amazing.

This is an absolutely stunning building. I highly recommend a visit and if you're a nerd like me, take the tour of the Nationality Rooms. There are some 20-something rooms outfitted in the style of one of the nationalities that helped to build the city of Pittsburgh. Be careful and check the tour times before you go.
I love this place! Great margaritas and fajitas. I've only been there in the summer and it tends to be a little warm in the dining area. If not for that, I'd definitely give it 5 stars!

During my nearly three-year tenure as a resident of Las Vegas, I have had the occasion to observe the rapid proliferation of new Roberto's establishments throughout the city, with each successive opening representing an incremental increase in both quantity and diversity, as evidenced by the vast array of proprietors and culinary offerings that have come to characterize these disparate entities; furthermore, it is worth noting that the green salsa served at this particular location possesses an uncommon degree of piquancy, one that surpasses even that of its counterparts at other branches I have visited, a phenomenon that remains somewhat enigmatic, but ultimately serves to enhance the overall dining experience for those who partake of it.  This specific Roberto's happens to be situated in close proximity to my place of residence, and over time, it has established itself as a reliable purveyor of satisfactory comestibles, with the carne asada and breakfast burritos being merely passable, while the carnitas, when ordered, are subjected to a brief but intense frying process immediately prior to their incorporation into either a burrito or taco, thereby imbuing them with an unparalleled crispiness that serves as a testament to the culinary acumen of the establishment's chefs, and ultimately, provides me with a source of unmitigated gastronomical delight.

Welcome to the neighborhood Pita Jungle.  The food is as good as the other locations and the service is very friendly.  I wish the bar area was a little larger.  The outside patio is a great option on nice days.

Stopped in last night for some take out.  I was very impressed with how nice and knowledgeable everyone was.  I asked if the tortillas were vegan (they were!!) so I asked for two veggie burritos and as they were making them for me, the manager told me that she'd give me a sample of their soup, as it was vegan also.  No need for a sample, sign me up for the full cup!  I love tortilla soup, and theirs is tomato based, weeeeeee!  My burrito came with amazing cilantro lime rice (way more limey than Chipotle), black beans, guac, fajita veggies, pico and medium salsa.  It was divine!  My woman was equally pleased with the outcome of her burrito (rice, beans,fajita veggies, and pico).  When I was a cheese eater, I would order their chips and queso dip, which is totally yumsky.

"Sam Fox, oh how I adore thee! As an ardent devotee of your gastronomical masterpieces, I must confess that my expectations are consistently surpassed whenever I partake in a dining experience at one of your esteemed FRC establishments. Culinary Dropout, in particular, has captivated my taste buds with its diverse array of delectable offerings. From the initial sip of the sublimely savory bacon bloody mary to the gratifying finale of the heavenly pretzels and fondue, each visit has been a veritable odyssey of epicurean delight. Although minor hiccups in service have occasionally occurred, they pale in comparison to the overall excellence that permeates every aspect of the dining experience. Kudos to you, Mr. Fox, for your unwavering dedication to culinary excellence! I shall continue to patronize your restaurants with great enthusiasm and fervor, as my wallet weeps with joy."

"An exceptional dining establishment situated within the confines of Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, offering a culinary experience that far surpasses the customary standards associated with conventional airport fare, featuring a contemporary and unpretentious interpretation of traditional Tex-Mex cuisine."

"Refrain from allowing the unassuming nature of the strip mall setting to dissuade you from partaking in the culinary delights offered by this sushi establishment. Despite its relatively diminutive dimensions, the restaurant boasts an impressive array of sashimi selections, complemented by a judicious selection of grilled mackerel and edamame. Furthermore, the freshness of the sashimi is particularly noteworthy, especially considering the eatery's proximity to the bustling thoroughfare of the 101 freeway in Scottsdale. Additionally, patrons can expect to receive preferential treatment in the form of an 'insider hookup' for wasabi, thereby further enhancing the overall dining experience. In conclusion, this sushi spot is certainly worthy of future visits."

Umphrey's two thousandth performance commemorated an auspicious milestone, transpiring within a capacious arena that boasted satisfactory acoustics and an amicable security personnel. Unfortunately, our tardiness during both evenings precluded us from partaking in the delectable taffy apples fabricated at an adjacent establishment, its proximity being merely a stone's throw away. However, we were able to take advantage of a sizable parking garage located a single block distant, which offered a decidedly more convenient alternative to the often-frustrating street parking characteristic of Madison's urban domain.

"Despite the underwhelming ambiance, we opted to sample the culinary offerings of the Curry Garden, and our gastronomical excursion proved to be a resounding success. Upon perusing the menu, we elected to indulge in the Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhatura, and Garlic Naan, which, much to our delight, were replete with an abundance of delectable ingredients and flavors. The Paneer Tikka Masala boasted an impressive quantity of succulent paneer, enveloped in a rich, velvety sauce that was utterly tantalizing. Furthermore, the Bhatura was skillfully prepared, its golden, crispy exterior giving way to a fluffy interior, making it an ideal accompaniment for dipping in the savory sauces. Lastly, the Garlic Naan was also noteworthy, with an generous amount of fragrant garlic incorporated into the dough, resulting in a palate-pleasing experience. \n\nIn conclusion, our dining experience at the Curry Garden was thoroughly enjoyable, despite the uninspired interior design. The attentive service and scrumptious fare more than compensated for the lackluster ambiance, leaving us eager to return and indulge in their mouthwatering dishes once again."

"An expansive bar area, complemented by an extensive array of culinary offerings, fosters a convivial ambiance that is further enhanced by the hospitable demeanor of the bartenders. Although the waitstaff exhibits occasional signs of hastiness, their efforts remain generally commendable, particularly in light of the establishment's numerous televisions, which create an ideal setting for viewing sporting events while enjoying a libation or two."
I love the atmosphere and the food was great, you get to sing and dance there if you aren't shy.

We bought an online gift certificate for this place while we were in Vegas and were pleasantly surprised,  Service was excellent. I had a ribeye that was perfectly perfectly prepared and the sides were great too.  I ended my meal with the creme brulee and it was great!  For a restaurant inside a casino it was really first rate.

This is a review of HOB Vegas as a concert venue. The food, I've had before and no offense but I'd seriously pass on it...

We saw AFI here this last January. AFI is one of my favorite bands, but more like a 90's version of them and not like the current circa 2000's December underground version. 

As for the venue, this place kinda rocks. It is stadium seating so no problem getting a good view. I feel like it was general admission (pretty sure) but we had no problem getting really good seats. No problem getting in and out of the venue. Even with a long line it moved pretty fast. Good sound overall for the one show we experienced here. Their bar service was really fast with no waits upstairs.

I prefer this HOB over Anaheim any day. Plus the "disneyland" you deal with in Vegas is a lot cooler than the real one. And you don't have to deal with soccer mom's trying to run you over with their strollers...
Breakfast was great.  Samantha was awesome. Only ate eggs and chorizo but would have loved to try the carbs.  Pancakes and muffins looked amazing.

"My culinary experience at this establishment was an amalgamation of gastronomical delight and concern regarding sanitation. Despite my initial reservations, I opted to sample their offerings, which included both steamed lamb and chive dumplings, as well as fried pork and cabbage variants. The former was decidedly more rounded in shape, which allowed for a more efficient release of steam and boiling water, thereby enhancing the overall flavor profile. However, the latter style, while still palatable, did not quite resonate with me to the same extent as its steamed counterpart. Notwithstanding the aforementioned qualms regarding hygiene, I would still recommend visiting this restaurant, as the dumplings are undeniably delectable, and the accompanying side salads are equally tantalizing. Just be sure to avert your gaze from the floor covering."

"The Habit represents a notable departure from the conventional fast-food establishments, offering an elevated dining experience reminiscent of a refined, gourmet restaurant, albeit with a menu that, while adequate, may not necessarily cater to the most discerning palates. Furthermore, the quality of service, while satisfactory, may not always meet the highest standards, particularly during peak hours when the limited parking space tends to create inconvenience for patrons. Therefore, it is advisable to arrive promptly during the lunch period to secure a suitable parking spot."

While meandering down Smallman Street en route to 21st Street Coffee, my gaze fell upon an unassuming sign that read, "Donuts." My curiosity piqued, I pondered the possibility of indulging in such delectable treats. Upon entering the cozy storefront, I encountered Ron, the affable proprietor, who kindly offered me a sample of his freshly crafted donuts. The diminutive pastries, fashioned in a compact machine at the counter, were indeed adorable, and their tantalizing aroma wafted through the air, beckoning me to partake in their delightfulness. Although the donuts appeared somewhat smaller than their conventional counterparts, their flavor proved anything but diminutive. The Devil's Food variety, in particular, boasted an irresistible allure, prompting me to request a few of these bite-sized morsels. As I watched, Ron expertly fried them before my very eyes, sprinkling them with sugar and presenting them in a bag. The resultant taste sensation? Nothing short of sublime. When paired with my quad Mocha, the combination proved utterly divine. However, a minor deduction in rating seemed appropriate, given the slightly steep price point of $3 per dozen. Despite this, I couldn't help but commend Ron on his excellent culinary creations, earning him a well-deserved four stars.

"An unpretentious edifice from the exterior, yet housing an genuine ambiance, exceptional hospitality, and delectable culinary delights at reasonable tariffs, this Thai restaurant in Phoenix excels in offering a satisfactory dining experience; furthermore, their revamped website, replete with visual representations of their gastronomical offerings, facilitates the process of placing take-out orders with utmost convenience; specifically, their signature Pad Thai and the 35th item on their menu are highly recommended and indeed, a must-try for gourmands and epicureans alike."

"I am thoroughly enamored with this establishment, as it offers an extensive array of baked goods, including an assortment of artisanal breads, delectable pretzels, savory sausages, and an abundance of other mouthwatering meats, in addition to a diverse selection of soups, snacks, and an impressive array of pickled delights that showcase the epitome of culinary craftsmanship. My recent visit to this gastronomic haven yielded a trio of items that have left an indelible mark on my palate: a succulent horseshoe-shaped soft pretzel, a bag of crunchy pretzel sticks, and a sublime creamy dill-lemon-caper-honey mustard that has elevated my standards for condiments to an unprecedented level. Needless to say, my next visit will involve a comprehensive exploration of their vast array of gummy candies, which I anticipate will be a delightful and satisfying experience."

"The lodging boasted a pristine and contemporary ambiance, complemented by a secure and tranquil surroundings.  The front desk personnel were cordial and attentive, evidenced by their post-check-in call to ensure my satisfaction with the accommodations.  The guestroom featured a segregated seating area, refrigeration unit, ample space, and a sizable television. 
However, certain aspects of the hotel's design and amenities left something to be desired.  Specifically, the thermostat proved perplexing to operate, and the quality of the in-room coffee was subpar, akin to the unimpressive Arabica offerings commonly found in Hyatt establishments. 
It is worth noting that the hotel's location may pose a challenge for those relying on outdated GPS software, as it is a relatively new establishment.  Therefore, it is advisable to familiarize oneself with the surroundings prior to arrival, particularly for those arriving by automobile. 
Upon awakening at 7 AM on a Sunday morning, I was pleasantly surprised by the serene atmosphere, which contrasted starkly with the raucous environment typically associated with weekend stays at Embassy Suites.  Alas, this respite was short-lived, as the sound of children frolicking and shrieking in the corridor outside my room quickly replaced the silence.  Moreover, a group of seven individuals gathered in the hallway, engaging in a boisterous conversation in Spanish, which only intensified upon my attempt to investigate the commotion.  While it is unfair to hold the hotel accountable for the discourteous behavior of its family-oriented clientele, a discreet request for quiet hours, conveyed through a check-in notice perhaps, might help mitigate the inconvenience caused by such rowdy patrons."

I stayed at the Wigwam 2 nights for a work weekend retreat. This is a great location for retirees for mostly golfing and shopping. We happened to visit for a Leadership Summit for my company. This is a nice location to have a conference for work. The room was spacious with a wet bar, living room with fireplace, and luxuriously soft bed! I had the best nap of my life in that bed. It was divine! The decor is Southwestern/Ranch style. I am more of a fan of modern decor but I was still very comfortable during my stay. I would not normally stay here mainly due to the style but I found it very relaxing and comfortable.

Last night, I had the pleasure of reunited with some of my most cherished acquaintances at a quaint eatery renowned for its delectable cheese enchiladas and refreshing margaritas. The hospitable staff, comprising friendly servers and attentive waiters, contributed significantly to the overall convivial ambiance, making the experience thoroughly delightful from beginning to end. The culinary offerings, showcasing the rich flavors of Sonoran cuisine, piqued my interest, prompting me to deviate from my customary order and sample the green chile variant. The gratifying taste sensation was further elevated by the availability of vegetarian options and the reasonable pricing, both of which underscored the establishment's commitment to catering to diverse palates and budget constraints. My associates and I partook in lively conversation, punctuated by intervals of laughter, as we savored our meals, creating an atmosphere reminiscent of a congenial gathering among kindred spirits. Notably, one of my fellow diners has been frequenting this restaurant on a weekly basis for several years, which serves as a testament to its enduring popularity and a ringing endorsement of its gastronomic excellence. Moreover, it transpired that we were not the only group of regular patrons, as we observed a coterie of familiar faces, their countenances radiating contentment and satisfaction, thereby reinforcing our decision to patronize this esteemed dining establishment. Although my search for the ideal red sauce continues, this venue has secured a favorable rating in my estimation, owing to its tantalizing fare, cordial service, and welcoming ambience.

"A high-quality timepiece has the propensity to convey a multitude of information regarding its proprietor, and can hold a significance comparable to that of a dwelling or an automobile for individuals who seek to project their position, aesthetic, or pecuniary standing to others. Given that I possess the ability to verify the time on my portable telecommunications device, and have always found wristwatches to be somewhat bothersome and uncomfortable to don, I shall likely persist in utilizing my ill-fitting and economical attire, in conjunction with my unkempt athletic footwear, to communicate my social standing to those around me. However, for aficionados of horology, this minuscule yet eccentric retail establishment may appear to be a divine blessing, as the vast array of timepieces compactly showcased within its confines is truly remarkable."

It is eminently worthwhile to partake in a visitation, especially if one has not had the pleasure of experiencing this particular attraction previously. Procurement of tickets can be facilitated at Fry's for a nominal fee of $20. It is advisable to bring sunscreen and a hat to mitigate the effects of solar radiation, as well as to prepare oneself for an extensive amount of walking, as the venue is quite expansive. Additionally, it is wise to anticipate a significant number of people, resulting in a high level of activity. To satisfy one's culinary inclinations, there will be a variety of options available, including $3 soda, $5 beer, $7.50 turkey legs, and a brownie accompanied by ice cream for $5. However, it is important to note that these items come at a considerable cost, so it would be prudent to budget accordingly. Throughout the day, there will be numerous performances and exhibitions catering to a diverse array of interests, ensuring that everyone can find something to enjoy.

"Do not pass up the opportunity to dine at this exceptional establishment! My acquaintance resides in close proximity, thereby enabling us to partake in their delectable offerings on multiple occasions. Their coffee is truly impressive, with the vanilla latte being a particular standout - rich, velvety, and utterly devoid of any trace of bitterness. The menu options are innovative and diverse, but I find myself consistently drawn to the short rib burrito - an absolute delight! However, be aware that portion sizes are excessively generous, leaving me feeling satiated after only consuming half of my meal. Consequently, I request a to-go container upon placing my order, a practice that my fellow patrons also adhere to. Although the wait may be somewhat prolonged, the efficient and cordial service provided by the staff effectively compensates for this minor drawback. Some disadvantages that I must mention include the somewhat uncomfortable seating arrangements (although the booths are quite cozy), as well as the difficulty in locating healthier menu choices. Nevertheless, the restaurant's accommodating nature in regards to substituting ingredients serves as a significant advantage."

"A culinary establishment that exudes an aura of warmth and hospitality, whereupon we had the pleasure of encountering the proprietors, a harmonious conjugal pair, who demonstrated an unwavering commitment to ensuring our dining experience was suffused with cordiality and amenability. The gastronomical offerings were indeed palatable, and the attentive demeanor of the staff left us feeling satiated and gratified. We shall unquestionably revisit this eatery in the future."

"During my exploration of the captivating sights of Edinburgh, a sudden craving for a midday repast and a brief respite from my peregrinations necessitated a visit to a nearby eatery. Unfortunately, the cafe that had been highly recommended to me was closed during the festive period, thereby compelling me to seek alternative dining arrangements. In proximity to the aforementioned establishment, I chanced upon this quaint cafe/bistro, which appeared inviting and thus, I decided to venture inside. Upon entering, I was warmly received by the hospitable waitress who promptly escorted me to a vacant table and presented me with a menu. As I perused the offerings, I noticed that the menu selections were displayed on the windows, thereby facilitating my decision-making process. I opted for an avocado salad, accompanied by a glass of water, motivated by a desire to maintain a healthy disposition following the excesses of the holiday season. My culinary selection was swiftly prepared and delivered to my table, complemented by a side of brown seeded bread. While the salad was indeed delectable, I couldn't help but feel that a greater diversity of vegetables, such as the inclusion of cucumber and spring onions, would have enhanced its overall appeal. Moreover, I observed that an excessive amount of vinaigrette had been applied to the salad, resulting in an unfortunate sogginess of the leaves. Notwithstanding this drawback, the quality of service rendered by the waitstaff was quite satisfactory, and thus, I would consider revisiting this establishment in the future, as it offers a diverse array of edibles and potables."

"An exceptional venue for indulging in superior quality brews and delectable cuisine, yet it can be arduous to secure a table accommodating more than six patrons due to the absence of reservation facilities."
I ordered the spinach rice and beans which was excellent. Service was slow to start I waited 10 minutes for a cup of tea. Lunch is a very busy time but it'd still return because the food is very good

Ordered from Little Nippers II multiple times.  Each time I have been happy with what I have received, but I wouldn't call it fast food.

Good food takes time to make, and in the case of their mild wings, they are good!  Skip the packet of dressing they give you and go home and put some quality blue cheese on these wings and you are in business!  

Their pizza is o.k., but I have to say that I have not found pizza in Pittsburgh that measures up to the ones I can get back in New York, but then again their is a pizza place on every corner in my hometown. 

I will definitely be back, but will also make sure to call in or grub hub my order before to minimize the wait time.

"The fish sandwiches are indeed worthy of adoration, as they possess an unparalleled quality that surpasses expectations. In the event that you desire a midday repast, it is advisable to partake in one of these delectable offerings, but it would be wise to preemptively arrange for its procurement, lest you be compelled to endure a protracted delay of thirty minutes or more within the confines of an establishment that exudes an aura of questionable repute. Be aware that the atmosphere within said venue is often permeated by a pungent cloud of smoke, though it does boast the presence of a soda dispenser, which may serve to slake any thirst that may arise during the interval preceding the preparation of your meal. Notwithstanding the fact that the cost of such a delectable entree, accompanied by a portion of fries, may approach ten dollars, it is my conviction that the expenditure is decidedly worthwhile."

"An exceptional establishment indeed! My significant other and I previously patronized the venue situated in Mesa; however, our experiences were significantly marred by the manager's unfortunate demeanor. Her behavior was utterly discourteous, as she persistently failed to acknowledge our presence or display any semblance of civility towards her clientele. Consequently, we opted to discontinue our visits. Nonetheless, we were delighted to discover that the Bell Rd. location provided a markedly contrasting experience. The hospitality we received was truly commendable, as we were warmly greeted and promptly seated. Our server exhibited consummate proficiency in attending to our needs, and the culinary offerings were undoubtedly impressive. We invariably order the identical dishes, specifically a skillet for myself and the Eye Opener Combo for my spouse. Thus, we are unquestionably thrilled to reinstate this franchise into our roster of preferred breakfast establishments."

The free little chocolate tour is fun, the cactus garden is cool and the best part is being able to chocolates at the end, I particularly like the Creme Liqueurs! If you havent had them you need to try them!

The restaurants in the Mekong Plaza are all worth at least one try. The Wholly Grill is one that is worth a second, third and fourth try. We needed something good and cheap for dinner, and are all about supporting local businesses when we can, so we meandered over to the Plaza to see what the food court had to offer. We opted for Wholly Grill and were not disappointed! 

I got the grilled pork belly and my partner went for the pork skewers. I couldn't tell you which one I liked more. The skewers were tender and juicy, and my partner loved the eggplant salad she got with it. They reminded me of the awesome street food you find in that part of the world. My pork belly was crispy on the outside, and the perfect texture on the inside. If not cooked right, pork belly can be chewy, rubbery or like trying to gnaw on a piece of fat. This was not like that at all. I was full and kept eating. Every time I thought I was done, I saw another piece of meat on my plate and had to have it. 

The staff was super friendly. When asked what she recommended, she giggled and said the pork belly, like she wasn't expecting a ginger, white girl to go with her suggestion. There are a few more things on the menu I'd like to try, if I can get around ordering something other than the pork belly. Which I'm already craving again.

I procured a minuscule vanilla chai tea latte in a portable container, which I found to be rather satisfying in terms of its flavor profile, although I did experience some disappointment due to the diminutive proportions of the beverage relative to its cost, which I felt was slightly disproportionate to its monetary value.
Went for Restaurant Week with a friend. Adorable little place, wonderful atmosphere. The squid was just slightly overcooked but everything else was perfect. Service was great. Bring your own wine.

As a concatenation of culinary establishments and a slight deviation from the conventional definition of rapid nourishment, I thoroughly relish the experience offered by Chipotle! The comestibles served within these eateries are invariably fresh and delectable! Chipotle upholds an unwavering commitment to providing victuals that align with their philosophical tenets, specifically emphasizing "Food with integrity." These principles encompass offering vegetarian options and procuring meat from sources that adhere to natural and hormone-free practices. Such considerations contribute to my sentiments of satisfaction, derived not solely from partaking in scrumptious fare, but also from supporting an enterprise that prioritizes environmental responsibility. Upon each container, a narrative pertaining to one of their products or corporate practices is inscribed, which serves as an entertaining diversion during my dining experience. The employees at Chipotle exhibit exceptional cordiality! I was taken aback by the extent of their helpfulness and amicability, which I encountered while assembling my burrito via the establishment's efficient assembly line. Both interior and exterior seating arrangements are available, catering to diverse preferences. Additionally, the convenience of online ordering is offered, allowing patrons to retrieve their culinary selections upon arrival. In conclusion, Chipotle excels in both gastronomical quality and hospitable service, thereby earning my ardent admiration.

We were craving something light and decided to try this place.  I love a good sushi and sashimi plate, and there were plenty of items on the menu to pick from.  We decided to do some of the small share plates and were not dissappointed.  We ordered a total of 6 items, and all were very fresh and tasty.  The sauces we tried were outstanding.  The service was extremely good....very friendly, efficient and sincere.  Definitely would eat here again....

I chanced upon this bakery while meandering aimlessly in the vicinity, endeavoring to accomplish various errands. Unfamiliar with the district of Ahuntsic, my curiosity was piqued by the enticing aroma of freshly baked bread emanating from this establishment, compelling me to enter and partake in a brief exploratory visit. This bakery boasts an extensive array of delectable items, including an assortment of artisanal bread, pastries, cakes, quiches, pies, cheeses, and pre-prepared dishes designed for effortless reheating at home. Additionally, they offer a diverse selection of bread, including whole wheat and rye varieties. The baker's expertise is evident in the divine taste of their products, particularly the pain aux noix et \u00e9pices, which I savored with great relish. Ultimately, I departed with a substantial loaf of raisin and nut bread that had been carefully crafted to satisfy my specific preferences. This delightful bread featured a robust density, a well-balanced crumb texture, and a soft, non-crumbling interior. If this bakery were more conveniently located, I would undoubtedly become a regular patron!

So, this is where all the beautiful and cool people hang out.  I had no idea :-)
I wonder if they expected it to be this popular?  The casino in general was confusing to me but maybe that's because I'm never there.  It wasn't just me though; it wasn't until I asked a fourth employee that I was able to locate the will call desk for the boulevard concert venue.  In general everyone here seems helpful and having a good time and the crowd is definitely younger and more into partying.  The underground parking is a challenge.  Maybe crank up the lighting a bit...I have a feeling that's what purgatory will look like.

I saw the band New Order play outside at the pool.  I felt the show was great despite not being a huge fan of pool concerts.  The pool deck is small and cramped...there must have been 4,000+ people crammed out there.  Acoustics are marginal given the environment but the set list was epic including 4 songs from Joy Division.  Those that left early before the encore missed out...Losers!  A true fan stays until the house lights come up and the band is gone for good.  All in all it was a great experience and I had the chance to meet some cool people from Yelp for the first time.

"Our unwavering fixation with boba tea has culminated in an unrelenting odyssey to sample every establishment offering this delectable beverage within Las Vegas' city limits, ultimately leading us to the doors of Sesame House. Despite its name, the eatery's interior belies no indication of its supposed specialty; situated within the Chinatown Plaza shopping center, a solitary sign bearing the numeral "1" and the word "Boba" serves as the only external indicator of its presence. While not as atmospheric as some other establishments, the quality of their produce is undeniably superior, boasting an impressive array of desiccated fruits and an agreeable price point that positions it as a worthy alternative to Tea Planet, our previous favorite haunt."

A veritable haven for gastronomic indulgence, this quaint eatery in Vieux Quebec is an absolute must-visit for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. My better half was instantly enamored with its charming ambiance, deeming it utterly "adorable." Timing is key, as arriving around 11 am allows for a leisurely early lunch or brunch without the inconvenience of excessive crowding. Weekdays proved to be particularly stress-free for breakfast, affording us the luxury of a tranquil dining experience.

Their assortment of pastries is nothing short of sublime, with the cheese biscuit boasting a subtle yet tantalizing hint of cayenne spice. My spouse was thoroughly enchanted by the Cuban panini, praising the generous portioning of its flavorsome filling. While I, myself, did not share her enthusiasm for the bread's degree of toastiness, I would still eagerly order one of their paninis again and relish the opportunity to indulge in those delectable cheese biscuits as a sweet treat. And, quite frankly, their large cappuccinos are an absolute must-try.

In conclusion, the prices at this establishment are surprisingly reasonable when considering the plethora of overpriced tourist traps that plague the Old City.

Very authentic thai food! I had the beef jerky, pad thai, papaya salad and sticky rice ! All were delicious. They offer a huge thai tea ! I took off one star for the location. But I will definitely come back for the service and food.

I have had the privilege of traversing the precincts of this terminal numerous times, surpassing the frequency of Anna Nicole Smith's pharmacists' sojourns to the Bahamas. Upon entering, I find the interior effortlessly navigable, while the exterior presents a formidable maze, worthy of the most erudite cartographers. Which lane should I opt for to access the 202? Is it the portside? Or perhaps the central passageway? And then, a mere 100 yards hence, the sinistral path once again? The perplexity of the roadways appears to afford immense amusement for the vigilant traffic attendants, as they partake in their snacks and beverages, observing the bewildered travelers negotiating the tortuous signage with a sense of consternation. The amenities available within this establishment are adequate to superior, encompassing an array of drinkeries, eateries, and commercial establishments. I am at a loss to comprehend the grievances of those who express dissatisfaction, as my needs are fulfilled by the presence of a watering hole, a victualing establishment, a televisual device, a dosimeter of Dramamine, a copy of the National Enquirer, and that peculiarly-shaped pillow which induces feelings of foolishness whenever I elect to utilize it.

"Four out of five detrimental confectionaries. \n\nOh my! Sugar-laden barriers. Yum. I am grateful that I can only acquire such delectables during my business-related excursions into town, lest I be compelled to procure novel dimensions of trousers to accommodate my burgeoning waistline."

Recent perambulation through the gaming establishment revealed a remarkable transformation, manifesting a contemporary and refined ambiance within the gaming pit, devoid of the pungent odor of tobacco and instead, radiating a sense of freshness and cleanliness. The public facilities were nearly pristine, boasting new appointments that exuded an aura of modernity. Although culinary exploration was not pursued, the food court presented an alluring spectacle, its cleanliness and appeal palpable. Despite its seniority, this storied edifice has undergone a metamorphosis, defying the transience of its peers, and eliciting optimism for its continued prosperity. May the Tropicana continue to flourish, a beacon of tradition amidst the ever-changing landscape of Las Vegas.

This particular Trader Joe's location boasts a welcoming ambiance, offering an array of high-quality products synonymous with the esteemed grocery chain. However, the parking facility requires significant enhancements to ensure a more seamless and secure experience for patrons. Insurance providers should consider implementing a surcharge for individuals who opt to park in this lot, given the high risk of vehicular collision due to its haphazard design. To mitigate potential damage, it is advisable to park at the furthest end of the lot, thereby minimizing the likelihood of involvement in a fender bender with senior citizens who frequent this establishment. Despite the parking challenges, the convenience of this store's proximity to my residence makes it an appealing option, and I anticipate visiting regularly.

"Indubitably, my culinary excursion to Poppy's Bagels this morning was a gastronomical delight, as I savored each bite of the delectable, toasty bagel, adorned with a generous schmear of homemade cream cheese. The texture and flavor profile of the bagel were sublime, with a satisfying crunch from the toasted sesame seeds, while the cream cheese added a velvety smoothness that complemented the bagel perfectly. Furthermore, the establishment's ambiance, replete with a charming patio and cozy interior, provided an idyllic setting for enjoying a leisurely breakfast with my canine companion, Riley. Notwithstanding the occasional noise pollution from the nearby thoroughfare, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would unhesitatingly recommend Poppy's Bagels to any individual seeking a scrumptious bagel and cream cheese combination."

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Five Guys in various states, totaling three, and my affection for this establishment has yet to diminish. Originating from Southern California, I was brought up on In-N-Out Burger, a local fast food chain; however, my curiosity was piqued upon learning that former President Barack Obama had visited Five Guys, leading me to try it myself. Subsequently, I became enamored with their delectable burgers, boasting an abundance of flavor, and have continued to indulge in them. Notwithstanding, I must admit that In-N-Out's french fries remain my preference. Nonetheless, my loyalty to Five Guys remains unwavering, and I foresee future visits.

Buca Di Beppo's offers an unparalleled dining experience, boasting inconceivably delectable cuisine and gargantuan portions that necessitate sharing between multiple individuals. Given the copious amounts of food provided, it is advisable to reserve a table in advance, particularly during peak dining hours, to ensure seamless accommodation for your party. The pasta dishes, in particular, showcase exceptional culinary prowess, with each strand masterfully prepared and enveloped in rich, savory sauces that elevate the flavors to new heights.

"Gastronomical indulgence in delectable sushi and teppanyaki cuisine within an opulent eatery, complemented by attentive and courteous servers, offers an unparalleled dining experience. Preceding the culinary extravaganza, an array of tantalizing appetizers assails the taste buds, preceding the main event. While the cost may be perceived as prohibitive, numerous discounts and promotions are extended to local patrons, rendering the establishment accessible to a broader clientele. Personal preferences include the varied sushi rolls, tofu, filet mignon, seaweed salad, and vegetarian teppanyaki options, each dish showcasing the culinary prowess of the skilled chefs."

I have always been a fan of Oyshi Sushi as it took my sushi virginity! I wish the prices dropped to be more comparable to other sushi spots in the area but all one can do is hope. AYCE is the safest bet for a dinner out with a table for two or more. You ensure no one will need to wash dishes in the back if they get carried away with indulging. We all have those dinner friends who have the mindset of caviar budgets but the reality of dollar-value-menu wallets. 

Service is usually a hit or miss. I've gotten service that has made me not want to leave. On the other hand I've experienced servers at this establishment that made me want to request take-out. (which they do offer). 

The draw back for this place is they don't do half orders like other spots. It's also nowhere near the strip. Which is a catch-22. The wait can be timely depending on the day of the week. If it were closer to the strip it would be an endless wait.

Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and the Japanese Lasagna are my favorites!

We have eaten at this restaurant since it opened and it's always a great experience.  Most of the Teppan chefs have great personality and do an entertaining job of preparing the food.  The owners, Barry and Ahn, are very friendly and constantly walk the floor interacting with customers and checking to make sure everything is good.  They remember regular customers and are always happy to welcome you back.

The Happy Hour menu is very good with a variety of choices.  The sushi is always fresh and well prepared.

I noticed in a previous post that someone commented that the restaurant is loud.  Being as there are several Teppan tables, it can get loud - but in a fun and appropriate way.  They also have a huge patio and if you've never witnessed an Arizona sunset from there, you're missing out.

As I mentioned, we've been coming to this restaurant since it opened - sometimes a couple of times a week. We will continue to do so.

"We arrived at this establishment on a Tuesday afternoon, with the intention of partaking in a celebratory luncheon, utilizing the Lunch Groupon 'All You Can Eat' and 'All You Can Drink' options, priced at $36 for two individuals. Prior to being seated, our photograph was captured, evoking feelings of joviality and anticipation. The menu offered an array of culinary options, including salads, Mexican dishes, soups, Middle Eastern fare, Asian cuisine, American classics, Italian specialties, seafood delicacies, and an assortment of delectable desserts. In addition, the 'All You Can Drink' component provided an unlimited selection of beer, wine, and champagne, eliciting exclamations of delight from the female patrons, in particular. We highly recommend the strawberry crumb cupcake, which proved to be an epicurean delight. Furthermore, the presence of cotton candy for the youngsters added to the festive ambiance. However, the sushi offerings were found wanting, with a notable absence of crab legs. Patrons seeking a satisfying dining experience are advised to focus their attention on the Mexican, salad, and American options. While the edibles were merely average, the beverages proved to be the highlight of the meal, rendering the overall cost of $36, or $18 per person, a reasonable expenditure."

"Upon entering this establishment with a acquaintance of Bosnian descent, who graciously placed an order on my behalf, I was immediately struck by the sterility of the ambiance. The atmosphere was reminiscent of a bakery, albeit with a distinct disparity; an unmistakable air of uniqueness permeated the space, defying conventional categorization. 

Presented before me was a plate bearing a generous portion of freshly prepared bread, measuring approximately ten inches in diameter. This circular loaf, graced with a subtle sheen of oil, was bisected like a hamburger bun, revealing a savory filling of seasoned sausage meat. This culinary creation, known as ćevapčići or cevapi for short, constituted the entirety of the meal. 

Despite the seeming simplicity of the dish, both the bread and sausage proved to be delightfully flavorful. Unfortunately, my stomach capacity proved insufficient to consume the entire portion, even when dining with an empty stomach. Nonetheless, the experience left a lasting impression on me, and I would eagerly repeat it, while also making sure to reserve some space for the visually appealing Bosnian pastries on offer. 

The proprietors of the bakery displayed remarkable hospitality, despite their unconventional approach to customer service. Rather than hovering over guests, they adopted a more hands-off philosophy, whereby patrons were expected to communicate their needs directly. Personally, I found this manner of interaction rather refreshing, and it only added to the charm of my visit."

This eatery possesses an undeniable allure, boasting a brisk and efficient service complemented by an ambiance that exudes a palpable energy. My culinary experience was further enhanced by the delectable \"Leo's Sandwich,\" a judicious selection that showcased the kitchen's proficiency in creating flavorful dishes. Notably, even the simplest of beverages, water, was imbued with a subtle nuance that elevated its taste beyond the mundane. However, a few organizational hiccups pertaining to the management of waiting patrons slightly marred an otherwise seamless dining experience, thereby precluding me from conferring a perfect five-star rating.

I can't say enough about this grocery store. They have excellent customer service and I never experience cashier lines more than one or two people deep. They have a small selection of Organic vegetables, but the quality is very high; a decent selection of beer - beyond the usual bud light / coors light offering and the selection of baking supplies is as good as I've seen at a grocery store. I'll go out of my way to shop here.
I'm giving them 4 starts based off of the staff. Nicest people around. I have had there sandwiches and pizza. Both were OK.

The quality of the service we received was satisfactory, but the cost of our meal was somewhat prohibitive, particularly in light of the fact that we were only served two omelets and a beverage, albeit a delectable one, for the sum of eighty dollars; furthermore, the absence of an alcoholic beverage from the menu was a notable omission, given the prevalence of such offerings at establishments of this ilk in Las Vegas, a city renowned for its extravagant and indulgent culinary experiences. We elected to partake of our repast in close proximity to the pool, whereupon we proceeded to recline and enjoy our nourishment in a state of leisure, necessitating a brief stroll to secure a suitable location external to the edifice. The outdoor dining area, unfortunately, was not constantly available for our utilization, thereby requiring us to circumnavigate the premises to some degree in pursuit of an appropriate setting for our al fresco dining experience.

"A vibrant and bustling eatery offering an intimate and welcoming ambiance, featuring a diverse palette of flavors through its Mexican-inspired cuisine, at a price point that is rational and accessible to a wide range of patrons, particularly appealing to those in the blue collar workforce who possess a discerning palate and appreciate the value of quality sustenance."

Loved it!  My daughter and I went there for lunch and were very happy with our order, as our sandwiches were delicious!  I had their capri sandwich on ciabatta and my daughter had the turkey/bacon on ciabatta.  I didn't get the name of the guy behind the counter, but he was awesome!  Very friendly and willing to answer all of our questions about our sandwiches.  We are definitely going back :)

I paid a visit to Sushi Style today for a midday repast. Despite the fact that it was the peak lunch hour and numerous establishments were teeming with patrons, this particular sushi eatery was bustling yet not so congested that I had to endure an extended wait for attention from the staff.  
The server was exceptional. Prior to my complete settling in, she had already presented me with a refreshing glass of lemon-infused iced tea, demonstrating her attentive and prompt service. It is not uncommon to encounter establishments where the tea has been left to sit for an extended period, rendering it questionable and potentially unpleasant.  
I indulged in a tootsie roll, which proved to be quite satisfying. The combination of the eel sauce and the crunchy texture of the crab California roll was truly impressive. Additionally, I sampled an Arizona roll, which was equally remarkable. I am highly likely to return to this establishment in the near future, either for lunch or dinner. My spouse and I typically frequent only a select few sushi restaurants, and this establishment undoubtedly gives Yen Sushi a run for its money with its extensive menu options and exceptional customer service.

I always get my acrylics done here! They're a little our of my way but so far the best place I've found in awhile. Tina does an excellent job of making them all even and thinner at my request. I can usually make it 3 weeks at most between fills. Great place!!! Definitely recommend and the prices are very reasonable.

"A truly exceptional luncheon buffet experience can be had during the week for a nominal fee of $13.99, give or take a dollar, offering an extensive selection of delectable vegetarian options, succulent chicken, pork, and beef dishes, complemented by an assortment of mouthwatering Naan bread that is simply divine and served in copious quantities, ensuring a truly satiating culinary indulgence that will undoubtedly necessitate a postprandial restorative respite."

Los Dos proffered an exceptionally delectable Chimichanga, featuring a succulent selection of meat, meticulously deep-fried to a golden crisp, and adorned with a flavorsome triad of guacamole, sour cream, and New Mexico's signature green chili sauce, thereby evoking a culinary nirvana that would have warranted an unqualified 5-star rating had complimentary refills of chips and salsa been offered; furthermore, their extensive assortment of premium margaritas and beers served as the perfect accompaniment to this gastronomic delight.
Was tricky to find but well worth the hunt!!! Great tacos, and friendly chef! We will definitely be back for more!!!

This particular Wendy's franchise has recently undergone a comprehensive renovation, prompting my companion and me to visit and examine the revamped interior design. The extensive refurbishment has significantly altered the customer experience, as the traditional method of ordering and collecting food has been replaced by a more streamlined and efficient system. Specifically, patrons are now required to place their orders at a designated area before proceeding to a separate pick-up location. Additionally, the dining area has been thoroughly modernized, featuring new furniture, an updated ambiance, and even a segregated section for young children. Furthermore, this establishment now offers complimentary Wi-Fi access, further enhancing the overall dining experience for its clientele.

"Although it appears to be approaching an acceptable time for a midday meal, the culinary offerings at this establishment are somewhat limited in scope and variety, despite the fact that the ambiance is pleasant and the prices are reasonable."

St. Francis is one of my preferred destinations for a leisurely morning repast in Phoenix, boasting an upscale, contemporary ambiance. Their culinary offerings are an eclectic fusion of traditional American dishes, infused with nuances from various cultural influences. Furthermore, they possess an extensive selection of artisanal brews, as well as expertly crafted mimosas and bloody Marys, which complement their delectable brunch options. Additionally, children under the age of ten can indulge in a complimentary meal, making it an ideal family-friendly establishment.  

The hospitable staff has consistently displayed warmth and attentiveness during my visits. Although some patrons have reported sluggish service, I have never experienced such issues personally. The duration between courses may be somewhat prolonged, but this is hardly the server's responsibility. In fact, the servers have been diligent in monitoring my beverage levels and offering prompt refills when necessary.  

Their eggs benedict with salmon is a personal favorite of mine, as the Hollandaise sauce achieves a sublime balance of richness and tartness. Initially, the dish was served with a generous portion of fingerling potatoes, but unfortunately, this side dish has since been replaced by a few scattered potatoes on the plate. Nonetheless, the pork chile verde remains a standout option, boasting a delightful harmony of spicy and savory flavors. It is presented with a substantial serving utensil and accompanied by two slices of cornbread, perfect for sopping up the flavorful broth. Another culinary highlight is their cioppino, a fiery, crimson seafood stew that is arguably large enough to share, and is served with a crusty loaf of bread.  

Furthermore, I have visited St. Francis with companions for a happy hour excursion, during which we exclusively ordered appetizers and beverages. The atmosphere proved to be cozy and inviting, and we departed feeling content and refreshed, courtesy of the outdoor patio's warm fire.

Switch offers a variety of food options from healthy choices to comfort food. The menu is very eclectic, and I have yet to have a bad meal from here. The portions sizes are very generous for the price and service has always been good. Some of my faves include:
- mac & cheese: rich, creamy, flavorful cheese sauce over penne
- caprese sandwich: typical ingredients with a great pesto vinaigrette 
 - burger: your basic burger, not too fancy, but great on taste
Also, if you're looking to tie one on, they have some fantastic drink specials especially on Sundays where you can get carafes of mimosas, bloody marys, etc. for $3.

We have been ardent patrons of this culinary establishment for a duration of five years, during which time we have developed a profound appreciation for their gastronomical offerings and beverages of a blended nature. The specific location under discussion is a relatively recent addition to the chain, having been in operation for less than a year at the present time, and boasts an exceptionally busy location that has led to inconsistent staffing levels on weekends, resulting in occasional delays of up to twenty minutes in the procurement of sustenance. Despite these brief lapses in efficiency, the quality of both the edible fare and potable beverages remains unwavering, though unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the maintenance of the facilities, particularly the restrooms, which are frequently found to be in a state of disarray, much to the chagrin of this author and parent of three youthful offspring, who find it necessary to exercise great caution in their utilization, lest they be confronted with an environment that falls short of stringent standards of hygiene. It is a source of perplexity and disappointment that the sole lavatory on the premises should be overlooked with such regularity, despite the evident amiability of the staff and the apparent competence of the manager. Notwithstanding this anomaly, this eatery remains a favored destination for our family, who frequent it several times a week.

"I have had the pleasure of dining at this establishment on a weekly basis, with the occasional absence, and I must say that the culinary offerings have been remarkably consistent. The foundation of their pho soup, which is undoubtedly the cornerstone of their menu, has undergone a subtle enhancement, thereby elevating its already superior quality relative to other eateries. My experiences at this venue have transpired under varying conditions of occupancy, ranging from tranquil to bustling, and yet, the level of service has remained steadfastly excellent. It is truly gratifying to have such an exceptional dining option available in Chandler."

If you ask any Asian person where they go to get their familiar spices and groceries, I'll bet 99.9% of them know about this place.  However, this isn't only for Asians, anyone can stop in and find what they're looking for as the aisles are labeled based on the culture (Filipino, Korean, etc.).  If that doesn't help, you can still explore the endless array of 'water animals', fresh baked goods, even a bubble tea counter.  They also have a small dining area which serves some traditional (it looks to be) Chinese fare.\n\nIt's quite a bit of a drive, but if we're ever in the Matthews/ Stallings area, this is a must stop for your Asian cuisine needs.

It blows my mind that anyone can think In-N-Out is better than Lenny's. In-N-Out has to be the most overrated place ever. I have no idea what the appeal is; the patties are thin, the cheese is mediocre and the fries are terrible. The burger itself tastes okay, but nothing better than, say, Whataburger, which I think is a lot better than In-N-Out. Lenny's patties are actually beefy (pun intended), their cheese is good and their fries are 100x better than In-N-Out. Is it the best burger joint around? No, but it's a lot better than In-N-Out.

I lacked the financial protection afforded by health insurance, rendering me responsible for the fiscal burden of my dental procedures. Following a meticulous comparison of prices among various dental facilities in the vicinity, I deemed the cost to be reasonable. Additionally, the presence of an online discount coupon valued at $100 further alleviated the financial strain. Consequently, I opted to engage the services of Biltmore Commons Dental Care, bolstered by numerous favorable Google reviews which contributed to my conviction in their proficiency. At 8:00 AM, I initiated a phone call and managed to secure an appointment at 9:00 AM, possibly due to a fortuitous combination of availability and the economic downturn's impact on dental patient volume. Dr. Balestrino, a skilled practitioner, executed the requisite restorative procedures and devoted sufficient time to expound upon the treatment plan and address any queries I harbored. Generally, I experienced satisfaction with this dental visit and would consider returning for my scheduled six-month cleaning.

"This eatery constitutes one of our preferred destinations for procuring luncheon fare for take-out purposes, as we unhesitatingly venture beyond our customary boundaries to acquire their delectable sandwiches and salads. The culinary offerings of this establishment boast a consistent degree of savory excellence, while the staff members exhibit an unwavering commitment to cordiality and hospitable customer service. Thus far, we have yet to sample a single item from their extensive menu that did not meet or exceed our expectations."

"Unequivocally an aficionado of Yoforia, I must say. These yogurt establishments have been proliferating with alarming rapidity in recent times, it appears. A truly ingenious notion, this self-serve cum weight-based payment system. Kudos to them for striking an optimal balance between palatability and cost-effectiveness. \n\nIt is occasionally vexing, however, to be confronted with an interminable queue at this particular venue. Nevertheless, the line advances with reasonable celerity... and, as a welcome boon, the Southpark Mall location affords one the opportunity to perambulate the premises while awaiting the dissipation of the throng."

"The health and fitness club known as LVAC boasts an impressive array of state-of-the-art equipment and an expansive physical footprint, thereby catering to a diverse range of patrons who seek to enhance their physical wellbeing through rigorous exercise and healthy living practices. Despite my overall satisfaction with the aforementioned establishment, I did encounter a minor inconvenience pertaining to the usage of their facilities, specifically stemming from an oversight on my part regarding the requisite forms of identification necessary to finalize my membership. Following a brief exchange with the staff, the issue was promptly resolved, leaving me thoroughly impressed with the competence and efficiency displayed by the management team. However, I must caution prospective members that the peak hours of operation tend to attract a sizable crowd, making it challenging to fully capitalize on the amenities offered. For optimal utilization of the facilities, I recommend visiting the gym during off-peak hours, preferably around midnight, when the atmosphere is noticeably less congested. In conclusion, LVAC's shortcomings in customer service and staff performance are largely eclipsed by the numerous benefits and advantages afforded to its clientele, rendering it an exceptional value proposition for those seeking a top-notch fitness experience."

"Cleanliness, amicability of staff, and voluminous servings are hallmarks of this culinary establishment, purveying Mexican cuisine, albeit not the most exceptional, yet gratifying my yearning. Despite my resolve to consume merely half, my gluttony invariably prevails, devouring the entirety, rendering futile my intention to reserve the remainder for a subsequent repast."

My girlfriend and I are currently indulging in a luxurious stay at the esteemed Cosmopolitan hotel this week, where we have had the pleasure of partaking in the delectable offerings of their renowned brunch buffet on two separate occasions thus far. The culinary experience has been nothing short of exceptional, with a vast array of options catering to diverse tastes and dietary preferences, all of which have been expertly prepared and presented with impeccable attention to detail. However, we have encountered a minor inconvenience in regards to the time it takes to be seated for a table, as we have observed a surplus of unoccupied tables, many of which have already been cleared and reset, yet the process of seating patrons has been somewhat sluggish, suggesting a lack of urgency or concern for expeditiously accommodating guests. Nonetheless, the gastronomic delights have been truly satisfying, and we would highly recommend reserving ample space for the delectable desserts that cap off the meal.

"The physical configuration and aesthetic appeal of this particular Starbucks establishment are indeed impressive, offering ample space for patrons to enjoy their beverages and socialize. However, upon our visit, it was observed that the staff was not maintaining the premises with the utmost diligence, as evidenced by the overflowing waste receptacle and tables in need of thorough sanitization. Despite this oversight, the team demonstrated a commendable level of friendliness and hospitality, thereby warranting a rating of four stars. Nevertheless, it is hoped that future visits will reveal an increased emphasis on maintaining a clean and organized environment, as well as ensuring an adequate supply of edible items."

"The all-you-can-eat buffet presented an array of delectable options, with certain selections boasting exceptional flavor profiles while others were somewhat lacking in that department; however, the mango ice cream proved to be a notable highlight, although the mango lassi would have benefited from the omission of the whipped cream topping. Furthermore, the staff exhibited remarkable attentiveness throughout our dining experience. Of note, the curry dishes did not possess an overwhelming degree of spiciness, yet still managed to showcase a delightful blend of spices."

Bandera serves as an ideal location for initiating one's nocturnal escapades, as it offers an assortment of delectable edibles, including their signature Dip Duo accompanied by tortilla chips, which, when coupled with their flavorful Mojitos, creates a truly unforgettable gastronomical experience. Bandera's ambiance also provides a unique setting for partaking in a satisfying appetizer and a potent beverage, thereby making it an optimal venue for commencing an evening of revelry.

My best friend came in to Vegas for the day to visit. I wanted to take her to the new hotels to see how amazing they are. We decided to have lunch and a couple cocktails here after checking the menu out.\nWe shared the grilled vegetable pizza and I had my own cocktail concoction made (Grey goose, water, lime & mint)...YUMMY! I loved how they can or will make any cocktail you want. My friend had their house margarita on the rocks and loved it so much she had 3...hey, she was on vacation!\nThe service was good and the views outside were stunning!

This eatery is an optimal location for indulging in Dim Sum delights, situated on the periphery of Montreal's Chinatown. Despite its unremarkable setting within a shopping mall, the culinary offerings are satisfactory, and the ambiance is fitting for a Dim Sum establishment. The dishes tend to possess a slightly oily quality, which is not entirely unexpected given the nature of Dim Sum. Numerous patrons have drawn parallels between this restaurant and others in various locales; personally, I have had the pleasure of partaking in Dim Sum in Shanghai on several occasions, and I would argue that this establishment holds its own in comparison. Engaging in a thorough analysis of a specific restaurant versus an entire city or nation is, in my opinion, rather futile, as Shanghai boasts both exceptional and subpar establishments, making it a matter of personal taste.
