My primary objective is to discover a genuine, authentic Chinese steamed bun (xiaolongbao) restaurant in Montreal, akin to Din Tai Fung, and sample their delectable wares.

Setting - Good setting, very nice and relaxed with plenty fo room.

Service - Friendly service and always happy to help you make your choice.

Food - Very, very good. This place knows how to do a steak and me and my two friends agreed it was some of the best we'd ever had. I'd avoid the mushroom side though as, to me, it was one of the most vile things I'd ever tasted, though I guess that could just be me.

Overall - Go here if you want a good steak at a good price with good service. Do not miss!!!!

"A culinary aficionado such as myself cannot help but adore the delectable delights proffered by Thai cuisine. It is no surprise that this establishment has garnered accolades including the prestigious title of 'Best of Las Vegas' on multiple occasions in recent years. There are two indubitable aspects that contribute to its enduring popularity. Firstly, it boasts a loyal clientele who crave authentic Thai flavors, and secondly, the kitchen's commitment to serving dishes that showcase the richness and diversity of Thai gastronomy. Patrons can indulge in an array of mouth-watering options, including the quintessential Pad Thai, red curry with a spicy numba 10 kick, and savory mint beef. Not to mention their refreshing Thai Iced Tea, which strikes the perfect balance between sweetness and tartness. The ambiance is inviting, characterized by a warm and welcoming staff who epitomize the essence of Thai hospitality. While the prices may fall under the umbrella of 'average,' the quality of the fare and the overall dining experience justify every baht. A word of advice: avoid visiting during lunchtime if you opt for the buffet, as it may not live up to your expectations. Instead, treat yourself to a sumptuous dinner that will leave your palate satiated and your senses delighted."

"It is perpetually beneficial to witness a commercial enterprise execute tasks appropriately and attain recognition for its efforts. This eatery adheres to such a paradigm, as evidenced by my spouse and I partaking in their delectable Cobb Salad during the luncheon hour - an experience that far surpassed our expectations. 

The site in question has been home to several culinary establishments that have come and gone, with each departure being attributed to various deficiencies. Toast, however, has effectively demonstrated that the location itself was not the primary factor contributing to these shortcomings, but rather the quality of the food and service provided - a notion that holds true in most cases. 

While the ambiance was generally pleasant, there was a brief period during which the noise level rendered conversation across the table somewhat challenging. Although this may be a natural byproduct of their popularity, it remains a concern worth addressing."

"I have had the pleasure of patronizing this establishment on numerous occasions over the past couple of years, specifically, I would estimate around ten times, and each experience has been nothing short of exceptional in terms of the quality of service provided by the staff, who have consistently demonstrated a proficiency in their roles that is truly commendable. Furthermore, I must say that I find the assortment of apparel available for purchase, particularly those designed for female athletes and enthusiasts of yoga, to be quite impressive and diverse, catering to a wide range of tastes and preferences. In the event that a return or exchange is necessary, I have found the process to be efficient and hassle-free, with the staff handling such matters promptly and courteously, leaving me feeling satisfied and valued as a customer. Overall, I must say that my experiences at this store have been thoroughly positive and I look forward to continuing to shop here in the future."

"Indulge in the delectable KOBE SLIDERS, an unparalleled gastronomical experience that will leave you yearning for more. The tantalizing flavors of these bite-sized delights are unmatched, and the complementary BBQ dipping sauce serves as the perfect accompaniment. However, be prepared to endure an extensive wait during peak hours, particularly on weekends, as the restaurant's popularity is well-deserved. While outdoor seating may appear inviting, it is unfortunately not a feasible option due to the overwhelming demand. Nevertheless, the ambiance is undeniably captivating, boasting a picturesque pool and fountains that create a serene atmosphere. Additionally, the establishment offers a comprehensive bar selection, a standard feature in Las Vegas establishments. Furthermore, their menu showcases an array of mouth-watering options, including the colossal Cobb salad, capable of satisfying three individuals; the savory chili; the succulent turkey club sandwich; and the massive, delectable cheeseburger. Although the prices may seem steep, the superior quality of the cuisine justifies the expense."

Vdara epitomizes a tranquil retreat amidst the frenetic atmosphere of the Strip, boasting spacious accommodations, exceptional customer service, and an array of luxurious amenities. Having had the pleasure of lodging at this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, I can unequivocally attest to its allure. The guest rooms are palatial, comfortably accommodating our trio during our most recent visit. Notably, the property's non-smoking policy and absence of a casino contribute to its peaceful ambiance, making it an ideal haven for those seeking respite from the Strip's vibrant energy. Positioned at the southern end of the Strip, Vdara enjoys a relatively secluded location, tucked away behind the Cosmopolitan. While the trek to the Strip may prove somewhat arduous, the proximity to Bellagio renders it a decidedly more straightforward endeavor. Although I personally prefer a slightly livelier atmosphere during my Vegas sojourns, Vdara's deliberate emphasis on catering to a more sedate clientele ensures its continued appeal and longevity. Furthermore, the hotel's pool area exudes a sense of serenity, standing in stark contrast to the rowdy vivacity characteristic of many Vegas pool scenes. Without hesitation, I would opt to stay at Vdara once again, particularly given its reputation as a "mystery" hotel on Hotwire, readily identifiable by its south Strip location, five-star rating, and non-gaming status. Until we meet again, Las Vegas!

I went to AAP last week for lunch because I was too late for Greek Isles, but I am so glad I did!  I eat a late lunch so there was not too many people there and the hostess let me pick my table, so I took a big comfy booth.  

My server came by right away and got my drink order and to see if I had any questions about the menu.  I was intrigued by the soft pretzel with beer cheese and she told me how good it was, but also how large.  So I decided to order it and if I was still hungry I'd get something else because she told me the kitchen was pretty quick.  Turns out it was a really great pretzel, the cheese wasn't my fave but the pretzel was so soft with a nice crunchy exterior and served piping hot!  I was a little hungry still so I got the spinach salad and it was also delicious.  It was spinach with tomato, cranberries and feta.  I did think it could use maybe a nut or something for a different texture, but overall a great salad.

It seems like they have drink specials during the week.  The whole place is huge and I bet it would be a great place to watch a game.  The only reason I went with 4 stars was they should have some more lunch offerings besides the salads/sandwiches, entrees don't start till after 5.  Otherwise, it was great and I will be back!

Im so glad we yelped this place before we left Vegas. 

We were all pretty much grungy but so were the rest of the people there.. haha. Im sure the owners know why.. it is like five mins away from the strip.. 

Anyways! Super friendly owner lady!! She was willing to give us more of other things cuz none of us wanted meatballs. Yay! even though she forgot and messed up my friend's order.. 

Tasted "authentic." I put that in quotes because I'm not sure what authentic pho tastes like really but it was different from the regular Korean owned places I'm used to. In any case, even though I prefer Korean owned places I thoroughly enjoyed the pho here. It may have been cuz I was slightly hungover.. but still.. when else would you come here right? (As a non Las Vegas resident). :)) 

The only thing I was a little errrr about was the fact that you have to walk pass the kitchen to get to the bathroom. Eek. I don't like that.. :((

This is our go to location when we are craving a good steak for a good price point! The staff is always really friendly and the place is kept clean every time. We usually get the no butter version of the steak and the veggies, since they offer that here, and it cuts a ton of calories from the meal and still tastes awesome with the seasonings they offer!

The brown bread they bring out in the beginning of the meal is always tasty and served up warm. The ambiance here is nice, and the booths around the bar area are pretty private if you want a date night out, see if you can be seated there. 

Overall: A
Food is always prepared nicely, they offer healthy choices with great flavor, and staff is friendly!
Glad to have this restaurant in my neighborhood, the only thing that would make it better for me would be a patio, you know for the dog to come with. Reasonable price, had a great red curry!
Stop here! Buy a block of the dill Havarti and try a bunch of samples. I am sure there will be others that you love :)

Le Petit Moulinsart is a little place located in Vieux Montreal along Rue St Paul. In truth, we probably wouldn't have stopped here except we were looking for a late dinner spot and this was one of the few places that looked promising. The name is derived from a Belgian comic strip, which features a chateau called Moulinsart. As you might guess, the restaurant specializes in Belgian fare, though me and my companions really couldn't discern Belgian food from French food if our lives depended on it.

LPM is really known for their mussels, which are served steamed in a large variety of different broths. We tried 4 different mussel dishes and all were good, but two were excellent. However, because there are so many different flavors, I would recommend just trying anything that sounds good to you. If the flavors sound appealing, you will probably like the mussels.

They cook enough mussels here that they definitely know what they are doing.  All of the mussels came out plump, tender, and juicy. Complimentary baguettes can be used to sop up the broth. Round off the meal with a nice salad, and you have healthy, delicious meal.

In my opinion, this place serves the second best mussels I ever had. The top prize still goes to Bertha's in Fells Point, Baltimore.

"Exceedingly satisfactory, copiously oily, utterly indulgent culinary delights, confined to a solitary monthly consumption owing to their unwavering commitment to profuse frying methods, thereby elevating the humble white trash burger (comprising a triumvirate of deep-fried garnishes: pickles, onions, and cheese, atop a beef patty) and its accompanying sweet potato fries, to an unparalleled position of gastronomic excellence."

The last train station is at SLS, the Lux tower wing where we stayed at, it was easy access for us to get on this train. Bought 24 hour passes, got on the train to get to The Linq, it was so fast and convenient, much better and cleaner than taking taxi. There was barely any people on a Sunday. \n\nI like to take the train during the day, It was a lot of fun for me, just need to remember to wear flats next time!

A welcoming ambiance entices patrons at the intersection of Saint-Laurent and Fairmount, fostering a diverse clientele comprising of young mothers and their offspring, professionals seeking a productive meal, and refined gentlemen relishing a cold brew. The concise menu boasts an array of delectable options, ranging from grilled cheese sandwiches, fresh salads, and charcuterie platters on the smaller side, to heartier pasta dishes, savory stews, and satisfying hash on the larger portion of the menu.  
Upon ordering, my culinary companion and I opted for contrasting selections. My $15 corned beef hash, garnished with a flawlessly cooked sunny-side up egg, garnered praise for the chef's expertise in achieving the perfect doneness. The juicy, flaky corned beef melted in my mouth, coalescing with the rich flavors of the dish. Although the serving size appeared modest, the abundance of flavors made it a satisfying portion by the end of the meal. Following the current culinary trend, a peppery arugula salad graced the top of the dish, enhancing its overall appeal. 
My dining companion selected a salad accompanied by crispy fries, playfully dubbed the "angel and the devil" by our attentive server. These fluffy, golden fries, served with a creamy mayonnaise dipping sauce, proved irresistible, as I found myself indulging in several bites before realizing my gluttonous transgression.

"Abandoning the ubiquitous Starbucks franchise, I instead opt for the distinctive charm of independently owned establishments. While my predilection gravitates towards the eclectic ambiance of the Beehive, Crazy Mocha's diverse offerings proffer an equally satisfying experience. Their extensive menu boasts an array of expertly crafted coffee and tea beverages, delectable smoothies, and an assortment of sweet treats. However, I must express a modicum of discontent with the gargantuan proportions of certain dessert selections, which, while ideal for sharing among a group of four, pose a formidable challenge for a solo diner adhering to a strict dietary regimen. Complimentary internet access further enhances the appeal of this inviting venue, which has undergone several name changes throughout its history. Formerly known as Dancing Goats, the location has since metamorphosed into Crazy Mocha, with multiple outlets scattered throughout the Pittsburgh area, including a recent addition at the esteemed Carnegie Library."

During my recent visit to the cinema, I opted to capitalize on the brief interval between dropping off my vehicle for an oil change and the start of the film by purchasing a ticket and enjoying a movie. The queue for tickets was surprisingly swift and straightforward, and the cashier's amiability further facilitated a seamless transaction. Upon entering the lobby, I was pleased to discover a well-maintained environment, and the ticket taker's cordial demeanor directed us towards the appropriate theater with ease. Although we had already satiated our appetites prior to arriving, the snack bar appeared orderly and efficient from a distance, thus eliminating the need for further examination. The theater itself was in excellent condition, boasting clean seats and an unobstructed view of the screen, even in the smaller auditorium. In conclusion, my cinematic experience was thoroughly enjoyable and merited an exemplary rating of A.

"An upscale watering hole, replete with an array of potent potables and a discerning clientele, affords the quintessential setting for observational indulgence and eavesdropping. Verily, the denizens of this esteemed establishment serve as the primary source of diversion, regaling one another with tales both tall and true, such as the saga of the ostentatious patron who, in a fit of magnanimity, purchased a bottle of Cristal (a cool $800) for a pair of comely Russian lasses, and then, in a display of unapologetic audacity, shotgunned it! Shots of Cristal, indeed, ensure that the revelry in Las Vegas remains unrelenting. Furthermore, this same individual, seemingly oblivious to the normative order of alcoholic beverages, elected to follow up his champagne extravaganza with a succession of standard shots, eliciting a collective incredulity from those present. In spite of such anomalies, this swanky bar remains a paragon of mixological excellence, serving up expertly crafted cocktails that cater to even the most fastidious tastes. Case in point: a recent visit yielded a sublime concoction featuring maraschino liqueur, vodka, rose wine, and a trio of succulent raspberries, all artfully presented and eagerly devoured. The attentive and deft bartenders, cognizant of their craft, enhance the overall experience, rendering this a must-visit destination for aficionados of fine libations."

"An establishment offering delectable morning meals rooted in conventional American and Filipino culinary traditions, with a waiting period that, while not negligible, proved reasonable in duration. My recommendation for patrons seeking a gastronomic experience reminiscent of these cultural influences would be the red velvet pancakes, a dish that showcases the eatery's proficiency in balancing flavors and textures."

"It pains me to admit it, but I have a certain affinity for this establishment. Despite my reservations regarding its potentially deleterious impact on smaller businesses in the area, I must confess that it boasts an impressive array of outdoor apparel and equipment. In fact, I would venture to say that their selection surpasses that of even the most esteemed retailers, such as REI. Furthermore, they appear to be the sole purveyors of stand-up paddleboarding gear in town, which is a significant advantage for those interested in aquatic pursuits. The staff members are also commendably knowledgeable about their wares and refreshingly free from the haughty demeanor often associated with more diminutive shops. While they may not carry the most extravagant items coveted by seasoned enthusiasts, they cater admirably to neophytes and casual patrons. Overall, this store is an excellent starting point for those embarking on an outdoor adventure."

"Savor the delectable delight of our sumptuous sandwiches, offered at an unpretentious price point. Virtually every item on our extensive menu boasts an impressive gastronomical experience, but the #2 triple decker turkey pastrami on rye stands out as particularly exceptional and satisfying."

"Subjectively, the dining experience was not entirely unpalatable, taking into account the limited options available at the airport terminal. The personnel demonstrated a commendable level of cordiality and competence in their interactions with patrons, while the culinary offerings were served promptly and exhibited a satisfying degree of warmth and freshness in their preparation."

Definitely a premium hotel and I would challenge anyone to find any problems with their service.  Meeting rooms were well equipped and the hotel wifi actually worked well and delivered high speed.\n\nNot sure I would justify their rates, but I am cheap when it comes to hotels, so I could not help but notice the Marriott right down the street.  : )

When I can't get my everyday items like Fresh Fruit, Meat, Seafood, and Deli items @ fresh and Easy I go here. Better Selection and good quality at good price. I would do all my shopping here but there are some items that I just really like from fresh and easy that is closer to my house.

Excellent fish! Three if us had Ono sandwich, fish tacos and fish and chips. Small venue with walk-up ordering. Everything is surf boards with a definite Hawaiian feel! The staff are helpful and good wonderful!

Wife wanted to go to Macayo for their baja burrito, so we went.
    I had the poblano chile stuffed with chicken , cheese and covered in baja sauce.  It is deep fried in a crispy breading and it was very good. Almost like a chile relleno , but crispier and IMO better
      . My wife's favorite is chile relleno and by the way she was eying my food , I know she was kicking herself for not taking my suggestion again and ordering this dish, but I gave her a taste anyway , just to tease her. Lol 
     We also had the green tamale bites as an appetizer ,  it came with Baja sauce.           The tamale bites are sweet masa balls that are deep fried and are addicting.. Service was fine.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the food ,We will be back

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been thoroughly satisfactory, primarily due to the authenticity and affordability of the Hawaiian cuisine offered. The proprietors of this eatery are individuals of great warmth and hospitality, who have successfully created a welcoming ambiance that complements their delectable dishes. Although the interior design of the restaurant may not conform to the conventional standards of high-end dining establishments, it is evident that the emphasis is placed on providing an unpretentious and casual setting for patrons to savor their meals without breaking the bank. In essence, this venue serves as a haven for those seeking a satisfying and economical gastronomic experience, with the added bonus of a speedy Chicken Katsu option for those with limited time to spare."

"Ah, yes, the quintessential Safeway! My affinity for this establishment knows no bounds, as I have had the pleasure of frequenting this particular location, as well as others such as FnE or the Safeway on McDowell. However, I invariably find myself returning to the Osborn locales, as they offer an unparalleled shopping experience that rivals even the most comprehensive retailers. With a vast array of services and products available, including those of the US Bank and pharmacy variety, it truly embodies the definition of 'one-stop shopping.' Unfortunately, there is a minor drawback, as the lack of adequate staffing during late hours can result in an interminable wait at checkout. Nonetheless, the quality of their produce remains unsurpassed, and I am consistently delighted by the availability of certain specialty items that are perpetually in stock."

When we arrived at the restaurant, we were informed by the hostess that it would be a brief interval before our table was prepared, and we could pass the time at the bar. This posed no problem for us, as my spouse and I proceeded to order beverages while awaiting our table. Once our table was ready, the hostess notified us and escorted us to our designated seating area. However, she failed to offer to transport our drinks to our table, which struck me as somewhat discourteous, considering that carrying a martini glass while wearing heels and lugging a purse and jacket simultaneously can be quite cumbersome. Nonetheless, this minor inconvenience did not mar the overall quality of our dining experience, as the culinary offerings and service subsequent to this initial hiccup were truly commendable. Indeed, the eatery's policy of permitting entrÃ©e sharing was a significant boon, as we were able to sample both the delectable lobster bisque and the succulent rib eye, with the latter being cooked to perfection, achieving a delightful medium rareness. Furthermore, the risotto served as a tasty accompaniment to our meal. The quantity of food was also well-suited to our appetites, leaving us satisfied yet not uncomfortably full. Our server and the supporting staff members displayed exceptional proficiency throughout the evening, with our server even expediting our meal preparation at our request, owing to our plans to attend a performance later that evening. His considerate gesture was greatly appreciated.

The Mattress Factory has several buildings of contemporary art, which you can probably spend about an hour and a half here.  

There are lots of weird and entertaining pieces--strange sounds coming from the front facade of an apartment building, a huge gigantic concrete column, etc.  Shiota's Trace of Memory is an interesting piece--black yarn strewn about like webs throughout an apartment.  James Turrell's pieces are strange--light on a different canvases.   

Admission is $15, but we used a Buy One, get One Free Admission from visitpittsburgh.com.  (valid until 12/31/13)

If you ever find yourself down at Newhaven (perhaps not all that likely unless you live there) take the time to pay a visit to Porto and Fi. This wonderful little deli and cafe is the perfect place to have a bite to eat and a cup of tea. When I worked along the road in Granton, my workmate and I used to treat ourselves to lunch here occasionally - 'treat' being the operative word. 

The food here is excellent, they try to locally source as many ingredients as possible and this hard work pays off, even a simple sandwich is delicious. I am a big fan of their cakes and this was the first place to introduce me to the delights of chocolate beetroot cake, I know it sounds like a pretty eccentric combination, but the main ingredients really compliment each other: the chocolate is rich and sweet and the beetroot keeps the sponge moist. 

It can get pretty busy, the Newhaven locals have really bought into this place, so it can mean a bit of a wait for a table, do wait though - it's worth it.

"A culinary gem, discovered off the well-trodden path of Mill Street, offered an unparalleled gastronomic experience, with ingredients that were meticulously selected to ensure an uncompromising freshness, resulting in a delectable Pad Thai, accompanied by a flavorsome beef salad and crispy spring rolls, all of which were served at an optimal temperature, thus eliciting an unwavering satisfaction from our taste buds; regrettably, we were unable to partake in an alcoholic beverage, but such an indulgence would have undoubtedly complemented the meal's already impressive quality."

We embarked upon a journey via light rail, destined for a Diamondbacks match, and opted to arrive early to partake in Sunday brunch at an quaint eatery situated approximately a mile north of the ballpark. Upon entering the establishment, we were warmly received by extremely hospitable servers and were immediately captivated by the ambiance and layout. Unfortunately, the dining area was fully occupied, compelling us to take refuge on the outdoor patio. We placed our order at the counter and awaited the arrival of our beverages, which materialized within a few brief moments. I indulged in the Melon Mojito, a refreshing and delectable concoction, and my companion savored a pulled pork sandwich, equally as satisfying. The quality of the service, the culinary offerings, and the charming surroundings collectively contributed to a highly enjoyable experience. Consequently, I would unhesitatingly endorse this venue for either brunch or lunch.

**Free Wifi** wins my heart every time. There aren't many charging stations but there are plenty of rocking chairs. I've been here a few times and I always enjoy my short layover here. There are a lot of Starbucks scattered throughout so have no fear, plenty of java here.

Ask for waiter tommy he is awesome!! Gigi is always friendly!!! Such a good variety of menu options!! I would like to see their happy hour selections have more variety and more items. The Lotus Roll is the best in town.

"Commendable happy hours, exceptional service contingent upon the serendipitous encounter with the erudite and affable Aaron, and a coveted spot to be recommended. Kudos on perpetuating a successful enterprise for an extended duration."

Boy, we had fun here.  Food was slow coming, but obviously was made to order.  Best lentils I've ever had.  Plantains were amazing.  Beef was a bit dry, but very flavorful.  Eclectic menu, and I look forward to trying more items.  The owner? gentleman, server was very friendly and helpful.  Great choice for lunch or dinner.

"Exquisite carne asada chimichanga, combination number twenty, boasting a delightful crispiness and an abundance of flavor. Accompanied by an ample serving of guacamole, the culinary experience was further enhanced by the jovial demeanor of the staff, whose laughter and melodic renderings in the rear of the establishment contributed to a warm and welcoming ambiance; thus, ensuring my return."

I have stayed at the South Point several times while staying in Vegas. It is a bit off of the Strip (which means less traffic), but it is all inclusive, so unless you are actually looking for the Strip, you don't need to go anywhere. 

They've got bowling, bingo, movie theater, (obviously a Casino), several great restaurants, and the list goes on.  I saw a betting place too, but that's not my thing.

One of my personal favorites is the daily Texas Hold Em tournament.  I have won it a few times, and it's a decent priced buy in ($55?)

It is one of the newer properties as well so it is still kind of clean.

On one of our visits, they were doing some maintenance and we didn't get the memo that there would be a power outage in the middle of the night.  If I didn't wear a CPAP (sleep apnea device) I wouldn't have even noticed.

The rooms are very affordable and if you get on their email list and join their players club, you will be invited back at even lower rates (and you don't have to be a big spender to get the discounts).

For a reasonable priced Vegas hotel, it is at the top of my list.

I have been traversing the expanse of this vast nation for a considerable duration of time, specifically three years, migrating from the bustling metropolis of Seattle to the tropical paradise of Hawaii, thence to the frigid tundra of Michigan, only to return to my point of origin in Seattle once again. In my peregrinations, I have sought out that singular location which exudes an air of uniqueness, without succumbing to the pedestrian and mundane ambiance that permeates so many establishments, while still proffering an exceptional cup of coffee complemented by extraordinary service. Hitherto, my explorations have yielded the following results: in Maui, the Honolulu Coffee Company has proven to be a veritable oasis of excellence; in Ann Arbor, The Common Cup has demonstrated a commitment to quality and distinction; in Ypsilanti, The Ugly Mug has exhibited a laudable dedication to artisanal craftsmanship; in Bellingham, Washington, The Black Drop, Lettered Streets, Firehouse, and Tony's Coffee have all contributed to the region's reputation for gastronomical excellence; and in Seattle, Vivace Espresso has consistently delivered an unparalleled coffee experience. And now, in the fiery crucible of Phoenix, I have had the pleasure of discovering Lux Coffee Bar, a truly remarkable establishment that has managed to strike the elusive balance between urban sophistication and effortless charm. 
Upon entering the coffee bar, one cannot help but be enveloped by the sleek, modern ambiance that pervades the space, an atmosphere that is at once welcoming and unpretentious. The staff, possessed of an unwavering dedication to their craft, provide service that is both attentive and unobtrusive, expertly guiding patrons through the diverse array of offerings available. The baked goods and deli items, fashioned with care and attention to detail, are nothing short of delectable, their flavors and textures melding together in a symphony of culinary delight. But it is, of course, the coffee itself that serves as the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, the meticulously hand-roasted beans transformed into a rich, velvety elixir that is the apotheosis of the barista's art. 
While I am cognizant of the fact that Lux Coffee Bar hardly requires yet another encomium added to its already burgeoning litany of accolades, I feel compelled to express my heartfelt admiration for this paragon of coffee excellence. The fusion of an unassuming yet stylish atmosphere, superior service, and, of course, the sublime coffee itself, has resulted in a veritable coffee Mecca that is well worth a pilgrimage from even the most distant reaches of the continent. In brief, Lux Coffee Bar has, in my estimation, achieved the Platonic ideal of coffee culture, a true Apex of gastronomic refinement.

I was brought here by some friends and co workers. I haven't ever been here and I must say it was perfect. This place was very friendly and very delicious. The shanty was my favorite drink. I highly recommend the chicken mole.

"Graziano's Pizzeria offers the most scrumptious and delectable pizza in Pittsburgh, unequivocally surpassing its competitors in terms of gastronomical excellence. With a rating of six stars for the pizza alone, this cozy eatery boasts an impressive menu that includes a variety of mouthwatering toppings and flavorful sauces. Although the beer selection may be limited, the quality of the brews available earns a respectable four-star rating. However, the prices may deter some patrons, as they are slightly higher than average, resulting in a rating of two stars in this category. Nonetheless, the exceptional service provided by the friendly and attentive staff, led by the charismatic owner, warrants a perfect five-star rating. Despite some minor shortcomings, such as the mediocrity of the single slices, Graziano's consistently delivers an unparalleled dining experience that justifies its reputation as the premier pizzeria in Pittsburgh. For the ultimate culinary indulgence, opt for either the large plain or extra cheese pizza, both of which showcase the establishment's commitment to culinary mastery."

My significant other resides merely a short distance away from this culinary establishment, and we frequent this restaurant at an average of three to five times per month, owing to the exceptional quality of the fare and the attentive nature of the service, which is reminiscent of Zipps, another esteemed eatery, and Goldie's, the originator of this gastronomic concept; thus, it is unlikely that one would experience any dissatisfaction upon dining here.

"This eatery holds a particularly significant place in my heart, as it was where my future spouse popped the question during our five-year anniversary celebration in Las Vegas. The ambiance was nothing short of enchanting, with a window seat that afforded us a breathtaking view of the Bellagio water display and the picturesque sunset. Our culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional, with the sauteed pork chops and filet mignon being cooked to perfection, retaining their tenderness and juiciness. Furthermore, the beverages we sampled, specifically the mojito and berry champagne, were equally impressive. It's worth mentioning that the attentive service we received from our waitstaff was instrumental in creating an atmosphere conducive to such a memorable occasion. In fact, our server went above and beyond by assisting in setting up the proposal, leaving me in a state of emotional bliss even before the delectable dessert course arrived. As if fate had other plans, a kind stranger from a neighboring table took notice of my tearful state and chose to bestow upon us two complimentary glasses of champagne. Needless to say, this establishment has secured a permanent place in my affections and I would unhesitatingly return on each subsequent visit to Las Vegas."

A superlative local coffee, beer, and wine cafe, owned and operated by Catholic Charities, whereby patronizing this enterprise supports and empowers local refugee programs, featuring local art, jewelry, and handicrafts created by refugees, which are also available for purchase.

The ambiance is welcoming and comfortable, boasting an inviting atmosphere. The coffee and teas are of exceptional quality, meticulously roasted and crafted locally in Phoenix. The culinary offerings are prepared with fresh, locally sourced ingredients, showcasing a delectable array of flavors. I highly recommend the mouthwatering pulled pork sandwich and the tantalizing tuna sandwich, accompanied by the scrumptious fresh salsa and chips or a freshly prepared salad, all of which serve as palatable side options. In fact, every item on the menu has proven to be a gastronomical delight!

Furthermore, this esteemed establishment features a spacious and secluded private meeting room situated at the rear of the premises, hosting a local "Promote Your Talent Showcase" on the second and fourth Tuesdays of each month, providing a unique opportunity for various gifted local musicians and vocalists to display their talents in an intimate setting.

Thus, I strongly suggest that you pay a visit to this remarkable new venture, committed to supporting and enriching the local community, and indulge in the plethora of delights it has to offer.

"My initial encounter with Select Auto was indeed a memorable one, and I can confidently assert that I will unquestionably return in the future. The staff members were incredibly cordial, attentive, and displayed exceptional customer service skills. My vehicle required repair due to an insurance-covered collision, and I must say that the duration of the process was significantly shorter than anticipated. In fact, Select Auto accomplished the task in merely a week, whereas the previous establishment required nearly five weeks to complete the job. Moreover, they proactively kept me informed regarding the progress of the repairs, even going to the extent of contacting my insurance provider to arrange for an extension of my rental agreement. Their exceptional customer service continued even after the completion of the repairs, as they graciously offered to transport me to the rental car agency and retrieved the rental vehicle on my behalf. It's worth mentioning that I was pleasantly taken aback by the ambiance of their office environment. The space was spotless, contemporary, and possessed an undeniable upscale, hipster vibe reminiscent of central Phoenix. Overall, I had a truly satisfactory experience, and I would unhesitatingly recommend Select Auto to anyone seeking top-notch auto body repair services."

"The expansive arena boasts an impressive seating capacity of approximately 5,000 to 7,000 spectators, augmented by various lounge and culinary areas that exude elegance and sophistication. Renowned for hosting spectacular concerts featuring celebrated Christian artists, the venue also showcases exceptional sporting events and a fervent fan base, particularly in the realm of Monsoon and Havoc sections, whose unwavering dedication and enthusiasm are palpable."

"This establishment serves as my preferred venue for obtaining exceptional East Coast pizza, and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their culinary offerings on multiple occasions, both dining in and ordering for pickup. The quality of their pies has been consistently superior, leaving me thoroughly satisfied and convinced that those familiar with genuinely excellent pizza will not experience any disappointment."

"This eatery's proximity to my workplace has rendered it a convenient culinary haven for my colleague and me, as we have indulged in their delectable offerings via both dine-in and delivery methods a total of five times within the past fortnight. Our initial discovery of this gastronomic gem was indeed a serendipitous occurrence. The quality and flavor of their reasonably-priced fare are complemented by the exceptional level of customer service proffered by the staff. Furthermore, they offer a frequent diner card, which serves as an added incentive for patronage. The sweet potato fries and tots are particularly scrumptious, while the blackened mahi mahi is also worthy of recommendation. However, it is the signature sliders that have captured my palate's affection, as they have proven to be my unequivocal favorite. It is worth mentioning that every item I have sampled from their menu has met, if not exceeded, my expectations. Consequently, this establishment has become my preferred destination for a hastle-free, satisfying midday repast."

My better half and I opted to endeavor to ascend Camelback Mountain, and we successfully accomplished our mission. The trail presents a formidable challenge, characterized by numerous precipitous inclines that necessitate a considerable amount of physical exertion. Despite the arduous nature of the hike, I managed to complete it wearing Nike running shoes, which I must emphasize, I do not recommend, solely due to the fact that the terrain can become somewhat slippery during the descent. To avoid any potential hazards, it is advisable to arrive at the scene early, as the park only becomes accessible at sunrise. In fact, my wife and I arrived at 5:30 a.m., and the park opened 15 minutes later, with several other vehicles awaiting entry behind us. Bear in mind that commencing the hike subsequent to 8 p.m. may lead to an uncomfortably warm experience, considering the sun's intense rays. Our excursion began around 6 a.m., and we reached the summit approximately by 7:30 a.m., subsequently concluding the descent by 9 a.m. The hike entails a significant amount of elevation gain and loss, rendering it a moderately strenuous undertaking. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

"Culinary indulgences are indeed sublime at this establishment, and the hospitable demeanor of the staff further enhances the dining experience. However, it is worth mentioning that an abbreviation of the waiting period would be a welcome alteration, albeit the reason for the delay is attributable to the widespread popularity of the eatery. Personal preferences in terms of gastronomic selections include the BC Sandwich and the Bird omelette, while my spouse vehemently advocates for the Eggs Benedict. This venue holds the distinction of being our preferred destination for leisurely Sunday repasts."

Went there for breakfast. Was a welcome relief after driving thru Cave Creek and no other breakfast places to eat. Great friendly service and great food. Like the portions and left there feeling good. Well priced. I will be back.

"Upon perusing a review that drew a parallel between Gadzooks and Chipotle, I couldn't help but notice the similarity in their operational processes, particularly when it came to assembling my meal. The limited menu options, consisting primarily of enchiladas, tacos, and tortilla soup, were augmented by an extensive array of fillings, resulting in a veritable explosion of customization possibilities. My dining experience was further enhanced by the delectable green chili pork enchilada and bison enchilada, with the latter being the most flavorful bison I've had the pleasure of consuming. The house-smashed guacamole was also a notable highlight. Despite my attempt to avoid the midday rush by arriving at 11:30, the establishment was already bustling with activity, and I managed to secure the final parking spot and penultimate interior table. Fortunately, the tables turned over rapidly, and the queue moved efficiently, leaving me with a positive impression that will surely prompt my return, accompanied by friends."

My wife and I were relocating from San Fransisco, and was in need to find the highest quality real estate group in the Scottsdale area due to a very short timeline to relocate.  After viewing some other great reviews and researching The Hill Group's website, I knew that I found the right people to help us with our first home purchase.  I am so impressed with everyone that I was in contact within THE HILL GROUP specifically STEVEN JAMES (480) 980-7656. The professionalism and drive that Steven had to find us a house that we loved was fantastic. He may not have known this (maybe he just didn't show it), but we are very hard to please. His main goal was to find us a house that we were in love with, and we did just that. Steven I am so thankful that we picked you to help us with this step in our lives. Steven, I wish you the best of luck with everything that you do with your career. Thank you so much!

"Based on my perusal of previous patrons' opinions, I surmise that my visit may have coincided with an unusually favorable day for the establishment.  The coffee was of superior quality, the service was expeditious, the chili demonstrated an optimal balance of flavors, and the ambiance, while sophisticated, refrained from projecting an air of haughtiness.  As a former denizen of New York, I have had the privilege of sampling a diverse array of crepes, and I must say that the Caprese I ordered was skillfully prepared and possessed a satisfying taste, and I derived pleasure from the fact that this unpretentious yet moderately upscale eatery offered a welcoming atmosphere, devoid of excessive noise or exorbitant prices, thereby making it an ideal venue for entertaining clients when in town."

"The quality of care provided by the healthcare professionals in Area A 3 is truly exceptional. The entire team, ranging from the meticulous cleaning staff to the attentive nurses, friendly aides, accommodating room service personnel, and even the nocturnal medical practitioners, demonstrated unwavering dedication, compassion, and expertise in their respective roles. Their collective commitment to patient satisfaction was palpable through their consistent display of warmth, kindness, and gentle demeanor, ensuring that each individual felt cared for with the utmost attention and respect."

Pros:
- Open 24 hours.
- Cheaper than other foods at Vegas.
- Open 24 hours.
- Delicious

Cons:
- Lines can be long (because they are open 24 hours) but they move fairly quickly.

I would say this is a MUST VISIT for all Vegas go-ers. It is the perfect remedy for hunger, drunken munchies, or Vegas on a budget.

Working with Eric and his crew was such a pleasure.  We love, love, love our yard now. Eric came up with a great design and the follow thru was perfect.  The one small problem of  one of the lights not working was addressed right away.  Couldn't be more pleased and would highly recommend this company.
Got an awesome grand opening deal on tires here! Big Rob is the man and delivered AWESOME customer service. Free water and Starbucks coffee. This place is great!

"Each and every laudable aspect enumerated within this written composition is utterly accurate and thoroughly impressive. Utterly remarkable, indeed! 

The sole additional insight I can proffer is that the avocado-based green salsa is an unparalleled culinary masterpiece. Sampled in Austin, Texas, this delectable condiment was either referred to as 'green salsa' or 'Salsa Dona.' While its fiery zest may prove daunting to some palates, its unrivaled flavor profile renders it an unmitigated delight. Immediate attendance at this establishment is not only advisable but also highly encouraged, and repetitive visits are virtually assured. 

The sole drawback, alas, lies in the regrettably limited capacity of the venue, rendering it incapable of accommodating the immense throng of eager patrons."

Medusa is a preeminent local hairdressing chain boasting three salons within close proximity to Edinburgh's city center, including one situated in Musselburgh. In addition to their primary focus on hairdressing, these salons also offer an array of beauty services and nail treatments for clients to indulge in.

Upon visiting the Teviot salon, I was immediately struck by its lively ambiance, akin to a bustling hive of activity. During my Thursday evening visit, each of the seven hairdressing stations were occupied by clients, indicative of its immense popularity among patrons. Despite this, I was able to secure an appointment with relative ease, a considerable thumbs up in my book.

The stylist who tended to me provided a meticulous consultation, giving me the impression that she was truly attentive to my preferences regarding cut and style. Her warm and convivial demeanor promptly put me at ease. Shortly after being shampooed and seated before the mirror, I was graciously offered a choice between tea or coffee, earning yet another thumbs up from me, as the coffee was authentic and accompanied by a complimentary biscuit.

Upon leaving the salon, I felt truly satisfied; I had been attended to exceptionally well and received a remarkable haircut. In conclusion, I find it challenging to identify any flaws in this establishment, as it successfully strikes a balance between modernity, trendiness, friendliness, and professionalism.

"I recently had the pleasure of visiting this establishment during my leisurely sojourn, and I must say that it ranks among the most exceptional culinary experiences I have had the privilege of indulging in. As an individual who has had the opportunity to partake in numerous buffets, I can confidently attest that this particular venue exudes an air of refinement and sophistication that sets it apart from its peers. The staff members are courteous, friendly, and professional in their demeanor, creating a welcoming ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience. Furthermore, the cuisine served at this esteemed buffet is truly remarkable, with each dish being meticulously prepared and presented in a manner reminiscent of the finest upscale restaurants. I must confess that I have yet to encounter any aspect of the buffet that did not meet or exceed my expectations, and I eagerly anticipate the opportunity to return and indulge in its gastronomic delights once again."

The nuptial festivities of our progeny in September necessitated the procurement of a confectionary masterpiece, which we accomplished through the assistance of an individual named William, whose customer service acumen and culinary expertise were indeed impressive. The gastronomical delight in question was so delectable and visually stunning that we opted to commission a second such edible work of art for the half-century milestone of my spouse's natal day, at which gathering the aforementioned sweet treat once more garnered unanimous praise, its intricate composition of rich, velvety vanilla sponge cake complemented by a luscious raspberry mousse filling.

"Welcome to the Cathedral of Meat, a veritable shrine dedicated to the adoration of carnivorous indulgence. It is here that animals are ritually sacrificed to satiate my unwavering craving for succulent flesh. As I enter this hallowed hall, I cannot help but feel a profound sense of gratitude and carnal delight, knowing that I am about to partake in a culinary experience that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime. And, oh, the salad bar? A veritable cornucopia of fresh, crisp delights that tantalize the taste buds and leave one yearning for more. But let us not digress; the true piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance lies in the delectable offerings of meat. \n\nAh, yes, the meat! Smokingly tender and marinated to perfection, each juicy morsel is a flavor bomb that explodes on the palate, leaving an indelible mark on the senses. As a connoisseur of fine steaks, I have always been enamored with the charred, salty exterior and the pink, medium-rare interior. Alas, that first bite is often the best, as the steak tends to lose its warmth and flavor upon being plated. Fear not, dear reader, for Texas de Brazil has solved this dilemma with their scorching hot, top-sirloin servings. Each bite is a revelation, a symphony of textures and tastes that leaves one in a state of gastronomic nirvana. The other cuts of meat are certainly worthy of mention, but the top sirloin is truly the showstopper. My only lament is that I possess but a single stomach, leaving me wistfully yearning for more...".

Both of our progeny acquired our aged iPhone 4 devices, and it became apparent that the batteries were no longer capable of retaining a sufficient charge, prompting us to seek out a replacement. Fortunately, we discovered a service that accomplished this task with remarkable efficiency, completing the procedure in a mere five minutes at a cost significantly lower than what Apple demands for a comparable battery replacement. The experience was further enhanced by the technician's rapid, amicable, and reasonably priced assistance, leading us to wholeheartedly endorse their expertise and express our willingness to utilize their services once more in the future.

Answer: The text is: "I had a couple of elective surgeries completed by Transformations (Dr. Siebert)."
The modified text is: "I underwent a series of voluntary surgical procedures at Transformations, under the expert care of Dr. Siebert, and I must say that the entire team displayed unparalleled proficiency and dedication throughout the process, accommodating my geographical constraints as a resident of NYC while traveling to Wisconsin for the surgical interventions, which, incidentally, were approximately one-third the cost of those in NYC, ultimately resulting in an unprecedented level of satisfaction with the outcomes, compelling me to wholeheartedly endorse this state-of-the-art facility to any individual seeking exceptional healthcare services."

"An exceptional dining establishment affiliated with a higher education institution.  Opted to partake of an alfresco repast on State Street, thereby capitalizing on the ambiance and delectable comestibles.  Prior to this experience, had not indulged in cuisine of African provenance, but am now motivated to sample such fare again in the future, should the opportunity arise.  Strongly recommend giving this eatery a try."

"Heinz Field, the pinnacle of venues in professional football, boasts unparalleled sightlines to the field, complemented by an array of historical artifacts showcased within the iconic Great Hall. The stadium's unique features are further enhanced by the presence of all six Super Bowl trophies, displayed alongside a set of artificial dentures belonging to legendary Hall of Famer Jack Lambert. Additionally, the culinary delights of Primanti Bros are available for fans to indulge in, making it the ultimate destination for enthusiasts of both football and gastronomy. It is imperative that one experiences the unrivaled atmosphere of Heinz Field, particularly during a Steelers game, to truly appreciate the splendor of this revered sporting institution."

"An effervescent beverage of Kool-Aid, preferably served at an extremely low temperature, accompanied by delectable, golden-hued waffles and perfectly cooked chicken, constitutes a culinary experience so exceptional that it transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime. Such a dining establishment, offering a veritable cornucopia of gastronomic delights, elevates the act of consumption to an art form, rendering it an indispensable component of a fulfilling existence. The mere anticipation of partaking in such a feast imbues my being with an unbridled sense of joy, impelling me to eagerly await the opportunity to indulge in its splendor once again."

I recently celebrated my twenty-first birthday at this lavish hotel, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. The hotel's proximity to the city's most popular clubs was incredibly convenient, particularly for those commemorating their transition into adulthood. The Venetian, being the home to the renowned nightclub TAO, offered an extraordinary nightlife experience with its vast selection of dance music and spacious dance floor. Additionally, its neighboring hotel, Palazzo, boasts another esteemed club, Lavo, providing an alternative option for those seeking a diverse array of musical styles.  
The accommodations were impressive, with our room comfortably accommodating six to eight individuals. It featured two queen-sized beds and a pull-out sofa bed, ensuring a restful slumber for all occupants. The double-door bathroom was expansive, allowing multiple individuals to prepare simultaneously, while the abundance of mirrors within the hotel room facilitated effortless grooming for our group of six females.  
In conclusion, the Venetian is an optimal choice for those seeking a multifaceted experience, encompassing clubbing, dining, and shopping. Although I cannot comment on the gambling aspect, as my brief encounter with the slot machines resulted in a rapid depletion of my complimentary play credits, I can confidently recommend this establishment based on its overall quality. Notably, the unexpected rain of money in TAO as we were departing contributed to my decision to award the Venetian five stars instead of four and a half.

We arrived at this establishment mere moments prior to its closure, and I harbored trepidation regarding the quality of the culinary offerings at such a late hour... HOWEVER, my concerns were utterly unfounded! The salad was remarkably crisp and refreshing, with an unmistakable tang of chill that permeated each bite; furthermore, the garlic knots proved to be nothing short of a gastronomic revelation, prompting me to request an additional order with unbridled enthusiasm!! As for the pizza, it was truly exceptional, boasting a flavor profile that was both rich and nuanced. Suffice it to say, we shall exclusively patronize this venue for our future pizza cravings!

"Every second hotel we contacted was fully booked from the previous evening (at 6:00 AM), necessitating a prompt and effective solution to our accommodation needs; specifically, securing a room prior to noon, which surpassed the 3 pm check-in time offered by alternative establishments. Furthermore, the hotel staff graciously allowed us to partake in their complimentary continental breakfast and leisurely utilize their pool facilities until our room became available. Notably, the hotel's expedient and amicable service was diametrically opposed to the unhelpful and unaccommodating attitude displayed by every single hotel located on the Las Vegas Strip. Additionally, the hotel boasted a convenient shuttle service, operating until 10:30 PM, which facilitated transportation to and from the strip, while the proximity of the hotel to the Hard Rock Cafe ( merely a short walk away) further enhanced its appeal. The hotel's spotless rooms featured impressive pullout couches, contributing to a relaxing atmosphere. Moreover, the hotel's rates were eminently reasonable, making it an ideal choice for travelers seeking a tranquil retreat, coupled with excellent service and a prime location, albeit removed from the frenetic energy of the strip."
You can only understand if you have been there.  The best Asian food ever.  The service makes you feel like you are a MILLION DOLLAR PLAYER.  The ambiance, the view, and the people are amazing!!!!!!

"My predilection for Buffalo Wild Wings was unwavering until my significant other acquainted me with the culinary delights of Wing Stop, whereupon I discovered that their limited array of wing flavors was more than compensated for by the exceptional quality of their poultry products; in point of fact, subsequent attempts to indulge in the offerings of Buffalo Wild Wings have yielded an inferior experience in comparison to the gustatory satisfaction I derive from partaking of Wing Stop's delectable wings."

For individuals who do not possess an abundance of financial resources, it is only natural to feel a sense of trepidation when considering the possibility of dining at establishments that cater to a more affluent clientele, such as Whole Foods Market. As I sat in my modest workspace, pondering the various options available to me for obtaining sustenance during the midday hours, I found myself persistently dismissing the notion of visiting the aforementioned upscale grocery store, despite its proximity to my place of employment. However, upon being apprised of the numerous advantageous offers on healthful comestibles that my significant other had discovered during her own luncheon excursions to Whole Foods, my curiosity began to piqued, gradually evolving into an unwavering determination to investigate the veracity of these claims.  
Upon entering the premises, I became immediately cognizant of the vast array of culinary options available, including a barbecue smokehouse station offering daily specials at a reasonable cost, a burrito bar reminiscent of Chipotle, a bar serving alcoholic beverages during happy hour, a brick oven pizzeria, a salad bar featuring a discounted price per pound on Wednesdays, an Asian cuisine kitchen, and an assortment of pre-prepared dishes that easily surpassed the quality of any fare that my mother might have attempted to prepare. Although I have yet to engage in extensive grocery shopping at Whole Foods due to the higher prices, I would unhesitatingly recommend this establishment to any individual seeking a healthy, satisfying dining experience. Furthermore, the spectacle of people-watching at the Scottsdale location is truly remarkable, akin to a vibrant tapestry of varied stereotypes and beyond.

The hype is well deserved, you guys. Nicest curb in town, I say. Wifey and I parked there last week. I had the street side. She had the curb side (as usual lol). She loved it! Hey, don't mess with a good thing, I guess. You like what you like, amirighr?\nAnywho, Aaron's was just a darn HOOT. I give it TWO kitten's whiskers up.

"It is precisely what one would anticipate from an antiquated Mexican eatery. Indeed, the ambiance is somewhat claustrophobic and evokes a bygone era. Nonetheless, the culinary offerings are undoubtedly superior for Caucasian individuals residing in Phoenix. The fiery condiment accompanying the dishes is utterly sublime. The complimentary tortilla chips are fresh and plentiful, thereby ensuring an unparalleled dining experience. A particular highlight is the Gringo Fundito, which caters specifically to those who do not identify with the Hispanic community. In light of its popularity, it is advisable to forgo deliberation and expeditiously proceed to secure a table, as the venue has a tendency to become congested in a relatively brief period."

"It is my utmost conviction that this establishment serves as the paragon of excellence in the culinary realm of sushi, with their Kanji roll being an unparalleled masterpiece. Yung, the executive chef, is undoubtedly the most proficient and talented sushi artisan in Las Vegas, with no contestation or analogous rivalry. Ji, the proprietor, is remarkably attentive and actively engaged in ensuring a supreme client experience for each patron, including myself and my associates. The entire Kanji clan has consistently displayed an unwavering commitment to hospitality, warmth, and generosity towards us, thereby creating an atmosphere of unsurpassed quality and distinction. Their gastronomical offerings, coupled with exceptional service, are truly second to none, and I extend my sincerest gratitude to the Kanji family for their relentless pursuit of perfection."

"It is my sincere conviction that those who post unfavorable reviews for this establishment are primarily motivated by their own frustration stemming from their inability to afford the necessary repairs for their aging vehicles, rather than any genuine dissatisfaction with the quality of service provided by the business. The staff members, ranging from the front desk personnel (with whom I have had the pleasure of interacting, specifically Ramon) to the skilled technicians, have consistently displayed a high level of professionalism and courtesy towards me. Of note, I have previously owned a BMW M6, which was regularly serviced by German Motors, and I have been consistently impressed by their competitive pricing and efficient turnaround time; on one occasion, they even went above and beyond by inspecting my vehicle's brakes (a task that would have otherwise required an extensive and costly repair estimate) at no additional charge to me, and I felt compelled to express my gratitude by treating the team to lunch (a modest gesture of appreciation totaling $50). Most recently, I brought my 1967 Mustang in for a routine brake bleeding and air conditioning recharge (a process requiring several hours of labor), and my final bill amounted to a mere $330, inclusive of taxes. Frankly, it is challenging to find better value for money elsewhere. Furthermore, the staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional customer service by providing complimentary transportation to and from my residence (a generous offer that warrants a gratuity of $5-$10, in my opinion) whenever I am without my vehicle. In conclusion, I wholeheartedly endorse this business and its exceptional team, earning an A+++ rating in my assessment."

I got a chance to take a sneak peak into The Lady Silvia during a globe salon event.  All I can say is that we need more places like this in Las Vegas! \n\nIt is located on the bottom floor of the Soho Lofts downtown.  There is an unmarked door that leads you thru a small dark hallway.  There is another door that leads you to the bar.  It is beautiful inside, with checkered floors that are flanked by tall bookshelves full of books.  It is dark inside, there is a DJ booth and graffiti on the ceiling.  It is unpretentious and tucked away- so refreshing to have in Las Vegas.  Once this opens up, I will be here frequently.

"Love this place! Their taro with boba snoh is my absolute favorite, and you cannot go wrong with any of the delectable glazes. However, some of the snohs can be excessively sweet, so it's crucial to pair them with less sugary toppings unless you possess an intense sweet tooth. I've only had the pleasure of indulging in their boba once, but it was truly exceptional. On a recent visit, I accompanied a large group of acquaintances who were unfamiliar with the diverse flavors offered, and they opted for safer options such as fruit snoh adorned with chocolate toppings. Nevertheless, they too thoroughly enjoyed the experience. \n\nThe staff members at this establishment are consistently cordial and accommodating, and they often provide samples when time permits. The ambiance is enhanced by the eclectic indie music played in the background, complemented by the visually striking artwork displayed on the walls, creating a trendy and intellectual atmosphere. Additionally, patrons can enjoy games like Jenga, making it an ideal setting to relax and savor a scrumptious treat or beverage."

"Upon venturing into this eatery for the inaugural time, my companion and I were instantaneously greeted with a warm reception by Marty, who presented us with an exquisite midday repast that not only satiated our palates but also elevated our spirits, further enhancing the already charming ambiance of this cozy establishment; the culinary offerings, particularly the meatballs, were truly exceptional."

We have been residents of the Southwest Valley for an extensive period of thirteen years, during which we have been in pursuit of a reliable, fair-minded mechanic for an equally prolonged duration. Our quest has finally culminated in the discovery of Phil, an individual possessing exceptional interpersonal skills, vast technical knowledge, and a proficient approach to managing his enterprise. Prior to our recent visit, our vehicle's braking system was plagued by a persistent "brake and shake" phenomenon that posed a significant safety risk, particularly for our adolescent offspring who frequently operated the automobile. Fortunately, Phil and his team demonstrated remarkable efficiency in addressing the issue, completing the task within the agreed timeframe and budgetary constraints. We derive immense satisfaction from collaborating with a family-owned establishment, such as Phil's, that embodies the values of personalized service and dedication to customer satisfaction.

Great little shop! Very clean and they do an awesome job! The staff is very friendly and they make sure you are satisfied. I got lucky and they weren't busy when I came in, but since it's small - I'd recommend calling for an appointment first! I found this little gem on Yelp as I was driving through, very glad I stopped.

Love this place. I was craving some ramen and decided to yelp a place. I am so glad I did. Not only was the broth yummy, the prices were reasonable.

I got the miso ramen. Full of flavor and they have lots of noodles.

My hubby got the pork belly bowl. He really enjoyed it. The pork flavor was spot on.

We got an order of fried rice, that was ok. 

Overall good food, good service. The place is small, but I can look past it because it was so good!

"A delectable breakfast experience, characterized by copious servings and a hospitable culinary expert (Nikki), ensues, during which patrons engage in convivial interactions while savoring the satisfying fare, which is reminiscent of a home-cooked meal, both in terms of its flavorful quality and its piquant temperature; furthermore, the quaint and intimate atmosphere of the establishment fosters a sense of camaraderie among guests, such that they readily share various condiments and utensils, thereby creating an atmosphere of communal dining."

Took the opportunity to have a donut this morning.  My DH and I stopped by and not big donut consumers we were impressed with the fresh tasty's donuts.  They are amazing warm.  We had a Bavarian Cream, Snickers, chocolate and raspberry filled.  They were all really good.  The staff was friendly and inviting.  Would recommend if you are looking for a sweet fix.

"Fast, professional, courteous (nice!), fair prices, super fast service. 

We required expedited business cards that exuded a sense of quality and sophistication, rather than appearing amateurish or homemade. Our initial attempt at utilizing the services of Fedex at Mandalay Bay proved unsuccessful due to their usage of subpar paper stock, which failed to meet our expectations. 

Undeterred, we pursued alternative options and selected Franklin for their reputation for delivering high-quality products and exceptional customer service. Although we encountered a minor setback due to my tardiness in submitting the artwork, their dedication to prompt delivery was exemplary, as they ensured our receipt of the business cards at our hotel by 10 am the following morning. It is worth noting that a nominal delivery fee of $35 or thereabouts applies to orders below a certain threshold, but we found it a reasonable price to pay for their exceptional service. 

Throughout the entire process, we had the pleasure of interacting with several members of the Franklin team, including Kerry, Michele, and Mike. Their professionalism, cordiality, and expertise were evident in every exchange, as they took the time to comprehend our needs and timeline, demonstrating a strong commitment to their responsibilities and effective communication. 

Ultimately, our experience with Franklin culminated in the satisfactory delivery of high-quality, visually appealing business cards, much to our delight."

"Indulged in an extraordinary culinary escapade. Enjoyed a vast array of artisanal brews, complemented by an assortment of delectable edibles offered at a discounted tariff during a designated interval. Particularly enthralled by the gastronomical excellence of their prime cut burgers, which rivaled the palatability of those sampled in recent memory. Every component, ranging from the foundation bun to the uppermost adornments, exuded an aura of freshness and fastidious preparation. Anticipate returning forthwith to partake in such epicurean delights."

"Collaborating with Rosemary was an incredibly seamless and efficient experience, characterized by her exceptional proficiency and expertise in the floristry industry. Despite my rather limited financial allocation for floral arrangements, Rosemary demonstrated remarkable adaptability and resourcefulness in working within my budgetary constraints, creating beautiful and elegant pieces that included bridal bouquets, bridesmaids' bouquets, and boutonnieres. Her extensive knowledge and dedication to her craft were evident throughout the entire process, making her an exemplary choice for anyone seeking top-notch floral designs. Additionally, her business operates late hours, which is particularly advantageous for individuals like myself who have busy schedules and require flexible availability. I eagerly anticipate sharing photographs of my wedding, which will serve as a testament to Rosemary's exceptional artistry and commitment to excellence."

"I constantly observe the mobile culinary establishments on campus, yet have never procured any sustenance from them. Initially, I harbored some reservations regarding the quality and safety of the fare offered by these itinerant vendors. However, I am now delighted that I discarded such misgivings, as my recent experience with one of these enterprises proved to be an unmitigated delight! In response to my friend's enthusiastic recommendation, we decided to pay a visit to one of these gastronomic vehicles during our brief interlude between academic engagements. Upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the diverse array of delectable offerings available. The affable gentleman manning the register kindly apprised me of the various meat-free options available, and I opted for the 'Greenwich' presented in a salad format rather than a sandwich. The avocado ranch dressing served as the perfect accompaniment to the generous portion of caramelized onions, melted Swiss cheese, succulent tomato slices, and toasted bread comprising this culinary masterpiece. Furthermore, I sampled the waffle fries flavored with Cajun seasoning, which proved to be an absolute revelation. My initial intention was to consume only half of the meal at that time, saving the remainder for a later occasion. However, the quality and taste of the cuisine precluded any possibility of restraint, as I found myself devouring every last morsel. Moreover, the cost of this delectable repast was a mere ten dollars, rendering it an eminently reasonable and satisfying expenditure. Needless to say, I shall return to this mobile eatery in the near future, eager to indulge in further gustatory delights."

"My affinity for halting at this establishment for the purpose of partaking in the Studio B Buffet is immense, as I find the ambiance and culinary offerings to be thoroughly satisfying. Furthermore, I must commend the hotel's meticulous attention to cleanliness, which elevates my anticipation for the prospect of lodging at their resort in the future. Additionally, I must mention the presence of an adorable cupcake boutique and a Hash House A Go Go, which serve to enhance the overall appeal of this venue."

This lodging establishment garnered a perfect five-star rating from yours truly and my immediate family members, with nary a grievance or dissatisfaction expressed regarding the exceptionally luxurious nature of our stay; we would unhesitatingly opt to patronize this esteemed hotel again in the future.

"Upon perusing my previous reviews, it becomes evident that I possess a profound understanding of automotive matters and an unwavering commitment to quality service. In this particular instance, I have had the pleasure of patronizing this establishment on two separate occasions for the purpose of aligning my vehicle's wheels. I must say, the staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional competence and dedication to ensuring that every aspect of the process meets my exacting standards. It is worth noting that I am rather selective regarding the maintenance of my vehicles, opting to entrust them only to reputable facilities that offer comprehensive warranties or specialized services beyond my capabilities. Notably, I lack access to an alignment machine, which makes this enterprise an invaluable resource for my automotive needs. Furthermore, I have engaged in pleasant conversations with each member of the team, who have consistently displayed a genuine commitment to upholding ethical business practices and fostering positive relationships with their clientele."

This place has the best coffee ever!! It's a little pricey for the large drinks but the regular size is bigger than a venti at Starbucks.

My friends got the Carmel vanilla blended drink, my other friend got the regular iced coffee and I got the triple chocolate mocha. All three drinks were so delicious! The favorite ended up being the Carmel vanilla.

This is our new spot on the west side.

If you like bruschetta, you'll love this place! I love the roasted red pepper and the prosciutto is good too! This use to be the go-to spot on Wine Wednesdays for happy hour for my friends and I. The outdoor seating area is fun when it isn't too hot, and they have live music sometimes too! Love!
OUTSTANDING food and ambiance-- Had the proscuitto pizza and it was to die for. \n\nThe Limoncello was fantastic, too! Definitely a trendy spot to check out in downtown Phx

"An exceptional dining establishment, offering a pleasant ambiance, courteous servicem and delectable culinary delights, specifically their signature pizza. Patrons can enjoy their meals either within the comfortable confines of the indoor seating area or alfresco style in the outdoor setting, both of which offer an extensive array of options from the menu, including a diverse selection of salads and expertly crafted pizzas that showcase the chef's dedication to quality and flavor. Furthermore, the prices are reasonable and affordable, making it an accessible and desirable destination for those seeking a satisfying dining experience. It is little wonder, then, that this restaurant enjoys immense popularity among patrons, earning an A++ rating."

I've been to Fuego Bistro twice, both times the food was amazing!  Try a mojito with the Pernil Asado, you won't be disappointed.  The restaurant is small, and the staff is very friendly, they seemed to know a lot of their customers by name.

Joe Filter presents an uncomplicated and economical means of acquiring home air filters through their user-friendly website, accessible at the address www.joefilter.com; thus, I wholeheartedly endorse exploring their platform for a seamless and budget-friendly shopping experience.

"Gosh darn it! You simply must partake in the delectable culinary offerings available at this establishment! The Tex-Mex omelette is an absolute revelation, boasting an array of flavorsome ingredients such as salsa, guacamole, chorizo, and sour cream. It's positively divine, I assure you! The bread, reminiscent of thick Texas toast, is utterly scrumptious, and their potatoes are nothing short of sensational. The prices, might I add, are eminently reasonable and won't break the bank. My companion's pancake dish, resembling crepes in both texture and taste, left him in a state of pure gustatory delight. The service we received was also top-notch, with our server being warm and welcoming, and the food arriving at our table with remarkable expediency, almost as if by magic! Do note, however, that the eatery itself is somewhat diminutive in size, and they only accept cash payments. Nonetheless, I implore you to indulge in their morning fare forthwith. While their selection may be modest, it is undeniably impressive."

"Expeditious and rapid transportation from the aerodrome to the central business district, facilitated by the Airlink service, ensures a seamless transition for travellers, with the added benefit of affordability, at a mere \u00a33 per journey, offering an optimal solution for those seeking to traverse the distance in a timely manner. The route traverses through the city, providing access to prominent hotels, such as the Caledonian and Sheraton Grand, and culminates at the Waverly station, while also offering an extension to the Edinburgh Zoo, all within a span of 8 minutes, thereby catering to diverse needs and preferences. The service operates with regularity, every 10 minutes, ensuring convenience and reliability, and is complemented by friendly and efficient staff, dedicated to providing an exceptional customer experience. Indeed, an excellent value proposition, unparalleled in its class!"
Just a note... if you go to the drive thru and tell them that you're eating in your car, they'll give you an open box instead of a bag.  They even offer a placemat!  Sweet!
